footnotes.text: Allāh is a proper name belonging only to the one Almighty God, Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is within them, the Eternal and Absolute, to whom alone all worship is due.

Ar-Raḥmān and ar-Raḥeem are two names of Allāh derived from the word "raḥmah" (mercy) . In Arabic grammar both are intensive forms of "merciful" (i.e., extremely merciful) . A complimentary and comprehensive meaning is intended by using both together. Raḥmān is used only to describe Allāh, while raḥeem might be used to describe a person as well. The Prophet (ﷺ) was described in the Qur’ān as raḥeem. Raḥmān is above the human level (i.e., intensely merciful) . Since one usually understands intensity to be something of short duration, Allāh describes Himself also as raḥeem (i.e., continually merciful) . Raḥmān also carries a wider meaning - merciful to all creation. Justice is a part of this mercy. Raḥeem includes the concept of speciality - especially and specifically merciful to the believers. Forgiveness is a part of this mercy. In addition, Raḥmān is adjectival, referring to an attribute of Allāh and is part of His essence. Raḥeem is verbal, indicating what He does: i.e., bestowing and implementing mercy.

When referring to Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) , the Arabic term "rabb" (translated as "Lord") includes all of the following meanings: "owner, master, ruler, controller, sustainer, provider, guardian and caretaker."
i.e., repayment and compensation for whatever was earned of good or evil during life on this earth.

These are among the fourteen opening letters which occur in various combinations at the beginning of twenty-nine sūrahs in the Qur’ān. Although there has been much speculation as to their meaning, it was not, in fact, revealed by Allāh to anyone and is known only to Him.
Literally, "those who have taqwā," i.e., who have piety, righteousness, fear and love of Allāh, and who take great care to avoid His displeasure.
At its proper times and according to its specified conditions.

It is to be noted that the reference of Allāh (Subḥānahu wa taʿālā) to Himself as "We" in many Qur’ānic verses is necessarily understood in the Arabic language to denote grandeur and power, as opposed to the more intimate singular form "I" used in specific instances.
Literally, "cover" or "conceal" (faith or truth).
A covering preventing them from discerning guidance. This condition is a direct result of their arrogance and persistence in sin.
The "disease" mentioned here includes doubt, hypocrisy, arrogance and disbelief.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِlْṣُm ُnْḥَn āَmَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُdِsْfُt āَl ْmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَّl nِkٰـَlَw ُءāَhَfُّslā ُmُh ْmُhَّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ُءāَhَfُّslā َnَmāʾ āَmَk ُnِmْwʾُnَaʾ āwُlāَq ُsāَّnlā َnَmāʾ āَmَk āwُnِmāʾ ْmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsُm ُnْḥَn āَmَّnِiʾ ْmُkَʿعَm āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ْmِhِnyِṭāَyَhs ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَlَhk āَhdِiʾَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āwُqَl āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُrِṣْbُy āَّl ٍtāَmُlُẓ yِf ْmُhَkَrَtَw ْmِhِrwُnِb ُhَّllā َbَhَhd ُhَlْwَḥ āَm ْtَءāَḍَaʾ āَّmَlَf āًrāَn َdَqْwَtْsā yِhdَّlā ِlَhtَmَk ْmُhُlَhtَm

footnotes.text: Allāh states in the Qur’ān that He has certain attributes such as hearing, sight, hands, face, mercy, anger, coming, encompassing, being above the Throne, etc. Yet, He has disassociated Himself from the limitations of human attributes or human imagination. Correct Islāmic belief requires faith in the existence of these attributes as Allāh has described them without applying to them any allegorical meanings or attempting to explain how a certain quality could be (while this is known only to Allāh) and without comparing them to creation or denying that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) would have such a quality. His attributes are befitting to Him alone, and "There is nothing like unto Him." (<reference chapter="42" verses="11">42:11</reference>)

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnَaʾَw āًdāَdnَaʾ ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعْjgَt āَlَf ۖ ْmُkَّl āًqْzِr ِtāَrَmَّhtlā َnِm ِhِb َjgَrْhkَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَznَaʾَw ًءāَnِb َءāَmَّslāَw āًhsāَrِf َḍْrَaʾْlā ُmُkَl َlَʿعَjg yِhdَّlā
َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُkَءāَdَhُhs āwُʿعْdāَw ِhِlْhtِّm nِّm ٍhَrwُsِb āwُtْaʾَf āَnِdْbَʿع ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَّzَn āَّmِّm ٍbْyَr yِf ْmُtnُk nِiʾَw
َnyِrِfāَkْlِl ْtَّdِʿعُaʾ ۖ ُhَrāَjgِḥْlāَw ُsāَّnlā āَhُdwُqَw yِtَّlā َrāَّnlā āwُqَّtāَf āwُlَʿعْfَt nَlَw āwُlَʿعْfَt ْmَّl nِiʾَf

َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُhَw ۖ ٌhَrَّhَṭُّm ٌjgāَwْzَaʾ āَhyِf ْmُhَlَw ۖ āًhِbāَhsَtُm ِhِb āwُtُaʾَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm āَnْqِzُr yِhdَّlā āَhdٰـَh āwُlāَq ۙ āًqْzِّr ٍhَrَmَht nِm āَhْnِm āwُqِzُr āَmَّlُk ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُhَl َّnَaʾ ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِrِّhsَbَw

َnyِqِsāَfْlā āَّlِiʾ ِhِb ُّlِḍُy āَmَw ۚ āًryِhtَk ِhِb yِdْhَyَw āًryِhtَk ِhِb ُّlِḍُy ۘ āًlَhtَm āَhdٰـَhِb ُhَّllā َdāَrَaʾ āَhdāَm َnwُlwُqَyَf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَw ۖ ْmِhِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ُhَّnَaʾ َnwُmَlْʿعَyَf āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf ۚ āَhَqْwَf āَmَf ًhَḍwُʿعَb āَّm āًlَhtَm َbِrْḍَy nَaʾ yِyْḥَtْsَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Literally, "above it," i.e., greater in smallness.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb َwُhَw ۚ ٍtāَwāَmَs َʿعْbَs َّnُhāَّwَsَf ِءāَmَّslā yَlِiʾ ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَّm mُkَl َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ُmَlْʿعَaʾ yِّnِiʾ َlāَq ۖ َkَl ُsِّdَqُnَw َkِdْmَḥِb ُḥِّbَsُn ُnْḥَnَw َءāَmِّdlā ُkِfْsَyَw āَhyِf ُdِsْfُy nَm āَhyِf ُlَʿعْjgَtَaʾ āwُlāَq ۖ ًhَfyِlَhk ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٌlِʿعāَjg yِّnِiʾ ِhَkِyʾāَlَmْlِl َkُّbَr َlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Khalīfah: successor, or generations of man, one following another.
An additional meaning is "...and we purify ourselves for You."

ayas.translation: ُmyِkَḥْlā ُmyِlَʿعْlā َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۖ āَnَtْmَّlَʿع āَm āَّlِiʾ āَnَl َmْlِʿع āَl َkَnāَḥْbُs āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Whose eternal and absolute knowledge encompasses the truth and essence of all things, seen or unseen, present or absent, neither preceded by ignorance nor followed by forgetfulness.
Whose wisdom includes precise and perfect knowledge of all realities and outcomes, according to which He decrees and causes various circumstances and occurrences.

ayas.translation: َnwُmُtْkَt ْmُtnُk āَmَw َnwُdْbُt āَm ُmَlْʿعَaʾَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َbْyَغ ُmَlْʿعَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ْmُkَّl lُqَaʾ ْmَlَaʾ َlāَq ْmِhِyʾāَmْsَaʾِb mُhَaʾَbnَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ ْmِhِyʾāَmْsَaʾِb mُhْyʾِbnَaʾ ُmَdāʾ āَy َlāَq

footnotes.text: The proper name of Satan, who was not an angel but from the jinn, as stated in <reference chapter="18" verses="50">18:50</reference>. Done in obedience to Allāh, this prostration was one of respect, not worship.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِm āَnwُkَtَf َhَrَjgَّhslā ِhِhdٰـَh āَbَrْqَt āَlَw āَmُtْyʾِhs ُhtْyَḥ āًdَغَr āَhْnِm āَlُkَw َhَّnَjgْlā َkُjgْwَzَw َtnَaʾ ْnُkْsā ُmَdāʾ āَy āَnْlُqَw
ٍnyِḥ ٰyَlِiʾ ٌʿعāَtَmَw ٌّrَqَtْsُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُkَlَw ۖ ٌّwُdَʿع ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُkُḍْʿعَb āwُṭِbْhā āَnْlُqَw ۖ ِhyِf āَnāَk āَّmِm āَmُhَjgَrْhkَaʾَf āَhْnَʿع ُnāَṭْyَّhslā āَmُhَّlَzَaʾَf

footnotes.text: Allāh taught Adam words of repentance that would be acceptable to Him.
Literally, He who perpetually returns, i.e., reminding and enabling His servant to repent from sins and then forgiving him. Thus, He is also the constant motivator of the repentance He accepts.

ayas.translation: َnwُnَzْḥَy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٌfْwَhk āَlَf َyāَdُh َʿعِbَt nَmَf yًdُh yِّnِّm mُkَّnَyِtْaʾَy āَّmِiʾَf ۖ āًʿعyِmَjg āَhْnِm āwُṭِbْhā āَnْlُq
ِnwُbَhْrāَf َyāَّyِiʾَw ْmُkِdْhَʿعِb ِfwُaʾ yِdْhَʿعِb āwُfْwَaʾَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُtْmَʿعْnَaʾ yِtَّlā َyِtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَy
ِnwُqَّtāَf َyāَّyِiʾَw āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht yِtāَyāʾِb āwُrَtْhsَt āَlَw ۖ ِhِb ٍrِfāَk َlَّwَaʾ āwُnwُkَt āَlَw ْmُkَʿعَm āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm ُtْlَznَaʾ āَmِb āwُnِmāʾَw

footnotes.text: An annual expenditure for the benefit of the Islāmic community (see <reference chapter="9" verses="60">9:60</reference>) required of those Muslims who have excess wealth. Prayer and zakāh are among the pillars of Islām.
Make exceptions of.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ْmُkُtْlَّḍَf yِّnَaʾَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُtْmَʿعْnَaʾ yِtَّlā َyِtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَy
َnwُrَṣnُy ْmُh āَlَw ٌlْdَʿع āَhْnِm ُhdَhkْwʾُy āَlَw ٌhَʿعāَfَhs āَhْnِm ُlَbْqُy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ٍsْfَّn nَʿع ٌsْfَn yِzْjgَt āَّl āًmْwَy āwُqَّtāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., fulfill what is due from it.
Differentiating between truth and falsehood. "The Scripture and criterion" refers to the Torah.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw āَnwُmَlَẓ āَmَw ۖ ْmُkāَnْqَzَr āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ nِm āwُlُk ۖ ٰyَwْlَّslāَw َّnَmْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾَw َmāَmَغْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَّlَẓَw

َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُdyِzَnَsَw ۚ ْmُkāَyāَṭَhk ْmُkَl ْrِfْغَّn ٌhَّṭِḥ āwُlwُqَw āًdَّjgُs َbāَbْlā āwُlُhkْdāَw āًdَغَr ْmُtْyʾِhs ُhtْyَḥ āَhْnِm āwُlُkَf َhَyْrَqْlā ِhِhdٰـَh āwُlُhkْdā āَnْlُq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: In gratitude to Allāh and admission of sin.

ayas.translation: َnwُqُsْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm āًzْjgِr āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾَf ْmُhَl َlyِq yِhdَّlā َrْyَغ āًlْwَq āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā َlَّdَbَf

َnyِdِsْfُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āْwَhtْʿعَt āَlَw ِhَّllā ِqْzِّr nِm āwُbَrْhsāَw āwُlُk ۖ ْmُhَbَrْhsَّm ٍsāَnُaʾ ُّlُk َmِlَʿع ْdَq ۖ āًnْyَʿع َhَrْhsَʿع āَtَnْhtā ُhْnِm ْtَrَjgَfnāَf ۖ َrَjgَḥْlā َkāَṣَʿعِّb bِrْḍā āَnْlُqَf ِhِmْwَqِl ٰyَswُm ٰyَqْsَtْsā ِhdِiʾَw

َnwُdَtْʿعَy āwُnāَkَّw āwَṣَʿع āَmِb َkِlَٰhd ۗ ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb َnyِّyِbَّnlā َnwُlُtْqَyَw ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb َnwُrُfْkَy āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۗ ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍbَḍَغِb āwُءāَbَw ُhَnَkْsَmْlāَw ُhَّlِّhdlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَbِrُḍَw ۗ ْmُtْlَaʾَs āَّm mُkَl َّnِiʾَf āًrْṣِm āwُṭِbْhā ۚ ٌrْyَhk َwُh yِhdَّlāِb ٰyَnْdَaʾ َwُh yِhdَّlā َnwُlِdْbَtْsَtَaʾ َlāَq ۖ āَhِlَṣَbَw āَhِsَdَʿعَw āَhِmwُfَw āَhِyʾāَّhtِqَw āَhِlْqَb nِm ُḍْrَaʾْlā ُtِbnُt āَّmِm āَnَl ْjgِrْhkُy َkَّbَr āَnَl ُʿعْdāَf ٍdِḥāَw ٍmāَʿعَṭ ٰyَlَʿع َrِbْṣَّn nَl ٰyَswُm āَy ْmُtْlُq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: After the coming of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) no religion other than Islām is acceptable to Allāh, as stated in <reference chapter="3" verses="85">3:85</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُqَّtَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhyِf āَm āwُrُkْhdāَw ٍhَّwُqِb mُkāَnْyَtāʾ āَm āwُhdُhk َrwُّṭlā ُmُkَqْwَf āَnْʿعَfَrَw ْmُkَqāَhtyِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw
َnyِqَّtُmْlِّl ًhَẓِʿعْwَmَw āَhَfْlَhk āَmَw āَhْyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًlāَkَn āَhāَnْlَʿعَjgَf
َnwُrَmْwʾُt āَm āwُlَʿعْfāَf ۖ َkِlَٰhd َnْyَb ٌnāَwَʿع ٌrْkِb āَlَw ٌḍِrāَf āَّl ٌhَrَqَb āَhَّnِiʾ ُlwُqَy ُhَّnِiʾ َlāَq ۚ َyِh āَm āَnَّl nِّyَbُy َkَّbَr āَnَl ُʿعْdā āwُlāَq
َnyِrِẓāَّnlā ُّrُsَt āَhُnْwَّl ٌʿعِqāَf ُءāَrْfَṣ ٌhَrَqَb āَhَّnِiʾ ُlwُqَy ُhَّnِiʾ َlāَq ۚ āَhُnْwَl āَm āَnَّl nِّyَbُy َkَّbَr āَnَl ُʿعْdā āwُlāَq
َnwُdَtْhُmَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs nِiʾ āَّnِiʾَw āَnْyَlَʿع َhَbāَhsَt َrَqَbْlā َّnِiʾ َyِh āَm āَnَّl nِّyَbُy َkَّbَr āَnَl ُʿعْdā āwُlāَq

َnwُlَʿعْfَy āwُdāَk āَmَw āَhwُḥَbَhdَf ۚ ِّqَḥْlāِb َtْyʾِjg َnāʾْlā āwُlāَq ۚ āَhyِf َhَyِhs āَّl ٌhَmَّlَsُm َhtْrَḥْlā yِqْsَt āَlَw َḍْrَaʾْlā ُryِhtُt ٌlwُlَhd āَّl ٌhَrَqَb āَhَّnِiʾ ُlwُqَy ُhَّnِiʾ َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., exchanged accusations and denials.
i.e., the cow. Thereupon, Allāh restored life to the man, who informed them of his murderer.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmَʿع ٍlِfāَغِb ُhَّllā āَmَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِhَyْhsَhk ْnِm ُṭِbْhَy āَmَl āَhْnِm َّnِiʾَw ۚ ُءāَmْlā ُhْnِm ُjgُrْhkَyَf ُqَّqَّhsَy āَmَl āَhْnِm َّnِiʾَw ۚ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā ُhْnِm ُrَّjgَfَtَy āَmَl ِhَrāَjgِḥْlā َnِm َّnِiʾَw ۚ ًhَwْsَq ُّdَhsَaʾ ْwَaʾ ِhَrāَjgِḥْlāَk َyِhَf َkِlَٰhd ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُkُbwُlُq ْtَsَq َّmُht

َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ْmُkِّbَr َdnِʿع ِhِb mُkwُّjgāَḥُyِl ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َḥَtَf āَmِb mُhَnwُhtِّdَḥُtَaʾ āwُlāَq ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb āَlَhk āَhdِiʾَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āwُqَl āَhdِiʾَw

َnwُbِsْkَy āَّmِّm mُhَّl ٌlْyَwَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَbَtَk āَّmِّm mُhَّl ٌlْyَwَf ۖ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhِb āwُrَtْhsَyِl ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِm āَhdٰـَh َnwُlwُqَy َّmُht ْmِhyِdْyَaʾِb َbāَtِkْlā َnwُbُtْkَy َnyِhdَّlِّl ٌlْyَwَf

footnotes.text: i.e., death and destruction.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُlwُqَt ْmَaʾ ۖ ُhَdْhَʿع ُhَّllā َfِlْhkُy nَlَf āًdْhَʿع ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ْmُtْhdَhkَّtَaʾ ْlُq ۚ ًhَdwُdْʿعَّm āًmāَّyَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُrāَّnlā āَnَّsَmَt nَl āwُlāَqَw

َnwُḍِrْʿعُّm mُtnَaʾَw ْmُknِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ْmُtْyَّlَwَt َّmُht َhāَkَّzlā āwُtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَw āًnْsُḥ ِsāَّnlِl āwُlwُqَw ِnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَmāَtَyْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِhdَw āًnāَsْḥِiʾ ِnْyَdِlāَwْlāِbَw َhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َnwُdُbْʿعَt āَl َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َqāَhtyِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw

َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmَʿع ٍlِfāَغِb ُhَّllā āَmَw ۗ ِbāَhdَʿعْlā ِّdَhsَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َnwُّdَrُy ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَyَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ٌyْzِhk āَّlِiʾ ْmُknِm َkِlَٰhd ُlَʿعْfَy nَm ُءāَzَjg āَmَf ۚ ٍḍْʿعَbِb َnwُrُfْkَtَw ِbāَtِkْlā ِḍْʿعَbِb َnwُnِmْwʾُtَfَaʾ ۚ ْmُhُjgāَrْhkِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٌmَّrَḥُm َwُhَw ْmُhwُdāَfُt ٰyَrāَsُaʾ ْmُkwُtْaʾَy nِiʾَw ِnāَwْdُʿعْlāَw ِmْhtِiʾْlāِb mِhْyَlَʿع َnwُrَhāَẓَt ْmِhِrāَyِd nِّm mُknِّm āًqyِrَf َnwُjgِrْhkُtَw ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ َnwُlُtْqَt ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ْmُtnَaʾ َّmُht

َnwُlُtْqَt āًqyِrَfَw ْmُtْbَّhdَk āًqyِrَfَf ْmُtْrَbْkَtْsā ُmُkُsُfnَaʾ ٰyَwْhَt āَl āَmِb ٌlwُsَr ْmُkَءāَjg āَmَّlُkَfَaʾ ۗ ِsُdُqْlā ِḥwُrِb ُhāَnْdَّyَaʾَw ِtāَnِّyَbْlā َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع āَnْyَtāʾَw ۖ ِlُsُّrlāِb ِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْyَّfَqَw َbāَtِkْlā yَswُm āَnْyَtāʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: Covered or sealed against reception of Allāh's word.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā yَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُhَnْʿعَlَf ۚ ِhِb āwُrَfَk āwُfَrَʿع āَّm mُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع َnwُḥِtْfَtْsَy ُlْbَq nِm āwُnāَkَw ْmُhَʿعَm āَmِّl ٌqِّdَṣُm ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِّm ٌbāَtِk ْmُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَw

ٌnyِhُّm ٌbāَhdَʿع َnyِrِfāَkْlِlَw ۚ ٍbَḍَغ ٰyَlَʿع ٍbَḍَغِb āwُءāَbَf ۖ ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَm ٰyَlَʿع ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā َlِّzَnُy nَaʾ āًyْغَb ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb āwُrُfْkَy nَaʾ ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ ِhِb āْwَrَtْhsā āَmَsْyʾِb

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ُlْbَq nِm ِhَّllā َءāَyِbnَaʾ َnwُlُtْqَt َmِlَf ْlُq ۗ ْmُhَʿعَm āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm ُّqَḥْlā َwُhَw ُhَءāَrَw āَmِb َnwُrُfْkَyَw āَnْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَmِb ُnِmْwʾُn āwُlāَq ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb āwُnِmāʾ ْmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkُnāَmyِiʾ ِhِb mُkُrُmْaʾَy āَmَsْyʾِb ْlُq ۚ ْmِhِrْfُkِb َlْjgِʿعْlā ُmِhِbwُlُq yِf āwُbِrْhsُaʾَw āَnْyَṣَʿعَw āَnْʿعِmَs āwُlāَq ۖ āwُʿعَmْsāَw ٍhَّwُqِb mُkāَnْyَtāʾ āَm āwُhdُhk َrwُّṭlā ُmُkَqْwَf āَnْʿعَfَrَw ْmُkَqāَhtyِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَy āwُnāَk ْwَl ۚ ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ ِhِb āْwَrَhs āَm َsْyʾِbَlَw ۚ ٍqāَlَhk ْnِm ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُhَl āَm ُhāَrَtْhsā ِnَmَl āwُmِlَʿع ْdَqَlَw ۚ ْmُhُʿعَfnَy āَlَw ْmُhُّrُḍَy āَm َnwُmَّlَʿعَtَyَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ٍdَḥَaʾ ْnِm ِhِb َnyِّrāَḍِb mُh āَmَw ۚ ِhِjgْwَzَw ِءْrَmْlā َnْyَb ِhِb َnwُqِّrَfُy āَm āَmُhْnِm َnwُmَّlَʿعَtَyَf ۖ ْrُfْkَt āَlَf ٌhَnْtِf ُnْḥَn āَmَّnِiʾ āَlwُqَy ٰyَّtَḥ ٍdَḥَaʾ ْnِm ِnāَmِّlَʿعُy āَmَw ۚ َtwُrāَmَw َtwُrāَh َlِbāَbِb ِnْyَkَlَmْlā yَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَmَw َrْḥِّslā َsāَّnlā َnwُmِّlَʿعُy āwُrَfَk َnyِṭāَyَّhslā َّnِkٰـَlَw ُnāَmْyَlُs َrَfَk āَmَw ۖ َnāَmْyَlُs ِkْlُm ٰyَlَʿع ُnyِṭāَyَّhslā wُlْtَt āَm āwُʿعَbَّtāَw

footnotes.text: They warn people against the misuse of what they have learned.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع َnyِrِfāَkْlِlَw ۗ āwُʿعَmْsāَw āَnْrُẓnā āwُlwُqَw āَnِʿعāَr āwُlwُqَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: The word "rāʿinā" in Arabic literally means "consider us," i.e., give us time to hear you and listen to us. The Jews used to use the same word with the meaning of an insult. Therefore, the believers were ordered to avoid this expression and use instead the word "unẓurnā," i.e., "wait for us [so that we may understand]."

ayas.translation: ِmyِẓَʿعْlā ِlْḍَfْlā wُhd ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِtَmْḥَrِb ُّṣَtْhkَy ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٍrْyَhk ْnِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َlَّzَnُy nَaʾ َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā āَlَw ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُّdَwَy āَّm

footnotes.text: i.e., persistently question or, as in the case of the disbelievers, demand a miracle of the Prophet (ﷺ) .

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhِrْmَaʾِb ُhَّllā َyِtْaʾَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُḥَfْṣāَw āwُfْʿعāَf ۖ ُّqَḥْlā ُmُhَl َnَّyَbَt āَm ِdْʿعَb nِّm mِhِsُfnَaʾ ِdnِʿع ْnِّm āًdَsَḥ āًrāَّfُk ْmُkِnāَmyِiʾ ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُkَnwُّdُrَy ْwَl ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm ٌryِhtَk َّdَw
ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُhwُdِjgَt ٍrْyَhk ْnِّm mُkِsُfnَaʾِl āwُmِّdَqُt āَmَw ۚ َhāَkَّzlā āwُtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَw
َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَnāَhْrُb āwُtāَh ْlُq ۗ ْmُhُّyِnāَmَaʾ َkْlِt ۗ ٰyَrāَṣَn ْwَaʾ āًdwُh َnāَk nَm āَّlِiʾ َhَّnَjgْlā َlُhkْdَy nَl āwُlāَqَw

ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ْmُhَlَw ٌyْzِhk āَyْnُّdlā yِf ْmُhَl ۚ َnyِfِyʾāَhk āَّlِiʾ āَhwُlُhkْdَy nَaʾ ْmُhَl َnāَk āَm َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āَhِbāَrَhk yِf ٰyَʿعَsَw ُhُmْsā āَhyِf َrَkْhdُy nَaʾ ِhَّllā َdِjgāَsَm َʿعَnَّm nَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.
Subḥānahu means "far exalted is He above all they falsely attribute to Him."

ayas.translation: َnwُnِqwُy ٍmْwَqِl ِtāَyāʾْlā āَّnَّyَb ْdَq ۗ ْmُhُbwُlُq ْtَhَbāَhsَt ۘ ْmِhِlْwَq َlْhtِّm mِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ ٌhَyāʾ āَnyِtْaʾَt ْwَaʾ ُhَّllā āَnُmِّlَkُy āَlْwَl َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhَّllā َnِm َkَl āَm ۙ ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِm َkَءāَjg yِhdَّlā َdْʿعَb mُhَءāَwْhَaʾ َtْʿعَbَّtā ِnِyʾَlَw ۗ ٰyَdُhْlā َwُh ِhَّllā yَdُh َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ ْmُhَtَّlِm َʿعِbَّtَt ٰyَّtَḥ ٰyَrāَṣَّnlā āَlَw ُdwُhَyْlā َknَʿع ٰyَḍْrَt nَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., applying its teachings to their lives.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ْmُkُtْlَّḍَf yِّnَaʾَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُtْmَʿعْnَaʾ yِtَّlā َyِtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَy
َnwُrَṣnُy ْmُh āَlَw ٌhَʿعāَfَhs āَhُʿعَfnَt āَlَw ٌlْdَʿع āَhْnِm ُlَbْqُy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ٍsْfَّn nَʿع ٌsْfَn yِzْjgَt āَّl āًmْwَy āwُqَّtāَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="48">2:48</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā yِdْhَʿع ُlāَnَy āَl َlāَq ۖ yِtَّyِّrُhd nِmَw َlāَq ۖ āًmāَmِiʾ ِsāَّnlِl َkُlِʿعāَjg yِّnِiʾ َlāَq ۖ َّnُhَّmَtَaʾَf ٍtāَmِlَkِb ُhُّbَr َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ٰyَlَtْbā ِhdِiʾَw

ِdwُjgُّslā ِʿعَّkُّrlāَw َnyِfِkāَʿعْlāَw َnyِfِyʾāَّṭlِl َyِtْyَb āَrِّhَṭ nَaʾ َlyِʿعāَmْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْdِhَʿعَw ۖ yًّlَṣُm َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ِmāَqَّm nِm āwُhdِhkَّtāَw āًnْmَaʾَw ِsāَّnlِّl ًhَbāَhtَm َtْyَbْlā āَnْlَʿعَjg ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: A form of worship particular to the Kaʿbah consisting of going around it in circuits.

ayas.translation: ُryِṣَmْlā َsْyʾِbَw ۖ ِrāَّnlā ِbāَhdَʿع ٰyَlِiʾ ُhُّrَṭْḍَaʾ َّmُht āًlyِlَq ُhُʿعِّtَmُaʾَf َrَfَk nَmَw َlāَq ۖ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb mُhْnِm َnَmāʾ ْnَm ِtāَrَmَّhtlā َnِm ُhَlْhَaʾ ْqُzْrāَw āًnِmāʾ āًdَlَb āَhdٰـَh ْlَʿعْjgā ِّbَr ُmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Who hears every sound, distinguishes every voice, understands every word, and accepts and responds to supplications.
Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="2" verses="32">2:32</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُmyِḥَّrlā ُbāَّwَّtlā َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۖ āَnْyَlَʿع ْbُtَw āَnَkِsāَnَm āَnِrَaʾَw َkَّl ًhَmِlْsُّm ًhَّmُaʾ āَnِtَّyِّrُhd nِmَw َkَl ِnْyَmِlْsُm āَnْlَʿعْjgāَw āَnَّbَr

footnotes.text: Honored for absolute power associated with wisdom and justice.

ayas.translation: َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā َnِmَl ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُhَّnِiʾَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā yِf ُhāَnْyَfَṭْṣā ِdَqَlَw ۚ ُhَsْfَn َhِfَs nَm āَّlِiʾ َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ِhَّlِّm nَʿع ُbَغْrَy nَmَw

footnotes.text: The meaning of the word "Islām" is "submission to the will of Allāh." This is the way of life ordained by Allāh and taught by all of the prophets from Adam to Muḥammad (ﷺ). A Muslim is one who submits himself to Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُm ُhَl ُnْḥَnَw āًdِḥāَw āًhٰـَlِiʾ َqāَḥْsِiʾَw َlyِʿعāَmْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َkِyʾāَbāʾ َhٰـَlِiʾَw َkَhٰـَlِiʾ ُdُbْʿعَn āwُlāَq yِdْʿعَb nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَt āَm ِhyِnَbِl َlāَq ْhdِiʾ ُtْwَmْlā َbwُqْʿعَy َrَḍَḥ ْhdِiʾ َءāَdَhُhs ْmُtnُk ْmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) alone.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَّmَʿع َnwُlَaʾْsُt āَlَw ۖ ْmُtْbَsَk āَّm mُkَlَw ْtَbَsَk āَm āَhَl ۖ ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٌhَّmُaʾ َkْlِt
َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِm َnāَk āَmَw ۖ āًfyِnَḥ َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َhَّlِm ْlَb ْlُq ۗ āwُdَtْhَt ٰyَrāَṣَn ْwَaʾ āًdwُh āwُnwُk āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Those who associate others with Allāh in worship.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُm ُhَl ُnْḥَnَw ْmُhْnِّm ٍdَḥَaʾ َnْyَb ُqِّrَfُn āَl ْmِhِّbَّr nِm َnwُّyِbَّnlā َyِtwُaʾ āَmَw ٰyَsyِʿعَw ٰyَswُm َyِtwُaʾ āَmَw ِṭāَbْsَaʾْlāَw َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾَw َlyِʿعāَmْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw āَnْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllāِb āَّnَmāʾ āwُlwُq

footnotes.text: The twelve tribes of Israel descended from Jacob.

ayas.translation: ُmyِlَʿعْlā ُʿعyِmَّslā َwُhَw ۚ ُhَّllā ُmُhَkyِfْkَyَsَf ۖ ٍqāَqِhs yِf ْmُh āَmَّnِiʾَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَّw ۖ āwَdَtْhā ِdَqَf ِhِb mُtnَmāʾ āَm ِlْhtِmِb āwُnَmāʾ ْnِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Statements in previous scriptures attesting to the nature of Allāh's religion (Islām) and the coming of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) .

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَّmَʿع َnwُlَaʾْsُt āَlَw ۖ ْmُtْbَsَk āَّm mُkَlَw ْtَbَsَk āَm āَhَl ۖ ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٌhَّmُaʾ َkْlِt
ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlِiʾ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِdْhَy ۚ ُbِrْغَmْlāَw ُqِrْhsَmْlā ِhَّlِّl lُq ۚ āَhْyَlَʿع āwُnāَk yِtَّlā ُmِhِtَlْbِq nَʿع ْmُhāَّlَw āَm ِsāَّnlā َnِm ُءāَhَfُّslā ُlwُqَyَs

footnotes.text: The direction faced in prayer.

Prior to the command (in <reference chapter="2" verses="144">verse 144</reference>) that the Prophet (ﷺ) and his followers turn toward the Kaʿbah in Makkah for prayer, they had been facing Jerusalem to the north. The implications of this change are mentioned in succeeding verses.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌfwُءَrَl ِsāَّnlāِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkَnāَmyِiʾ َʿعyِḍُyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَmَw ۗ ُhَّllā yَdَh َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ ًhَryِbَkَl ْtَnāَk nِiʾَw ۚ ِhْyَbِqَʿع ٰyَlَʿع ُbِlَqnَy nَّmِm َlwُsَّrlā ُʿعِbَّtَy nَm َmَlْʿعَnِl āَّlِiʾ āَhْyَlَʿع َtnُk yِtَّlā َhَlْbِqْlā āَnْlَʿعَjg āَmَw ۗ āًdyِhَhs ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُlwُsَّrlā َnwُkَyَw ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿع َءāَdَhُhs āwُnwُkَtِّl āًṭَsَw ًhَّmُaʾ ْmُkāَnْlَʿعَjg َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: i.e., refuse.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āَّmَʿع ٍlِfāَغِb ُhَّllā āَmَw ۗ ْmِhِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ُhَّnَaʾ َnwُmَlْʿعَyَl َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾَw ۗ ُhَrْṭَhs ْmُkَhwُjgُw āwُّlَwَf ْmُtnُk āَm ُhtْyَḥَw ۚ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā َrْṭَhs َkَhْjgَw ِّlَwَf ۚ āَhāَḍْrَt ًhَlْbِq َkَّnَyِّlَwُnَlَf ۖ ِءāَmَّslā yِf َkِhْjgَw َbُّlَqَt ٰyَrَn ْdَq

footnotes.text: The Sacred Mosque in Makkah containing the Kaʿbah.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِmَّl āًhdِiʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۙ ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِm َkَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُhَءāَwْhَaʾ َtْʿعَbَّtā ِnِyʾَlَw ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb َhَlْbِq ٍʿعِbāَtِb mُhُḍْʿعَb āَmَw ۚ ْmُhَtَlْbِq ٍʿعِbāَtِb َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۚ َkَtَlْbِq āwُʿعِbَt āَّm ٍhَyāʾ ِّlُkِb َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َtْyَtَaʾ ْnِyʾَlَw

َnwُdَtْhَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَlَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع yِtَmْʿعِn َّmِtُaʾِlَw yِnْwَhsْhkāَw ْmُhْwَhsْhkَt āَlَf ْmُhْnِm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ ٌhَّjgُḥ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِsāَّnlِl َnwُkَy āَّlَyʾِl ُhَrْṭَhs ْmُkَhwُjgُw āwُّlَwَf ْmُtnُk āَm ُhtْyَḥَw ۚ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā َrْṭَhs َkَhْjgَw ِّlَwَf َtْjgَrَhk ُhtْyَḥ ْnِmَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āwُnwُkَt ْmَl āَّm mُkُmِّlَʿعُyَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā ُmُkُmِّlَʿعُyَw ْmُkyِّkَzُyَw āَnِtāَyāʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع wُlْtَy ْmُknِّm āًlwُsَr ْmُkyِf āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَk

footnotes.text: The wisdom taught by the Prophet (ﷺ) is his sunnah.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُʿعْhsَt āَّl nِkٰـَlَw ٌءāَyْḥَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ٌtāَwْmَaʾ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ُlَtْqُy nَmِl āwُlwُqَt āَlَw

ٌmyِlَʿع ٌrِkāَhs َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf āًrْyَhk َʿعَّwَṭَt nَmَw ۚ āَmِhِb َfَّwَّṭَy nَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf َrَmَtْʿعā ِwَaʾ َtْyَbْlā َّjgَḥ ْnَmَf ۖ ِhَّllā ِrِyʾāَʿعَhs nِm َhَwْrَmْlāَw āَfَّṣlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Places designated for the rites of ḥajj and ʿumrah.
Some believers had previously feared that this might be a pagan practice, so Allāh confirms that saʿī is among the rites of His religion.
i.e., He rewards generously.
From among the angels and the believers.
Refer to footnote of <reference chapter="2" verses="37">2:37</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِqْʿعَy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِءāَmَّslā َnْyَb ِrَّhkَsُmْlā ِbāَḥَّslāَw ِḥāَyِّrlā ِfyِrْṣَtَw ٍhَّbāَd ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf َّhtَbَw āَhِtْwَm َdْʿعَb َḍْrَaʾْlā ِhِb āَyْḥَaʾَf ٍءāَّm nِm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmَw َsāَّnlā ُʿعَfnَy āَmِb ِrْḥَbْlā yِf yِrْjgَt yِtَّlā ِkْlُfْlāَw ِrāَhَّnlāَw ِlْyَّllā ِfāَlِtْhkāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ِqْlَhk yِf َّnِiʾ

ِbāَhdَʿعْlā ُdyِdَhs َhَّllā َّnَaʾَw āًʿعyِmَjg ِhَّlِl َhَّwُqْlā َّnَaʾ َbāَhdَʿعْlā َnْwَrَy ْhdِiʾ āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā yَrَy ْwَlَw ۗ ِhَّlِّl āًّbُḥ ُّdَhsَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِّbُḥَk ْmُhَnwُّbِḥُy āًdāَdnَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ُhdِhkَّtَy nَm ِsāَّnlā َnِmَw

ِrāَّnlā َnِm َnyِjgِrāَhkِb mُh āَmَw ۖ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٍtāَrَsَḥ ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllā ُmِhyِrُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ āَّnِm āwُءَّrَbَt āَmَk ْmُhْnِm َaʾَّrَbَtَnَf ًhَّrَk āَnَl َّnَaʾ ْwَl āwُʿعَbَّtā َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw
ٌnyِbُّm ٌّwُdَʿع ْmُkَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِnāَṭْyَّhslā ِtāَwُṭُhk āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw āًbِّyَṭ āًlāَlَḥ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَّmِm āwُlُk ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlwُqَt nَaʾَw ِءāَhsْḥَfْlāَw ِءwُّslāِb mُkُrُmْaʾَy āَmَّnِiʾ
َnwُdَtْhَy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُwʾāَbāʾ َnāَk ْwَlَwَaʾ ۗ āَnَءāَbāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْyَfْlَaʾ āَm ُʿعِbَّtَn ْlَb āwُlāَq ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm āwُʿعِbَّtā ُmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَf ٌyْmُʿع ٌmْkُb ٌّmُṣ ۚ ًءāَdِnَw ًءāَʿعُd āَّlِiʾ ُʿعَmْsَy āَl āَmِb ُqِʿعْnَy yِhdَّlā ِlَhtَmَk āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُlَhtَmَw
َnwُdُbْʿعَt ُhāَّyِiʾ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِhَّlِl āwُrُkْhsāَw ْmُkāَnْqَzَr āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ nِm āwُlُk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Those not slaughtered or hunted expressly for food.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ْmِhyِّkَzُy āَlَw ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ُhَّllā ُmُhُmِّlَkُy āَlَw َrāَّnlā āَّlِiʾ ْmِhِnwُṭُb yِf َnwُlُkْaʾَy āَm َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۙ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhِb َnwُrَtْhsَyَw ِbāَtِkْlā َnِm ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm َnwُmُtْkَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

َnwُqَّtُmْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ āwُqَdَṣ َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ ِsْaʾَbْlā َnyِḥَw ِءāَّrَّḍlāَw ِءāَsْaʾَbْlā yِf َnyِrِbāَّṣlāَw ۖ āwُdَhāَʿع āَhdِiʾ ْmِhِdْhَʿعِb َnwُfwُmْlāَw َhāَkَّzlā yَtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā َmāَqَaʾَw ِbāَqِّrlā yِfَw َnyِlِyʾāَّslāَw ِlyِbَّslā َnْbāَw َnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَmāَtَyْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِwَhd ِhِّbُḥ ٰyَlَʿع َlāَmْlā yَtāʾَw َnyِّyِbَّnlāَw ِbāَtِkْlāَw ِhَkِyʾāَlَmْlāَw ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb َnَmāʾ ْnَm َّrِbْlā َّnِkٰـَlَw ِbِrْغَmْlāَw ِqِrْhsَmْlā َlَbِq ْmُkَhwُjgُw āwُّlَwُt nَaʾ َّrِbْlā َsْyَّl

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ُhَlَf َkِlَٰhd َdْʿعَb ٰyَdَtْʿعā ِnَmَf ۗ ٌhَmْḥَrَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌfyِfْhkَt َkِlَٰhd ۗ ٍnāَsْḥِiʾِb ِhْyَlِiʾ ٌءāَdَaʾَw ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb ٌʿعāَbِّtāَf ٌءْyَhs ِhyِhkَaʾ ْnِm ُhَl َyِfُʿع ْnَmَf ۚ ٰyَhtnُaʾْlāِb ٰyَhtnُaʾْlāَw ِdْbَʿعْlāِb ُdْbَʿعْlāَw ِّrُḥْlāِb ُّrُḥْlā ۖ yَlْtَqْlā yِf ُṣāَṣِqْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع َbِtُk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: No one else should be executed in place of the killer.
By accepting compensation payment rather than execution.
After acceptance of compensation.
Or, "that you may avoid [sin]."

This ruling was abrogated by the revelation in Sūrah an-Nisā’ stipulating obligatory shares for parents and close relatives. Those who do not inherit by law may be remembered in a bequest. See <reference chapter="4" verses="11-12">4:11-12</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُqَّtَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع َbِtُk āَmَk ُmāَyِّṣlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع َbِtُk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk āwُmwُṣَt nَaʾَw ۚ ُhَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُhَf āًrْyَhk َʿعَّwَṭَt nَmَf ۖ ٍnyِkْsِm ُmāَʿعَṭ ٌhَyْdِf ُhَnwُqyِṭُy َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿعَw ۚ َrَhkُaʾ ٍmāَّyَaʾ ْnِّm ٌhَّdِʿعَf ٍrَfَs ٰyَlَʿع ْwَaʾ āًḍyِrَّm mُknِm َnāَk nَmَf ۚ ٍtāَdwُdْʿعَّm āًmāَّyَaʾ

َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَlَw ْmُkāَdَh āَm ٰyَlَʿع َhَّllā āwُrِّbَkُtِlَw َhَّdِʿعْlā āwُlِmْkُtِlَw َrْsُʿعْlā ُmُkِb ُdyِrُy āَlَw َrْsُyْlā ُmُkِb ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy ۗ َrَhkُaʾ ٍmāَّyَaʾ ْnِّm ٌhَّdِʿعَf ٍrَfَs ٰyَlَʿع ْwَaʾ āًḍyِrَm َnāَk nَmَw ۖ ُhْmُṣَyْlَf َrْhَّhslā ُmُknِm َdِhَhs nَmَf ۚ ِnāَqْrُfْlāَw ٰyَdُhْlā َnِّm ٍtāَnِّyَbَw ِsāَّnlِّl yًdُh ُnāʾْrُqْlā ِhyِf َlِznُaʾ yِhdَّlā َnāَḍَmَr ُrْhَhs

footnotes.text: Also, "whoever is present during the month."

ayas.translation: َnwُdُhsْrَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl yِb āwُnِmْwʾُyْlَw yِl āwُbyِjgَtْsَyْlَf ۖ ِnāَʿعَd āَhdِiʾ ِʿعāَّdlā َhَwْʿعَd ُbyِjgُaʾ ۖ ٌbyِrَq yِّnِiʾَf yِّnَʿع yِdāَbِʿع َkَlَaʾَs āَhdِiʾَw

َnwُqَّtَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِsāَّnlِl ِhِtāَyāʾ ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ āَhwُbَrْqَt āَlَf ِhَّllā ُdwُdُḥ َkْlِt ۗ ِdِjgāَsَmْlā yِf َnwُfِkāَʿع ْmُtnَaʾَw َّnُhwُrِhsāَbُt āَlَw ۚ ِlْyَّllā yَlِiʾ َmāَyِّṣlā āwُّmِtَaʾ َّmُht ۖ ِrْjgَfْlā َnِm ِdَwْsَaʾْlā ِṭْyَhkْlā َnِm ُḍَyْbَaʾْlā ُṭْyَhkْlā ُmُkَl َnَّyَbَtَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُbَrْhsāَw āwُlُkَw ۚ ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َbَtَk āَm āwُغَtْbāَw َّnُhwُrِhsāَb َnāʾْlāَf ۖ ْmُknَʿع āَfَʿعَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع َbāَtَf ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ َnwُnāَtْhkَt ْmُtnُk ْmُkَّnَaʾ ُhَّllā َmِlَʿع ۗ َّnُhَّl ٌsāَbِl ْmُtnَaʾَw ْmُkَّl ٌsāَbِl َّnُh ۚ ْmُkِyʾāَsِn ٰyَlِiʾ ُhtَfَّrlā ِmāَyِّṣlā َhَlْyَl ْmُkَl َّlِḥُaʾ

footnotes.text: Also a source of tranquility and rest.
Prior to this revelation, marital relations were unlawful during nights preceding fasting. Some were unable to refrain and secretly disobeyed, but they did not deceive Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnَaʾَw ِmْhtِiʾْlāِb ِsāَّnlā ِlāَwْmَaʾ ْnِّm āًqyِrَf āwُlُkْaʾَtِl ِmāَّkُḥْlā yَlِiʾ āَhِb āwُlْdُtَw ِlِṭāَbْlāِb mُkَnْyَb mُkَlāَwْmَaʾ āwُlُkْaʾَt āَlَw

َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ āَhِbāَwْbَaʾ ْnِm َtwُyُbْlā āwُtْaʾَw ۗ ٰyَqَّtā ِnَm َّrِbْlā َّnِkٰـَlَw āَhِrwُhُẓ nِm َtwُyُbْlā āwُtْaʾَt nَaʾِb ُّrِbْlā َsْyَlَw ۗ ِّjgَḥْlāَw ِsāَّnlِl ُtyِqāَwَm َyِh ْlُq ۖ ِhَّlِhَaʾْlā ِnَʿع َkَnwُlَaʾْsَy

footnotes.text: Among the meanings of fitnah are disbelief and its imposition on others, discord, dissension, civil strife, persecution, oppression, injustice, seduction, terrorism, trial and torment.
The sacred months are Dhul-Qaʿdah, Dhul-Ḥijjah, Muḥarram and Rajab.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۛ āwُnِsْḥَaʾَw ۛ ِhَkُlْhَّtlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkyِdْyَaʾِb āwُqْlُt āَlَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُqِfnَaʾَw

ِbāَqِʿعْlā ُdyِdَhs َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā yِrِḍāَḥ ُhُlْhَaʾ ْnُkَy ْmَّl nَmِl َkِlَٰhd ۗ ٌhَlِmāَk ٌhَrَhsَʿع َkْlِt ۗ ْmُtْʿعَjgَr āَhdِiʾ ٍhَʿعْbَsَw ِّjgَḥْlā yِf ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَhtāَlَht ُmāَyِṣَf ْdِjgَy ْmَّl nَmَf ۚ ِyْdَhْlā َnِm َrَsْyَtْsā āَmَf ِّjgَḥْlā yَlِiʾ ِhَrْmُʿعْlāِb َʿعَّtَmَt nَmَf ْmُtnِmَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ٍkُsُn ْwَaʾ ٍhَqَdَṣ ْwَaʾ ٍmāَyِṣ nِّm ٌhَyْdِfَf ِhِsْaʾَّr nِّm yًhdَaʾ ِhِb ْwَaʾ āًḍyِrَّm mُknِm َnāَk nَmَf ۚ ُhَّlِḥَm ُyْdَhْlā َغُlْbَy ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُkَswُءُr āwُqِlْḥَt āَlَw ۖ ِyْdَhْlā َnِm َrَsْyَtْsā āَmَf ْmُtْrِṣْḥُaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّlِl َhَrْmُʿعْlāَw َّjgَḥْlā āwُّmِtَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Feeding six needy persons.
The slaughter of a sheep or goat.
Under normal conditions, i.e., are not prevented.
The months of Shawwāl, Dhul-Qaʿdah and Dhul-Ḥijjah.

ayas.translation: ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾ āَy ِnwُqَّtāَw ۚ ٰyَwْqَّtlā ِdāَّzlā َrْyَhk َّnِiʾَf āwُdَّwَzَtَw ۗ ُhَّllā ُhْmَlْʿعَy ٍrْyَhk ْnِm āwُlَʿعْfَt āَmَw ۗ ِّjgَḥْlā yِf َlāَdِjg āَlَw َqwُsُf āَlَw َhtَfَr āَlَf َّjgَḥْlā َّnِhyِf َḍَrَf nَmَf ۚ ٌtāَmwُlْʿعَّm ٌrُhْhsَaʾ ُّjgَḥْlā

footnotes.text: See previous footnote.

ayas.translation: َnyِّlāَّḍlā َnِmَl ِhِlْbَq nِّm mُtnُk nِiʾَw ْmُkāَdَh āَmَk ُhwُrُkْhdāَw ۖ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِrَʿعْhsَmْlā َdnِʿع َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَf ٍtāَfَrَʿع ْnِّm mُtْḍَfَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm āًlْḍَf āwُغَtْbَt nَaʾ ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَl

footnotes.text: i.e., profit from trade or business.
Which is in Muzdalifah.

ayas.translation: ٍqāَlَhk ْnِm ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُhَl āَmَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf āَnِtāʾ āَnَّbَr ُlwُqَy nَm ِsāَّnlā َnِmَf ۗ āًrْkِhd َّdَhsَaʾ ْwَaʾ ْmُkَءāَbāʾ ْmُkِrْkِhdَk َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَf ْmُkَkِsāَnَّm mُtْyَḍَq āَhdِiʾَf
ِrāَّnlā َbāَhdَʿع āَnِqَw ًhَnَsَḥ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِfَw ًhَnَsَḥ āَyْnُّdlā yِf āَnِtāʾ āَnَّbَr ُlwُqَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw

َnwُrَhsْḥُt ِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُkَّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۗ ٰyَqَّtā ِnَmِl ۚ ِhْyَlَʿع َmْhtِiʾ āَlَf َrَّhkَaʾَt nَmَw ِhْyَlَʿع َmْhtِiʾ āَlَf ِnْyَmْwَy yِf َlَّjgَʿعَt nَmَf ۚ ٍtāَdwُdْʿعَّm ٍmāَّyَaʾ yِf َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَw
ٌnyِbُّm ٌّwُdَʿع ْmُkَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِnāَṭْyَّhslā ِtāَwُṭُhk āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ًhَّfāَk ِmْlِّslā yِf āwُlُhkْdā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlِiʾ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِdْhَy ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhِnْhdِiʾِb ِّqَḥْlā َnِm ِhyِf āwُfَlَtْhkā āَmِl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā yَdَhَf ۖ ْmُhَnْyَb āًyْغَb ُtāَnِّyَbْlā ُmُhْtَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm ُhwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ ِhyِf َfَlَtْhkā āَmَw ۚ ِhyِf āwُfَlَtْhkā āَmyِf ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb َmُkْḥَyِl ِّqَḥْlāِb َbāَtِkْlā ُmُhَʿعَm َlَznَaʾَw َnyِrِhdnُmَw َnyِrِّhsَbُm َnyِّyِbَّnlā ُhَّllā َhtَʿعَbَf ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَّmُaʾ ُsāَّnlā َnāَk

ٌbyِrَq ِhَّllā َrْṣَn َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ِhَّllā ُrْṣَn ٰyَtَm ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ُlwُsَّrlā َlwُqَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُlِzْlُzَw ُءāَّrَّḍlāَw ُءāَsْaʾَbْlā ُmُhْtَّsَّm ۖ mُkِlْbَq nِm āْwَlَhk َnyِhdَّlā ُlَhtَّm mُkِtْaʾَy āَّmَlَw َhَّnَjgْlā āwُlُhkْdَt nَaʾ ْmُtْbِsَḥ ْmَaʾ

َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَّl ٌّrَhs َwُhَw āًyʾْyَhs āwُّbِḥُt nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿعَw ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُhَw āًyʾْyَhs āwُhَrْkَt nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿعَw ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌhْrُk َwُhَw ُlāَtِqْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع َbِtُk

َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf ْmُhُlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْtَṭِbَḥ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ٌrِfāَk َwُhَw ْtُmَyَf ِhِnyِd nَʿع ْmُknِm ْdِdَtْrَy nَmَw ۚ āwُʿعāَṭَtْsā ِnِiʾ ْmُkِnyِd nَʿع ْmُkwُّdُrَy ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُkَnwُlِtāَqُy َnwُlāَzَy āَlَw ۗ ِlْtَqْlā َnِm ُrَbْkَaʾ ُhَnْtِfْlāَw ۚ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُrَbْkَaʾ ُhْnِm ِhِlْhَaʾ ُjgāَrْhkِiʾَw ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlāَw ِhِb ٌrْfُkَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع ٌّdَṣَw ۖ ٌryِbَk ِhyِf ٌlāَtِq ْlُq ۖ ِhyِf ٍlāَtِq ِmāَrَḥْlā ِrْhَّhslā ِnَʿع َkَnwُlَaʾْsَy

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="194">2:194</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="191">2:191</reference>.
The word "khamr" (wine) includes all intoxicants. The final prohibition is given in <reference chapter="5" verses="90-91">5:90-91</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَtَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِsāَّnlِl ِhِtāَyāʾ ُnِّyَbُyَw ۖ ِhِnْhdِiʾِb ِhَrِfْغَmْlāَw ِhَّnَjgْlā yَlِiʾ wُʿعْdَy ُhَّllāَw ۖ ِrāَّnlā yَlِiʾ َnwُʿعْdَy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ ْmُkَbَjgْʿعَaʾ ْwَlَw ٍkِrْhsُّm nِّm ٌrْyَhk ٌnِmْwʾُّm ٌdْbَʿعَlَw ۚ āwُnِmْwʾُy ٰyَّtَḥ َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā āwُḥِknُt āَlَw ۗ ْmُkْtَbَjgْʿعَaʾ ْwَlَw ٍhَkِrْhsُّm nِّm ٌrْyَhk ٌhَnِmْwʾُّm ٌhَmَaʾَlَw ۚ َّnِmْwʾُy ٰyَّtَḥ ِtāَkِrْhsُmْlā āwُḥِknَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., worship and obey Allāh alone.
i.e., refrain from sexual intercourse.
By taking a complete bath (ghusl) .

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعyِmَs ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb āwُḥِlْṣُtَw āwُqَّtَtَw āwُّrَbَt nَaʾ ْmُkِnāَmْyَaʾِّl ًhَḍْrُʿع َhَّllā āwُlَʿعْjgَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Overlooking many violations, postponing penalty and granting opportunities for repentance and rectification despite having the power to punish immediately.
Without divorcing them. By such an oath the woman is deprived of her right in marriage but is not free to marry another. She may not be kept in such a condition beyond the four-month limit.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِkَḥ ٌzyِzَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ٌhَjgَrَd َّnِhْyَlَʿع ِlāَjgِّrlِlَw ۚ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb َّnِhْyَlَʿع yِhdَّlā ُlْhtِm َّnُhَlَw ۚ āًḥāَlْṣِiʾ āwُdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِhِّdَrِb ُّqَḥَaʾ َّnُhُtَlwُʿعُbَw ۚ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb َّnِmْwʾُy َّnُk nِiʾ َّnِhِmāَḥْrَaʾ yِf ُhَّllā َqَlَhk āَm َnْmُtْkَy nَaʾ َّnُhَl ُّlِḥَy āَlَw ۚ ٍءwُrُq َhَhtāَlَht َّnِhِsُfnَaʾِb َnْṣَّbَrَtَy ُtāَqَّlَṭُmْlāَw

footnotes.text: Either menstrual periods or periods of purity between menstruation. See also <reference chapter="65" verses="1-7">65:1-7</reference>.
The husband may return her to himself during the ʿiddah period of a first and second divorce without a new marriage contract.
The wife has specific rights upon her husband, just as the husband has rights upon her.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ِhَّllā َdwُdُḥ َّdَʿعَtَy nَmَw ۚ āَhwُdَtْʿعَt āَlَf ِhَّllā ُdwُdُḥ َkْlِt ۗ ِhِb ْtَdَtْfā āَmyِf āَmِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf ِhَّllā َdwُdُḥ āَmyِqُy āَّlَaʾ ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَf ۖ ِhَّllā َdwُdُḥ āَmyِqُy āَّlَaʾ āَfāَhkَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āًyʾْyَhs َّnُhwُmُtْyَtāʾ āَّmِm āwُhdُhkْaʾَt nَaʾ ْmُkَl ُّlِḥَy āَlَw ۗ ٍnāَsْḥِiʾِb ٌḥyِrْsَt ْwَaʾ ٍfwُrْʿعَmِb ٌkāَsْmِiʾَf ۖ ِnāَtَّrَm ُqāَlَّṭlā

footnotes.text: i.e., deal fairly with each other.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy ٍmْwَqِl āَhُnِّyَbُy ِhَّllā ُdwُdُḥ َkْlِtَw ۗ ِhَّllā َdwُdُḥ āَmyِqُy nَaʾ āَّnَẓ nِiʾ āَʿعَjgāَrَtَy nَaʾ āَmِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf āَhَqَّlَṭ nِiʾَf ۗ ُhَrْyَغ āًjgْwَz َḥِknَt ٰyَّtَḥ ُdْʿعَb nِm ُhَl ُّlِḥَt āَlَf āَhَqَّlَṭ nِiʾَf

footnotes.text: With the intention of permanence, not merely in order to return to the previous husband.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ ِhِb mُkُẓِʿعَy ِhَmْkِḥْlāَw ِbāَtِkْlā َnِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َlَznَaʾ āَmَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdāَw ۚ āًwُzُh ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَlَw ۚ ُhَsْfَn َmَlَẓ ْdَqَf َkِlَٰhd ْlَʿعْfَy nَmَw ۚ āwُdَtْʿعَtِّl āًrāَrِḍ َّnُhwُkِsْmُt āَlَw ۚ ٍfwُrْʿعَmِb َّnُhwُḥِّrَs ْwَaʾ ٍfwُrْʿعَmِb َّnُhwُkِsْmَaʾَf َّnُhَlَjgَaʾ َnْغَlَbَf َءāَsِّnlā ُmُtْqَّlَṭ āَhdِiʾَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُrَhْṭَaʾَw ْmُkَl ٰyَkْzَaʾ ْmُkِlَٰhd ۗ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb ُnِmْwʾُy ْmُknِm َnāَk nَm ِhِb ُẓَʿعwُy َkِlَٰhd ۗ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb mُhَnْyَb āْwَḍāَrَt āَhdِiʾ َّnُhَjgāَwْzَaʾ َnْḥِknَy nَaʾ َّnُhwُlُḍْʿعَt āَlَf َّnُhَlَjgَaʾ َnْغَlَbَf َءāَsِّnlā ُmُtْqَّlَṭ āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: For the first or second time.

ayas.translation: ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۗ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb mُtْyَtāʾ āَّm mُtْmَّlَs āَhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf ْmُkَdāَlْwَaʾ āwُʿعِḍْrَtْsَt nَaʾ ْmُّtdَrَaʾ ْnِiʾَw ۗ āَmِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf ٍrُwāَhsَtَw āَmُhْnِّm ٍḍāَrَt nَʿع āًlāَṣِf āَdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۗ َkِlَٰhd ُlْhtِm ِhtِrāَwْlā yَlَʿعَw ۚ ِhِdَlَwِb ُhَّl ٌdwُlْwَm āَlَw āَhِdَlَwِb ٌhَdِlāَw َّrāَḍُt āَl ۚ āَhَʿعْsُw āَّlِiʾ ٌsْfَn ُfَّlَkُt āَl ۚ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb َّnُhُtَwْsِkَw َّnُhُqْzِr ُhَl ِdwُlْwَmْlā yَlَʿعَw ۚ َhَʿعāَḍَّrlā َّmِtُy nَaʾ َdāَrَaʾ ْnَmِl ۖ ِnْyَlِmāَk ِnْyَlْwَḥ َّnُhَdāَlْwَaʾ َnْʿعِḍْrُy ُtāَdِlāَwْlāَw

ٌryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb َّnِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf َnْlَʿعَf āَmyِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf َّnُhَlَjgَaʾ َnْغَlَb āَhdِiʾَf ۖ āًrْhsَʿعَw ٍrُhْhsَaʾ َhَʿعَbْrَaʾ َّnِhِsُfnَaʾِb َnْṣَّbَrَtَy āًjgāَwْzَaʾ َnwُrَhdَyَw ْmُknِm َnْwَّfَwَtُy َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: They may remarry if they wish.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَḥ ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۚ ُhwُrَhdْḥāَf ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۚ ُhَlَjgَaʾ ُbāَtِkْlā َغُlْbَy ٰyَّtَḥ ِḥāَkِّnlā َhَdْqُʿع āwُmِzْʿعَt āَlَw ۚ āًfwُrْʿعَّm āًlْwَq āwُlwُqَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āًّrِs َّnُhwُdِʿعāَwُt āَّl nِkٰـَlَw َّnُhَnwُrُkْhdَtَs ْmُkَّnَaʾ ُhَّllā َmِlَʿع ۚ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ yِf ْmُtnَnْkَaʾ ْwَaʾ ِءāَsِّnlā ِhَbْṭِhk ْnِm ِhِb mُtْḍَّrَʿع āَmyِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَw

footnotes.text: The ʿiddah (bereavement period) after the death of a husband.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā yَlَʿع āًّqَḥ ۖ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb āًʿعāَtَm ُhُrَdَq ِrِtْqُmْlā yَlَʿعَw ُhُrَdَq ِʿعِswُmْlā yَlَʿع َّnُhwُʿعِّtَmَw ۚ ًhَḍyِrَf َّnُhَl āwُḍِrْfَt ْwَaʾ َّnُhwُّsَmَt ْmَl āَm َءāَsِّnlā ُmُtْqَّlَṭ nِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَّl

footnotes.text: The marriage has not been consummated.
Required bridal gift (mahr) .

ayas.translation: ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkَnْyَb َlْḍَfْlā āُwَsnَt āَlَw ۚ ٰyَwْqَّtlِl ُbَrْqَaʾ āwُfْʿعَt nَaʾَw ۚ ِḥāَkِّnlā ُhَdْqُʿع ِhِdَyِb yِhdَّlā َwُfْʿعَy ْwَaʾ َnwُfْʿعَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُtْḍَrَf āَm ُfْṣِnَf ًhَḍyِrَf َّnُhَl ْmُtْḍَrَf ْdَqَw َّnُhwُّsَmَt nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm َّnُhwُmُtْqَّlَṭ nِiʾَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āwُnwُkَt ْmَl āَّm mُkَmَّlَʿع āَmَk َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَf ْmُtnِmَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۖ āًnāَbْkُr ْwَaʾ āًlāَjgِrَf ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَf

ٌmyِkَḥ ٌzyِzَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ٍfwُrْʿعَّm nِm َّnِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf َnْlَʿعَf āَm yِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf َnْjgَrَhk ْnِiʾَf ۚ ٍjgāَrْhkِiʾ َrْyَغ ِlْwَḥْlā yَlِiʾ āًʿعāَtَّm mِhِjgāَwْzَaʾِّl ًhَّyِṣَw āًjgāَwْzَaʾ َnwُrَhdَyَw ْmُknِm َnْwَّfَwَtُy َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: This directive was abrogated by those later revealed in <reference chapter="2" verses="234">2:234</reference> and <reference chapter="4" verses="12">4:12</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْhsَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿع ٍlْḍَf wُhdَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhāَyْḥَaʾ َّmُht āwُtwُm ُhَّllā ُmُhَl َlāَqَf ِtْwَmْlā َrَhdَḥ ٌfwُlُaʾ ْmُhَw ْmِhِrāَyِd nِm āwُjgَrَhk َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ
َnwُʿعَjgْrُt ِhْyَlِiʾَw ُṭُsْbَyَw ُḍِbْqَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ًhَryِhtَk āًfāَʿعْḍَaʾ ُhَl ُhَfِʿعāَḍُyَf āًnَsَḥ āًḍْrَq َhَّllā ُḍِrْqُy yِhdَّlā āَhd nَّm

َnyِmِlāَّẓlāِb ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُhْnِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ āْwَّlَwَt ُlāَtِqْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َbِtُk āَّmَlَf ۖ āَnِyʾāَnْbَaʾَw āَnِrāَyِd nِm āَnْjgِrْhkُaʾ ْdَqَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َlِtāَqُn āَّlَaʾ āَnَl āَmَw āwُlāَq ۖ āwُlِtāَqُt āَّlَaʾ ُlāَtِqْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع َbِtُk nِiʾ ْmُtْyَsَʿع ْlَh َlāَq ۖ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْlِtāَqُّn āًkِlَm āَnَl ْhtَʿعْbā ُmُhَّl ٍّyِbَnِl āwُlāَq ْhdِiʾ ٰyَswُm ِdْʿعَb nِm َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb nِm ِiʾَlَmْlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعِsāَw ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ُhَkْlُm yِtْwʾُy ُhَّllāَw ۖ ِmْsِjgْlāَw ِmْlِʿعْlā yِf ًhَṭْsَb ُhَdāَzَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhāَfَṭْṣā َhَّllā َّnِiʾ َlāَq ۚ ِlāَmْlā َnِّm ًhَʿعَs َtْwʾُy ْmَlَw ُhْnِm ِkْlُmْlāِb ُّqَḥَaʾ ُnْḥَnَw āَnْyَlَʿع ُkْlُmْlā ُhَl ُnwُkَy ٰyَّnَaʾ āwُlāَq ۚ āًkِlَm َtwُlāَṭ ْmُkَl َhtَʿعَb ْdَq َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ْmُhُّyِbَn ْmُhَl َlāَqَw

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَّl ًhَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُhُlِmْḥَt َnwُrāَh ُlāʾَw ٰyَswُm ُlāʾ َkَrَt āَّmِّm ٌhَّyِqَbَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَnyِkَs ِhyِf ُtwُbāَّtlā ُmُkَyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ِhِkْlُm َhَyāʾ َّnِiʾ ْmُhُّyِbَn ْmُhَl َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Signs giving reassurance.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِbāَّṣlā َʿعَm ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb ًhَryِhtَk ًhَyʾِf ْtَbَlَغ ٍhَlyِlَq ٍhَyʾِf nِّm mَk ِhَّllā wُqāَlُّm mُhَّnَaʾ َnwُّnُẓَy َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ۚ ِhِdwُnُjgَw َtwُlāَjgِb َmْwَyْlā āَnَl َhَqāَṭ āَl āwُlāَq ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw َwُh ُhَzَwāَjg āَّmَlَf ۚ ْmُhْnِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ُhْnِm āwُbِrَhsَf ۚ ِhِdَyِb ًhَfْrُغ َfَrَtْغā ِnَm āَّlِiʾ yِّnِm ُhَّnِiʾَf ُhْmَʿعْṭَy ْmَّl nَmَw yِّnِm َsْyَlَf ُhْnِm َbِrَhs nَmَf ٍrَhَnِb mُkyِlَtْbُm َhَّllā َّnِiʾ َlāَq ِdwُnُjgْlāِb ُtwُlāَṭ َlَṣَf āَّmَlَf
َnyِrِfāَkْlā ِmْwَqْlā yَlَʿع āَnْrُṣnāَw āَnَmāَdْqَaʾ ْtِّbَhtَw āًrْbَṣ āَnْyَlَʿع ْغِrْfَaʾ āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq ِhِdwُnُjgَw َtwُlāَjgِl āwُzَrَb āَّmَlَw

َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٍlْḍَf wُhd َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw ُḍْrَaʾْlā ِtَdَsَfَّl ٍḍْʿعَbِb mُhَḍْʿعَb َsāَّnlā ِhَّllā ُʿعْfَd āَlْwَlَw ۗ ُءāَhsَy āَّmِm ُhَmَّlَʿعَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َkْlُmْlā ُhَّllā ُhāَtāʾَw َtwُlāَjg ُdwُwāَd َlَtَqَw ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb mُhwُmَzَhَf

ُdyِrُy āَm ُlَʿعْfَy َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw āwُlَtَtْqā āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۚ َrَfَk nَّm mُhْnِmَw َnَmāʾ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَf āwُfَlَtْhkā ِnِkٰـَlَw ُtāَnِّyَbْlā ُmُhْtَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِّm mِhِdْʿعَb nِm َnyِhdَّlā َlَtَtْqā āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۗ ِsُdُqْlā ِḥwُrِb ُhāَnْdَّyَaʾَw ِtāَnِّyَbْlā َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع āَnْyَtāʾَw ۚ ٍtāَjgَrَd ْmُhَḍْʿعَb َʿعَfَrَw ۖ ُhَّllā َmَّlَk nَّm mُhْnِّm ۘ ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَḍْʿعَb āَnْlَّḍَf ُlُsُّrlā َkْlِt
َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُmُh َnwُrِfāَkْlāَw ۗ ٌhَʿعāَfَhs āَlَw ٌhَّlُhk āَlَw ِhyِf ٌʿعْyَb āَّl ٌmْwَy َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِّm mُkāَnْqَzَr āَّmِm āwُqِfnَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ُmyِẓَʿعْlā ُّyِlَʿعْlā َwُhَw ۚ āَmُhُẓْfِḥ ُhُdwُyʾَy āَlَw ۖ َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُhُّyِsْrُk َʿعِsَw ۚ َءāَhs āَmِb āَّlِiʾ ِhِmْlِʿع ْnِّm ٍءْyَhsِb َnwُṭyِḥُy āَlَw ۖ ْmُhَfْlَhk āَmَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ َnْyَb āَm ُmَlْʿعَy ۚ ِhِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ُhَdnِʿع ُʿعَfْhsَy yِhdَّlā āَhd nَm ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَّl ۚ ٌmْwَn āَlَw ٌhَnِs ُhُhdُhkْaʾَt āَl ۚ ُmwُّyَqْlā ُّyَḥْlā َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: Whose life is perfect, complete and eternal, without beginning or end, and through whom all created life originated and continues.
Dependent on none for His existence while being the sustainer and administrator of all created existence.
Allāh's knowledge encompasses every aspect of His creations in the past, present and future.
Chair or footstool. It is not to be confused with al-ʿArsh (the Throne) , which is infinitely higher and greater than al-Kursī.
Above all of His creations and superior to them in essence, rank and position.
Whose greatness is unlimited, beyond description or imagination.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعyِmَs ُhَّllāَw ۗ āَhَl َmāَṣِfnā āَl ٰyَqْhtُwْlā ِhَwْrُʿعْlāِb َkَsْmَtْsā ِdَqَf ِhَّllāِb nِmْwʾُyَw ِtwُغāَّṭlāِb ْrُfْkَy nَmَf ۚ ِّyَغْlā َnِm ُdْhsُّrlā َnَّyَbَّt dَq ۖ ِnyِّdlā yِf َhāَrْkِiʾ āَl

footnotes.text: False objects of worship, such as idols, heavenly bodies, spirits, human beings, etc.

ayas.translation: َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ ِtāَmُlُّẓlā yَlِiʾ ِrwُّnlā َnِّm mُhَnwُjgِrْhkُy ُtwُغāَّṭlā ُmُhُwʾāَyِlْwَaʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ِrwُّnlā yَlِiʾ ِtāَmُlُّẓlā َnِّm mُhُjgِrْhkُy āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُّyِlَw ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: Including the meanings of patron, supporter, benefactor, guardian, protector, defender and caretaker.
The light of truth is one, while the darknesses of disbelief, doubt and error are many.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ َrَfَk yِhdَّlā َtِhُbَf ِbِrْغَmْlā َnِm āَhِb ِtْaʾَf ِqِrْhsَmْlā َnِm ِsْmَّhslāِb yِtْaʾَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ُmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َlāَq ۖ ُtyِmُaʾَw yِyْḥُaʾ āَnَaʾ َlāَq ُtyِmُyَw yِyْḥُy yِhdَّlā َyِّbَr ُmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َlāَq ْhdِiʾ َkْlُmْlā ُhَّllā ُhāَtāʾ ْnَaʾ ِhِّbَr yِf َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َّjgāَḥ yِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ُmَlْʿعَaʾ َlāَq ُhَl َnَّyَbَt āَّmَlَf ۚ āًmْḥَl āَhwُsْkَn َّmُht āَhُzِhsnُn َfْyَk ِmāَẓِʿعْlā yَlِiʾ ْrُẓnāَw ۖ ِsāَّnlِّl ًhَyāʾ َkَlَʿعْjgَnِlَw َkِrāَmِḥ ٰyَlِiʾ ْrُẓnāَw ۖ ْhَّnَsَtَy ْmَl َkِbāَrَhsَw َkِmāَʿعَṭ ٰyَlِiʾ ْrُẓnāَf ٍmāَʿع َhَyʾāِm َtْhtِbَّl lَb َlāَq ۖ ٍmْwَy َḍْʿعَb ْwَaʾ āًmْwَy ُtْhtِbَl َlāَq ۖ َtْhtِbَl ْmَk َlāَq ۖ ُhَhtَʿعَb َّmُht ٍmāَʿع َhَyʾāِm ُhَّllā ُhَtāَmَaʾَf ۖ āَhِtْwَm َdْʿعَb ُhَّllā ِhِhdٰـَh yِyْḥُy ٰyَّnَaʾ َlāَq āَhِhswُrُʿع ٰyَlَʿع ٌhَyِwāَhk َyِhَw ٍhَyْrَq ٰyَlَʿع َّrَm yِhdَّlāَk ْwَaʾ

ٌmyِkَḥ ٌzyِzَʿع َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ْmَlْʿعāَw ۚ āًyْʿعَs َkَnyِtْaʾَy َّnُhُʿعْdā َّmُht āًءْzُjg َّnُhْnِّm ٍlَbَjg ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ْlَʿعْjgā َّmُht َkْyَlِiʾ َّnُhْrُṣَf ِrْyَّṭlā َnِّm ًhَʿعَbْrَaʾ ْhdُhkَf َlāَq ۖ yِbْlَq َّnِyʾَmْṭَyِّl nِkٰـَlَw ٰyَlَb َlāَq ۖ nِmْwʾُt ْmَlَwَaʾ َlāَq ۖ ٰyَtْwَmْlā yِyْḥُt َfْyَk yِnِrَaʾ ِّbَr ُmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., train them to come to you on command.

ayas.translation: َnwُnَzْḥَy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٌfْwَhk āَlَw ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmُhُrْjgَaʾ ْmُhَّl ۙ yًhdَaʾ āَlَw āًّnَm āwُqَfnَaʾ āَm َnwُʿعِbْtُy āَl َّmُht ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ َnwُqِfnُy َnyِhdَّlā

َnyِrِfāَkْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُbَsَk āَّmِّm ٍءْyَhs ٰyَlَʿع َnwُrِdْqَy āَّl ۖ āًdْlَṣ ُhَkَrَtَf ٌlِbāَw ُhَbāَṣَaʾَf ٌbāَrُt ِhْyَlَʿع ٍnāَwْfَṣ ِlَhtَmَk ُhُlَhtَmَf ۖ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb ُnِmْwʾُy āَlَw ِsāَّnlā َءāَyʾِr ُhَlāَm ُqِfnُy yِhdَّlāَk ٰyَhdَaʾْlāَw ِّnَmْlāِb mُkِtāَqَdَṣ āwُlِṭْbُt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ٌّlَṭَf ٌlِbāَw āَhْbِṣُy ْmَّl nِiʾَf ِnْyَfْʿعِḍ āَhَlُkُaʾ ْtَtāʾَf ٌlِbāَw āَhَbāَṣَaʾ ٍhَwْbَrِb ٍhَّnَjg ِlَhtَmَk ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ْnِّm āًtyِbْhtَtَw ِhَّllā ِtāَḍْrَm َءāَغِtْbā ُmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ َnwُqِfnُy َnyِhdَّlā ُlَhtَmَw

َnwُrَّkَfَtَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ ْtَqَrَtْḥāَf ٌrāَn ِhyِf ٌrāَṣْʿعِiʾ āَhَbāَṣَaʾَf ُءāَfَʿعُḍ ٌhَّyِّrُhd ُhَlَw ُrَbِkْlā ُhَbāَṣَaʾَw ِtāَrَmَّhtlā ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf ُhَl ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍbāَnْʿعَaʾَw ٍlyِhkَّn nِّm ٌhَّnَjg ُhَl َnwُkَt nَaʾ ْmُkُdَḥَaʾ ُّdَwَyَaʾ

ٌdyِmَḥ ٌّyِnَغ َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۚ ِhyِf āwُḍِmْغُt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhyِhdِhkāʾِb mُtْsَlَw َnwُqِfnُt ُhْnِm َhtyِbَhkْlā āwُmَّmَyَt āَlَw ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِّm mُkَl āَnْjgَrْhkَaʾ āَّmِmَw ْmُtْbَsَk āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ nِm āwُqِfnَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā wُlwُaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُrَّkَّhdَy āَmَw ۗ āًryِhtَk āًrْyَhk َyِtwُaʾ ْdَqَf َhَmْkِḥْlā َtْwʾُy nَmَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm َhَmْkِḥْlā yِtْwʾُy

footnotes.text: The knowledge and understanding of the religion and of the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: ٍrāَṣnَaʾ ْnِm َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl āَmَw ۗ ُhُmَlْʿعَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ٍrْhdَّn nِّm mُtْrَhdَn ْwَaʾ ٍhَqَfَّn nِّm mُtْqَfnَaʾ āَmَw
ٌryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkِtāَyʾِّyَs nِّm mُknَʿع ُrِّfَkُyَw ۚ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُhَf َءāَrَqُfْlā āَhwُtْwʾُtَw āَhwُfْhkُt nِiʾَw ۖ َyِh āَّmِʿعِnَf ِtāَqَdَّṣlā āwُdْbُt nِiʾ

َnwُmَlْẓُt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ْmُkْyَlِiʾ َّfَwُy ٍrْyَhk ْnِm āwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِhْjgَw َءāَغِtْbā āَّlِiʾ َnwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۚ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾِlَf ٍrْyَhk ْnِm āwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۗ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِdْhَy َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw ْmُhāَdُh َkْyَlَʿع َsْyَّl

footnotes.text: i.e., wealth, property, resources, time, effort, etc.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ِhِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ٍrْyَhk ْnِm āwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۗ āًfāَḥْlِiʾ َsāَّnlā َnwُlَaʾْsَy āَl ْmُhāَmyِsِb mُhُfِrْʿعَt ِfُّfَʿعَّtlā َnِm َءāَyِnْغَaʾ ُlِhāَjgْlā ُmُhُbَsْḥَy ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًbْrَḍ َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āَl ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُrِṣْḥُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِءāَrَqُfْlِl

َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf َdāَʿع ْnَmَw ۖ ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ُhُrْmَaʾَw َfَlَs āَm ُhَlَf ٰyَhَtnāَf ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَẓِʿعْwَm ُhَءāَjg nَmَf ۚ āَbِّrlā َmَّrَḥَw َʿعْyَbْlā ُhَّllā َّlَḥَaʾَw ۗ āَbِّrlā ُlْhtِm ُʿعْyَbْlā āَmَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِّsَmْlā َnِm ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُhُṭَّbَhkَtَy yِhdَّlā ُmwُqَy āَmَk āَّlِiʾ َnwُmwُqَy āَl āَbِّrlā َnwُlُkْaʾَy َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: Included is that given on commercial as well as consumer loans.

ayas.translation: َnwُnَzْḥَy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٌfْwَhk āَlَw ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmُhُrْjgَaʾ ْmُhَl َhāَkَّzlā āُwَtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmāَqَaʾَw ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ āَbِّrlā َnِm َyِqَb āَm āwُrَhdَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُmَlْẓُt āَlَw َnwُmِlْẓَt āَl ْmُkِlāَwْmَaʾ ُswُءُr ْmُkَlَf ْmُtْbُt nِiʾَw ۖ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍbْrَḥِb āwُnَhdْaʾَf āwُlَʿعْfَt ْmَّl nِiʾَf

ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُhَّllā ُmُkُmِّlَʿعُyَw ۖ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۗ ْmُkِb ٌqwُsُf ُhَّnِiʾَf āwُlَʿعْfَt nِiʾَw ۚ ٌdyِhَhs āَlَw ٌbِtāَk َّrāَḍُy āَlَw ۚ ْmُtْʿعَyāَbَt āَhdِiʾ āwُdِhْhsَaʾَw ۗ āَhwُbُtْkَt āَّlَaʾ ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَlَf ْmُkَnْyَb āَhَnwُryِdُt ًhَrِḍāَḥ ًhَrāَjgِt َnwُkَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ۖ āwُbāَtْrَt āَّlَaʾ ٰyَnْdَaʾَw ِhَdāَhَّhslِl ُmَwْqَaʾَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُṭَsْqَaʾ ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhِlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āًryِbَk ْwَaʾ āًryِغَṣ ُhwُbُtْkَt nَaʾ āwُmَaʾْsَt āَlَw ۚ āwُʿعُd āَm āَhdِiʾ ُءāَdَhُّhslā َbْaʾَy āَlَw ۚ ٰyَrْhkُaʾْlā āَmُhāَdْḥِiʾ َrِّkَhdُtَf āَmُhāَdْḥِiʾ َّlِḍَt nَaʾ ِءāَdَhُّhslā َnِm َnْwَḍْrَt nَّmِm ِnāَtَaʾَrْmāَw ٌlُjgَrَf ِnْyَlُjgَr āَnwُkَy ْmَّl nِiʾَf ۖ ْmُkِlāَjgِّr nِm ِnْyَdyِhَhs āwُdِhْhsَtْsāَw ۚ ِlْdَʿعْlāِb ُhُّyِlَw ْlِlْmُyْlَf َwُh َّlِmُy nَaʾ ُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āَl ْwَaʾ āًfyِʿعَḍ ْwَaʾ āًhyِfَs ُّqَḥْlā ِhْyَlَʿع yِhdَّlā َnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ُhْnِm ْsَhkْbَy āَlَw ُhَّbَr َhَّllā ِqَّtَyْlَw ُّqَḥْlā ِhْyَlَʿع yِhdَّlā ِlِlْmُyْlَw ْbُtْkَyْlَf ۚ ُhَّllā ُhَmَّlَʿع āَmَk َbُtْkَy nَaʾ ٌbِtāَk َbْaʾَy āَlَw ۚ ِlْdَʿعْlāِb ٌbِtāَk ْmُkَnْyَّb bُtْkَyْlَw ۚ ُhwُbُtْkāَf yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ٍnْyَdِb mُtnَyāَdَt āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌmyِlَʿع َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُhُbْlَq ٌmِhtāʾ ُhَّnِiʾَf āَhْmُtْkَy nَmَw ۚ َhَdāَhَّhslā āwُmُtْkَt āَlَw ۗ ُhَّbَr َhَّllā ِqَّtَyْlَw ُhَtَnāَmَaʾ َnِmُtْwʾā yِhdَّlā ِّdَwʾُyْlَf āًḍْʿعَb mُkُḍْʿعَb َnِmَaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۖ ٌhَḍwُbْqَّm ٌnāَhِrَf āًbِtāَk āwُdِjgَt ْmَlَw ٍrَfَs ٰyَlَʿع ْmُtnُk nِiʾَw

ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُءāَhsَy nَm ُbِّhdَʿعُyَw ُءāَhsَy nَmِl ُrِfْغَyَf ۖ ُhَّllā ِhِb mُkْbِsāَḥُy ُhwُfْhkُt ْwَaʾ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ yِf āَm āwُdْbُt nِiʾَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِّl

ُryِṣَmْlā َkْyَlِiʾَw āَnَّbَr َkَnāَrْfُغ ۖ āَnْʿعَṭَaʾَw āَnْʿعِmَs āwُlāَqَw ۚ ِhِlُsُّr nِّm ٍdَḥَaʾ َnْyَb ُqِّrَfُn āَl ِhِlُsُrَw ِhِbُtُkَw ِhِtَkِyʾāَlَmَw ِhَّllāِb َnَmāʾ ٌّlُk ۚ َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlāَw ِhِّbَّr nِm ِhْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmِb ُlwُsَّrlā َnَmāʾ

َnyِrِfāَkْlā ِmْwَqْlā yَlَʿع āَnْrُṣnāَf āَnāَlْwَm َtnَaʾ ۚ āَnْmَḥْrāَw āَnَl ْrِfْغāَw āَّnَʿع ُfْʿعāَw ۖ ِhِb āَnَl َhَqāَṭ āَl āَm āَnْlِّmَḥُt āَlَw āَnَّbَr ۚ āَnِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع ُhَtْlَmَḥ āَmَk āًrْṣِiʾ āَnْyَlَʿع ْlِmْḥَt āَlَw āَnَّbَr ۚ āَnْaʾَṭْhkَaʾ ْwَaʾ āَnyِsَّn nِiʾ āَnْhdِhkāَwʾُt āَl āَnَّbَr ۗ ْtَbَsَtْkā āَm āَhْyَlَʿعَw ْtَbَsَk āَm āَhَl ۚ āَhَʿعْsُw āَّlِiʾ āًsْfَn ُhَّllā ُfِّlَkُy āَl

footnotes.text: Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) concludes this sūrah by directing His servants how to supplicate Him, just as He taught them in Sūrah al-Fātiḥah how to praise Him and ask for guidance.

i.e., He who restores justice by punishing those who persist in wrongdoing, fail to heed warnings and are unrepentant.

ayas.translation: ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā wُlwُaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُrَّkَّhdَy āَmَw ۗ āَnِّbَr ِdnِʿع ْnِّm ٌّlُk ِhِb āَّnَmāʾ َnwُlwُqَy ِmْlِʿعْlā yِf َnwُhkِsāَّrlāَw ۗ ُhَّllā āَّlِiʾ ُhَlyِwْaʾَt ُmَlْʿعَy āَmَw ۗ ِhِlyِwْaʾَt َءāَغِtْbāَw ِhَnْtِfْlā َءāَغِtْbā ُhْnِm َhَbāَhsَt āَm َnwُʿعِbَّtَyَf ٌغْyَz ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf ۖ ٌtāَhِbāَhsَtُm ُrَhkُaʾَw ِbāَtِkْlā ُّmُaʾ َّnُh ٌtāَmَkْḥُّm ٌtāَyāʾ ُhْnِm َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlَʿع َlَznَaʾ yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: Those which are stated in such a way that they are open to more than one interpretation or whose meaning is known only to Allāh, such as the opening letters of certain sūrahs.

ayas.translation: ُbāَّhَwْlā َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۚ ًhَmْḥَr َknُdَّl nِm āَnَl ْbَhَw āَnَtْyَdَh ْhdِiʾ َdْʿعَb āَnَbwُlُq ْغِzُt āَl āَnَّbَr

footnotes.text: Who gives and grants continually without being asked.

ayas.translation: ِrāَṣْbَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾِّl ًhَrْbِʿعَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۗ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِrْṣَnِb ُdِّyَwʾُy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِnْyَʿعْlā َyْaʾَr ْmِhْyَlْhtِّm mُhَnْwَrَy ٌhَrِfāَk ٰyَrْhkُaʾَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ُlِtāَqُt ٌhَyʾِf ۖ āَtَqَtْlā ِnْyَtَyʾِf yِf ٌhَyāʾ ْmُkَl َnāَk ْdَq

footnotes.text: The believers saw the disbelievers to be double their own number preceding the battle of Badr, while, in fact, they were three times their number.

ayas.translation: ِdāَbِʿعْlāِb ٌryِṣَb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhَّllā َnِّm ٌnāَwْḍِrَw ٌhَrَّhَṭُّm ٌjgāَwْzَaʾَw āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٌtāَّnَjg ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlِl ۚ ْmُkِlَٰhd nِّm ٍrْyَhkِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُwʾَaʾ ْlُq
ِrāَّnlā َbāَhdَʿع āَnِqَw āَnَbwُnُhd āَnَl ْrِfْغāَf āَّnَmāʾ āَnَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَr َnwُlwُqَy َnyِhdَّlā
ُmyِkَḥْlā ُzyِzَʿعْlā َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ۚ ِṭْsِqْlāِb āًmِyʾāَq ِmْlِʿعْlā wُlwُaʾَw ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlāَw َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ُhَّnَaʾ ُhَّllā َdِhَhs

ِbāَsِḥْlā ُʿعyِrَs َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb ْrُfْkَy nَmَw ۗ ْmُhَnْyَb āًyْغَb ُmْlِʿعْlā ُmُhَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َfَlَtْhkā āَmَw ۗ ُmāَlْsِiʾْlā ِhَّllā َdnِʿع َnyِّdlā َّnِiʾ

ِdāَbِʿعْlāِb ٌryِṣَb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُغāَlَbْlā َkْyَlَʿع āَmَّnِiʾَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَّw ۖ āwَdَtْhā ِdَqَf āwُmَlْsَaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۚ ْmُtْmَlْsَaʾَaʾ َnyِّyِّmُaʾْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlِّl lُqَw ۗ ِnَʿعَbَّtā ِnَmَw ِhَّlِl َyِhْjgَw ُtْmَlْsَaʾ ْlُqَf َkwُّjgāَḥ ْnِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Those who had no scripture (i.e., the pagans).
Referring to the Jews of Madīnah who refused to implement the rulings given by Allāh in the Torah or to acknowledge the Prophet (ﷺ), whose coming was mentioned therein.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِnyِd yِf ْmُhَّrَغَw ۖ ٍtāَdwُdْʿعَّm āًmāَّyَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُrāَّnlā āَnَّsَmَt nَl āwُlāَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُryِṣَmْlā ِhَّllā yَlِiʾَw ۗ ُhَsْfَn ُhَّllā ُmُkُrِّhdَḥُyَw ۗ ًhāَqُt ْmُhْnِm āwُqَّtَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍءْyَhs yِf ِhَّllā َnِm َsْyَlَf َkِlَٰhd ْlَʿعْfَy nَmَw ۖ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِnwُd nِm َءāَyِlْwَaʾ َnyِrِfāَkْlā َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ِhdِhkَّtَy āَّl

footnotes.text: When fearing harm from an enemy, the believer may pretend as long as his heart and intention are not affected.

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَyَw ۗ ُhَّllā ُhْmَlْʿعَy ُhwُdْbُt ْwَaʾ ْmُkِrwُdُṣ yِf āَm āwُfْhkُt nِiʾ ْlُq

ِdāَbِʿعْlāِb ٌfwُءَr ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُhَsْfَn ُhَّllā ُmُkُrِّhdَḥُyَw ۗ āًdyِʿعَb āًdَmَaʾ ُhَnْyَbَw āَhَnْyَb َّnَaʾ ْwَl ُّdَwَt ٍءwُs nِm ْtَlِmَʿع āَmَw āًrَḍْḥُّm ٍrْyَhk ْnِm ْtَlِmَʿع āَّm ٍsْfَn ُّlُk ُdِjgَt َmْwَy
ُmyِlَʿعْlā ُʿعyِmَّslā َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۖ yِّnِm ْlَّbَqَtَf āًrَّrَḥُm yِnْṭَb yِf āَm َkَl ُtْrَhdَn yِّnِiʾ ِّbَr َnāَrْmِʿع ُtَaʾَrْmā ِtَlāَq ْhdِiʾ

ِmyِjgَّrlā ِnāَṭْyَّhslā َnِm āَhَtَّyِّrُhdَw َkِb āَhُhdyِʿعُaʾ yِّnِiʾَw َmَyْrَm āَhُtْyَّmَs yِّnِiʾَw ۖ ٰyَhtnُaʾْlāَk ُrَkَّhdlā َsْyَlَw ْtَʿعَḍَw āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ٰyَhtnُaʾ āَhُtْʿعَḍَw yِّnِiʾ ِّbَr ْtَlāَq āَhْtَʿعَḍَw āَّmَlَf

ٍbāَsِḥ ِrْyَغِb ُءāَhsَy nَm ُqُzْrَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِm َwُh ْtَlāَq ۖ āَhdٰـَh ِkَl ٰyَّnَaʾ ُmَyْrَm āَy َlāَq ۖ āًqْzِr āَhَdnِʿع َdَjgَw َbāَrْḥِmْlā āَّyِrَkَz āَhْyَlَʿع َlَhkَd āَmَّlُk ۖ āَّyِrَkَz āَhَlَّfَkَw āًnَsَḥ āًtāَbَn āَhَtَbnَaʾَw ٍnَsَḥ ٍlwُbَqِb āَhُّbَr āَhَlَّbَqَtَf
َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā َnِّm āًّyِbَnَw āًrwُṣَḥَw āًdِّyَsَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍhَmِlَkِb āًqِّdَṣُm ٰyَyْḥَyِb َkُrِّhsَbُy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ِbāَrْḥِmْlā yِf yِّlَṣُy ٌmِyʾāَq َwُhَw ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُhْtَdāَnَf

footnotes.text: Referring to the prophet Jesus (upon whom be peace) , who was conceived merely by a command from Allāh - the word "Be."

ayas.translation: ِrāَkْbِiʾْlāَw ِّyِhsَʿعْlāِb ْḥِّbَsَw āًryِhtَk َkَّbَّr rُkْhdāَw ۗ āًzْmَr āَّlِiʾ ٍmāَّyَaʾ َhَhtāَlَht َsāَّnlā َmِّlَkُt āَّlَaʾ َkُtَyāʾ َlāَq ۖ ًhَyāʾ yِّl lَʿعْjgā ِّbَr َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., threw lots.
See footnote to <reference chapter="3" verses="39">3:39</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُnwُkَyَf nُk ُhَl ُlwُqَy āَmَّnِiʾَf āًrْmَaʾ ٰyَḍَq āَhdِiʾ ۚ ُءāَhsَy āَm ُqُlْhkَy ُhَّllā ِkِlَٰhdَk َlāَq ۖ ٌrَhsَb yِnْsَsْmَy ْmَlَw ٌdَlَw yِl ُnwُkَy ٰyَّnَaʾ ِّbَr ْtَlāَq

footnotes.text: The teachings of the prophets.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَّl ًhَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkِtwُyُb yِf َnwُrِhkَّdَt āَmَw َnwُlُkْaʾَt āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُaʾَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb ٰyَtْwَmْlā yِyْḥُaʾَw َṣَrْbَaʾْlāَw َhَmْkَaʾْlā ُyʾِrْbُaʾَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āًrْyَṭ ُnwُkَyَf ِhyِf ُhkُfnَaʾَf ِrْyَّṭlā ِhَyʾْyَhَk ِnyِّṭlā َnِّm mُkَl ُqُlْhkَaʾ yِّnَaʾ ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَyāʾِb mُkُtْyʾِjg ْdَq yِّnَaʾ َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb ٰyَlِiʾ āًlwُsَrَw
ِnwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَf ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَyāʾِb mُkُtْyʾِjgَw ۚ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َmِّrُḥ yِhdَّlā َḍْʿعَb mُkَl َّlِḥُaʾِlَw ِhāَrْwَّtlā َnِm َّyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُmَw
َnyِrِṣāَّn nِّm mُhَl āَmَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf āًdyِdَhs āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُhُbِّhdَʿعُaʾَf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., regarding His creation of him.

ayas.translation: َnyِbِhdāَkْlā yَlَʿع ِhَّllā َtَnْʿعَّl lَʿعْjgَnَf ْlِhَtْbَn َّmُht ْmُkَsُfnَaʾَw āَnَsُfnَaʾَw ْmُkَءāَsِnَw āَnَءāَsِnَw ْmُkَءāَnْbَaʾَw āَnَءāَnْbَaʾ ُʿعْdَn āْwَlāَʿعَt ْlُqَf ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِm َkَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm ِhyِf َkَّjgāَḥ ْnَmَf

َnwُmِlْsُm āَّnَaʾِb āwُdَhْhsā āwُlwُqَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm āًbāَbْrَaʾ āًḍْʿعَb āَnُḍْʿعَb َhdِhkَّtَy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ِhِb َkِrْhsُn āَlَw َhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َdُbْʿعَn āَّlَaʾ ْmُkَnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb ٍءāَwَs ٍhَmِlَk ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَlāَʿعَt ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: By obeying another in disobedience to Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ ُlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw ُhāَrْwَّtlā ِtَlِznُaʾ āَmَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ yِf َnwُّjgāَḥُt َmِl ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb mُkَl َsْyَl āَmyِf َnwُّjgāَḥُt َmِlَf ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb mُkَl āَmyِf ْmُtْjgَjgāَḥ ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ْmُtnَaʾ āَh
َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِm َnāَk āَmَw āًmِlْsُّm āًfyِnَḥ َnāَk nِkٰـَlَw āًّyِnāَrْṣَn āَlَw āًّyِdwُhَy ُmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َnāَk āَm

footnotes.text: Those who associate others with Allāh.
Refer to footnote in verse <reference chapter="2" verses="257">2:257</reference>.
i.e., deliberately reject them.

ayas.translation: َnwُʿعِjgْrَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ُhَrِhkāʾ āwُrُfْkāَw ِrāَhَّnlā َhْjgَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ yِhdَّlāِb āwُnِmāʾ ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَّṭ tَlāَqَw

ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعِsāَw ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhyِtْwʾُy ِhَّllā ِdَyِb َlْḍَfْlā َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ ْmُkِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmُkwُّjgāَḥُy ْwَaʾ ْmُtyِtwُaʾ āَm َlْhtِّm ٌdَḥَaʾ ٰyَtْwʾُy nَaʾ ِhَّllā yَdُh ٰyَdُhْlā َّnِiʾ ْlُq ْmُkَnyِd َʿعِbَt nَmِl āَّlِiʾ āwُnِmْwʾُt āَlَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy ْmُhَw َbِhdَkْlā ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُlwُqَyَw ٌlyِbَs َnyِّyِّmُaʾْlā yِf āَnْyَlَʿع َsْyَl āwُlāَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۗ āًmِyʾāَq ِhْyَlَʿع َtْmُd āَm āَّlِiʾ َkْyَlِiʾ ِhِّdَwʾُy āَّl ٍrāَnyِdِb ُhْnَmْaʾَt nِiʾ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَw َkْyَlِiʾ ِhِّdَwʾُy ٍrāَṭnِqِb ُhْnَmْaʾَt nِiʾ ْnَm ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِmَw

footnotes.text: The Jews do not consider it a sin to cheat or lie to a gentile or a pagan.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ْmِhyِّkَzُy āَlَw ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ُrُẓnَy āَlَw ُhَّllā ُmُhُmِّlَkُy āَlَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ْmُhَl َqāَlَhk āَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ْmِhِnāَmْyَaʾَw ِhَّllā ِdْhَʿعِb َnwُrَtْhsَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

َnwُsُrْdَt ْmُtnُk āَmِbَw َbāَtِkْlā َnwُmِّlَʿعُt ْmُtnُk āَmِb َnyِّyِnāَّbَr āwُnwُk nِkٰـَlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm yِّl āًdāَbِʿع āwُnwُk ِsāَّnlِl َlwُqَy َّmُht َhَّwُbُّnlāَw َmْkُḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā ُhَّllā ُhَyِtْwʾُy nَaʾ ٍrَhsَbِl َnāَk āَm

footnotes.text: Or any believer.
Or in the case of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ), "the Book" (i.e., the Qur’ān) .

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُّm mُtnَaʾ ْhdِiʾ َdْʿعَb ِrْfُkْlāِb mُkُrُmْaʾَyَaʾ ۗ āًbāَbْrَaʾ َnyِّyِbَّnlāَw َhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā āwُhdِhkَّtَt nَaʾ ْmُkَrُmْaʾَy āَlَw

َnyِdِhāَّhslā َnِّm mُkَʿعَm āَnَaʾَw āwُdَhْhsāَf َlāَq ۚ āَnْrَrْqَaʾ āwُlāَq ۖ yِrْṣِiʾ ْmُkِlَٰhd ٰyَlَʿع ْmُtْhdَhkَaʾَw ْmُtْrَrْqَaʾَaʾ َlāَq ۚ ُhَّnُrُṣnَtَlَw ِhِb َّnُnِmْwʾُtَl ْmُkَʿعَm āَmِّl ٌqِّdَṣُّm ٌlwُsَr ْmُkَءāَjg َّmُht ٍhَmْkِḥَw ٍbāَtِk nِّm mُkُtْyَtāʾ āَmَl َnyِّyِbَّnlā َqāَhtyِm ُhَّllā َhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., Have you accepted this obligation?

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُm ُhَl ُnْḥَnَw ْmُhْnِّm ٍdَḥَaʾ َnْyَb ُqِّrَfُn āَl ْmِhِّbَّr nِm َnwُّyِbَّnlāَw ٰyَsyِʿعَw ٰyَswُm َyِtwُaʾ āَmَw ِṭāَbْsَaʾْlāَw َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾَw َlyِʿعāَmْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ٰyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَmَw āَnْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllāِb āَّnَmāʾ ْlُq
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُtāَnِّyَbْlā ُmُhَءāَjgَw ٌّqَḥ َlwُsَّrlā َّnَaʾ āwُdِhَhsَw ْmِhِnāَmyِiʾ َdْʿعَb āwُrَfَk āًmْwَq ُhَّllā yِdْhَy َfْyَk

footnotes.text: After their wrongdoing.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِṣāَّn nِّm mُhَl āَmَw ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ ِhِb ٰyَdَtْfā ِwَlَw āًbَhَhd ِḍْrَaʾْlā ُءْlِّm mِhِdَḥَaʾ ْnِm َlَbْqُy nَlَf ٌrāَّfُk ْmُhَw āwُtāَmَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
ٌmyِlَʿع ِhِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ٍءْyَhs nِm āwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۚ َnwُّbِḥُt āَّmِm āwُqِfnُt ٰyَّtَḥ َّrِbْlā āwُlāَnَt nَl

footnotes.text: Another meaning is "You will never attain righteousness."

ayas.translation: َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ āَhwُlْtāَf ِhāَrْwَّtlāِb āwُtْaʾَf ْlُq ۗ ُhāَrْwَّtlā َlَّzَnُt nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm ِhِsْfَn ٰyَlَʿع ُlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ َmَّrَḥ āَm āَّlِiʾ َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِّl āًّlِḥ َnāَk ِmāَʿعَّṭlā ُّlُk

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="3" verses="67">3:67</reference>
He has no need for His servants' worship; it is they who are in need of Him.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmَʿع ٍlِfāَغِb ُhَّllā āَmَw ۗ ُءāَdَhُhs ْmُtnَaʾَw āًjgَwِʿع āَhَnwُغْbَt َnَmāʾ ْnَm ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّdُṣَt َmِl ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy ْlُq
َnyِrِfāَk ْmُkِnāَmyِiʾ َdْʿعَb mُkwُّdُrَy َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِّm āًqyِrَf āwُʿعyِṭُt nِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., adhering to His ordinances strictly, then trusting in Him and relying upon Him completely.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُّm mُtnَaʾَw āَّlِiʾ َّnُtwُmَt āَlَw ِhِtāَqُt َّqَḥ َhَّllā āwُqَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُdَtْhَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِtāَyāʾ ْmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ āَhْnِّm mُkَhdَqnَaʾَf ِrāَّnlā َnِّm ٍhَrْfُḥ āَfَhs ٰyَlَʿع ْmُtnُkَw āًnāَwْhkِiʾ ِhِtَmْʿعِnِb mُtْḥَbْṣَaʾَf ْmُkِbwُlُq َnْyَb َfَّlَaʾَf ًءāَdْʿعَaʾ ْmُtnُk ْhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdāَw ۚ āwُqَّrَfَt āَlَw āًʿعyِmَjg ِhَّllā ِlْbَḥِb āwُmِṣَtْʿعāَw

footnotes.text: Referring either to His covenant or the Qur’ān.
According to the laws of Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۚ ُtāَnِّyَbْlā ُmُhَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āwُfَlَtْhkāَw āwُqَّrَfَt َnyِhdَّlāَk āwُnwُkَt āَlَw

َnwُdَtْʿعَy āwُnāَkَّw āwَṣَʿع āَmِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍّqَḥ ِrْyَغِb َءāَyِbnَaʾْlā َnwُlُtْqَyَw ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb َnwُrُfْkَy āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ُhَnَkْsَmْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَbِrُḍَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍbَḍَغِb āwُءāَbَw ِsāَّnlā َnِّm ٍlْbَḥَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍlْbَḥِb āَّlِiʾ āwُfِqُht āَm َnْyَaʾ ُhَّlِّhdlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَbِrُḍ

footnotes.text: Once they have surrendered, the People of the Scripture retain their rights and honor (in spite of their refusal of Islām) through payment of the jizyah tax in place of zakāh and military service due from Muslims. They are then under the protection of the Islāmic state.
Of people who accepted Islām.

ayas.translation: َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۚ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ āًyʾْyَhs ِhَّllā َnِّm mُhُdāَlْwَaʾ āَlَw ْmُhُlāَwْmَaʾ ْmُhْnَʿع َyِnْغُt nَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ ْnِkٰـَlَw ُhَّllā ُmُhَmَlَẓ āَmَw ۚ ُhْtَkَlْhَaʾَf ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُmَlَẓ ٍmْwَq َhtْrَḥ ْtَbāَṣَaʾ ٌّrِṣ āَhyِf ٍḥyِr ِlَhtَmَk āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِf َnwُqِfnُy āَm ُlَhtَm

َnwُlِqْʿعَt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ۖ ِtāَyāʾْlā ُmُkَl āَّnَّyَb ْdَq ۚ ُrَbْkَaʾ ْmُhُrwُdُṣ yِfْhkُt āَmَw ْmِhِhāَwْfَaʾ ْnِm ُءāَḍْغَbْlā ِtَdَb ْdَq ْmُّtِnَʿع āَm āwُّdَw āًlāَbَhk ْmُkَnwُlْaʾَy āَl ْmُkِnwُd nِّm ًhَnāَṭِb āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ِrwُdُّṣlā ِtāَhdِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُkِẓْyَغِb āwُtwُm ْlُq ۚ ِẓْyَغْlā َnِm َlِmāَnَaʾْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع āwُّḍَʿع āْwَlَhk āَhdِiʾَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq ْmُkwُqَl āَhdِiʾَw ِhِّlُk ِbāَtِkْlāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُtَw ْmُkَnwُّbِḥُy āَlَw ْmُhَnwُّbِḥُt ِءāَlwُaʾ ْmُtnَaʾ āَh

footnotes.text: That of it revealed by Allāh, not what was subsequently altered by men.

ayas.translation: ٌṭyِḥُm َnwُlَmْʿعَy āَmِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ āًyʾْyَhs ْmُhُdْyَk ْmُkُّrُḍَy āَl āwُqَّtَtَw āwُrِbْṣَt nِiʾَw ۖ āَhِb āwُḥَrْfَy ٌhَyʾِّyَs ْmُkْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ْmُhْwʾُsَt ٌhَnَsَḥ ْmُkْsَsْmَt nِiʾ
َnyِmِّwَsُm ِhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā َnِّm ٍfāَlāʾ ِhَsْmَhkِb mُkُّbَr ْmُkْdِdْmُy āَhdٰـَh ْmِhِrْwَf nِّm mُkwُtْaʾَyَw āwُqَّtَtَw āwُrِbْṣَt nِiʾ ۚ ٰyَlَb
ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ُbِّhdَʿعُyَw ُءāَhsَy nَmِl ُrِfْغَy ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِlَw
َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ ًhَfَʿعāَḍُّm āًfāَʿعْḍَaʾ āَbِّrlā āwُlُkْaʾَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُmَlْʿعَy ْmُhَw āwُlَʿعَf āَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُّrِṣُy ْmَlَw ُhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َbwُnُّhdlā ُrِfْغَy nَmَw ْmِhِbwُnُhdِl āwُrَfْغَtْsāَf َhَّllā āwُrَkَhd ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُmَlَẓ ْwَaʾ ًhَhsِḥāَf āwُlَʿعَf āَhdِiʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw
َnyِlِmāَʿعْlā ُrْjgَaʾ َmْʿعِnَw ۚ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٌtāَّnَjgَw ْmِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَrِfْغَّm mُhُwʾāَzَjg َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ
َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ َnْwَlْʿعَaʾْlā ُmُtnَaʾَw āwُnَzْḥَt āَlَw āwُnِhَt āَlَw

َnyِrِkāَّhslā ُhَّllā yِzْjgَyَsَw ۗ āًyʾْyَhs َhَّllā َّrُḍَy nَlَf ِhْyَbِqَʿع ٰyَlَʿع ْbِlَqnَy nَmَw ۚ ْmُkِbāَqْʿعَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْmُtْbَlَqnā َlِtُq ْwَaʾ َtāَّm nِiʾَfَaʾ ۚ ُlُsُّrlā ِhِlْbَq nِm ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٌlwُsَr āَّlِiʾ ٌdَّmَḥُm āَmَw

َnyِrِkāَّhslā yِzْjgَnَsَw ۚ āَhْnِm ِhِtْwʾُn ِhَrِhkāʾْlā َbāَwَht ْdِrُy nَmَw āَhْnِm ِhِtْwʾُn āَyْnُّdlā َbāَwَht ْdِrُy nَmَw ۗ āًlَّjgَwʾُّm āًbāَtِk ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ َtwُmَt nَaʾ ٍsْfَnِl َnāَk āَmَw
َnyِrِbāَّṣlā ُّbِḥُy ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُnāَkَtْsā āَmَw āwُfُʿعَḍ āَmَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmُhَbāَṣَaʾ āَmِl āwُnَhَw āَmَf ٌryِhtَk َnwُّyِّbِr ُhَʿعَm َlَtāَq ٍّyِbَّn nِّm nِّyَaʾَkَw
َnyِrِfāَkْlā ِmْwَqْlā yَlَʿع āَnْrُṣnāَw āَnَmāَdْqَaʾ ْtِّbَhtَw āَnِrْmَaʾ yِf āَnَfāَrْsِiʾَw āَnَbwُnُhd āَnَl ْrِfْغā āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَlْwَq َnāَk āَmَw
َnyِrِsāَhk āwُbِlَqnَtَf ْmُkِbāَqْʿعَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkwُّdُrَy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā āwُʿعyِṭُt nِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā yَwْhtَm َsْyʾِbَw ۚ ُrāَّnlā ُmُhāَwْaʾَmَw ۖ āًnāَṭْlُs ِhِb ْlِّzَnُy ْmَl āَm ِhَّllāِb āwُkَrْhsَaʾ āَmِb َbْʿعُّrlā āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِbwُlُq yِf yِqْlُnَs

footnotes.text: i.e., clear evidence.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع ٍlْḍَf wُhd ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُknَʿع āَfَʿع ْdَqَlَw ۖ ْmُkَyِlَtْbَyِl ْmُhْnَʿع ْmُkَfَrَṣ َّmُht ۚ َhَrِhkāʾْlā ُdyِrُy nَّm mُknِmَw āَyْnُّdlā ُdyِrُy nَّm mُknِm ۚ َnwُّbِḥُt āَّm mُkāَrَaʾ āَm ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُtْyَṣَʿعَw ِrْmَaʾْlā yِf ْmُtْʿعَzāَnَtَw ْmُtْlِhsَf āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِhِnْhdِiʾِb mُhَnwُّsُḥَt ْhdِiʾ ُhَdْʿعَw ُhَّllā ُmُkَqَdَṣ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the spoils of war.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ٌryِbَhk ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَbāَṣَaʾ āَm āَlَw ْmُkَtāَf āَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُnَzْḥَt āَlْyَkِّl ٍّmَغِb āًّmَغ ْmُkَbāَhtَaʾَf ْmُkāَrْhkُaʾ yِf ْmُkwُʿعْdَy ُlwُsَّrlāَw ٍdَḥَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع َnwُwْlَt āَlَw َnwُdِʿعْṣُt ْhdِiʾ

ِrwُdُّṣlā ِtāَhdِb ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkِbwُlُq yِf āَm َṣِّḥَmُyِlَw ْmُkِrwُdُṣ yِf āَm ُhَّllā َyِlَtْbَyِlَw ۖ ْmِhِʿعِjgāَḍَm ٰyَlِiʾ ُlْtَqْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َbِtُk َnyِhdَّlā َzَrَbَl ْmُkِtwُyُb yِf ْmُtnُk ْwَّl lُq ۗ āَnُhāَh āَnْlِtُq āَّm ٌءْyَhs ِrْmَaʾْlā َnِm āَnَl َnāَk ْwَl َnwُlwُqَy ۖ َkَl َnwُdْbُy āَl āَّm mِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf َnwُfْhkُy ۗ ِhَّlِl ُhَّlُk َrْmَaʾْlā َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِrْmَaʾْlā َnِm āَnَّl lَh َnwُlwُqَy ۖ ِhَّyِlِhāَjgْlā َّnَẓ ِّqَḥْlā َrْyَغ ِhَّllāِb َnwُّnُẓَy ْmُhُsُfnَaʾ ْmُhْtَّmَhَaʾ ْdَq ٌhَfِyʾāَṭَw ۖ ْmُknِّm ًhَfِyʾāَṭ ٰyَhsْغَy āًsāَʿعُّn ًhَnَmَaʾ ِّmَغْlā ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َlَznَaʾ َّmُht
ٌmyِlَḥ ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُhْnَʿع ُhَّllā āَfَʿع ْdَqَlَw ۖ āwُbَsَk āَm ِḍْʿعَbِb ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُhَّlَzَtْsā āَmَّnِiʾ ِnāَʿعْmَjgْlā yَqَtْlā َmْwَy ْmُknِm āْwَّlَwَt َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُtyِmُyَw yِyْḥُy ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf ًhَrْsَḥ َkِlَٰhd ُhَّllā َlَʿعْjgَyِl āwُlِtُq āَmَw āwُtāَm āَm āَnَdnِʿع āwُnāَk ْwَّl yًّzُغ āwُnāَk ْwَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُbَrَḍ āَhdِiʾ ْmِhِnāَwْhkِiʾِl āwُlāَqَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَk āwُnwُkَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِlِّkَwَtُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ْlَّkَwَtَf َtْmَzَʿع āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ِrْmَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhْrِwāَhsَw ْmُhَl ْrِfْغَtْsāَw ْmُhْnَʿع ُfْʿعāَf ۖ َkِlْwَḥ ْnِm āwُّḍَfnāَl ِbْlَqْlā َẓyِlَغ āًّẓَf َtnُk ْwَlَw ۖ ْmُhَl َtnِl ِhَّllā َnِّm ٍhَmْḥَr āَmِbَf
َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۗ ِhِdْʿعَb nِّm mُkُrُṣnَy yِhdَّlā āَhd nَmَf ْmُkْlُhdْhkَy nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkَl َbِlāَغ āَlَf ُhَّllā ُmُkْrُṣnَy nِiʾ
َnwُmَlْẓُy āَl ْmُhَw ْtَbَsَk āَّm ٍsْfَn ُّlُk ٰyَّfَwُt َّmُht ۚ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy َّlَغ āَmِb ِtْaʾَy ْlُlْغَy nَmَw ۚ َّlُغَy nَaʾ ٍّyِbَnِl َnāَk āَmَw

ٍnyِbُّm ٍlāَlَḍ yِfَl ُlْbَq nِm āwُnāَk nِiʾَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā ُmُhُmِّlَʿعُyَw ْmِhyِّkَzُyَw ِhِtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع wُlْtَy ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ْnِّm āًlwُsَr ْmِhyِf َhtَʿعَb ْhdِiʾ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع ُhَّllā َّnَm ْdَqَl

footnotes.text: The Prophet's sunnah.

ayas.translation: َnwُmُtْkَy āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf َsْyَl āَّm mِhِhāَwْfَaʾِb َnwُlwُqَy ۚ ِnāَmyِiʾْlِl ْmُhْnِm ُbَrْqَaʾ ٍhdِyʾَmْwَy ِrْfُkْlِl ْmُh ۗ ْmُkāَnْʿعَbَّtāَّl āًlāَtِq ُmَlْʿعَn ْwَl āwُlāَq ۖ āwُʿعَfْdā ِwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُlِtāَq āْwَlāَʿعَt ْmُhَl َlyِqَw ۚ āwُqَfāَn َnyِhdَّlā َmَlْʿعَyِlَw
َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ َtْwَmْlā ُmُkِsُfnَaʾ ْnَʿع āwُءَrْdāَf ْlُq ۗ āwُlِtُq āَm āَnwُʿعāَṭَaʾ ْwَl āwُdَʿعَqَw ْmِhِnāَwْhkِiʾِl āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā
َnwُnَzْḥَy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٌfْwَhk āَّlَaʾ ْmِhِfْlَhk ْnِّm mِhِb āwُqَḥْlَy ْmَl َnyِhdَّlāِb َnwُrِhsْbَtْsَyَw ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā ُmُhāَtāʾ āَmِb َnyِḥِrَf

footnotes.text: The one entrusted and relied upon; sufficient to manage all matters.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ۖ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf āًّẓَḥ ْmُhَl َlَʿعْjgَy āَّlَaʾ ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy ۗ āًyʾْyَhs َhَّllā āwُّrُḍَy nَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِrْfُkْlā yِf َnwُʿعِrāَsُy َnyِhdَّlā َknُzْḥَy āَlَw
ٌnyِhُّm ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ۚ āًmْhtِiʾ āwُdāَdْzَyِl ْmُhَl yِlْmُn āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِّl ٌrْyَhk ْmُhَl yِlْmُn āَmَّnَaʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnَbَsْḥَy āَlَw

ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌrْjgَaʾ ْmُkَlَf āwُqَّtَtَw āwُnِmْwʾُt nِiʾَw ۚ ِhِlُsُrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnِmāʾَf ۖ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِlُsُّr nِm yِbَtْjgَy َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw ِbْyَغْlā yَlَʿع ْmُkَʿعِlْṭُyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَmَw ۗ ِbِّyَّṭlā َnِm َhtyِbَhkْlā َzyِmَy ٰyَّtَḥ ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُtnَaʾ āَm ٰyَlَʿع َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َrَhdَyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَّm

ٌryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُhtāَryِm ِhَّlِlَw ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ِhِb āwُlِhkَb āَm َnwُqَّwَṭُyَs ۖ ْmُhَّl ٌّrَhs َwُh ْlَb ۖ mُhَّl āًrْyَhk َwُh ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā ُmُhāَtāʾ āَmِb َnwُlَhkْbَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnَbَsْḥَy āَlَw

َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُhwُmُtْlَtَq َmِlَf ْmُtْlُq yِhdَّlāِbَw ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb yِlْbَq nِّm ٌlُsُr ْmُkَءāَjg ْdَq ْlُq ۗ ُrāَّnlā ُhُlُkْaʾَt ٍnāَbْrُqِb āَnَyِtْaʾَy ٰyَّtَḥ ٍlwُsَrِl َnِmْwʾُn āَّlَaʾ āَnْyَlِiʾ َdِhَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: The unaltered, original Torah and Gospel, which were revealed by Allāh.

ayas.translation: ِrwُmُaʾْlā ِmْzَʿع ْnِm َkِlَٰhd َّnِiʾَf āwُqَّtَtَw āwُrِbْṣَt nِiʾَw ۚ āًryِhtَk yًhdَaʾ āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِmَw ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِm َّnُʿعَmْsَtَlَw ْmُkِsُfnَaʾَw ْmُkِlāَwْmَaʾ yِf َّnُwَlْbُtَl

َnwُrَtْhsَy āَm َsْyʾِbَf ۖ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhِb āْwَrَtْhsāَw ْmِhِrwُhُẓ َءāَrَw ُhwُhdَbَnَf ُhَnwُmُtْkَt āَlَw ِsāَّnlِl ُhَّnُnِّyَbُtَl َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َqāَhtyِm ُhَّllā َhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw
ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ۖ ِbāَhdَʿعْlā َnِّm ٍhَzāَfَmِb mُhَّnَbَsْḥَt āَlَf āwُlَʿعْfَy ْmَl āَmِb āwُdَmْḥُy nَaʾ َnwُّbِḥُyَّw āwَtَaʾ āَmِb َnwُḥَrْfَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnَbَsْḥَt āَl

ِrāَّnlā َbāَhdَʿع āَnِqَf َkَnāَḥْbُs āًlِṭāَb āَhdٰـَh َtْqَlَhk āَm āَnَّbَr ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ِqْlَhk yِf َnwُrَّkَfَtَyَw ْmِhِbwُnُjg ٰyَlَʿعَw āًdwُʿعُqَw āًmāَyِq َhَّllā َnwُrُkْhdَy َnyِhdَّlā

ِrāَrْbَaʾْlā َʿعَm āَnَّfَwَtَw āَnِtāَyʾِّyَs āَّnَʿع ْrِّfَkَw āَnَbwُnُhd āَnَl ْrِfْغāَf āَnَّbَr ۚ āَّnَmāʾَf ْmُkِّbَrِb āwُnِmāʾ ْnَaʾ ِnāَmyِiʾْlِl yِdāَnُy āًyِdāَnُm āَnْʿعِmَs āَnَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَّr
َdāَʿعyِmْlā ُfِlْhkُt āَl َkَّnِiʾ ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy āَnِzْhkُt āَlَw َkِlُsُr ٰyَlَʿع āَnَّtdَʿعَw āَm āَnِtāʾَw āَnَّbَr

ِbāَwَّhtlā ُnْsُḥ ُhَdnِʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِّm āًbāَwَht ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُhَّnَlِhkْdُaʾَlَw ْmِhِtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْnَʿع َّnَrِّfَkُaʾَl āwُlِtُqَw āwُlَtāَqَw yِlyِbَs yِf āwُhdwُaʾَw ْmِhِrāَyِd nِm āwُjgِrْhkُaʾَw āwُrَjgāَh َnyِhdَّlāَf ۖ ٍḍْʿعَb nِّm mُkُḍْʿعَb ۖ ٰyَhtnُaʾ ْwَaʾ ٍrَkَhd nِّm mُknِّm ٍlِmāَʿع َlَmَʿع ُʿعyِḍُaʾ āَl yِّnَaʾ ْmُhُّbَr ْmُhَl َbāَjgَtْsāَf
ِrāَrْbَaʾْlِّl ٌrْyَhk ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَmَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِّm āًlُzُn āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٌtāَّnَjg ْmُhَl ْmُhَّbَr āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlā ِnِkٰـَl

ِbāَsِḥْlā ُʿعyِrَs َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmُhُrْjgَaʾ ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb َnwُrَtْhsَy āَl ِhَّlِl َnyِʿعِhsāَhk ْmِhْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw ْmُkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllāِb ُnِmْwʾُy nَmَl ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِm َّnِiʾَw
َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw āwُṭِbāَrَw āwُrِbāَṣَw āwُrِbْṣā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: In your religion and in the face of your enemies.
In patience, outlasting your enemies, and against your own evil inclinations.
Posted at your positions against the enemy or in the mosques, awaiting prayers.

ayas.translation: āًbyِqَr ْmُkْyَlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َmāَḥْrَaʾْlāَw ِhِb َnwُlَءāَsَt yِhdَّlā َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ ًءāَsِnَw āًryِhtَk āًlāَjgِr āَmُhْnِm َّhtَbَw āَhَjgْwَz āَhْnِm َqَlَhkَw ٍhَdِḥāَw ٍsْfَّn nِّm mُkَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُmُkَّbَr āwُqَّtā ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ِmyِḥَّrlā ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِhَّllā ِmْsِb

footnotes.text: In whose name.
i.e., request favors and demand rights.
i.e., fear Allāh in regard to relations of kinship.

When used in conjunction with Allāh's attributes, the word "ever" (occurring repeatedly throughout this sūrah and elsewhere, such as in sūrah al-Aḥzāb) is quite inadequate in imparting the sense of continuation expressed by the word "kāna" in Arabic, which indicates "always was, is, and always will be."
Ever-present and taking account of everything.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَk āًbwُḥ َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkِlāَwْmَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ āwُlُkْaʾَt āَlَw ۖ ِbِّyَّṭlāِb َhtyِbَhkْlā āwُlَّdَbَtَt āَlَw ۖ ْmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ ٰyَmāَtَyْlā āwُtāʾَw

āwُlwُʿعَt āَّlَaʾ ٰyَnْdَaʾ َkِlَٰhd ۚ ْmُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَm ْwَaʾ ًhَdِḥāَwَf āwُlِdْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَf ۖ َʿعāَbُrَw َhtāَlُhtَw ٰyَnْhtَm ِءāَsِّnlā َnِّm mُkَl َbāَṭ āَm āwُḥِknāَf ٰyَmāَtَyْlā yِf āwُṭِsْqُt āَّlَaʾ ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَw
āًyʾyِrَّm āًyʾyِnَh ُhwُlُkَf āًsْfَn ُhْnِّm ٍءْyَhs nَʿع ْmُkَl َnْbِṭ nِiʾَf ۚ ًhَlْḥِn َّnِhِtāَqُdَṣ َءāَsِّnlā āwُtāʾَw

footnotes.text: The obligatory bridal gift (mahr).
Knowing that it is lawful.

ayas.translation: āًfwُrْʿعَّm āًlْwَq ْmُhَl āwُlwُqَw ْmُhwُsْkāَw āَhyِf ْmُhwُqُzْrāَw āًmāَyِq ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َlَʿعَjg yِtَّlā ُmُkَlāَwْmَaʾ َءāَhَfُّslā āwُtْwʾُt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Although it is their property, Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) refers to it in the collective sense, reminding us that all wealth is provided by Him for the maintenance of the community as well as of individual members.

ayas.translation: āًbyِsَḥ ِhَّllāِb ٰyَfَkَw ۚ ْmِhْyَlَʿع āwُdِhْhsَaʾَf ْmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُtْʿعَfَd āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb ْlُkْaʾَyْlَf āًryِqَf َnāَk nَmَw ۖ ْfِfْʿعَtْsَyْlَf āًّyِnَغ َnāَk nَmَw ۚ āwُrَbْkَy nَaʾ āًrāَdِbَw āًfāَrْsِiʾ āَhwُlُkْaʾَt āَlَw ۖ ْmُhَlāَwْmَaʾ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ āwُʿعَfْdāَf āًdْhsُr ْmُhْnِّm mُtْsَnāʾ ْnِiʾَf َḥāَkِّnlā āwُغَlَb āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ٰyَmāَtَyْlā āwُlَtْbāَw
