āًfwُrْʿعَّm āًlْwَq ْmُhَl āwُlwُqَw ُhْnِّm mُhwُqُzْrāَf ُnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَmāَtَyْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā wُlwُaʾ َhَmْsِqْlā َrَḍَḥ āَhdِiʾَw
āًdyِdَs āًlْwَq āwُlwُqَyْlَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtَyْlَf ْmِhْyَlَʿع āwُfāَhk āًfāَʿعِḍ ًhَّyِّrُhd ْmِhِfْlَhk ْnِm āwُkَrَt ْwَl َnyِhdَّlā َhsْhkَyْlَw

āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhَّllā َnِّm ًhَḍyِrَf ۚ āًʿعْfَn ْmُkَl ُbَrْqَaʾ ْmُhُّyَaʾ َnwُrْdَt āَl ْmُkُwʾāَnْbَaʾَw ْmُkُwʾāَbāʾ ۗ ٍnْyَd ْwَaʾ āَhِb yِṣwُy ٍhَّyِṣَw ِdْʿعَb nِm ۚ ُsُdُّslā ِhِّmُaʾِlَf ٌhَwْhkِiʾ ُhَl َnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ ُhtُlُّhtlā ِhِّmُaʾِlَf ُhāَwَbَaʾ ُhَhtِrَwَw ٌdَlَw ُhَّl nُkَy ْmَّl nِiʾَf ۚ ٌdَlَw ُhَl َnāَk nِiʾ َkَrَt āَّmِm ُsُdُّslā āَmُhْnِّm ٍdِḥāَw ِّlُkِl ِhْyَwَbَaʾِlَw ۚ ُfْṣِّnlā āَhَlَf ًhَdِḥāَw ْtَnāَk nِiʾَw ۖ َkَrَt āَm āَhtُlُht َّnُhَlَf ِnْyَtَnْhtā َqْwَf ًءāَsِn َّnُk nِiʾَf ۚ ِnْyَyَhtnُaʾْlā ِّẓَḥ ُlْhtِm ِrَkَّhdlِl ۖ ْmُkِdāَlْwَaʾ yِf ُhَّllā ُmُkyِṣwُy

footnotes.text: Literally, "that which he left."
Although the siblings themselves do not inherit in this case.

Based upon prophetic ḥadīths, scholars have ruled that debt takes precedent over a bequest, that a bequest may not include any who inherit by law, and that the total bequest may not be more than one third of one's estate. After the fulfillment of debts and bequests (if any), the remainder of the estate is to be divided according to the ordinances in this sūrah.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَḥ ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhَّllā َnِّm ًhَّyِṣَw ۚ ٍّrāَḍُm َrْyَغ ٍnْyَd ْwَaʾ āَhِb ٰyَṣwُy ٍhَّyِṣَw ِdْʿعَb nِm ۚ ِhtُlُّhtlā yِf ُءāَkَrُhs ْmُhَf َkِlَٰhd nِm َrَhtْkَaʾ āwُnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ ُsُdُّslā āَmُhْnِّm ٍdِḥāَw ِّlُkِlَf ٌtْhkُaʾ ْwَaʾ ٌhkَaʾ ُhَlَw ٌhَaʾَrْmā ِwَaʾ ًhَlāَlَk ُhtَrwُy ٌlُjgَr َnāَk nِiʾَw ۗ ٍnْyَd ْwَaʾ āَhِb َnwُṣwُt ٍhَّyِṣَw ِdْʿعَb nِّm ۚ mُtْkَrَt āَّmِm ُnُmُّhtlā َّnُhَlَf ٌdَlَw ْmُkَl َnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ ٌdَlَw ْmُkَّl nُkَy ْmَّl nِiʾ ْmُtْkَrَt āَّmِm ُʿعُbُّrlā َّnُhَlَw ۚ ٍnْyَd ْwَaʾ āَhِb َnyِṣwُy ٍhَّyِṣَw ِdْʿعَb nِm ۚ َnْkَrَt āَّmِm ُʿعُbُّrlā ُmُkَlَf ٌdَlَw َّnُhَl َnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ ٌdَlَw َّnُhَّl nُkَy ْmَّl nِiʾ ْmُkُjgāَwْzَaʾ َkَrَt āَm ُfْṣِn ْmُkَlَw

footnotes.text: These shares are divided equally between males and females. The siblings referred to in this verse are from the mother's side only. Those from the father or both parents are mentioned in Āyah 176.

This is a condition for any bequest. If it has been violated by the deceased, his bequest is not to be honored, or it may be adjusted by the executor. See <reference chapter="2" verses="182">2:182</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًlyِbَs َّnُhَl ُhَّllā َlَʿعْjgَy ْwَaʾ ُtْwَmْlā َّnُhāَّfَwَtَy ٰyَّtَḥ ِtwُyُbْlā yِf َّnُhwُkِsْmَaʾَf āwُdِhَhs nِiʾَf ۖ ْmُknِّm ًhَʿعَbْrَaʾ َّnِhْyَlَʿع āwُdِhْhsَtْsāَf ْmُkِyʾāَsِّn nِm َhَhsِḥāَfْlā َnyِtْaʾَy yِtāَّllāَw

footnotes.text: The witnesses must swear to actually having seen the act taking place.
The "other way" (i.e., penalty) was later revealed in <reference chapter="24" verses="2">24:2</reference>, canceling the ruling in this verse.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًbāَّwَt َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ āَmُhْnَʿع āwُḍِrْʿعَaʾَf āَḥَlْṣَaʾَw āَbāَt nِiʾَf ۖ āَmُhwُhdāʾَf ْmُknِm āَhِnāَyِtْaʾَy ِnāَhdَّllāَw

footnotes.text: Scholars differ over whether "the two" refers to two of the same sex (i.e., homosexuals) or those of opposite sexes. In either case, later rulings outlined in the sunnah have replaced this one.
Scholars have also interpreted "soon" to mean before death.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl āَnْdَtْʿعَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ٌrāَّfُk ْmُhَw َnwُtwُmَy َnyِhdَّlā āَlَw َnāʾْlā ُtْbُt yِّnِiʾ َlāَq ُtْwَmْlā ُmُhَdَḥَaʾ َrَḍَḥ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ِtāَyʾِّyَّslā َnwُlَmْʿعَy َnyِhdَّlِl ُhَbْwَّtlā ِtَsْyَlَw

āًryِhtَk āًrْyَhk ِhyِf ُhَّllā َlَʿعْjgَyَw āًyʾْyَhs āwُhَrْkَt nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿعَf َّnُhwُmُtْhِrَk nِiʾَf ۚ ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb َّnُhwُrِhsāَʿعَw ۚ ٍhَnِّyَbُّm ٍhَhsِḥāَfِb َnyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َّnُhwُmُtْyَtāʾ āَm ِḍْʿعَbِb āwُbَhْhdَtِl َّnُhwُlُḍْʿعَt āَlَw ۖ āًhْrَk َءāَsِّnlā āwُhtِrَt nَaʾ ْmُkَl ُّlِḥَy āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: The deceased man's heirs have no rights of marriage or otherwise over his widow.
At the time of marriage as mahr.

ayas.translation: āًnyِbُّm āًmْhtِiʾَw āًnāَtْhُb ُhَnwُhdُhkْaʾَtَaʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ُhْnِm āwُhdُhkْaʾَt āَlَf āًrāَṭnِq َّnُhāَdْḥِiʾ ْmُtْyَtāʾَw ٍjgْwَz َnāَkَّm ٍjgْwَz َlāَdْbِtْsā ُmُّtdَrَaʾ ْnِiʾَw
āًlyِbَs َءāَsَw āًtْqَmَw ًhَhsِḥāَf َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ َfَlَs ْdَq āَm āَّlِiʾ ِءāَsِّnlā َnِّm mُkُwʾāَbāʾ َḥَkَn āَm āwُḥِknَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Before Islām. After the ruling was revealed by Allāh, men were required to release those women unlawful to them (e.g., a stepmother, one of two sisters, or any wives over the limit of four). The same obligation applies to one once he has accepted Islām.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ َfَlَs ْdَq āَm āَّlِiʾ ِnْyَtْhkُaʾْlā َnْyَb āwُʿعَmْjgَt nَaʾَw ْmُkِbāَlْṣَaʾ ْnِm َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkِyʾāَnْbَaʾ ُlِyʾāَlَḥَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf َّnِhِb mُtْlَhkَd āwُnwُkَt ْmَّl nِiʾَf َّnِhِb mُtْlَhkَd yِtāَّllā ُmُkِyʾāَsِّn nِّm mُkِrwُjgُḥ yِf yِtāَّllā ُmُkُbِyʾāَbَrَw ْmُkِyʾāَsِn ُtāَhَّmُaʾَw ِhَʿعāَḍَّrlā َnِّm mُkُtāَwَhkَaʾَw ْmُkَnْʿعَḍْrَaʾ yِtāَّllā ُmُkُtāَhَّmُaʾَw ِtْhkُaʾْlā ُtāَnَbَw ِhkَaʾْlā ُtāَnَbَw ْmُkُtāَlāَhkَw ْmُkُtāَّmَʿعَw ْmُkُtāَwَhkَaʾَw ْmُkُtāَnَbَw ْmُkُtāَhَّmُaʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْtَmِّrُḥ

footnotes.text: See previous footnote.

ayas.translation: āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَḍyِrَfْlā ِdْʿعَb nِm ِhِb mُtْyَḍāَrَt āَmyِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَw ۚ ًhَḍyِrَf َّnُhَrwُjgُaʾ َّnُhwُtāʾَf َّnُhْnِm ِhِb mُtْʿعَtْmَtْsā āَmَf ۚ َnyِḥِfāَsُm َrْyَغ َnyِnِṣْḥُّm mُkِlāَwْmَaʾِb āwُغَtْbَt nَaʾ ْmُkِlَٰhd َءāَrَw āَّm mُkَl َّlِḥُaʾَw ۚ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َbāَtِk ۖ ْmُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَm āَّlِiʾ ِءāَsِّnlā َnِm ُtāَnَṣْḥُmْlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., slaves or war captives who had polytheist husbands.
The mahr, a specified gift to the bride required of the man upon marriage.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk āwُrِbْṣَt nَaʾَw ۚ ْmُknِm َtَnَʿعْlā َyِhsَhk ْnَmِl َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِbāَhdَʿعْlā َnِm ِtāَnَṣْḥُmْlā yَlَʿع āَm ُfْṣِn َّnِhْyَlَʿعَf ٍhَhsِḥāَfِb َnْyَtَaʾ ْnِiʾَf َّnِṣْḥُaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ٍnāَdْhkَaʾ ِtāَhdِhkَّtُm āَlَw ٍtāَḥِfāَsُm َrْyَغ ٍtāَnَṣْḥُm ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb َّnُhَrwُjgُaʾ َّnُhwُtāʾَw َّnِhِlْhَaʾ ِnْhdِiʾِb َّnُhwُḥِknāَf ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb nِّm mُkُḍْʿعَb ۚ mُkِnāَmyِiʾِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlā ُmُkِtāَyَtَf nِّm mُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَّm nِmَf ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlā ِtāَnَṣْḥُmْlā َḥِknَy nَaʾ āًlْwَṭ ْmُknِm ْʿعِṭَtْsَy ْmَّl nَmَw

āًmyِḥَr ْmُkِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ āwُlُtْqَt āَlَw ۚ ْmُknِّm ٍḍāَrَt nَʿع ًhَrāَjgِt َnwُkَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِlِṭāَbْlāِb mُkَnْyَb mُkَlāَwْmَaʾ āwُlُkْaʾَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., unlawfully or under false pretense.

ayas.translation: āًryِsَy ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َkِlَٰhd َnāَkَw ۚ āًrāَn ِhyِlْṣُn َfْwَsَf āًmْlُẓَw āًnāَwْdُʿع َkِlَٰhd ْlَʿعْfَy nَmَw
āًmyِrَk āًlَhkْdُّm mُkْlِhkْdُnَw ْmُkِtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُknَʿع ْrِّfَkُn ُhْnَʿع َnْwَhْnُt āَm َrِyʾāَbَk āwُbِnَtْjgَt nِiʾ

āًmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhِlْḍَf nِm َhَّllā āwُlَaʾْsāَw ۚ َnْbَsَtْkā āَّmِّm ٌbyِṣَn ِءāَsِّnlِlَw ۖ āwُbَsَtْkā āَّmِّm ٌbyِṣَn ِlāَjgِّrlِّl ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkَḍْʿعَb ِhِb ُhَّllā َlَّḍَf āَm āْwَّnَmَtَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: This may refer to shares of inheritance, wages and reward in the Hereafter.
By bequest, as only those relatives mentioned in verses 11 and 12 inherit fixed shares.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَk āًّyِlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ āًlyِbَs َّnِhْyَlَʿع āwُغْbَt āَlَf ْmُkَnْʿعَṭَaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۖ َّnُhwُbِrْḍāَw ِʿعِjgāَḍَmْlā yِf َّnُhwُrُjgْhāَw َّnُhwُẓِʿعَf َّnُhَzwُhsُn َnwُfāَhkَt yِtāَّllāَw ۚ ُhَّllā َẓِfَḥ āَmِb ِbْyَغْlِّl ٌtāَẓِfāَḥ ٌtāَtِnāَq ُtāَḥِlāَّṣlāَf ۚ ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾ ْnِm āwُqَfnَaʾ āَmِbَw ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَḍْʿعَb ُhَّllā َlَّḍَf āَmِb ِءāَsِّnlā yَlَʿع َnwُmāَّwَq ُlāَjgِّrlā

footnotes.text: This applies primarily to the husband-wife relationship.
i.e., their husbands' property and their own chastity.
i.e., major rebellion or refusal of basic religious obligations.

This final disciplinary measure is more psychological than physical. It may be resorted to only after failure of the first two measures and when it is expected to amend the situation and prevent family breakup; otherwise, it is not acceptable. The Prophet ﷺ (who never struck a woman or a servant) additionally stipulated that it must not be severe or damaging and that the face be avoided.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَhk āًmyِlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ āَmُhَnْyَb ُhَّllā ِqِّfَwُy āًḥāَlْṣِiʾ āَdyِrُy nِiʾ āَhِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm āًmَkَḥَw ِhِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm āًmَkَḥ āwُhtَʿعْbāَf āَmِhِnْyَb َqāَqِhs ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَw

āًrwُhkَf āًlāَtْhkُm َnāَk nَm ُّbِḥُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَmَw ِlyِbَّslā ِnْbāَw ِbnَjgْlāِb ِbِḥāَّṣlāَw ِbُnُjgْlā ِrāَjgْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِhd ِrāَjgْlāَw ِnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَmāَtَyْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِhdِbَw āًnāَsْḥِiʾ ِnْyَdِlāَwْlāِbَw ۖ āًyʾْyَhs ِhِb āwُkِrْhsُt āَlَw َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., those whose acquaintance you have made. Also interpreted as the wife.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ ُhْnُdَّl nِm ِtْwʾُyَw āَhْfِʿعāَḍُy ًhَnَsَḥ ُkَt nِiʾَw ۖ ٍhَّrَhd َlāَqْhtِm ُmِlْẓَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

āًrwُfَغ āًّwُfَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُkyِdْyَaʾَw ْmُkِhwُjgُwِb āwُḥَsْmāَf āًbِّyَṭ āًdyِʿعَṣ āwُmَّmَyَtَf ًءāَm āwُdِjgَt ْmَlَf َءāَsِّnlā ُmُtْsَmāَl ْwَaʾ ِṭِyʾāَغْlā َnِّm mُknِّm ٌdَḥَaʾ َءāَjg ْwَaʾ ٍrَfَs ٰyَlَʿع ْwَaʾ ٰyَḍْrَّm mُtnُk nِiʾَw ۚ āwُlِsَtْغَt ٰyَّtَḥ ٍlyِbَs yِrِbāَʿع āَّlِiʾ āًbُnُjg āَlَw َnwُlwُqَt āَm āwُmَlْʿعَt ٰyَّtَḥ ٰyَrāَkُs ْmُtnَaʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُbَrْqَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: The use of intoxicants was later prohibited completely. See <reference chapter="5" verses="90-91">5:90-91</reference>.
Literally, "distance." The state of one under obligation to perform ghusl (a complete bath) due to having had sexual intercourse or ejaculation.
Literally, able to erase and remove sins completely, leaving no trace of them in the record of deeds.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَlَf ْmِhِrْfُkِb ُhَّllā ُmُhَnَʿعَّl nِkٰـَlَw َmَwْqَaʾَw ْmُhَّl āًrْyَhk َnāَkَl āَnْrُẓnāَw ْʿعَmْsāَw āَnْʿعَṭَaʾَw āَnْʿعِmَs āwُlāَq ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw ۚ ِnyِّdlā yِf āًnْʿعَṭَw ْmِhِtَnِsْlَaʾِb āًّyَl āَnِʿعāَrَw ٍʿعَmْsُm َrْyَغ ْʿعَmْsāَw āَnْyَṣَʿعَw āَnْʿعِmَs َnwُlwُqَyَw ِhِʿعِḍāَwَّm nَʿع َmِlَkْlā َnwُfِّrَḥُy āwُdāَh َnyِhdَّlā َnِّm

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="104">2:104</reference>.
Or "except with little belief."

ayas.translation: āًlwُʿعْfَm ِhَّllā ُrْmَaʾ َnāَkَw ۚ ِtْbَّslā َbāَḥْṣَaʾ āَّnَʿعَl āَmَk ْmُhَnَʿعْlَn ْwَaʾ āَhِrāَbْdَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَhَّdُrَnَf āًhwُjgُw َsِmْṭَّn nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِّm mُkَʿعَm āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm āَnْlَّzَn āَmِb āwُnِmāʾ َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: See <reference chapter="7" verses="163-166">7:163-166</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًmْhtِiʾ ٰyَrَtْfā ِdَqَf ِhَّllāِb ْkِrْhsُy nَmَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَmِl َkِlَٰhd َnwُd āَm ُrِfْغَyَw ِhِb َkَrْhsُy nَaʾ ُrِfْغَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ
āًlyِtَf َnwُmَlْẓُy āَlَw ُءāَhsَy nَm yِّkَzُy ُhَّllā ِlَb ۚ mُhَsُfnَaʾ َnwُّkَzُy َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ
āًlyِbَs āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِm ٰyَdْhَaʾ ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlِl َnwُlwُqَyَw ِtwُغāَّṭlāَw ِtْbِjgْlāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy ِbāَtِkْlā َnِّm āًbyِṣَn āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ
āًmyِẓَʿع āًkْlُّm mُhāَnْyَtāʾَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َlāʾ āَnْyَtāʾ ْdَqَf ۖ ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā ُmُhāَtāʾ āَm ٰyَlَʿع َsāَّnlā َnwُdُsْḥَy ْmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Prophetic teachings.
In what was given to them. Also interpreted as "in him," i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: āًmyِkَḥ āًzyِzَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ َbāَhdَʿعْlā āwُqwُhdَyِl āَhَrْyَغ āًdwُlُjg ْmُhāَnْlَّdَb mُhُdwُlُjg ْtَjgِḍَn āَmَّlُk āًrāَn ْmِhyِlْṣُn َfْwَs āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

āًlyِlَẓ āًّlِẓ ْmُhُlِhkْdُnَw ۖ ٌhَrَّhَṭُّm ٌjgāَwْzَaʾ āَhyِf ْmُhَّl ۖ āًdَbَaʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُhُlِhkْdُnَs ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw

āًryِṣَb āًʿعyِmَs َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhِb mُkُẓِʿعَy āَّmِʿعِn َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِlْdَʿعْlāِb āwُmُkْḥَt nَaʾ ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb mُtْmَkَḥ āَhdِiʾَw āَhِlْhَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ِtāَnāَmَaʾْlā āwُّdَwʾُt nَaʾ ْmُkُrُmْaʾَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

āًlyِwْaʾَt ُnَsْḥَaʾَw ٌrْyَhk َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِlwُsَّrlāَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ُhwُّdُrَf ٍءْyَhs yِf ْmُtْʿعَzāَnَt nِiʾَf ۖ ْmُknِm ِrْmَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾَw َlwُsَّrlā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

āًdyِʿعَb āًlāَlَḍ ْmُhَّlِḍُy nَaʾ ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُdyِrُyَw ِhِb āwُrُfْkَy nَaʾ āwُrِmُaʾ ْdَqَw ِtwُغāَّṭlā yَlِiʾ āwُmَkāَḥَtَy nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُy َkِlْbَq nِm َlِznُaʾ āَmَw َkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmِb āwُnَmāʾ ْmُhَّnَaʾ َnwُmُʿعْzَy َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: False objects of worship or those transgressors who usurp the divine right of government.

ayas.translation: āًqyِfْwَtَw āًnāَsْḥِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āَnْdَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ ِhَّllāِb َnwُfِlْḥَy َkwُءāَjg َّmُht ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَmَّdَq āَmِb ٌhَbyِṣُّm mُhْtَbāَṣَaʾ āَhdِiʾ َfْyَkَf
āًغyِlَb āًlْwَq ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf ْmُhَّl lُqَw ْmُhْẓِʿعَw ْmُhْnَʿع ْḍِrْʿعَaʾَf ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf āَm ُhَّllā ُmَlْʿعَy َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., use not violence against them.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًbāَّwَt َhَّllā āwُdَjgَwَl ُlwُsَّrlā ُmُhَl َrَfْغَtْsāَw َhَّllā āwُrَfْغَtْsāَf َkwُءāَjg ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُmَlَّẓ hdِiʾ ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb َʿعāَṭُyِl āَّlِiʾ ٍlwُsَّr nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw
āًmyِlْsَt āwُmِّlَsُyَw َtْyَḍَq āَّmِّm āًjgَrَḥ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf āwُdِjgَy āَl َّmُht ْmُhَnْyَb َrَjgَhs āَmyِf َkwُmِّkَḥُy ٰyَّtَḥ َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َkِّbَrَw āَlَf

āًtyِbْhtَt َّdَhsَaʾَw ْmُhَّl āًrْyَhk َnāَkَl ِhِb َnwُẓَʿعwُy āَm āwُlَʿعَf ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw ۖ ْmُhْnِّm ٌlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ُhwُlَʿعَf āَّm mُkِrāَyِd nِm āwُjgُrْhkā ِwَaʾ ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ āwُlُtْqā ِnَaʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْbَtَk āَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw
āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ āَّnُdَّl nِّm mُhāَnْyَtāʾَّl āًhdِiʾَw
āًʿعyِmَjg āwُrِfnā ِwَaʾ ٍtāَbُht āwُrِfnāَf ْmُkَrْhdِḥ āwُhdُhk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًmyِẓَʿع āًzْwَf َzwُfَaʾَf ْmُhَʿعَm ُtnُk yِnَtْyَl āَy ٌhَّdَwَm ُhَnْyَbَw ْmُkَnْyَb nُkَt ْmَّl nَaʾَk َّnَlwُqَyَl ِhَّllā َnِّm ٌlْḍَf ْmُkَbāَṣَaʾ ْnِyʾَlَw

footnotes.text: The spoils of war. Although having pretended to befriend the believers in support of Allāh's religion, the hypocrite will not be willing to fight except for material gain.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ ِhyِtْwʾُn َfْwَsَf ْbِlْغَy ْwَaʾ ْlَtْqُyَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْlِtāَqُy nَmَw ۚ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāِb āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā َnwُrْhsَy َnyِhdَّlā ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْlِtāَqُyْlَf

āًryِṣَn َknُdَّl nِm āَnَّl lَʿعْjgāَw āًّyِlَw َknُdَّl nِm āَnَّl lَʿعْjgāَw āَhُlْhَaʾ ِmِlāَّẓlā ِhَyْrَqْlā ِhِhdٰـَh ْnِm āَnْjgِrْhkَaʾ āَnَّbَr َnwُlwُqَy َnyِhdَّlā ِnāَdْlِwْlāَw ِءāَsِّnlāَw ِlāَjgِّrlā َnِm َnyِfَʿعْḍَtْsُmْlāَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُlِtāَqُt āَl ْmُkَl āَmَw
āًfyِʿعَḍ َnāَk ِnāَṭْyَّhslā َdْyَk َّnِiʾ ۖ ِnāَṭْyَّhslā َءāَyِlْwَaʾ āwُlِtāَqَf ِtwُغāَّṭlā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُlِtāَqُy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُlِtāَqُy āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="4" verses="60">4:60</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًlyِtَf َnwُmَlْẓُt āَlَw ٰyَqَّtā ِnَmِّl ٌrْyَhk ُhَrِhkāʾْlāَw ٌlyِlَq āَyْnُّdlā ُʿعāَtَm ْlُq ۗ ٍbyِrَq ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnَtْrَّhkَaʾ āَlْwَl َlāَtِqْlā āَnْyَlَʿع َtْbَtَk َmِl āَnَّbَr āwُlāَqَw ۚ ًhَyْhsَhk َّdَhsَaʾ ْwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِhَyْhsَhkَk َsāَّnlā َnْwَhsْhkَy ْmُhْnِّm ٌqyِrَf āَhdِiʾ ُlāَtِqْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َbِtُk āَّmَlَf َhāَkَّzlā āwُtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَw ْmُkَyِdْyَaʾ āwُّfُk ْmُhَl َlyِq َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: Before permission was given by Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًhtyِdَḥ َnwُhَqْfَy َnwُdāَkَy āَl ِmْwَqْlā ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ِlāَmَf ۖ ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِّm ٌّlُk ْlُq ۚ َkِdnِʿع ْnِm ِhِhdٰـَh āwُlwُqَy ٌhَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِm ِhِhdٰـَh āwُlwُqَy ٌhَnَsَḥ ْmُhْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۗ ٍhَdَّyَhsُّm ٍjgwُrُb yِf ْmُtnُk ْwَlَw ُtْwَmْlā ُmُّkkِrْdُy āwُnwُkَt āَmَnْyَaʾ

footnotes.text: Addressing the Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: āًdyِhَhs ِhَّllāِb ٰyَfَkَw ۚ āًlwُsَr ِsāَّnlِl َkāَnْlَsْrَaʾَw ۚ َkِsْfَّn nِmَf ٍhَyʾِّyَs nِm َkَbāَṣَaʾ āَmَw ۖ ِhَّllā َnِmَf ٍhَnَsَḥ ْnِm َkَbāَṣَaʾ āَّm

footnotes.text: As a result of your mistakes or sins.
i.e., never absent, always seeing and having complete knowledge of everything within His dominion.

ayas.translation: āًlyِkَw ِhَّllāِb ٰyَfَkَw ۚ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ْlَّkَwَtَw ْmُhْnَʿع ْḍِrْʿعَaʾَf ۖ َnwُtِّyَbُy āَm ُbُtْkَy ُhَّllāَw ۖ ُlwُqَt yِhdَّlā َrْyَغ ْmُhْnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ َtَّyَb َkِdnِʿع ْnِm āwُzَrَb āَhdِiʾَf ٌhَʿعāَṭ َnwُlwُqَyَw

footnotes.text: i.e., its meanings and its objective.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُtْʿعَbَّtāَl ُhُtَmْḥَrَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُlْḍَf āَlْwَlَw ۗ ْmُhْnِm ُhَnwُṭِbnَtْsَy َnyِhdَّlā ُhَmِlَʿعَl ْmُhْnِm ِrْmَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾ ٰyَlِiʾَw ِlwُsَّrlā yَlِiʾ ُhwُّdَr ْwَlَw ۖ ِhِb āwُʿعāَhdَaʾ ِfْwَhkْlā ِwَaʾ ِnْmَaʾْlā َnِّm ٌrْmَaʾ ْmُhَءāَjg āَhdِiʾَw
āًlyِknَt ُّdَhsَaʾَw āًsْaʾَb ُّdَhsَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۚ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َsْaʾَb َّfُkَy nَaʾ ُhَّllā yَsَʿع ۖ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِḍِّrَḥَw ۚ َkَsْfَn āَّlِiʾ ُfَّlَkُt āَl ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْlِtāَqَf

footnotes.text: Allāh is able to defeat them in such a way as to deter others from attempting anything similar.

ayas.translation: āًtyِqُّm ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ āَhْnِّm ٌlْfِk ُhَّl nُkَy ًhَyʾِّyَs ًhَʿعāَfَhs ْʿعَfْhsَy nَmَw ۖ āَhْnِّm ٌbyِṣَn ُhَّl nُkَy ًhَnَsَḥ ًhَʿعāَfَhs ْʿعَfْhsَy nَّm

footnotes.text: Providing, protecting, witnessing, keeping precise records and capable of recompense.

ayas.translation: āًbyِsَḥ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ āَhwُّdُr ْwَaʾ āَhْnِm َnَsْḥَaʾِb āwُّyَḥَf ٍhَّyِḥَtِb mُtyِّyُḥ āَhdِiʾَw
āًlyِbَs ُhَl َdِjgَt nَlَf ُhَّllā ِlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۖ ُhَّllā َّlَḍَaʾ ْnَm āwُdْhَt nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُtَaʾ ۚ āwُbَsَk āَmِb mُhَsَkْrَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ِnْyَtَyʾِf َnyِqِfāَnُmْlā yِf ْmُkَl āَmَf

footnotes.text: i.e., divided between two viewpoints - whether or not they should be fought and killed.
As the result of their disobedience and disloyalty.
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) leaves or sends astray those who choose to reject His guidance.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw ْmُhْnِm āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَlَw ۖ ْmُhwُmُّtdَjgَw ُhtْyَḥ ْmُhwُlُtْqāَw ْmُhwُhdُhkَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُrِjgāَhُy ٰyَّtَḥ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْmُhْnِm āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَlَf ۖ ًءāَwَs َnwُnwُkَtَf āwُrَfَk āَmَk َnwُrُfْkَt ْwَl āwُّdَw

āًlyِbَs ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َlَʿعَjg āَmَf َmَlَّslā ُmُkْyَlِiʾ āْwَqْlَaʾَw ْmُkwُlِtāَqُy ْmَlَf ْmُkwُlَzَtْʿعā ِnِiʾَf ۚ ْmُkwُlَtāَqَlَf ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْmُhَṭَّlَsَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۚ ْmُhَmْwَq āwُlِtāَqُy ْwَaʾ ْmُkwُlِtāَqُy nَaʾ ْmُhُrwُdُṣ ْtَrِṣَḥ ْmُkwُءāَjg ْwَaʾ ٌqāَhtyِّm mُhَnْyَbَw ْmُkَnْyَb ٍmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ َnwُlِṣَy َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ

āًnyِbُّm āًnāَṭْlُs ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkَl āَnْlَʿعَjg ْmُkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۚ ْmُhwُmُtْfِqَht ُhtْyَḥ ْmُhwُlُtْqāَw ْmُhwُhdُhkَf ْmُhَyِdْyَaʾ āwُّfُkَyَw َmَlَّslā ُmُkْyَlِiʾ āwُqْlُyَw ْmُkwُlِzَtْʿعَy ْmَّl nِiʾَf ۚ āَhyِf āwُsِkْrُaʾ ِhَnْtِfْlā yَlِiʾ āwُّdُr āَm َّlُk ْmُhَmْwَq āwُnَmْaʾَyَw ْmُkwُnَmْaʾَy nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُy َnyِrَhkāʾ َnwُdِjgَtَs

āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ ِhَّllā َnِّm ًhَbْwَt ِnْyَʿعِbāَtَtُm ِnْyَrْhَhs ُmāَyِṣَf ْdِjgَy ْmَّl nَmَf ۖ ٍhَnِmْwʾُّm ٍhَbَqَr ُryِrْḥَtَw ِhِlْhَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ٌhَmَّlَsُّm ٌhَyِdَf ٌqāَhtyِّm mُhَnْyَbَw ْmُkَnْyَb ٍmْwَq nِm َnāَk nِiʾَw ۖ ٍhَnِmْwʾُّm ٍhَbَqَr ُryِrْḥَtَf ٌnِmْwʾُm َwُhَw ْmُkَّl ٍّwُdَʿع ٍmْwَq nِm َnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ āwُqَّdَّṣَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِlْhَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ٌhَmَّlَsُّm ٌhَyِdَw ٍhَnِmْwʾُّm ٍhَbَqَr ُryِrْḥَtَf ًaʾَṭَhk āًnِmْwʾُm َlَtَq nَmَw ۚ ًaʾَṭَhk āَّlِiʾ āًnِmْwʾُm َlُtْqَy nَaʾ ٍnِmْwʾُmِl َnāَk āَmَw

footnotes.text: Uninterrupted except when there is an Islāmically valid reason, as in Ramaḍān.
An accidental death usually results from some degree of negligence or error for which the believer feels the need to repent.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًbāَhdَʿع ُhَl َّdَʿعَaʾَw ُhَnَʿعَlَw ِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َbِḍَغَw āَhyِf āًdِlāَhk ُmَّnَhَjg ُhُwʾāَzَjgَf āًdِّmَʿعَtُّm āًnِmْwʾُm ْlُtْqَy nَmَw

āًryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُnَّyَbَtَf ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َّnَmَf ُlْbَq nِّm mُtnُk َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ٌhَryِhtَk ُmِnāَغَm ِhَّllā َdnِʿعَf āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā َḍَrَʿع َnwُغَtْbَt āًnِmْwʾُm َtْsَl َmāَlَّslā ُmُkْyَlِiʾ ٰyَqْlَaʾ ْnَmِl āwُlwُqَt āَlَw āwُnَّyَbَtَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmُtْbَrَḍ āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Do not assume that he pretends Islām merely in order to save himself, for he may be sincere in faith.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ َnyِdِʿعāَqْlā yَlَʿع َnyِdِhāَjgُmْlā ُhَّllā َlَّḍَfَw ۚ ٰyَnْsُḥْlā ُhَّllā َdَʿعَw āًّlُkَw ۚ ًhَjgَrَd َnyِdِʿعāَqْlā yَlَʿع ْmِhِsُfnَaʾَw ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾِb َnyِdِhāَjgُmْlā ُhَّllā َlَّḍَf ۚ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾَw ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾِb ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُdِhāَjgُmْlāَw ِrَrَّḍlā yِlwُaʾ ُrْyَغ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm َnwُdِʿعāَqْlā yِwَtْsَy āَّl

āًryِṣَm ْtَءāَsَw ۖ ُmَّnَhَjg ْmُhāَwْaʾَm َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ۚ āَhyِf āwُrِjgāَhُtَf ًhَʿعِsāَw ِhَّllā ُḍْrَaʾ ْnُkَt ْmَlَaʾ āwُlāَq ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnyِfَʿعْḍَtْsُm āَّnُk āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُtnُk َmyِf āwُlāَq ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِmِlāَẓ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmُhāَّfَwَt َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: By preferring to remain among the disbelievers, although they have the means to emigrate, in an environment where a Muslim is unable to practice his religion freely.
They are prevented by circumstances beyond their control.
Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="4" verses="43">4:43</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ُhُrْjgَaʾ َʿعَqَw ْdَqَf ُtْwَmْlā ُhْkِrْdُy َّmُht ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āًrِjgāَhُm ِhِtْyَb nِm ْjgُrْhkَy nَmَw ۚ ًhَʿعَsَw āًryِhtَk āًmَغāَrُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْdِjgَy ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْrِjgāَhُy nَmَw

āًnyِbُّm āًّwُdَʿع ْmُkَl āwُnāَk َnyِrِfāَkْlā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkَnِtْfَy nَaʾ ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾ ِhāَlَّṣlā َnِm āwُrُṣْqَt nَaʾ ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَlَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُtْbَrَḍ āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: The four rakʿah prayers are shortened to two rakʿahs.
The example of the Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions illustrates that fear is not a condition for this allowance, merely travel.

ayas.translation: āًnyِhُّm āًbāَhdَʿع َnyِrِfāَkْlِl َّdَʿعَaʾ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُkَrْhdِḥ āwُhdُhkَw ۖ ْmُkَtَḥِlْsَaʾ āwُʿعَḍَt nَaʾ ٰyَḍْrَّm mُtnُk ْwَaʾ ٍrَṭَّm nِّm yًhdَaʾ ْmُkِb َnāَk nِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَw ۚ ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَlْyَّm mُkْyَlَʿع َnwُlyِmَyَf ْmُkِtَʿعِtْmَaʾَw ْmُkِtَḥِlْsَaʾ ْnَʿع َnwُlُfْغَt ْwَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّdَw ۗ ْmُhَtَḥِlْsَaʾَw ْmُhَrْhdِḥ āwُhdُhkْaʾَyْlَw َkَʿعَm āwُّlَṣُyْlَf āwُّlَṣُy ْmَl ٰyَrْhkُaʾ ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ ِtْaʾَtْlَw ْmُkِyʾāَrَw nِm āwُnwُkَyْlَf āwُdَjgَs āَhdِiʾَf ْmُhَtَḥِlْsَaʾ āwُhdُhkْaʾَyْlَw َkَʿعَّm mُhْnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ ْmُqَtْlَf َhāَlَّṣlā ُmُhَl َtْmَqَaʾَf ْmِhyِf َtnُk āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: At times of fear on the battleground.

ayas.translation: āًtwُqْwَّm āًbāَtِk َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع ْtَnāَk َhāَlَّṣlā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَf ْmُtnَnْaʾَmْṭā āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ْmُkِbwُnُjg ٰyَlَʿعَw āًdwُʿعُqَw āًmāَyِq َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَf َhāَlَّṣlā ُmُtْyَḍَq āَhdِiʾَf
āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ َnwُjgْrَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā َnِm َnwُjgْrَtَw ۖ َnwُmَlْaʾَt āَmَk َnwُmَlْaʾَy ْmُhَّnِiʾَf َnwُmَlْaʾَt āwُnwُkَt nِiʾ ۖ ِmْwَqْlā ِءāَغِtْbā yِf āwُnِhَt āَlَw
āًmyِṣَhk َnyِnِyʾāَhkْlِّl nُkَt āَlَw ۚ ُhَّllā َkāَrَaʾ āَmِb ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb َmُkْḥَtِl ِّqَḥْlāِb َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَznَaʾ āَّnِiʾ
āًlyِkَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ُnwُkَy nَّm mَaʾ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُhْnَʿع َhَّllā ُlِdāَjgُy nَmَf āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ْmُhْnَʿع ْmُtْlَdāَjg ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ْmُtnَaʾ āَh
āًnyِbُّm āًmْhtِiʾَw āًnāَtْhُb َlَmَtْḥā ِdَqَf āًyʾyِrَb ِhِb ِmْrَy َّmُht āًmْhtِiʾ ْwَaʾ ًhَyʾyِṭَhk ْbِsْkَy nَmَw

āًmyِẓَʿع َkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُlْḍَf َnāَkَw ۚ ُmَlْʿعَt nُkَt ْmَl āَm َkَmَّlَʿعَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾَw ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm َkَnwُّrُḍَy āَmَw ۖ ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َnwُّlِḍُy āَmَw َkwُّlِḍُy nَaʾ ْmُhْnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَّṭ tَّmَhَl ُhُtَmْḥَrَw َkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُlْḍَf āَlْwَlَw

āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ ِhyِtْwʾُn َfْwَsَf ِhَّllā ِtāَḍْrَm َءāَغِtْbā َkِlَٰhd ْlَʿعْfَy nَmَw ۚ ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb ٍḥāَlْṣِiʾ ْwَaʾ ٍfwُrْʿعَm ْwَaʾ ٍhَqَdَṣِb َrَmَaʾ ْnَm āَّlِiʾ ْmُhāَwْjgَّn nِّm ٍryِhtَk yِf َrْyَhk āَّl

footnotes.text: i.e., make him responsible for his choice.

ayas.translation: āًdyِʿعَb āًlāَlَḍ َّlَḍ ْdَqَf ِhَّllāِb ْkِrْhsُy nَmَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَmِl َkِlَٰhd َnwُd āَm ُrِfْغَyَw ِhِb َkَrْhsُy nَaʾ ُrِfْغَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ
āًdyِrَّm āًnāَṭْyَhs āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعْdَy nِiʾَw āًhtāَnِiʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَy nِiʾ

āًlyِq ِhَّllā َnِm ُqَdْṣَaʾ ْnَmَw ۚ āًّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw ۖ āًdَbَaʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُhُlِhkْdُnَs ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw
āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ُhَl ْdِjgَy āَlَw ِhِb َzْjgُy āًءwُs ْlَmْʿعَy nَm ۗ ِbāَtِkْlā ِlْhَaʾ ِّyِnāَmَaʾ āَlَw ْmُkِّyِnāَmَaʾِb َsْyَّl

āًmyِlَʿع ِhِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ٍrْyَhk ْnِm āwُlَʿعْfَt āَmَw ۚ ِṭْsِqْlāِb ٰyَmāَtَyْlِl āwُmwُqَt nَaʾَw ِnāَdْlِwْlā َnِm َnyِfَʿعْḍَtْsُmْlāَw َّnُhwُḥِknَt nَaʾ َnwُbَغْrَtَw َّnُhَl َbِtُk āَm َّnُhَnwُtْwʾُt āَl yِtāَّllā ِءāَsِّnlā yَmāَtَy yِf ِbāَtِkْlā yِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُy āَmَw َّnِhyِf ْmُkyِtْfُy ُhَّllā ِlُq ۖ ِءāَsِّnlā yِf َkَnwُtْfَtْsَyَw

footnotes.text: i.e., their rights, in general, and their mahr, specifically.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf āwُqَّtَtَw āwُnِsْḥُt nِiʾَw ۚ َّḥُّhslā ُsُfnَaʾْlā ِtَrِḍْḥُaʾَw ۗ ٌrْyَhk ُḥْlُّṣlāَw ۚ āًḥْlُṣ āَmُhَnْyَb āَḥِlْṣُy nَaʾ āَmِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf āًḍāَrْʿعِiʾ ْwَaʾ āًzwُhsُn āَhِlْʿعَb nِm ْtَfāَhk ٌhَaʾَrْmā ِnِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., holding on to self-interests.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf āwُqَّtَtَw āwُḥِlْṣُt nِiʾَw ۚ ِhَqَّlَʿعُmْlāَk āَhwُrَhdَtَf ِlْyَmْlā َّlُk āwُlyِmَt āَlَf ۖ ْmُtْṣَrَḥ ْwَlَw ِءāَsِّnlā َnْyَb āwُlِdْʿعَt nَaʾ āwُʿعyِṭَtْsَt nَlَw

footnotes.text: Neither divorced nor enjoying the rights of marriage.

ayas.translation: āًmyِkَḥ āًʿعِsāَw ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ِhِtَʿعَs nِّm āًّlُk ُhَّllā ِnْغُy āَqَّrَfَtَy nِiʾَw

āًdyِmَḥ āًّyِnَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِl َّnِiʾَf āwُrُfْkَt nِiʾَw ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtā ِnَaʾ ْmُkāَّyِiʾَw ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَnْyَّṣَw ْdَqَlَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِlَw

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="3" verses="173">3:173</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf āwُḍِrْʿعُt ْwَaʾ āwُwْlَt nِiʾَw ۚ āwُlِdْʿعَt nَaʾ ٰyَwَhْlā āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَf ۖ āَmِhِb ٰyَlْwَaʾ ُhَّllāَf āًryِqَf ْwَaʾ āًّyِnَغ ْnُkَy nِiʾ ۚ َnyِbَrْqَaʾْlāَw ِnْyَdِlāَwْlā ِwَaʾ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْwَlَw ِhَّlِl َءāَdَhُhs ِṭْsِqْlāِb َnyِmāَّwَq āwُnwُk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., more knowledgeable of their best interests. Therefore, adhere to what He has enjoined upon you and testify honestly.

ayas.translation: āًdyِʿعَb āًlāَlَḍ َّlَḍ ْdَqَf ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhِlُsُrَw ِhِbُtُkَw ِhِtَkِyʾāَlَmَw ِhَّllāِb ْrُfْkَy nَmَw ۚ ُlْbَq nِm َlَznَaʾ yِhdَّlā ِbāَtِkْlāَw ِhِlwُsَr ٰyَlَʿع َlَّzَn yِhdَّlā ِbāَtِkْlāَw ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnِmāʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., renew, confirm and adhere to your belief.

ayas.translation: āًlyِbَs ْmُhَyِdْhَyِl āَlَw ْmُhَl َrِfْغَyِl ُhَّllā ِnُkَy ْmَّl āًrْfُk āwُdāَdْzā َّmُht āwُrَfَk َّmُht āwُnَmāʾ َّmُht āwُrَfَk َّmُht āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Being the source of all power and honor, Allāh grants them to whom He wills.

ayas.translation: āًʿعyِmَjg َmَّnَhَjg yِf َnyِrِfāَkْlāَw َnyِqِfāَnُmْlā ُʿعِmāَjg َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُhُlْhtِّm āًhdِiʾ ْmُkَّnِiʾ ۚ ِhِrْyَغ ٍhtyِdَḥ yِf āwُḍwُhkَy ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُhَʿعَm āwُdُʿعْqَt āَlَf āَhِb ُaʾَzْhَtْsُyَw āَhِb ُrَfْkُy ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ ْmُtْʿعِmَs āَhdِiʾ ْnَaʾ ِbāَtِkْlā yِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َlَّzَn ْdَqَw

footnotes.text: In this world, by participation in their blasphemy, and in the next, where you will share their punishment.

ayas.translation: āًlyِbَs َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع َnyِrِfāَkْlِl ُhَّllā َlَʿعْjgَy nَlَw ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُkَnْyَb ُmُkْḥَy ُhَّllāَf ۚ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِّm mُkْʿعَnْmَnَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْhdِwْḥَtْsَn ْmَlَaʾ āwُlāَq ٌbyِṣَn َnyِrِfāَkْlِl َnāَk nِiʾَw ْmُkَʿعَّm nُkَn ْmَlَaʾ āwُlāَq ِhَّllā َnِّm ٌḥْtَf ْmُkَl َnāَk nِiʾَf ْmُkِb َnwُṣَّbَrَtَy َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: In the Hereafter, but possibly in this world as well.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َhَّllā َnwُrُkْhdَy āَlَw َsāَّnlā َnwُءāَrُy ٰyَlāَsُk āwُmāَq ِhāَlَّṣlā yَlِiʾ āwُmāَq āَhdِiʾَw ْmُhُʿعِdāَhk َwُhَw َhَّllā َnwُʿعِdāَhkُy َnyِqِfāَnُmْlā َّnِiʾ
āًnyِbُّm āًnāَṭْlُs ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعْjgَt nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُtَaʾ ۚ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِnwُd nِm َءāَyِlْwَaʾ َnyِrِfāَkْlā āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ُhَّllā ِtْwʾُy َfْwَsَw ۖ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َʿعَm َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ِhَّlِl ْmُhَnyِd āwُṣَlْhkَaʾَw ِhَّllāِb āwُmَṣَtْʿعāَw āwُḥَlْṣَaʾَw āwُbāَt َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ

footnotes.text: Of repentance, self-discipline and good deeds, rewarding for them abundantly.

ayas.translation: āًryِdَq āًّwُfَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ٍءwُs nَʿع āwُfْʿعَt ْwَaʾ ُhwُfْhkُt ْwَaʾ āًrْyَhk āwُdْbُt nِiʾ

footnotes.text: Allāh is always able to exact retribution, although He pardons out of His grace.

ayas.translation: āًnyِbُّm āًnāَṭْlُs ٰyَswُm āَnْyَtāʾَw ۚ َkِlَٰhd nَʿع āَnْwَfَʿعَf ُtāَnِّyَbْlā ُmُhْtَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm َlْjgِʿعْlā āwُhdَhkَّtā َّmُht ۚ ْmِhِmْlُẓِb ُhَqِʿعāَّṣlā ُmُhْtَhdَhkَaʾَf ًhَrْhَjg َhَّllā āَnِrَaʾ āwُlāَqَf َkِlَٰhd nِm َrَbْkَaʾ ٰyَswُm āwُlَaʾَs ْdَqَf ۚ ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm āًbāَtِk ْmِhْyَlَʿع َlِّzَnُt nَaʾ ِbāَtِkْlā ُlْhَaʾ َkُlَaʾْsَy
āًẓyِlَغ āًqāَhtyِّm mُhْnِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾَw ِtْbَّslā yِf āwُdْʿعَt āَl ْmُhَl āَnْlُqَw āًdَّjgُs َbāَbْlā āwُlُhkْdā ُmُhَl āَnْlُqَw ْmِhِqāَhtyِmِb َrwُّṭlā ُmُhَqْwَf āَnْʿعَfَrَw

āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَlَf ْmِhِrْfُkِb āَhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َʿعَbَṭ ْlَb ۚ ٌfْlُغ āَnُbwُlُq ْmِhِlْwَqَw ٍّqَḥ ِrْyَغِb َءāَyِbnَaʾْlā ُmِhِlْtَqَw ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb mِhِrْfُkَw ْmُhَqāَhtyِّm mِhِḍْqَn āَmِbَf

footnotes.text: Another interpretation is "And [We made certain good foods unlawful to them]," based upon <reference chapter="4" verses="160">verse 160</reference>.
Or "except with little belief."
When they accused her of fornication.

ayas.translation: āًnyِqَy ُhwُlَtَq āَmَw ۚ ِّnَّẓlā َʿعāَbِّtā āَّlِiʾ ٍmْlِʿع ْnِm ِhِb mُhَl āَm ۚ ُhْnِّm ٍّkَhs yِfَl ِhyِf āwُfَlَtْhkā َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾَw ۚ ْmُhَl َhِّbُhs nِkٰـَlَw ُhwُbَlَṣ āَmَw ُhwُlَtَq āَmَw ِhَّllā َlwُsَr َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع َḥyِsَmْlā āَnْlَtَq āَّnِiʾ ْmِhِlْwَqَw

footnotes.text: Another meaning is "And they did not kill him, being certain [of his identity]," i.e., they killed another assuming it was Jesus (upon whom be peace).
One interpretation is that "his death" refers to that of Jesus after his return to earth. Or it can mean "the death of every individual from among the People of the Scripture."

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ ْmِhyِtْwʾُnَs َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlāَw َhāَkَّzlā َnwُtْwʾُmْlāَw ۚ َhāَlَّṣlā َnyِmyِqُmْlāَw ۚ َkِlْbَq nِm َlِznُaʾ āَmَw َkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlāَw ْmُhْnِm ِmْlِʿعْlā yِf َnwُhkِsāَّrlā ِnِkٰـَّl

āًrwُbَz َdwُwāَd āَnْyَtāʾَw ۚ َnāَmْyَlُsَw َnwُrāَhَw َsُnwُyَw َbwُّyَaʾَw ٰyَsyِʿعَw ِṭāَbْsَaʾْlāَw َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾَw َlyِʿعāَmْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَw ۚ ِhِdْʿعَb nِm َnyِّyِbَّnlāَw ٍḥwُn ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ āَmَk َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Al-Asbāṭ. See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="136">2:136</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًdyِʿعَb āًlāَlَḍ āwُّlَḍ ْdَq ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّdَṣَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِl َّnِiʾَf āwُrُfْkَt nِiʾَw ۚ ْmُkَّl āًrْyَhk āwُnِmāʾَf ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ِّqَḥْlāِb ُlwُsَّrlā ُmُkَءāَjg ْdَq ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

āًlyِkَw ِhَّllāِb ٰyَfَkَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَّl ۘ ٌdَlَw ُhَl َnwُkَy nَaʾ ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۖ ٌdِḥāَw ٌhٰـَlِiʾ ُhَّllā āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkَّl āًrْyَhk āwُhَtnā ۚ ٌhَhtāَlَht āwُlwُqَt āَlَw ۖ ِhِlُsُrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnِmāʾَf ۖ ُhْnِّm ٌḥwُrَw َmَyْrَm ٰyَlِiʾ āَhāَqْlَaʾ ُhُtَmِlَkَw ِhَّllā ُlwُsَr َmَyْrَm ُnْbā yَsyِʿع ُḥyِsَmْlā āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ َّqَḥْlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlwُqَt āَlَw ْmُkِnyِd yِf āwُlْغَt āَl ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Such as attributing divine qualities to certain creations of Allāh or revering them excessively.

ayas.translation: āًʿعyِmَjg ِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُhُrُhsْḥَyَsَf ْrِbْkَtْsَyَw ِhِtَdāَbِʿع ْnَʿع ْfِknَtْsَy nَmَw ۚ َnwُbَّrَqُmْlā ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā āَlَw ِhَّlِّl āًdْbَʿع َnwُkَy nَaʾ ُḥyِsَmْlā َfِknَtْsَy nَّl

āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُhَl َnwُdِjgَy āَlَw āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُhُbِّhdَʿعُyَf āwُrَbْkَtْsāَw āwُfَknَtْsā َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَw ۖ ِhِlْḍَf nِّm mُhُdyِzَyَw ْmُhَrwُjgُaʾ ْmِhyِّfَwُyَf ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf
āًnyِbُّm āًrwُn ْmُkْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَznَaʾَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌnāَhْrُb mُkَءāَjg ْdَq ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Showing the truth (i.e., the Qur’ān).

ayas.translation: āًmyِqَtْsُّm āًṭāَrِṣ ِhْyَlِiʾ ْmِhyِdْhَyَw ٍlْḍَfَw ُhْnِّm ٍhَmْḥَr yِf ْmُhُlِhkْdُyَsَf ِhِb āwُmَṣَtْʿعāَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf

ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُّlِḍَt nَaʾ ْmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy ۗ ِnْyَyَhtnُaʾْlā ِّẓَḥ ُlْhtِm ِrَkَّhdlِlَf ًءāَsِnَw āًlāَjgِّr ًhَwْhkِiʾ āwُnāَk nِiʾَw ۚ َkَrَt āَّmِm ِnāَhtُlُّhtlā āَmُhَlَf ِnْyَtَnْhtā āَtَnāَk nِiʾَf ۚ ٌdَlَw āَhَّl nُkَy ْmَّl nِiʾ āَhُhtِrَy َwُhَw ۚ َkَrَt āَm ُfْṣِn āَhَlَf ٌtْhkُaʾ ُhَlَw ٌdَlَw ُhَl َsْyَl َkَlَh ٌwʾُrْmā ِnِiʾ ۚ ِhَlāَlَkْlā yِf ْmُkyِtْfُy ُhَّllā ِlُq َkَnwُtْfَtْsَy

footnotes.text: This verse relates to siblings from the father's side or from both parents, whereas in Āyah 12 it concerned those from the mother's side alone.

ayas.translation: ُdyِrُy āَm ُmُkْḥَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ٌmُrُḥ ْmُtnَaʾَw ِdْyَّṣlā yِّlِḥُm َrْyَغ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُy āَm āَّlِiʾ ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ُhَmyِhَb mُkَl ْtَّlِḥُaʾ ۚ ِdwُqُʿعْlāِb āwُfْwَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ِmyِḥَّrlā ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِhَّllā ِmْsِb

footnotes.text: Which includes promises, covenants, oaths, etc.
The state of ritual consecration for ḥajj or ʿumrah.

ayas.translation: ِbāَqِʿعْlā ُdyِdَhs َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ ِnāَwْdُʿعْlāَw ِmْhtِiʾْlā yَlَʿع āwُnَwāَʿعَt āَlَw ۖ ٰyَwْqَّtlāَw ِّrِbْlā yَlَʿع āwُnَwāَʿعَtَw ۘ āwُdَtْʿعَt nَaʾ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā ِnَʿع ْmُkwُّdَṣ nَaʾ ٍmْwَq ُnāʾَnَhs ْmُkَّnَmِrْjgَy āَlَw ۚ āwُdāَṭْṣāَf ْmُtْlَlَḥ āَhdِiʾَw ۚ āًnāَwْḍِrَw ْmِhِّbَّr nِّm āًlْḍَf َnwُغَtْbَy َmāَrَḥْlā َtْyَbْlā َnyِّmāʾ āَlَw َdِyʾāَlَqْlā āَlَw َyْdَhْlā āَlَw َmāَrَḥْlā َrْhَّhslā āَlَw ِhَّllā َrِyʾāَʿعَhs āwُّlِḥُt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ۙ ٍmْhtِiʾِّl ٍfِnāَjgَtُm َrْyَغ ٍhَṣَmْhkَm yِf َّrُṭْḍā ِnَmَf ۚ āًnyِd َmāَlْsِiʾْlā ُmُkَl ُtyِḍَrَw yِtَmْʿعِn ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُtْmَmْtَaʾَw ْmُkَnyِd ْmُkَl ُtْlَmْkَaʾ َmْwَyْlā ۚ ِnْwَhsْhkāَw ْmُhْwَhsْhkَt āَlَf ْmُkِnyِd nِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َsِyʾَy َmْwَyْlā ۗ ٌqْsِf ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِmāَlْzَaʾْlāِb āwُmِsْqَtْsَt nَaʾَw ِbُṣُّnlā yَlَʿع َḥِbُhd āَmَw ْmُtْyَّkَhd āَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعُbَّslā َlَkَaʾ āَmَw ُhَḥyِṭَّnlāَw ُhَyِّdَrَtُmْlāَw ُhَhdwُqْwَmْlāَw ُhَqِnَhkْnُmْlāَw ِhِb ِhَّllā ِrْyَغِl َّlِhُaʾ āَmَw ِryِznِhkْlā ُmْḥَlَw ُmَّdlāَw ُhَtْyَmْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع ْtَmِّrُḥ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="173">2:173</reference>.
In the name of anything other than Allāh.

ayas.translation: ِbāَsِḥْlā ُʿعyِrَs َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ ِhْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َmْsā āwُrُkْhdāَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع َnْkَsْmَaʾ āَّmِm āwُlُkَf ۖ ُhَّllā ُmُkَmَّlَʿع āَّmِm َّnُhَnwُmِّlَʿعُt َnyِbِّlَkُm ِḥِrāَwَjgْlā َnِّm mُtْmَّlَʿع āَmَw ۙ ُtāَbِّyَّṭlā ُmُkَl َّlِḥُaʾ ْlُq ۖ ْmُhَl َّlِḥُaʾ āَhdāَm َkَnwُlَaʾْsَy

footnotes.text: Such as dogs, falcons, etc.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َnِm ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf َwُhَw ُhُlَmَʿع َṭِbَḥ ْdَqَf ِnāَmyِiʾْlāِb ْrُfْkَy nَmَw ۗ ٍnāَdْhkَaʾ yِhdِhkَّtُm āَlَw َnyِḥِfāَsُm َrْyَغ َnyِnِṣْḥُm َّnُhَrwُjgُaʾ َّnُhwُmُtْyَtāʾ āَhdِiʾ ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِm ُtāَnَṣْḥُmْlāَw ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm ُtāَnَṣْḥُmْlāَw ۖ ْmُhَّl ٌّlِḥ ْmُkُmāَʿعَṭَw ْmُkَّl ٌّlِḥ َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُmāَʿعَṭَw ۖ ُtāَbِّyَّṭlā ُmُkَl َّlِḥُaʾ َmْwَyْlā

footnotes.text: The specified bridal gift (mahr).

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhَtَmْʿعِn َّmِtُyِlَw ْmُkَrِّhَṭُyِl ُdyِrُy nِkٰـَlَw ٍjgَrَḥ ْnِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َlَʿعْjgَyِl ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy āَm ۚ ُhْnِّm mُkyِdْyَaʾَw ْmُkِhwُjgُwِb āwُḥَsْmāَf āًbِّyَṭ āًdyِʿعَṣ āwُmَّmَyَtَf ًءāَm āwُdِjgَt ْmَlَf َءāَsِّnlā ُmُtْsَmāَl ْwَaʾ ِṭِyʾāَغْlā َnِّm mُknِّm ٌdَḥَaʾ َءāَjg ْwَaʾ ٍrَfَs ٰyَlَʿع ْwَaʾ ٰyَḍْrَّm mُtnُk nِiʾَw ۚ āwُrَّhَّṭāَf āًbُnُjg ْmُtnُk nِiʾَw ۚ ِnْyَbْʿعَkْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkَlُjgْrَaʾَw ْmُkِswُءُrِb āwُḥَsْmāَw ِqِfāَrَmْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkَyِdْyَaʾَw ْmُkَhwُjgُw āwُlِsْغāَf ِhāَlَّṣlā yَlِiʾ ْmُtْmُq āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="4" verses="43">4:43</reference>.
i.e., had sexual intercourse.

ayas.translation: ِrwُdُّṣlā ِtāَhdِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ āَnْʿعَṭَaʾَw āَnْʿعِmَs ْmُtْlُq ْhdِiʾ ِhِb mُkَqَhtāَw yِhdَّlā ُhَqāَhtyِmَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َhَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdāَw

َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ٌryِbَhk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ ٰyَwْqَّtlِl ُbَrْqَaʾ َwُh āwُlِdْʿعā ۚ āwُlِdْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ٍmْwَq ُnāʾَnَhs ْmُkَّnَmِrْjgَy āَlَw ۖ ِṭْsِqْlāِb َءāَdَhُhs ِhَّlِl َnyِmāَّwَq āwُnwُk āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ ْmُknَʿع ْmُhَyِdْyَaʾ َّfَkَf ْmُhَyِdْyَaʾ ْmُkْyَlِiʾ āwُṭُsْbَy nَaʾ ٌmْwَq َّmَh ْhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ِlyِbَّslā َءāَwَs َّlَḍ ْdَqَf ْmُknِm َkِlَٰhd َdْʿعَb َrَfَk nَmَf ۚ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُkَّnَlِhkْdُaʾَlَw ْmُkِtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُknَʿع َّnَrِّfَkُaʾَّl āًnَsَḥ āًḍْrَq َhَّllā ُmُtْḍَrْqَaʾَw ْmُhwُmُtْrَّzَʿعَw yِlُsُrِb mُtnَmāʾَw َhāَkَّzlā ُmُtْyَtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā ُmُtْmَqَaʾ ْnِyʾَl ۖ ْmُkَʿعَm yِّnِiʾ ُhَّllā َlāَqَw ۖ āًbyِqَn َrَhsَʿع ْyَnْhtā ُmُhْnِm āَnْhtَʿعَbَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َqāَhtyِm ُhَّllā َhdَhkَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: By spending in the cause of Allāh, seeking His reward.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْḥَfْṣāَw ْmُhْnَʿع ُfْʿعāَf ۖ ْmُhْnِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ْmُhْnِّm ٍhَnِyʾāَhk ٰyَlَʿع ُʿعِlَّṭَt ُlāَzَt āَlَw ۚ ِhِb āwُrِّkُhd āَّmِّm āًّẓَḥ āwُsَnَw ۙ ِhِʿعِḍāَwَّm nَʿع َmِlَkْlā َnwُfِّrَḥُy ۖ ًhَyِsāَq ْmُhَbwُlُq āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ْmُhāَّnَʿعَl ْmُhَqāَhtyِّm mِhِḍْqَn āَmِbَf

footnotes.text: In the Torah concerning the coming of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُʿعَnْṣَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ُhَّllā ُmُhُyʾِّbَnُy َfْwَsَw ۚ ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ َءāَḍْغَbْlāَw َhَwāَdَʿعْlā ُmُhَnْyَb āَnْyَrْغَaʾَf ِhِb āwُrِّkُhd āَّmِّm āًّẓَḥ āwُsَnَf ْmُhَqāَhtyِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ٰyَrāَṣَn āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َnِmَw

footnotes.text: In the Gospel concerning the coming of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).
i.e., among their various denominations or sects.

ayas.translation: ٌnyِbُّm ٌbāَtِkَw ٌrwُn ِhَّllā َnِّm mُkَءāَjg ْdَq ۚ ٍryِhtَk nَʿع wُfْʿعَyَw ِbāَtِkْlā َnِm َnwُfْhkُt ْmُtnُk āَّmِّm āًryِhtَk ْmُkَl ُnِّyَbُy āَnُlwُsَr ْmُkَءāَjg ْdَq ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Of your sin in that regard.
i.e., security, well-being, integrity and escape from Hellfire. Literally, "freedom from all evil."

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy āَm ُqُlْhkَy ۚ āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُkْlُm ِhَّlِlَw ۗ āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَmَw ُhَّmُaʾَw َmَyْrَm َnْbā َḥyِsَmْlā َkِlْhُy nَaʾ َdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ āًyʾْyَhs ِhَّllā َnِm ُkِlْmَy nَmَf ْlُq ۚ َmَyْrَm ُnْbā ُḥyِsَmْlā َwُh َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َrَfَk ْdَqَّl

ُryِṣَmْlā ِhْyَlِiʾَw ۖ āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُkْlُm ِhَّlِlَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ُbِّhdَʿعُyَw ُءāَhsَy nَmِl ُrِfْغَy ۚ َqَlَhk ْnَّmِّm ٌrَhsَb mُtnَaʾ ْlَb ۖ mُkِbwُnُhdِb mُkُbِّhdَʿعُy َmِlَf ْlُq ۚ ُhُwʾāَّbِḥَaʾَw ِhَّllā ُءāَnْbَaʾ ُnْḥَn ٰyَrāَṣَّnlāَw ُdwُhَyْlā ِtَlāَqَw

ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ٌryِhdَnَw ٌryِhsَb mُkَءāَjg ْdَqَf ۖ ٍryِhdَn āَlَw ٍryِhsَb nِm āَnَءāَjg āَm āwُlwُqَt nَaʾ ِlُsُّrlā َnِّm ٍhَrْtَf ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkَl ُnِّyَbُy āَnُlwُsَr ْmُkَءāَjg ْdَq ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy

َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā َnِّm āًdَḥَaʾ ِtْwʾُy ْmَl āَّm mُkāَtāʾَw āًkwُlُّm mُkَlَʿعَjgَw َءāَyِbnَaʾ ْmُkyِf َlَʿعَjg ْhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َhَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā ِmْwَq āَy ِhِmْwَqِl ٰyَswُm َlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Of all that you need - specifically, homes, wives and servants. Or "sovereigns," i.e., those of independent authority.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِsāَhk āwُbِlَqnَtَf ْmُkِrāَbْdَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُّdَtْrَt āَlَw ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َbَtَk yِtَّlā َhَsَّdَqُmْlā َḍْrَaʾْlā āwُlُhkْdā ِmْwَq āَy
َnwُlِhkāَd āَّnِiʾَf āَhْnِm āwُjgُrْhkَy nِiʾَf āَhْnِm āwُjgُrْhkَy ٰyَّtَḥ āَhَlُhkْdَّn nَl āَّnِiʾَw َnyِrāَّbَjg āًmْwَq āَhyِf َّnِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy āwُlāَq

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ āwُlَّkَwَtَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۚ َnwُbِlāَغ ْmُkَّnِiʾَf ُhwُmُtْlَhkَd āَhdِiʾَf َbāَbْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع āwُlُhkْdā āَmِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َmَʿعْnَaʾ َnwُfāَhkَy َnyِhdَّlā َnِm ِnāَlُjgَr َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., If you obey the command of Allāh trusting in Him, He will fulfill His promise to you.

ayas.translation: َnwُdِʿعāَq āَnُhāَh āَّnِiʾ āَlِtāَqَf َkُّbَrَw َtnَaʾ ْbَhْhdāَf ۖ āَhyِf āwُmāَd āَّm āًdَbَaʾ āَhَlُhkْdَّn nَl āَّnِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy āwُlāَq
َnyِqِsāَfْlā ِmْwَqْlā َnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb ْqُrْfāَf ۖ yِhkَaʾَw yِsْfَn āَّlِiʾ ُkِlْmَaʾ āَl yِّnِiʾ ِّbَr َlāَq

footnotes.text: Or "distinguish us" or "judge between us."
i.e., the killer allowed himself.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِdāَّnlā َnِm َḥَbْṣَaʾَf ۖ yِhkَaʾ َhَءْwَs َyِrāَwُaʾَf ِbāَrُغْlā āَhdٰـَh َlْhtِm َnwُkَaʾ ْnَaʾ ُtْzَjgَʿعَaʾ ٰyَtَlْyَw āَy َlāَq ۚ ِhyِhkَaʾ َhَءْwَs yِrāَwُy َfْyَk ُhَyِrُyِl ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُhtَḥْbَy āًbāَrُغ ُhَّllā َhtَʿعَbَf

footnotes.text: Referring to the dead body, evidence of his shameful deed.

ayas.translation: َnwُfِrْsُmَl ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َkِlَٰhd َdْʿعَb mُhْnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾ َّmُht ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb āَnُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjg ْdَqَlَw ۚ āًʿعyِmَjg َsāَّnlā āَyْḥَaʾ āَmَّnَaʾَkَf āَhāَyْḥَaʾ ْnَmَw āًʿعyِmَjg َsāَّnlā َlَtَq āَmَّnَaʾَkَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍdāَsَf ْwَaʾ ٍsْfَn ِrْyَغِb āًsْfَn َlَtَq nَm ُhَّnَaʾ َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb ٰyَlَʿع āَnْbَtَk َkِlَٰhd ِlْjgَaʾ ْnِm

footnotes.text: i.e., in legal retribution for murder.
i.e., that requiring the death penalty.
Or refrains from killing.
Heedless of Allāh's limits, negligent of their responsibilities.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ْmُhَlَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā yِf ٌyْzِhk ْmُhَl َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِm āْwَfnُy ْwَaʾ ٍfāَlِhk ْnِّm mُhُlُjgْrَaʾَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ َʿعَّṭَqُt ْwَaʾ āwُbَّlَṣُy ْwَaʾ āwُlَّtَqُy nَaʾ āًdāَsَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnْwَʿعْsَyَw ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā َnwُbِrāَḥُy َnyِhdَّlā ُءāَzَjg āَmَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Legal retribution.
i.e., commit acts of violence and terrorism against individuals or treason and aggression against the Islāmic state.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَf ۖ ْmِhْyَlَʿع āwُrِdْqَt nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm āwُbāَt َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ
َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِlyِbَs yِf āwُdِhāَjgَw َhَlyِsَwْlā ِhْyَlِiʾ āwُغَtْbāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ۖ ْmُhْnِm َlِّbُqُt āَm ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy ِbāَhdَʿع ْnِm ِhِb āwُdَtْfَyِl ُhَʿعَm ُhَlْhtِmَw āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَّm mُhَl َّnَaʾ ْwَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ْmُhَlَw ۖ ٌyْzِhk āَyْnُّdlā yِf ْmُhَl ۚ ْmُhَbwُlُq َrِّhَṭُy nَaʾ ُhَّllā ِdِrُy ْmَl َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ِhَّllā َnِm ُhَl َkِlْmَt nَlَf ُhَtَnْtِf ُhَّllā ِdِrُy nَmَw ۚ āwُrَhdْḥāَf ُhْwَtْwʾُt ْmَّl nِiʾَw ُhwُhdُhkَf āَhdٰـَh ْmُtyِtwُaʾ ْnِiʾ َnwُlwُqَy ۖ ِhِʿعِḍāَwَm ِdْʿعَb nِm َmِlَkْlā َnwُfِّrَḥُy ۖ َkwُtْaʾَy ْmَl َnyِrَhkāʾ ٍmْwَqِl َnwُʿعāَّmَs ِbِhdَkْlِl َnwُʿعāَّmَs ۛ āwُdāَh َnyِhdَّlā َnِmَw ۛ ْmُhُbwُlُq nِmْwʾُt ْmَlَw ْmِhِhāَwْfَaʾِb āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َnِm ِrْfُkْlā yِf َnwُʿعِrāَsُy َnyِhdَّlā َknُzْḥَy āَl ُlwُsَّrlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: They had not attended the Prophet's gatherings or heard his words.
The legal ruling desired by them.
The meaning here is misbelief, misconception, or self-delusion as a result of one's own refusal of truth.

ayas.translation: َnyِṭِsْqُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِṭْsِqْlāِb mُhَnْyَb mُkْḥāَf َtْmَkَḥ ْnِiʾَw ۖ āًyʾْyَhs َkwُّrُḍَy nَlَf ْmُhْnَʿع ْḍِrْʿعُt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُhْnَʿع ْḍِrْʿعَaʾ ْwَaʾ ْmُhَnْyَb mُkْḥāَf َkwُءāَjg nِiʾَf ۚ ِtْḥُّslِl َnwُlāَّkَaʾ ِbِhdَkْlِl َnwُʿعāَّmَs

َnwُrِfāَkْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb mُkْḥَy ْmَّl nَmَw ۚ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht yِtāَyāʾِb āwُrَtْhsَt āَlَw ِnْwَhsْhkāَw َsāَّnlā āُwَhsْhkَt āَlَf ۚ َءāَdَhُhs ِhْyَlَʿع āwُnāَkَw ِhَّllā ِbāَtِk nِm āwُẓِfْḥُtْsā āَmِb ُrāَbْḥَaʾْlāَw َnwُّyِnāَّbَّrlāَw āwُdāَh َnyِhdَّlِl āwُmَlْsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnwُّyِbَّnlā āَhِb ُmُkْḥَy ۚ ٌrwُnَw yًdُh āَhyِf َhāَrْwَّtlā āَnْlَznَaʾ āَّnِiʾ

َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb mُkْḥَy ْmَّl nَmَw ۚ ُhَّl ٌhَrāَّfَk َwُhَf ِhِb َqَّdَṣَt nَmَf ۚ ٌṣāَṣِq َḥwُrُjgْlāَw ِّnِّslāِb َّnِّslāَw ِnُhdُaʾْlāِb َnُhdُaʾْlāَw ِfnَaʾْlāِb َfnَaʾْlāَw ِnْyَʿعْlāِb َnْyَʿعْlāَw ِsْfَّnlāِb َsْfَّnlā َّnَaʾ āَhyِf ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْbَtَkَw

َnyِqَّtُmْlِّl ًhَẓِʿعْwَmَw yًdُhَw ِhāَrْwَّtlā َnِm ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُmَw ٌrwُnَw yًdُh ِhyِf َlyِjgnِiʾْlā ُhāَnْyَtāʾَw ۖ ِhāَrْwَّtlā َnِm ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm َmَyْrَm ِnْbā yَsyِʿعِb mِhِrāَhtāʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَnْyَّfَqَw

footnotes.text: i.e., following the tradition of the prophets of the Children of Israel.

ayas.translation: َnwُfِlَtْhkَt ِhyِf ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُyَf āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ۚ ِtāَrْyَhkْlā āwُqِbَtْsāَf ۖ ْmُkāَtāʾ āَm yِf ْmُkَwُlْbَyِّl nِkٰـَlَw ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَّmُaʾ ْmُkَlَʿعَjgَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۚ āًjgāَhْnِmَw ًhَʿعْrِhs ْmُknِm āَnْlَʿعَjg ٍّlُkِl ۚ ِّqَḥْlā َnِm َkَءāَjg āَّmَʿع ْmُhَءāَwْhَaʾ ْʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ۖ ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb mُhَnْyَb mُkْḥāَf ۖ ِhْyَlَʿع āًnِmْyَhُmَw ِbāَtِkْlā َnِm ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm ِّqَḥْlāِb َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَznَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Prior to this revelation, which supersedes all previous scriptures.
i.e., obedience to Allāh according to what He enjoined in the Qur’ān and through the sunnah of His Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُqِsāَfَl ِsāَّnlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾَw ۗ ْmِhِbwُnُhd ِḍْʿعَbِb mُhَbyِṣُy nَaʾ ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy āَmَّnَaʾ ْmَlْʿعāَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَf ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm ِḍْʿعَb nَʿع َkwُnِtْfَy nَaʾ ْmُhْrَhdْḥāَw ْmُhَءāَwْhَaʾ ْʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb mُhَnْyَb mُkْḥā ِnَaʾَw

َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُhْnِm ُhَّnِiʾَf ْmُknِّm mُhَّlَwَtَy nَmَw ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb ُءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb ۘ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ٰyَrāَṣَّnlāَw َdwُhَyْlā āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِmِdāَn ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf āwُّrَsَaʾ āَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُḥِbْṣُyَf ِhِdnِʿع ْnِّm ٍrْmَaʾ ْwَaʾ ِḥْtَfْlāِb َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ُhَّllā yَsَʿعَf ۚ ٌhَrِyʾāَd āَnَbyِṣُt nَaʾ ٰyَhsْhkَn َnwُlwُqَy ْmِhyِf َnwُʿعِrāَsُy ٌḍَrَّm mِhِbwُlُq yِf َnyِhdَّlā yَrَtَf

footnotes.text: About the hypocrites after their exposure.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعِsāَw ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhyِtْwʾُy ِhَّllā ُlْḍَf َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍmِyʾāَl َhَmْwَl َnwُfāَhkَy āَlَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُdِhāَjgُy َnyِrِfāَkْlā yَlَʿع ٍhَّzِʿعَaʾ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع ٍhَّlِhdَaʾ ُhَnwُّbِḥُyَw ْmُhُّbِḥُy ٍmْwَqِb ُhَّllā yِtْaʾَy َfْwَsَf ِhِnyِd nَʿع ْmُknِm َّdَtْrَy nَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ َrāَّfُkْlāَw ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِّm āًbِʿعَlَw āًwُzُh ْmُkَnyِd āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlā āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَّl ٌmْwَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ āًbِʿعَlَw āًwُzُh āَhwُhdَhkَّtā ِhāَlَّṣlā yَlِiʾ ْmُtْyَdāَn āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُqِsāَf ْmُkَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnَaʾَw ُlْbَq nِm َlِznُaʾ āَmَw āَnْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllāِb āَّnَmāʾ ْnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَّnِm َnwُmِqnَt ْlَh ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: Referring to the punishment the People of the Scripture (in their censure of the Muslims) claimed was deserved by them.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="256">2:256</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُmُtْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِhِb āwُjgَrَhk ْdَq ْmُhَw ِrْfُkْlāِb āwُlَhkَّd dَqَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq ْmُkwُءāَjg āَhdِiʾَw

َnyِdِsْfُmْlā ُّbِḥُy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۚ āًdāَsَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnْwَʿعْsَyَw ۚ ُhَّllā āَhَaʾَfْṭَaʾ ِbْrَḥْlِّl āًrāَn āwُdَqْwَaʾ āَmَّlُk ۚ ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ َءāَḍْغَbْlāَw َhَwāَdَʿعْlā ُmُhَnْyَb āَnْyَqْlَaʾَw ۚ āًrْfُkَw āًnāَyْغُṭ َkِّbَّr nِm َkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَّm mُhْnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnَdyِzَyَlَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy َfْyَk ُqِfnُy ِnāَtَṭwُsْbَm ُhāَdَy ْlَb ۘ āwُlāَq āَmِb āwُnِʿعُlَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَّlُغ ۚ ٌhَlwُlْغَm ِhَّllā ُdَy ُdwُhَyْlā ِtَlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Implying inability to give or stinginess.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āَm َءāَs ْmُhْnِّm ٌryِhtَkَw ۖ ٌhَdِṣَtْqُّm ٌhَّmُaʾ ْmُhْnِّm ۚ mِhِlُjgْrَaʾ ِtْḥَt nِmَw ْmِhِqْwَf nِm āwُlَkَaʾَl ْmِhِّbَّr nِّm mِhْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw َlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw َhāَrْwَّtlā āwُmāَqَaʾ ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., in great abundance.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِsāَّnlā َnِm َkُmِṣْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ُhَtَlāَsِr َtْغَّlَb āَmَf ْlَʿعْfَt ْmَّl nِiʾَw ۖ َkِّbَّr nِm َkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَm ْغِّlَb ُlwُsَّrlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِrِfāَkْlā ِmْwَqْlā yَlَʿع َsْaʾَt āَlَf ۖ āًrْfُkَw āًnāَyْغُṭ َkِّbَّr nِm َkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَّm mُhْnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnَdyِzَyَlَw ۗ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm mُkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَmَw َlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw َhāَrْwَّtlā āwُmyِqُt ٰyَّtَḥ ٍءْyَhs ٰyَlَʿع ْmُtْsَl ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="62">2:62</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُlُtْqَy āًqyِrَfَw āwُbَّhdَk āًqyِrَf ْmُhُsُfnَaʾ ٰyَwْhَt āَl āَmِb ٌlwُsَr ْmُhَءāَjg āَmَّlُk ۖ āًlُsُr ْmِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَsْrَaʾَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َqāَhtyِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْdَqَl
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āَmِb ٌryِṣَb ُhَّllāَw ۚ ْmُhْnِّm ٌryِhtَk āwُّmَṣَw āwُmَʿع َّmُht ْmِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َbāَt َّmُht āwُّmَṣَw āwُmَʿعَf ٌhَnْtِf َnwُkَt āَّlَaʾ āwُbِsَḥَw

ٍrāَṣnَaʾ ْnِm َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl āَmَw ۖ ُrāَّnlā ُhāَwْaʾَmَw َhَّnَjgْlā ِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ ْdَqَf ِhَّllāِb ْkِrْhsُy nَm ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkَّbَrَw yِّbَr َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَy ُḥyِsَmْlā َlāَqَw ۖ َmَyْrَm ُnْbā ُḥyِsَmْlā َwُh َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َrَfَk ْdَqَl

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhْnِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnَّsَmَyَl َnwُlwُqَy āَّmَʿع āwُhَtnَy ْmَّl nِiʾَw ۚ ٌdِḥāَw ٌhٰـَlِiʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِm āَmَw ۘ ٍhَhtāَlَht ُhtِlāَht َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َrَfَk ْdَqَّl

footnotes.text: i.e., one part of three, referring to the Christian concept of trinity.
They were in need of sustenance, proving that they were creations of Allāh, not divine beings.

ayas.translation: ُmyِlَʿعْlā ُʿعyِmَّslā َwُh ُhَّllāَw ۚ āًʿعْfَn āَlَw āًّrَḍ ْmُkَl ُkِlْmَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَtَaʾ ْlُq
ِlyِbَّslā ِءāَwَs nَʿع āwُّlَḍَw āًryِhtَk āwُّlَḍَaʾَw ُlْbَq nِm āwُّlَḍ ْdَq ٍmْwَq َءāَwْhَaʾ āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ِّqَḥْlā َrْyَغ ْmُkِnyِd yِf āwُlْغَt āَl ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āَy ْlُq
َnwُdَtْʿعَy āwُnāَkَّw āwَṣَʿع āَmِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ َmَyْrَm ِnْbā yَsyِʿعَw َdwُwāَd ِnāَsِl ٰyَlَʿع َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb nِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َnِʿعُl

َnwُrِbْkَtْsَy āَl ْmُhَّnَaʾَw āًnāَbْhُrَw َnyِsyِّsِq ْmُhْnِm َّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٰyَrāَṣَn āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِّl ًhَّdَwَّm mُhَbَrْqَaʾ َّnَdِjgَtَlَw ۖ āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw َdwُhَyْlā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِّl ًhَwāَdَʿع ِsāَّnlā َّdَhsَaʾ َّnَdِjgَtَl
َnyِdِhāَّhslā َʿعَm āَnْbُtْkāَf āَّnَmāʾ āَnَّbَr َnwُlwُqَy ۖ ِّqَḥْlā َnِm āwُfَrَʿع āَّmِm ِʿعْmَّdlā َnِm ُḍyِfَt ْmُhَnُyْʿعَaʾ ٰyَrَt ِlwُsَّrlā yَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَm āwُʿعِmَs āَhdِiʾَw
َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā ِmْwَqْlā َʿعَm āَnُّbَr āَnَlِhkْdُy nَaʾ ُʿعَmْṭَnَw ِّqَḥْlā َnِm āَnَءāَjg āَmَw ِhَّllāِb ُnِmْwʾُn āَl āَnَl āَmَw
َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُءāَzَjg َkِlَٰhdَw ۚ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg āwُlāَq āَmِb ُhَّllā ُmُhَbāَhtَaʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., their admission and acceptance of the truth and commitment to Allāh's religion (Islām).

ayas.translation: َnyِdَtْʿعُmْlā ُّbِḥُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُdَtْʿعَt āَlَw ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َّlَḥَaʾ āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ āwُmِّrَḥُt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُnِmْwʾُm ِhِb mُtnَaʾ yِhdَّlā َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ āًbِّyَṭ āًlāَlَḥ ُhَّllā ُmُkَqَzَr āَّmِm āwُlُkَw

َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِtāَyāʾ ْmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ْmُkَnāَmْyَaʾ āwُẓَfْḥāَw ۚ ْmُtْfَlَḥ āَhdِiʾ ْmُkِnāَmْyَaʾ ُhَrāَّfَk َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَhtāَlَht ُmāَyِṣَf ْdِjgَy ْmَّl nَmَf ۖ ٍhَbَqَr ُryِrْḥَt ْwَaʾ ْmُhُtَwْsِk ْwَaʾ ْmُkyِlْhَaʾ َnwُmِʿعْṭُt āَm ِṭَsْwَaʾ ْnِm َnyِkāَsَm ِhَrَhsَʿع ُmāَʿعْṭِiʾ ُhُtَrāَّfَkَf ۖ َnāَmْyَaʾْlā ُmُّtdَّqَʿع āَmِb mُkُhdِhkāَwʾُy nِkٰـَlَw ْmُkِnāَmْyَaʾ yِf ِwْغَّllāِb ُhَّllā ُmُkُhdِhkāَwʾُy āَl

footnotes.text: i.e., what is sworn to only out of habit of speech or what one utters carelessly without true intent.
i.e., that for a deliberate oath.
i.e., do not take oaths indiscriminately or swear to do that which is sinful, requiring expiation.

The prohibition understood from the word "avoid" is stronger than if Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) had merely said, "Abstain." The former requires distancing oneself from anything remotely related to these practices.

ayas.translation: ُnyِbُmْlā ُغāَlَbْlā āَnِlwُsَr ٰyَlَʿع āَmَّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَf ْmُtْyَّlَwَt nِiʾَf ۚ āwُrَhdْḥāَw َlwُsَّrlā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw

َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُّbِḥُy ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُnَsْḥَaʾَّw āwَqَّtā َّmُht āwُnَmāʾَّw āwَqَّtā َّmُht ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾَّw āwَqَّtā āَm āَhdِiʾ āwُmِʿعَṭ āَmyِf ٌḥāَnُjg ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع َsْyَl

ٍmāَqِtnā wُhd ٌzyِzَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُhْnِm ُhَّllā ُmِqَtnَyَf َdāَʿع ْnَmَw ۚ َfَlَs āَّmَʿع ُhَّllā āَfَʿع ۗ ِhِrْmَaʾ َlāَbَw َqwُhdَyِّl āًmāَyِṣ َkِlَٰhd ُlْdَʿع ْwَaʾ َnyِkāَsَm ُmāَʿعَṭ ٌhَrāَّfَk ْwَaʾ ِhَbْʿعَkْlā َغِlāَb āًyْdَh ْmُknِّm ٍlْdَʿع āَwَhd ِhِb ُmُkْḥَy ِmَʿعَّnlā َnِm َlَtَq āَm ُlْhtِّm ٌءāَzَjgَf āًdِّmَʿعَtُّm mُknِm ُhَlَtَq nَmَw ۚ ٌmُrُḥ ْmُtnَaʾَw َdْyَّṣlā āwُlُtْqَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="5" verses="1">5:1</reference>.
Refer to footnote for <reference chapter="3" verses="5">3:5</reference>.
Fishing and eating whatever is caught from the sea is permitted even during iḥrām.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb َhَّllā َّnَaʾَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعَtِl َkِlَٰhd ۚ َdِyʾāَlَqْlāَw َyْdَhْlāَw َmāَrَḥْlā َrْhَّhslāَw ِsāَّnlِّl āًmāَyِq َmāَrَḥْlā َtْyَbْlā َhَbْʿعَkْlā ُhَّllā َlَʿعَjg

footnotes.text: Conspicuously as a symbol of Allāh's religion.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾ āَy َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَf ۚ ِhtyِbَhkْlā ُhَrْhtَk َkَbَjgْʿعَaʾ ْwَlَw ُbِّyَّṭlāَw ُhtyِbَhkْlā yِwَtْsَy āَّl lُq

ٌmyِlَḥ ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۗ āَhْnَʿع ُhَّllā āَfَʿع ْmُkَl َdْbُt ُnāʾْrُqْlā ُlَّzَnُy َnyِḥ āَhْnَʿع āwُlَaʾْsَt nِiʾَw ْmُkْwʾُsَt ْmُkَl َdْbُt nِiʾ َءāَyْhsَaʾ ْnَʿع āwُlَaʾْsَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: By their unwillingness to carry out what was commanded of them.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾَw ۖ َbِhdَkْlā ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُrَtْfَy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِkٰـَlَw ۙ ٍmāَḥ āَlَw ٍhَlyِṣَw āَlَw ٍhَbِyʾāَs āَlَw ٍhَryِḥَb nِm ُhَّllā َlَʿعَjg āَm

footnotes.text: Categories of particular camels which were dedicated to the idols and set free to pasture, liberated from the service of man.

ayas.translation: َnwُdَtْhَy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُwʾāَbāʾ َnāَk ْwَlَwَaʾ ۚ āَnَءāَbāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْdَjgَw āَm āَnُbْsَḥ āwُlāَq ِlwُsَّrlā yَlِiʾَw ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَlāَʿعَt ْmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُyَf āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ۚ ْmُtْyَdَtْhā āَhdِiʾ َّlَḍ nَّm mُkُّrُḍَy āَl ۖ ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِmِhtāʾْlā َnِmَّl āًhdِiʾ āَّnِiʾ ِhَّllā َhَdāَhَhs ُmُtْkَn āَlَw ۙ ٰyَbْrُq āَhd َnāَk ْwَlَw āًnَmَht ِhِb yِrَtْhsَn āَl ْmُtْbَtْrā ِnِiʾ ِhَّllāِb ِnāَmِsْqُyَf ِhāَlَّṣlā ِdْʿعَb nِm āَmُhَnwُsِbْḥَt ۚ ِtْwَmْlā ُhَbyِṣُّm mُkْtَbāَṣَaʾَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُtْbَrَḍ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ ْmُkِrْyَغ ْnِm ِnāَrَhkāʾ ْwَaʾ ْmُknِّm ٍlْdَʿع āَwَhd ِnāَnْhtā ِhَّyِṣَwْlā َnyِḥ ُtْwَmْlā ُmُkَdَḥَaʾ َrَḍَḥ āَhdِiʾ ْmُkِnْyَb ُhَdāَhَhs āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِmَّl āًhdِiʾ āَّnِiʾ āَnْyَdَtْʿعā āَmَw āَmِhِtَdāَhَhs nِm ُّqَḥَaʾ āَnُtَdāَhَhsَl ِhَّllāِb ِnāَmِsْqُyَf ِnāَyَlْwَaʾْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َّqَḥَtْsā َnyِhdَّlā َnِm āَmُhَmāَqَm ِnāَmwُqَy ِnāَrَhkāʾَf āًmْhtِiʾ āَّqَḥَtْsā āَmُhَّnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع َrِhtُʿع ْnِiʾَf

َnyِqِsāَfْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُʿعَmْsāَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۗ ْmِhِnāَmْyَaʾ َdْʿعَb ٌnāَmْyَaʾ َّdَrُt nَaʾ āwُfāَhkَy ْwَaʾ āَhِhْjgَw ٰyَlَʿع ِhَdāَhَّhslāِb āwُtْaʾَy nَaʾ ٰyَnْdَaʾ َkِlَٰhd

ٌnyِbُّm ٌrْḥِs āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ْmُhْnِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhَtْyʾِjg ْhdِiʾ َknَʿع َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb ُtْfَfَk ْhdِiʾَw ۖ yِnْhdِiʾِb ٰyَtْwَmْlā ُjgِrْhkُt ْhdِiʾَw ۖ yِnْhdِiʾِb َṣَrْbَaʾْlāَw َhَmْkَaʾْlā ُyʾِrْbُtَw ۖ yِnْhdِiʾِb āًrْyَṭ ُnwُkَtَf āَhyِf ُhkُfnَtَf yِnْhdِiʾِb ِrْyَّṭlā ِhَyʾْyَhَk ِnyِّṭlā َnِm ُqُlْhkَt ْhdِiʾَw ۖ َlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw َhāَrْwَّtlāَw َhَmْkِḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā َkُtْmَّlَʿع ْhdِiʾَw ۖ āًlْhَkَw ِdْhَmْlā yِf َsāَّnlā ُmِّlَkُt ِsُdُqْlā ِḥwُrِb َkُّtdَّyَaʾ ْhdِiʾ َkِtَdِlāَw ٰyَlَʿعَw َkْyَlَʿع yِtَmْʿعِn ْrُkْhdā َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع āَy ُhَّllā َlāَq ْhdِiʾ
َnwُmِlْsُm āَnَّnَaʾِb ْdَhْhsāَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq yِlwُsَrِbَw yِb āwُnِmāʾ ْnَaʾ َnyِّyِrāَwَḥْlā yَlِiʾ ُtْyَḥْwَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw
َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ َhَّllā āwُqَّtā َlāَq ۖ ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm ًhَdِyʾāَm āَnْyَlَʿع َlِّzَnُy nَaʾ َkُّbَr ُʿعyِṭَtْsَy ْlَh َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع āَy َnwُّyِrāَwَḥْlā َlāَq ْhdِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., will Allāh consent to. (His ability is undoubted.)

ayas.translation: َnyِdِhāَّhslā َnِm āَhْyَlَʿع َnwُkَnَw āَnَtْqَdَṣ ْdَq nَaʾ َmَlْʿعَnَw āَnُbwُlُq َّnِyʾَmْṭَtَw āَhْnِm َlُkْaʾَّn nَaʾ ُdyِrُn āwُlāَq

َnyِqِzāَّrlā ُrْyَhk َtnَaʾَw āَnْqُzْrāَw ۖ َknِّm ًhَyāʾَw āَnِrِhkāʾَw āَnِlَّwَaʾِّl āًdyِʿع āَnَl ُnwُkَt ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm ًhَdِyʾāَm āَnْyَlَʿع ْlِznَaʾ āَnَّbَr َّmُhَّllā َmَyْrَm ُnْbā yَsyِʿع َlāَq
َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā َnِّm āًdَḥَaʾ ُhُbِّhdَʿعُaʾ āَّl āًbāَhdَʿع ُhُbِّhdَʿعُaʾ yِّnِiʾَf ْmُknِm ُdْʿعَb ْrُfْkَy nَmَf ۖ ْmُkْyَlَʿع āَhُlِّzَnُm yِّnِiʾ ُhَّllā َlāَq

ِbwُyُغْlā ُmāَّlَʿع َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۚ َkِsْfَn yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَaʾ āَlَw yِsْfَn yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَt ۚ ُhَtْmِlَʿع ْdَqَf ُhُtْlُq ُtnُk nِiʾ ۚ ٍّqَḥِb yِl َsْyَl āَm َlwُqَaʾ ْnَaʾ yِl ُnwُkَy āَm َkَnāَḥْbُs َlāَq ۖ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ِnْyَhٰـَlِiʾ َyِّmُaʾَw yِnwُhdِhkَّtā ِsāَّnlِl َtْlُq َtnَaʾَaʾ َmَyْrَm َnْbā yَsyِʿع āَy ُhَّllā َlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

ٌdyِhَhs ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َtnَaʾَw ۚ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َbyِqَّrlā َtnَaʾ َtnُk yِnَtْyَّfَwَt āَّmَlَf ۖ ْmِhyِf ُtْmُd āَّm āًdyِhَhs ْmِhْyَlَʿع ُtnُkَw ۚ ْmُkَّbَrَw yِّbَr َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِnَaʾ ِhِb yِnَtْrَmَaʾ āَm āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَl ُtْlُq āَm

ُmyِẓَʿعْlā ُzْwَfْlā َkِlَٰhd ۚ ُhْnَʿع āwُḍَrَw ْmُhْnَʿع ُhَّllā َyِḍَّr ۚ āًdَbَaʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٌtāَّnَjg ْmُhَl ۚ ْmُhُqْdِṣ َnyِqِdāَّṣlā ُʿعَfnَy ُmْwَy āَhdٰـَh ُhَّllā َlāَq

footnotes.text: An appointed time for death.
For resurrection.
They will experience the reality of what they had denied and the consequence of their denial.

ayas.translation: َnyِrَhkāʾ āًnْrَq ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْaʾَhsnَaʾَw ْmِhِbwُnُhdِb mُhāَnْkَlْhَaʾَf ْmِhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt َrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَnْlَʿعَjgَw āًrāَrْdِّm mِhْyَlَʿع َءāَmَّslā āَnْlَsْrَaʾَw ْmُkَّl nِّkَmُn ْmَl āَm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhāَّnَّkَّm ٍnْrَq nِّm mِhِlْbَq nِm āَnْkَlْhَaʾ ْmَk āْwَrَy ْmَlَaʾ
ٌnyِbُّm ٌrْḥِs āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَl ْmِhyِdْyَaʾِb ُhwُsَmَlَf ٍsāَṭْrِq yِf āًbāَtِk َkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَّzَn ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: In support of his prophethood (ﷺ).
They would have been destroyed immediately with no chance for repentance.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl ْmُhَf ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُrِsَhk َnyِhdَّlā ۚ ِhyِf َbْyَr āَl ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُkَّnَʿعَmْjgَyَl ۚ َhَmْḥَّrlā ِhِsْfَn ٰyَlَʿع َbَtَk ۚ ِhَّlِّl lُq ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَّm nَmِّl lُq

footnotes.text: Whose wisdom includes precise, perfect and absolute knowledge of all realities and outcomes, according to which He decrees and causes circumstances and occurrences.
Fully acquainted and familiar with every hidden thought, intent and condition of His servants.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُt āَّmِّm ٌءyِrَb yِnَّnِiʾَw ٌdِḥāَw ٌhٰـَlِiʾ َwُh āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۚ ُdَhْhsَaʾ āَّl lُq ۚ ٰyَrْhkُaʾ ًhَhِlāʾ ِhَّllā َʿعَm َّnَaʾ َnwُdَhْhsَtَl ْmُkَّnِyʾَaʾ ۚ َغَlَb nَmَw ِhِb mُkَrِhdnُaʾِl ُnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh َّyَlِiʾ َyِḥwُaʾَw ۚ ْmُkَnْyَbَw yِnْyَb ٌdyِhَhs ۖ ُhَّllā ِlُq ۖ ًhَdāَhَhs ُrَbْkَaʾ ٍءْyَhs ُّyَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: At every time and place until the Day of Judgement.
The Qur’ān. Also interpreted as "him," meaning Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnyِkِrْhsُm āَّnُk āَm āَnِّbَr ِhَّllāَw āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُtَnْtِf nُkَt ْmَl َّmُht

َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُryِṭāَsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَy َkَnwُlِdāَjgُy َkwُءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۚ āَhِb āwُnِmْwʾُy āَّl ٍhَyāʾ َّlُk āْwَrَy nِiʾَw ۚ āًrْqَw ْmِhِnāَhdāʾ yِfَw ُhwُhَqْfَy nَaʾ ًhَّnِkَaʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ ُʿعِmَtْsَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw

footnotes.text: When you recite the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm َnwُkَnَw āَnِّbَr ِtāَyāʾِb َbِّhdَkُn āَlَw ُّdَrُn āَnَtْyَl āَy āwُlāَqَf ِrāَّnlā yَlَʿع āwُfِqُw ْhdِiʾ ٰyَrَt ْwَlَw
َnwُbِhdāَkَl ْmُhَّnِiʾَw ُhْnَʿع āwُhُn āَmِl āwُdāَʿعَl āwُّdُr ْwَlَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm َnwُfْhkُy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhَl āَdَb ْlَb
َnwُrُfْkَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb َbāَhdَʿعْlā āwُqwُhdَf َlāَq ۚ āَnِّbَrَw ٰyَlَb āwُlāَq ۚ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَhdٰـَh َsْyَlَaʾ َlāَq ۚ ْmِhِّbَr ٰyَlَʿع āwُfِqُw ْhdِiʾ ٰyَrَt ْwَlَw

َnwُrِzَy āَm َءāَs āَlَaʾ ۚ ْmِhِrwُhُẓ ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَrāَzْwَaʾ َnwُlِmْḥَy ْmُhَw āَhyِf āَnْṭَّrَf āَm ٰyَlَʿع āَnَtَrْsَḥ āَy āwُlāَq ًhَtْغَb ُhَʿعāَّslā ُmُhْtَءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِhَّllā ِءāَqِlِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā َrِsَhk ْdَq

َnyِlَsْrُmْlā ِiʾَbَّn nِm َkَءāَjg ْdَqَlَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِtāَmِlَkِl َlِّdَbُm āَlَw ۚ āَnُrْṣَn ْmُhāَtَaʾ ٰyَّtَḥ āwُhdwُaʾَw āwُbِّhdُk āَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُrَbَṣَf َkِlْbَq nِّm ٌlُsُr ْtَbِّhdُk ْdَqَlَw

َnyِlِhāَjgْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَt āَlَf ۚ ٰyَdُhْlā yَlَʿع ْmُhَʿعَmَjgَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۚ ٍhَyāʾِb mُhَyِtْaʾَtَf ِءāَmَّslā yِf āًmَّlُs ْwَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًqَfَn َyِغَtْbَt nَaʾ َtْʿعَṭَtْsā ِnِiʾَf ْmُhُḍāَrْʿعِiʾ َkْyَlَʿع َrُbَk َnāَk nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the dead of heart, meaning the disbelievers.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَhsْḥُy ْmِhِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِbāَtِkْlā yِf āَnْṭَّrَf āَّm ۚ mُkُlāَhtْmَaʾ ٌmَmُaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhْyَḥāَnَjgِb ُryِṭَy ٍrِyʾāَṭ āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍhَّbāَd nِm āَmَw

footnotes.text: The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), in which all things are recorded.
The meaning is understood to be "Tell me..."

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُhَl َnَّyَzَw ْmُhُbwُlُq ْtَsَq nِkٰـَlَw āwُʿعَّrَḍَt āَnُsْaʾَb mُhَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ āَlْwَlَf
َnwُsِlْbُّm mُh āَhdِiʾَf ًhَtْغَb mُhāَnْhdَhkَaʾ āwُtwُaʾ āَmِb āwُḥِrَf āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk َbāَwْbَaʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْḥَtَf ِhِb āwُrِّkُhd āَm āwُsَn āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., their trial by poverty and hardship or the warnings of their prophets.
See footnote to <reference chapter="6" verses="40">verse 40</reference>.
Repeat in various ways for emphasis and clarification.
i.e., before your eyes.
i.e., reach and afflict.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ُryِṣَbْlāَw ٰyَmْʿعَaʾْlā yِwَtْsَy ْlَh ْlُq ۚ َّyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥwُy āَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعِbَّtَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ ٌkَlَm yِّnِiʾ ْmُkَl ُlwُqَaʾ āَlَw َbْyَغْlā ُmَlْʿعَaʾ āَlَw ِhَّllā ُnِyʾāَzَhk yِdnِʿع ْmُkَl ُlwُqَaʾ āَّl lُq

َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِm َnwُkَtَf ْmُhَdُrْṭَtَf ٍءْyَhs nِّm mِhْyَlَʿع َkِbāَsِḥ ْnِm āَmَw ٍءْyَhs nِّm mِhِbāَsِḥ ْnِm َkْyَlَʿع āَm ۖ ُhَhْjgَw َnwُdyِrُy ِّyِhsَʿعْlāَw ِhāَdَغْlāِb mُhَّbَr َnwُʿعْdَy َnyِhdَّlā ِdُrْṭَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: No one is held accountable for the deeds or intentions of another. That is left to Allāh's judgement.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِkāَّhslāِb َmَlْʿعَaʾِb ُhَّllā َsْyَlَaʾ ۗ āَnِnْyَb nِّm mِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َّnَm ِءāَlُwʾٰـَhَaʾ āwُlwُqَyِّl ٍḍْʿعَbِb mُhَḍْʿعَb āَّnَtَf َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: Those referred to in verses 52-54 are the poor Muslims who were sincere believers and students of the Prophet (ﷺ). The influential leaders of Quraysh had disdained to sit with them, saying to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ), "Perhaps if you evicted them, we would follow you."

ayas.translation: َnyِdَtْhُmْlā َnِm āَnَaʾ āَmَw āًhdِiʾ ُtْlَlَḍ ْdَq ۙ ْmُkَءāَwْhَaʾ ُʿعِbَّtَaʾ āَّl lُq ۚ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt َnyِhdَّlā َdُbْʿعَaʾ ْnَaʾ ُtyِhُn yِّnِiʾ ْlُq
َnyِlِṣāَfْlā ُrْyَhk َwُhَw ۖ َّqَḥْlā ُّṣُqَy ۖ ِhَّlِl āَّlِiʾ ُmْkُḥْlā ِnِiʾ ۚ ِhِb َnwُlِjgْʿعَtْsَt āَm yِdnِʿع āَm ۚ ِhِb mُtْbَّhdَkَw yِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع yِّnِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: The disbelievers would challenge the Prophet (ﷺ), telling him to bring on Allāh's punishment if he should be truthful in his warning.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍbāَtِk yِf āَّlِiʾ ٍsِbāَy āَlَw ٍbْṭَr āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā ِtāَmُlُẓ yِf ٍhَّbَḥ āَlَw āَhُmَlْʿعَy āَّlِiʾ ٍhَqَrَw nِm ُṭُqْsَt āَmَw ۚ ِrْḥَbْlāَw ِّrَbْlā yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَyَw ۚ َwُh āَّlِiʾ āَhُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِbْyَغْlā ُḥِtāَfَm ُhَdnِʿعَw

َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُy َّmُht ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm ِhْyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۖ yًّmَsُّm ٌlَjgَaʾ ٰyَḍْqُyِl ِhyِf ْmُkُhtَʿعْbَy َّmُht ِrāَhَّnlāِb mُtْḥَrَjg āَm ُmَlْʿعَyَw ِlْyَّllāِb mُkāَّfَwَtَy yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

footnotes.text: i.e., when you sleep.
One's decreed life span.

ayas.translation: َnwُhَqْfَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُfِّrَṣُn َfْyَk ْrُẓnā ۗ ٍḍْʿعَb َsْaʾَb mُkَḍْʿعَb َqyِhdُyَw āًʿعَyِhs ْmُkَsِbْlَy ْwَaʾ ْmُkِlُjgْrَaʾ ِtْḥَt nِm ْwَaʾ ْmُkِqْwَf nِّm āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع َhtَʿعْbَy nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ُrِdāَqْlā َwُh ْlُq

footnotes.text: Following your own inclinations rather than the truth, biased and hostile toward each other.
Other shades of meaning include "a permanence," "a realization" and "a time of stability."

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā ِmْwَqْlā َʿعَm ٰyَrْkِّhdlā َdْʿعَb ْdُʿعْqَt āَlَf ُnāَṭْyَّhslā َkَّnَyِsnُy āَّmِiʾَw ۚ ِhِrْyَغ ٍhtyِdَḥ yِf āwُḍwُhkَy ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُhْnَʿع ْḍِrْʿعَaʾَf āَnِtāَyāʾ yِf َnwُḍwُhkَy َnyِhdَّlā َtْyَaʾَr āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., denials or mockery.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُfْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿعَw ٍmyِmَḥ ْnِّm ٌbāَrَhs ْmُhَl ۖ āwُbَsَk āَmِb āwُlِsْbُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ āَhْnِm ْhdَhkْwʾُy āَّl ٍlْdَʿع َّlُk ْlِdْʿعَt nِiʾَw ٌʿعyِfَhs āَlَw ٌّyِlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm āَhَl َsْyَl ْtَbَsَk āَmِb ٌsْfَn َlَsْbُt nَaʾ ِhِb ْrِّkَhdَw ۚ āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُhْtَّrَغَw āًwْhَlَw āًbِʿعَl ْmُhَnyِd āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlā ِrَhdَw

َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ِّbَrِl َmِlْsُnِl āَnْrِmُaʾَw ۖ ٰyَdُhْlā َwُh ِhَّllā yَdُh َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ āَnِtْyʾā yَdُhْlā yَlِiʾ ُhَnwُʿعْdَy ٌbāَḥْṣَaʾ ُhَl َnāَrْyَḥ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُnyِṭāَyَّhslā ُhْtَwْhَtْsā yِhdَّlāَk ُhَّllā āَnāَdَh ْhdِiʾ َdْʿعَb āَnِbāَqْʿعَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ُّdَrُnَw āَnُّrُḍَy āَlَw āَnُʿعَfnَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm wُʿعْdَnَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., worship.

The example given is of one who has lost his way and is further confused by the evil ones who tempt him to follow various directions, all leading to destruction. Although his sincere friends call him back to the right path, he ignores them.
When interpreted as the "Day" (of resurrection), the sentence would read: "And the Day He says, 'Be,' and it is, His word will be the truth."
That which is absent, invisible, or beyond the perception of the senses or of the mind and therefore is unknown to man, except for what Allāh chooses to reveal.
What is present, visible and known to man. The knowledge of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) includes the reality of all things and all occurrences, no matter how they might appear to human beings.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِfāʾْlā ُّbِḥُaʾ āَl َlāَq َlَfَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ yِّbَr āَhdٰـَh َlāَq ۖ āًbَkْwَk ٰyَaʾَr ُlْyَّllā ِhْyَlَʿع َّnَjg āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: In verses 76-79, beginning from the people's own assertions, Abraham presents a picture of his dissatisfaction as the only logical conclusion one could reach, in order to show them the futility of their false objects of worship.

ayas.translation: َnyِّlāَّḍlā ِmْwَqْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَaʾَl yِّbَr yِnِdْhَy ْmَّl nِyʾَl َlāَq َlَfَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ yِّbَr āَhdٰـَh َlāَq āًغِzāَb َrَmَqْlā yَaʾَr āَّmَlَf
َnwُkِrْhsُt āَّmِّm ٌءyِrَb yِّnِiʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ْtَlَfَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ ُrَbْkَaʾ āَhdٰـَh yِّbَr āَhdٰـَh َlāَq ًhَغِzāَb َsْmَّhslā yَaʾَr āَّmَlَf

َnwُrَّkَhdَtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۗ āًmْlِʿع ٍءْyَhs َّlُk yِّbَr َʿعِsَw ۗ āًyʾْyَhs yِّbَr َءāَhsَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِb َnwُkِrْhsُt āَm ُfāَhkَaʾ āَlَw ۚ ِnāَdَh ْdَqَw ِhَّllā yِf yِّnwُّjgāَḥُtَaʾ َlāَq ۚ ُhُmْwَq ُhَّjgāَḥَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ۖ ِnْmَaʾْlāِb ُّqَḥَaʾ ِnْyَqyِrَfْlā ُّyَaʾَf ۚ āًnāَṭْlُs ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhِb ْlِّzَnُy ْmَl āَm ِhَّllāِb mُtْkَrْhsَaʾ ْmُkَّnَaʾ َnwُfāَhkَt āَlَw ْmُtْkَrْhsَaʾ āَm ُfāَhkَaʾ َfْyَkَw

footnotes.text: Specifically, the association of others in divinity with Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā yِzْjgَn َkِlَٰhdَkَw ۚ َnwُrāَhَw ٰyَswُmَw َfُswُyَw َbwُّyَaʾَw َnāَmْyَlُsَw َdwُwāَd ِhِtَّyِّrُhd nِmَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm āَnْyَdَh āًḥwُnَw ۚ āَnْyَdَh āًّlُk ۚ َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾ ُhَl āَnْbَhَwَw
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع َṭِbَḥَl āwُkَrْhsَaʾ ْwَlَw ۚ ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِb yِdْhَy ِhَّllā yَdُh َkِlَٰhd
َnyِrِfāَkِb āَhِb āwُsْyَّl āًmْwَq āَhِb āَnْlَّkَw ْdَqَf ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āَhِb ْrُfْkَy nِiʾَf ۚ َhَّwُbُّnlāَw َmْkُḥْlāَw َbāَtِkْlā ُmُhāَnْyَtāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

َnwُbَʿعْlَy ْmِhِḍْwَhk yِf ْmُhْrَhd َّmُht ۖ ُhَّllā ِlُq ۖ ْmُkُwʾāَbāʾ āَlَw ْmُtnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعَt ْmَl āَّm mُtْmِّlُʿعَw ۖ āًryِhtَk َnwُfْhkُtَw āَhَnwُdْbُt َsyِṭāَrَq ُhَnwُlَʿعْjgَt ۖ ِsāَّnlِّl yًdُhَw āًrwُn ٰyَswُm ِhِb َءāَjg yِhdَّlā َbāَtِkْlā َlَznَaʾ ْnَm ْlُq ۗ ٍءْyَhs nِّm ٍrَhsَb ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm āwُlāَq ْhdِiʾ ِhِrْdَq َّqَḥ َhَّllā āwُrَdَq āَmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., they did not appreciate the extent of His ability and wisdom.
The Jews, or it may refer to the believers, who are taught by the Qur’ān.
i.e., all other peoples.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِbْkَtْsَt ِhِtāَyāʾ ْnَʿع ْmُtnُkَw ِّqَḥْlā َrْyَغ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُlwُqَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb ِnwُhْlā َbāَhdَʿع َnْwَzْjgُt َmْwَyْlā ۖ ُmُkَsُfnَaʾ āwُjgِrْhkَaʾ ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ wُṭِsāَb ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlāَw ِtْwَmْlā ِtāَrَmَغ yِf َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ِhdِiʾ ٰyَrَt ْwَlَw ۗ ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm َlْhtِm ُlِznُaʾَs َlāَq nَmَw ٌءْyَhs ِhْyَlِiʾ َḥwُy ْmَlَw َّyَlِiʾ َyِḥwُaʾ َlāَq ْwَaʾ āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ٰyَrَtْfā ِnَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَw

footnotes.text: Striking them, as they are unwilling to give up their souls for judgement.

ayas.translation: َnwُmُʿعْzَt ْmُtnُk āَّm mُknَʿع َّlَḍَw ْmُkَnْyَb َʿعَّṭَqَّt dَqَl ۚ ُءāَkَrُhs ْmُkyِf ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْmُtْmَʿعَz َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkَءāَʿعَfُhs ْmُkَʿعَm ٰyَrَn āَmَw ۖ ْmُkِrwُhُẓ َءāَrَw ْmُkāَnْlَّwَhk āَّm mُtْkَrَtَw ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ْmُkāَnْqَlَhk āَmَk ٰyَdāَrُf āَnwُmُtْyʾِjg ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: Between yourselves and the claimed associates and intercessors.
He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) causes them to split and sprout.
Or "according to calculation," referring to their precise movement.
In the earth. See <reference chapter="77" verses="25-26">77:25-26</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl ْmُkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhِʿعْnَyَw َrَmْhtَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ِhِrَmَht ٰyَlِiʾ āwُrُẓnā ۗ ٍhِbāَhsَtُm َrْyَغَw āًhِbَtْhsُm َnāَّmُّrlāَw َnwُtْyَّzlāَw ٍbāَnْʿعَaʾ ْnِّm ٍtāَّnَjgَw ٌhَyِnāَd ٌnāَwْnِq āَhِʿعْlَṭ nِm ِlْhkَّnlā َnِmَw āًbِkāَrَtُّm āًّbَḥ ُhْnِm ُjgِrْhkُّn āًrِḍَhk ُhْnِm āَnْjgَrْhkَaʾَf ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk َtāَbَn ِhِb āَnْjgَrْhkَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَznَaʾ yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

footnotes.text: In the life of this world. The people of Paradise will be able to see Allāh in the Hereafter. See <reference chapter="75" verses="22-23">75:22-23</reference>.
Perceptive of the most precise and unapparent matters and the intricacies of all affairs. Also, He who benefits His servants in indiscernible ways.
See footnote in <reference chapter="6" verses="18">6:18</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍẓyِfَḥِb mُkْyَlَʿع āَnَaʾ āَmَw ۚ āَhْyَlَʿعَf َyِmَʿع ْnَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَnِlَf َrَṣْbَaʾ ْnَmَf ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ُrِyʾāَṣَb mُkَءāَjg ْdَq

footnotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) is directed to disassociate himself from all erroneous belief and practice.
Accusing the Prophet (ﷺ) of having learned from the Jews and Christians.

ayas.translation: ٍlyِkَwِb mِhْyَlَʿع َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ āًẓyِfَḥ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َkāَnْlَʿعَjg āَmَw ۗ āwُkَrْhsَaʾ āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: The Prophet's duty did not go beyond delivery of the message.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mُhُyʾِّbَnُyَf ْmُhُʿعِjgْrَّm mِhِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ َّmُht ْmُhَlَmَʿع ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُkِl āَّnَّyَz َkِlَٰhdَk ۗ ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb āًwْdَʿع َhَّllā āwُّbُsَyَf ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَy َnyِhdَّlā āwُّbُsَt āَlَw

َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl ْtَءāَjg āَhdِiʾ āَhَّnَaʾ ْmُkُrِʿعْhsُy āَmَw ۖ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُtāَyāʾْlā āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۚ āَhِb َّnُnِmْwʾُyَّl ٌhَyāʾ ْmُhْtَءāَjg nِyʾَl ْmِhِnāَmْyَaʾ َdْhَjg ِhَّllāِb āwُmَsْqَaʾَw

َnwُlَhْjgَy ْmُhَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ُhَّllā َءāَhsَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āwُnِmْwʾُyِl āwُnāَk āَّm āًlُbُq ٍءْyَhs َّlُk ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْrَhsَḥَw ٰyَtْwَmْlā ُmُhَmَّlَkَw َhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَّzَn āَnَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

َnwُrَtْfَy āَmَw ْmُhْrَhdَf ۖ ُhwُlَʿعَf āَm َkُّbَr َءāَhs ْwَlَw ۚ āًrwُrُغ ِlْwَqْlā َfُrْhkُz ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb yِḥwُy ِّnِjgْlāَw ِsnِiʾْlā َnyِṭāَyَhs āًّwُdَʿع ٍّyِbَn ِّlُkِl āَnْlَʿعَjg َkِlَٰhdَkَw

َnyِrَtْmُmْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَt āَlَf ۖ ِّqَḥْlāِb َkِّbَّr nِّm ٌlَّzَnُm ُhَّnَaʾ َnwُmَlْʿعَy َbāَtِkْlā ُmُhāَnْyَtāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ āًlَّṣَfُm َbāَtِkْlā ُmُkْyَlِiʾ َlَznَaʾ yِhdَّlā َwُhَw āًmَkَḥ yِغَtْbَaʾ ِhَّllā َrْyَغَfَaʾ
َnwُṣُrْhkَy āَّlِiʾ ْmُh ْnِiʾَw َّnَّẓlā āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَy nِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َkwُّlِḍُy ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَm َrَhtْkَaʾ ْʿعِṭُt nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Out of ignorance and blind imitation.
At the time of slaughter.

ayas.translation: َnyِdَtْʿعُmْlāِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ َwُh َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۗ ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb mِhِyʾāَwْhَaʾِb َnwُّlِḍُyَّl āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾَw ۗ ِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُtْrِrُṭْḍā āَm āَّlِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َmَّrَḥ āَّm mُkَl َlَّṣَf ْdَqَw ِhْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُmْsā َrِkُhd āَّmِm āwُlُkْaʾَt āَّlَaʾ ْmُkَl āَmَw

footnotes.text: In cases of dire necessity, what is normally prohibited becomes permissible, but only to the extent of the need.
i.e., by your obedience to them - obedience being the basis of worship.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm َnyِrِfāَkْlِl َnِّyُz َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ āَhْnِّm ٍjgِrāَhkِb َsْyَl ِtāَmُlُّẓlā yِf ُhُlَhtَّm nَmَk ِsāَّnlā yِf ِhِb yِhsْmَy āًrwُn ُhَl āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ُhāَnْyَyْḥَaʾَf āًtْyَm َnāَk nَmَwَaʾ
َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَmَw ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِb āَّlِiʾ َnwُrُkْmَy āَmَw ۖ āَhyِf āwُrُkْmَyِl āَhyِmِrْjgُm َrِbāَkَaʾ ٍhَyْrَq ِّlُk yِf āَnْlَʿعَjg َkِlَٰhdَkَw

َnwُrُkْmَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ٌdyِdَhs ٌbāَhdَʿعَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ٌrāَغَṣ āwُmَrْjgَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُbyِṣُyَs ۗ ُhَtَlāَsِr ُlَʿعْjgَy ُhtْyَḥ ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllā ۘ ِhَّllā ُlُsُr َyِtwُaʾ āَm َlْhtِm ٰyَtْwʾُn ٰyَّtَḥ َnِmْwʾُّn nَl āwُlāَq ٌhَyāʾ ْmُhْtَءāَjg āَhdِiʾَw

َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع َsْjgِّrlā ُhَّllā ُlَʿعْjgَy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ِءāَmَّslā yِf ُdَّʿعَّṣَy āَmَّnَaʾَk āًjgَrَḥ āًqِّyَḍ ُhَrْdَṣ ْlَʿعْjgَy ُhَّlِḍُy nَaʾ ْdِrُy nَmَw ۖ ِmāَlْsِiʾْlِl ُhَrْdَṣ ْḥَrْhsَy ُhَyِdْhَy nَaʾ ُhَّllā ِdِrُy nَmَf

footnotes.text: As a result of the person's arrogance and persistence in sin.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌmyِkَḥ َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۗ ُhَّllā َءāَhs āَm āَّlِiʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ْmُkāَwْhtَm ُrāَّnlā َlāَq ۚ āَnَl َtْlَّjgَaʾ yِhdَّlā āَnَlَjgَaʾ āَnْغَlَbَw ٍḍْʿعَbِb āَnُḍْʿعَb َʿعَtْmَtْsā āَnَّbَr ِsnِiʾْlā َnِّm mُhُwʾāَyِlْwَaʾ َlāَqَw ۖ ِsnِiʾْlā َnِّm mُtْrَhtْkَtْsā ِdَq ِّnِjgْlā َrَhsْʿعَm āَy āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُhُrُhsْḥَy َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: Another interpretation pertaining to this world is "And thus do We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others for what they have been earning."

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَk āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُdِhَhsَw āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُhْtَّrَغَw ۖ āَnِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَnْdِhَhs āwُlāَq ۚ āَhdٰـَh ْmُkِmْwَy َءāَqِl ْmُkَnwُrِhdnُyَw yِtāَyāʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َnwُّṣُqَy ْmُknِّm ٌlُsُr ْmُkِtْaʾَy ْmَlَaʾ ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َrَhsْʿعَm āَy

footnotes.text: They will be reproached thus at the Judgement.
Or "unjustly."

ayas.translation: َnyِrَhkāʾ ٍmْwَq ِhَّyِّrُhd nِّm mُkَaʾَhsnَaʾ āَmَk ُءāَhsَy āَّm mُkِdْʿعَb nِm ْfِlْhkَtْsَyَw ْmُkْbِhْhdُy ْaʾَhsَy nِiʾ ۚ ِhَmْḥَّrlā wُhd ُّyِnَغْlā َkُّbَrَw

footnotes.text: i.e., You will neither escape nor prevent its occurrence.
i.e., in the land or in the Hereafter.

ayas.translation: َnwُmُkْḥَy āَm َءāَs ۗ ْmِhِyʾāَkَrُhs ٰyَlِiʾ ُlِṣَy َwُhَf ِhَّlِl َnāَk āَmَw ۖ ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ُlِṣَy āَlَf ْmِhِyʾāَkَrُhsِl َnāَk āَmَf ۖ āَnِyʾāَkَrُhsِl āَhdٰـَhَw ْmِhِmْʿعَzِb ِhَّlِl āَhdٰـَh āwُlāَqَf āًbyِṣَn ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlāَw ِhtْrَḥْlā َnِm َaʾَrَhd āَّmِm ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: Their evil associates.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mِhyِzْjgَyَs ۚ ِhْyَlَʿع ًءāَrِtْfā āَhْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َmْsā َnwُrُkْhdَy āَّl ٌmāَʿعْnَaʾَw āَhُrwُhُẓ ْtَmِّrُḥ ٌmāَʿعْnَaʾَw ْmِhِmْʿعَzِb ُءāَhsَّn nَm āَّlِiʾ āَhُmَʿعْṭَy āَّl ٌrْjgِḥ ٌhtْrَḥَw ٌmāَʿعْnَaʾ ِhِhdٰـَh āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: The four categories of grazing livestock called "anʿām" collectively.
See <reference chapter="5" verses="103">5:103</reference>.
At the time of slaughter. Rather, they are dedicated to others among their "deities."
i.e., false assertions that such practices are part of Allāh's religion.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌmyِkَḥ ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhَfْṣَw ْmِhyِzْjgَyَs ۚ ُءāَkَrُhs ِhyِf ْmُhَf ًhَtْyَّm nُkَy nِiʾَw ۖ āَnِjgāَwْzَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ٌmَّrَḥُmَw āَnِrwُkُhdِّl ٌhَṣِlāَhk ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ِhِhdٰـَh ِnwُṭُb yِf āَm āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: i.e., their milk and offspring.
