Of what is lawful and unlawful according to their whims.

ayas.translation: َnyِdَtْhُm āwُnāَk āَmَw āwُّlَḍ ْdَq ۚ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ًءāَrِtْfā ُhَّllā ُmُhَqَzَr āَm āwُmَّrَḥَw ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb āًhَfَs ْmُhَdāَlْwَaʾ āwُlَtَq َnyِhdَّlā َrِsَhk ْdَq

َnyِfِrْsُmْlā ُّbِḥُy āَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āwُfِrْsُt āَlَw ۖ ِhِdāَṣَḥ َmْwَy ُhَّqَḥ āwُtāʾَw َrَmْhtَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ِhِrَmَht nِm āwُlُk ۚ ٍhِbāَhsَtُm َrْyَغَw āًhِbāَhsَtُm َnāَّmُّrlāَw َnwُtْyَّzlāَw ُhُlُkُaʾ āًfِlَtْhkُm َʿعْrَّzlāَw َlْhkَّnlāَw ٍtāَhswُrْʿعَm َrْyَغَw ٍtāَhswُrْʿعَّm ٍtāَّnَjg َaʾَhsnَaʾ yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

footnotes.text: In eating, as well as in all things generally.
As the disbelievers have done in making their own rulings about what is permissible and what is prohibited.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb َsāَّnlā َّlِḍُyِّl āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ٰyَrَtْfā ِnَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَf ۚ āَhdٰـَhِb ُhَّllā ُmُkāَّṣَw ْhdِiʾ َءāَdَhُhs ْmُtnُk ْmَaʾ ۖ ِnْyَyَhtnُaʾْlā ُmāَḥْrَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع ْtَlَmَtْhsā āَّmَaʾ ِnْyَyَhtnُaʾْlā ِmَaʾ َmَّrَḥ ِnْyَrَkَّhdlāʾ ْlُq ۗ ِnْyَnْhtā ِrَqَbْlā َnِmَw ِnْyَnْhtā ِlِbِiʾْlā َnِmَw

ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َkَّbَr َّnِiʾَf ٍdāَʿع āَlَw ٍغāَb َrْyَغ َّrُṭْḍā ِnَmَf ۚ ِhِb ِhَّllā ِrْyَغِl َّlِhُaʾ āًqْsِf ْwَaʾ ٌsْjgِr ُhَّnِiʾَf ٍryِznِhk َmْḥَl ْwَaʾ āًḥwُfْsَّm āًmَd ْwَaʾ ًhَtْyَm َnwُkَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُhُmَʿعْṭَy ٍmِʿعāَṭ ٰyَlَʿع āًmَّrَḥُm َّyَlِiʾ َyِḥwُaʾ āَm yِf ُdِjgَaʾ āَّl lُq

footnotes.text: Refer to <reference chapter="2" verses="173">2:173</reference> and <reference chapter="5" verses="3">5:3</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُqِdāَṣَl āَّnِiʾَw ۖ ْmِhِyْغَbِb mُhāَnْyَzَjg َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍmْẓَʿعِb َṭَlَtْhkā āَm ْwَaʾ āَyāَwَḥْlā ِwَaʾ āَmُhُrwُhُẓ ْtَlَmَḥ āَm āَّlِiʾ āَmُhَmwُḥُhs ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْmَّrَḥ ِmَnَغْlāَw ِrَqَbْlā َnِmَw ۖ ٍrُfُẓ yِhd َّlُk āَnْmَّrَḥ āwُdāَh َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿعَw

َnwُṣُrْhkَt āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾَw َّnَّẓlā āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَt nِiʾ ۖ āَnَl ُhwُjgِrْhkُtَf ٍmْlِʿع ْnِّm mُkَdnِʿع ْlَh ْlُq ۗ āَnَsْaʾَb āwُqāَhd ٰyَّtَḥ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َbَّhdَk َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm āَnْmَّrَḥ āَlَw āَnُwʾāَbāʾ āَlَw āَnْkَrْhsَaʾ āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَl āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَyَs

َnwُlِdْʿعَy ْmِhِّbَrِb mُhَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlāَw āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā َءāَwْhَaʾ ْʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ۚ ْmُhَʿعَm ْdَhْhsَt āَlَf āwُdِhَhs nِiʾَf ۖ āَhdٰـَh َmَّrَḥ َhَّllā َّnَaʾ َnwُdَhْhsَy َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkَءāَdَhُhs َّmُlَh ْlُq

َnwُlِqْʿعَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِb mُkāَّṣَw ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَّlِiʾ ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ yِtَّlā َsْfَّnlā āwُlُtْqَt āَlَw ۖ َnَṭَb āَmَw āَhْnِm َrَhَẓ āَm َhsِḥāَwَfْlā āwُbَrْqَt āَlَw ۖ ْmُhāَّyِiʾَw ْmُkُqُzْrَn ُnْḥَّn ۖ ٍqāَlْmِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَdāَlْwَaʾ āwُlُtْqَt āَlَw ۖ āًnāَsْḥِiʾ ِnْyَdِlāَwْlāِbَw ۖ āًyʾْyَhs ِhِb āwُkِrْhsُt āَّlَaʾ ۖ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْmُkُّbَr َmَّrَḥ āَm ُlْtَaʾ āْwَlāَʿعَt ْlُq

َnwُrَّkَhdَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِb mُkāَّṣَw ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ āwُfْwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِdْhَʿعِbَw ۖ ٰyَbْrُq āَhd َnāَk ْwَlَw āwُlِdْʿعāَf ْmُtْlُq āَhdِiʾَw ۖ āَhَʿعْsُw āَّlِiʾ āًsْfَn ُfِّlَkُn āَl ۖ ِṭْsِqْlāِb َnāَzyِmْlāَw َlْyَkْlā āwُfْwَaʾَw ۖ ُhَّdُhsَaʾ َغُlْbَy ٰyَّtَḥ ُnَsْḥَaʾ َyِh yِtَّlāِb āَّlِiʾ ِmyِtَyْlā َlāَm āwُbَrْqَt āَlَw
َnwُqَّtَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhِb mُkāَّṣَw ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhِlyِbَs nَʿع ْmُkِb َqَّrَfَtَf َlُbُّslā āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ۖ ُhwُʿعِbَّtāَf āًmyِqَtْsُm yِṭāَrِṣ āَhdٰـَh َّnَaʾَw
َnwُnِmْwʾُy ْmِhِّbَr ِءāَqِlِb mُhَّlَʿعَّl ًhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِّl āًlyِṣْfَtَw َnَsْḥَaʾ yِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āًmāَmَt َbāَtِkْlā yَswُm āَnْyَtāʾ َّmُht

footnotes.text: Meaning "additionally" or "moreover," not denoting time sequence.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِfāَغَl ْmِhِtَsāَrِd nَʿع āَّnُk nِiʾَw āَnِlْbَq nِm ِnْyَtَfِyʾāَṭ ٰyَlَʿع ُbāَtِkْlā َlِznُaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ āwُlwُqَt nَaʾ

َnwُfِdْṣَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ِbāَhdَʿعْlā َءwُs āَnِtāَyāʾ ْnَʿع َnwُfِdْṣَy َnyِhdَّlā yِzْjgَnَs ۗ āَhْnَʿع َfَdَṣَw ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb َbَّhdَk nَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَf ۚ ٌhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَnِّyَb mُkَءāَjg ْdَqَf ۚ ْmُhْnِm ٰyَdْhَaʾ āَّnُkَl ُbāَtِkْlā āَnْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَّnَaʾ ْwَl āwُlwُqَt ْwَaʾ

َnwُrِẓَtnُm āَّnِiʾ āwُrِẓَtnā ِlُq ۗ āًrْyَhk āَhِnāَmyِiʾ yِf ْtَbَsَk ْwَaʾ ُlْbَq nِm ْtَnَmāʾ ْnُkَt ْmَl āَhُnāَmyِiʾ āًsْfَn ُʿعَfnَy āَl َkِّbَr ِtāَyāʾ ُḍْʿعَb yِtْaʾَy َmْwَy ۗ َkِّbَr ِtāَyāʾ ُḍْʿعَb َyِtْaʾَy ْwَaʾ َkُّbَr َyِtْaʾَy ْwَaʾ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmُhَyِtْaʾَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ْlَh

footnotes.text: Those denoting the approach of the Last Hour.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَʿعْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mُhُyʾِّbَnُy َّmُht ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ ْmُhُrْmَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ٍءْyَhs yِf ْmُhْnِm َtْsَّl āًʿعَyِhs āwُnāَkَw ْmُhَnyِd āwُqَّrَf َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
َnwُmَlْẓُy āَl ْmُhَw āَhَlْhtِm āَّlِiʾ ٰyَzْjgُy āَlَf ِhَyʾِّyَّslāِb َءāَjg nَmَw ۖ āَhِlāَhtْmَaʾ ُrْhsَʿع ُhَlَf ِhَnَsَḥْlāِb َءāَjg nَm

footnotes.text: i.e., treated unjustly.

ayas.translation: َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِm َnāَk āَmَw ۚ āًfyِnَḥ َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ َhَّlِّm āًmَyِq āًnyِd ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlِiʾ yِّbَr yِnāَdَh yِnَّnِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., those who submit to the will of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُfِlَtْhkَt ِhyِf ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُyَf ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَّm mُkِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۚ ٰyَrْhkُaʾ َrْzِw ٌhَrِzāَw ُrِzَt āَlَw ۚ āَhْyَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ ٍsْfَn ُّlُk ُbِsْkَt āَlَw ۚ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ُّbَr َwُhَw āًّbَr yِغْbَaʾ ِhَّllā َrْyَغَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَt āَّm āًlyِlَq ۗ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ِhِnwُd nِm āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm mُkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَm āwُʿعِbَّtā
َnwُlِyʾāَq ْmُh ْwَaʾ āًtāَyَb āَnُsْaʾَb āَhَءāَjgَf āَhāَnْkَlْhَaʾ ٍhَyْrَq nِّm mَkَw
َnyِmِlāَẓ āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَnُsْaʾَb mُhَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ ْmُhāَwْʿعَd َnāَk āَmَf

footnotes.text: Satan. See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="34">2:34</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِṭ nِm ُhَtْqَlَhkَw ٍrāَّn nِm yِnَtْqَlَhk ُhْnِّm ٌrْyَhk āَnَaʾ َlāَq ۖ َkُtْrَmَaʾ ْhdِiʾ َdُjgْsَt āَّlَaʾ َkَʿعَnَm āَm َlāَq
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِm āَnwُkَtَf َhَrَjgَّhslā ِhِhdٰـَh āَbَrْqَt āَlَw āَmُtْyʾِhs ُhtْyَḥ ْnِm āَlُkَf َhَّnَjgْlā َkُjgْwَzَw َtnَaʾ ْnُkْsā ُmَdāʾ āَyَw

َnyِdِlāَhkْlā َnِm āَnwُkَt ْwَaʾ ِnْyَkَlَm āَnwُkَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhَrَjgَّhslā ِhِhdٰـَh ْnَʿع āَmُkُّbَr āَmُkāَhَn āَm َlāَqَw āَmِhِtāʾْwَs nِm āَmُhْnَʿع َyِrwُw āَm āَmُhَl َyِdْbُyِl ُnāَṭْyَّhslā āَmُhَl َsَwْsَwَf

ٌnyِbُّm ٌّwُdَʿع āَmُkَl َnāَṭْyَّhslā َّnِiʾ āَmُkَّl lُqَaʾَw ِhَrَjgَّhslā āَmُkْlِt nَʿع āَmُkَhْnَaʾ ْmَlَaʾ āَmُhُّbَr āَmُhāَdāَnَw ۖ ِhَّnَjgْlā ِqَrَw nِm āَmِhْyَlَʿع ِnāَfِṣْhkَy āَqِfَṭَw āَmُhُtāʾْwَs āَmُhَl ْtَdَb َhَrَjgَّhslā āَqāَhd āَّmَlَf ۚ ٍrwُrُغِb āَmُhāَّlَdَf
َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَnَl āَnْmَḥْrَtَw āَnَl ْrِfْغَt ْmَّl nِiʾَw āَnَsُfnَaʾ āَnْmَlَẓ āَnَّbَr āَlāَq
َnwُrَّkَّhdَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ ْnِm َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٌrْyَhk َkِlَٰhd ٰyَwْqَّtlā ُsāَbِlَw ۖ āًhsyِrَw ْmُkِtāʾْwَs yِrāَwُy āًsāَbِl ْmُkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ ْdَq َmَdāʾ yِnَb āَy

َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlِl َءāَyِlْwَaʾ َnyِṭāَyَّhslā āَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُhَnْwَrَt āَl ُhtْyَḥ ْnِm ُhُlyِbَqَw َwُh ْmُkāَrَy ُhَّnِiʾ ۗ āَmِhِtāʾْwَs āَmُhَyِrُyِl āَmُhَsāَbِl āَmُhْnَʿع ُʿعِznَy ِhَّnَjgْlā َnِّm mُkْyَwَbَaʾ َjgَrْhkَaʾ āَmَk ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُkَّnَnِtْfَy āَl َmَdāʾ yِnَb āَy

footnotes.text: The garments of Paradise.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُlwُqَtَaʾ ۖ ِءāَhsْḥَfْlāِb ُrُmْaʾَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ āَhِb āَnَrَmَaʾ ُhَّllāَw āَnَءāَbāʾ āَhْyَlَʿع āَnْdَjgَw āwُlāَq ًhَhsِḥāَf āwُlَʿعَf āَhdِiʾَw
َnyِfِrْsُmْlā ُّbِḥُy āَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āwُfِrْsُt āَlَw āwُbَrْhsāَw āwُlُkَw ٍdِjgْsَm ِّlُk َdnِʿع ْmُkَtَnyِz āwُhdُhk َmَdāʾ yِnَb āَy

footnotes.text: Literally, "place of prostration," meaning any place that a Muslim prays upon the earth. The term may also refer specifically to a mosque.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlwُqَt nَaʾَw āًnāَṭْlُs ِhِb ْlِّzَnُy ْmَl āَm ِhَّllāِb āwُkِrْhsُt nَaʾَw ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb َyْغَbْlāَw َmْhtِiʾْlāَw َnَṭَb āَmَw āَhْnِm َrَhَẓ āَm َhsِḥāَwَfْlā َyِّbَr َmَّrَḥ āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: Any unlawful deed.

ayas.translation: َnwُnَzْḥَy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٌfْwَhk āَlَf َḥَlْṣَaʾَw ٰyَqَّtā ِnَmَf ۙ yِtāَyāʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َnwُّṣُqَy ْmُknِّm ٌlُsُr ْmُkَّnَyِtْaʾَy āَّmِiʾ َmَdāʾ yِnَb āَy

َnyِrِfāَk āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُdِhَhsَw āَّnَʿع āwُّlَḍ āwُlāَq ۖ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt ْmُtnُk āَm َnْyَaʾ āwُlāَq ْmُhَnْwَّfَwَtَy āَnُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِbāَtِkْlā َnِّm mُhُbyِṣَn ْmُhُlāَnَy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ِhِtāَyāʾِb َbَّhdَk ْwَaʾ āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ٰyَrَtْfā ِnَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَf

footnotes.text: What is decreed for them.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَّl nِkٰـَlَw ٌfْʿعِḍ ٍّlُkِl َlāَq ۖ ِrāَّnlā َnِّm āًfْʿعِḍ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmِhِtāʾَf āَnwُّlَḍَaʾ ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āَnَّbَr ْmُhāَlwُaʾِl ْmُhāَrْhkُaʾ ْtَlāَq āًʿعyِmَjg āَhyِf āwُkَrāَّdā āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ āَhَtْhkُaʾ ْtَnَʿعَّl ٌhَّmُaʾ ْtَlَhkَd āَmَّlُk ۖ ِrāَّnlā yِf ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َnِّm mُkِlْbَq nِm ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٍmَmُaʾ yِf āwُlُhkْdā َlāَq

footnotes.text: The nation preceding it.
The followers of evil leaders.
Their leaders.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِrْjgُmْlā yِzْjgَn َkِlَٰhdَkَw ۚ ِṭāَyِhkْlā ِّmَs yِf ُlَmَjgْlā َjgِlَy ٰyَّtَḥ َhَّnَjgْlā َnwُlُhkْdَy āَlَw ِءāَmَّslā ُbāَwْbَaʾ ْmُhَl ُḥَّtَfُt āَl āَhْnَʿع āwُrَbْkَtْsāَw āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِhَّnَjgْlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ āَhَʿعْsُw āَّlِiʾ āًsْfَn ُfِّlَkُn āَl ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw

َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb āَhwُmُtْhtِrwُaʾ ُhَّnَjgْlā ُmُkْlِt nَaʾ āwُdwُnَw ۖ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَnِّbَr ُlُsُr ْtَءāَjg ْdَqَl ۖ ُhَّllā āَnāَdَh ْnَaʾ āَlْwَl َyِdَtْhَnِl āَّnُk āَmَw āَhdٰـَhِl āَnāَdَh yِhdَّlā ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā āwُlāَqَw ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā ُmِhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍّlِغ ْnِّm mِhِrwُdُṣ yِf āَm āَnْʿعَzَnَw

footnotes.text: i.e., ill will or sense of injury for what was inflicted upon them during worldly life.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā yَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُhَnْʿعَّl nَaʾ ْmُhَnْyَb ٌnِّhdَwʾُm َnَّhdَaʾَf ۚ ْmَʿعَn āwُlāَq ۖ āًّqَḥ ْmُkُّbَr َdَʿعَw āَّm mُّtdَjgَw ْlَhَf āًّqَḥ āَnُّbَr āَnَdَʿعَw āَm āَnْdَjgَw ْdَq nَaʾ ِrāَّnlā َbāَḥْṣَaʾ ِhَّnَjgْlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ ٰyَdāَnَw
َnwُʿعَmْṭَy ْmُhَw āَhwُlُhkْdَy ْmَl ۚ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٌmāَlَs nَaʾ ِhَّnَjgْlā َbāَḥْṣَaʾ āْwَdāَnَw ۚ ْmُhāَmyِsِb āًّlُk َnwُfِrْʿعَy ٌlāَjgِr ِfāَrْʿعَaʾْlā yَlَʿعَw ۚ ٌbāَjgِḥ āَmُhَnْyَbَw

footnotes.text: Those whose scales are balanced between good and evil deeds.
Both the inhabitants of Paradise and those of Hell.
i.e., great numbers or gathering of wealth.
The humble believers who are now in Paradise. Another interpretation regards them as the people on the elevated partition.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā yَlَʿع āَmُhَmَّrَḥ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ۚ ُhَّllā ُmُkَqَzَr āَّmِm ْwَaʾ ِءāَmْlā َnِm āَnْyَlَʿع āwُḍyِfَaʾ ْnَaʾ ِhَّnَjgْlā َbāَḥْṣَaʾ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ ٰyَdāَnَw
َnwُdَḥْjgَy āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُnāَk āَmَw āَhdٰـَh ْmِhِmْwَy َءāَqِl āwُsَn āَmَk ْmُhāَsnَn َmْwَyْlāَf ۚ āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُhْtَّrَغَw āًbِʿعَlَw āًwْhَl ْmُhَnyِd āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlā

َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع َّlَḍَw ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُrِsَhk ْdَq ۚ ُlَmْʿعَn āَّnُk yِhdَّlā َrْyَغ َlَmْʿعَnَf ُّdَrُn ْwَaʾ āَnَl āwُʿعَfْhsَyَf َءāَʿعَfُhs nِm āَnَّl lَhَf ِّqَḥْlāِb āَnِّbَr ُlُsُr ْtَءāَjg ْdَq ُlْbَq nِm ُhwُsَn َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَy ُhُlyِwْaʾَt yِtْaʾَy َmْwَy ۚ ُhَlyِwْaʾَt āَّlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ْlَh

footnotes.text: The fulfillment of what is promised in the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ُّbَr ُhَّllā َkَrāَbَt ۗ ُrْmَaʾْlāَw ُqْlَhkْlā ُhَl āَlَaʾ ۗ ِhِrْmَaʾِb ٍtāَrَّhkَsُm َmwُjgُّnlāَw َrَmَqْlāَw َsْmَّhslāَw āًhtyِhtَḥ ُhُbُlْṭَy َrāَhَّnlā َlْyَّllā yِhsْغُy ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā ُmُkَّbَr َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: There are several linguistic meanings of the words "istawā ʿalā," among them: to settle upon, to assume ascendancy above, and to assert authority over. However, it is known that all the attributes of Allāh are eternal, i.e., they have always existed and were present before He created. Thus, it cannot be said that He "rose" above the Throne, as Allāh has always been ascendant. Because the Creator may not be compared to His creation, the Prophet's companions and early scholars refused speculation as to how His actions could be interpreted, considering any such attempt unlawful. Similarly, the true nature of the Throne is known only to Allāh, the Exalted.
In supplication or otherwise.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َnِّm ٌbyِrَq ِhَّllā َtَmْḥَr َّnِiʾ ۚ āًʿعَmَṭَw āًfْwَhk ُhwُʿعْdāَw āَhِḥāَlْṣِiʾ َdْʿعَb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُdِsْfُt āَlَw

َnwُrَّkَhdَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ٰyَtْwَmْlā ُjgِrْhkُn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ِtāَrَmَّhtlā ِّlُk nِm ِhِb āَnْjgَrْhkَaʾَf َءāَmْlā ِhِb āَnْlَznَaʾَf ٍtِّyَّm ٍdَlَbِl ُhāَnْqُs āًlāَqِht āًbāَḥَs ْtَّlَqَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِhِtَmْḥَr ْyَdَy َnْyَb āًrْhsُb َḥāَyِّrlā ُlِsْrُy yِhdَّlā َwُhَw
ٍmyِẓَʿع ٍmْwَy َbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَqَf ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āًḥwُn āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَqَl
َnyِmَʿع āًmْwَq āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā āَnْqَrْغَaʾَw ِkْlُfْlā yِf ُhَʿعَm َnyِhdَّlāَw ُhāَnْyَjgnَaʾَf ُhwُbَّhdَkَf

footnotes.text: For a more detailed account, see <reference chapter="11" verses="25-48">11:25-48</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُqَّtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۗ āًdwُh ْmُhāَhkَaʾ ٍdāَʿع ٰyَlِiʾَw

َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhَّllā َءāَlāʾ āwُrُkْhdāَf ۖ ًhَṭْsَb ِqْlَhkْlā yِf ْmُkَdāَzَw ٍḥwُn ِmْwَq ِdْʿعَb nِm َءāَfَlُhk ْmُkَlَʿعَjg ْhdِiʾ āwُrُkْhdāَw ۚ ْmُkَrِhdnُyِl ْmُknِّm ٍlُjgَr ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌrْkِhd ْmُkَءāَjg nَaʾ ْmُtْbِjgَʿعَwَaʾ
َnyِqِdāَّṣlā َnِm َtnُk nِiʾ āَnُdِʿعَt āَmِb āَnِtْaʾَf ۖ āَnُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy َnāَk āَm َrَhdَnَw ُhَdْḥَw َhَّllā َdُbْʿعَnِl āَnَtْyʾِjgَaʾ āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., Allāh's punishment.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِẓَtnُmْlā َnِّm mُkَʿعَm yِّnِiʾ āwُrِẓَtnāَf ۚ ٍnāَṭْlُs nِm āَhِb ُhَّllā َlَّzَn āَّm mُkُwʾāَbāʾَw ْmُtnَaʾ āَhwُmُtْyَّmَs ٍءāَmْsَaʾ yِf yِnَnwُlِdāَjgُtَaʾ ۖ ٌbَḍَغَw ٌsْjgِr ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َʿعَqَw ْdَq َlāَq

footnotes.text: The false objects of worship which you have called "gods."

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُm āwُnāَk āَmَw ۖ āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā َrِbāَd āَnْʿعَṭَqَw āَّnِّm ٍhَmْḥَrِb ُhَʿعَm َnyِhdَّlāَw ُhāَnْyَjgnَaʾَf

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُkَhdُhkْaʾَyَf ٍءwُsِb āَhwُّsَmَt āَlَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِḍْrَaʾ yِf ْlُkْaʾَt āَhwُrَhdَf ۖ ًhَyāʾ ْmُkَl ِhَّllā ُhَqāَn ِhِhdٰـَh ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَnِّyَb mُkْtَءāَjg ْdَq ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۗ āًḥِlāَṣ ْmُhāَhkَaʾ َdwُmَht ٰyَlِiʾَw

َnyِdِsْfُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āْwَhtْʿعَt āَlَw ِhَّllā َءāَlāʾ āwُrُkْhdāَf ۖ āًtwُyُb َlāَbِjgْlā َnwُtِḥْnَtَw āًrwُṣُq āَhِlwُhُs nِm َnwُhdِhkَّtَt ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُkَaʾَّwَbَw ٍdāَʿع ِdْʿعَb nِm َءāَfَlُhk ْmُkَlَʿعَjg ْhdِiʾ āwُrُkْhdāَw

َnwُnِmْwʾُm ِhِb َlِsْrُaʾ āَmِb āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ۚ ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌlَsْrُّm āًḥِlāَṣ َّnَaʾ َnwُmَlْʿعَtَaʾ ْmُhْnِm َnَmāʾ ْnَmِl āwُfِʿعْḍُtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl ِhِmْwَq nِm āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlā ُaʾَlَmْlā َlāَq
َnyِlَsْrُmْlā َnِm َtnُk nِiʾ āَnُdِʿعَt āَmِb āَnِtْyʾā ُḥِlāَṣ āَy āwُlāَqَw ْmِhِّbَr ِrْmَaʾ ْnَʿع āْwَtَʿعَw َhَqāَّnlā āwُrَqَʿعَf
َnwُrَّhَṭَtَy ٌsāَnُaʾ ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkِtَyْrَq nِّm mُhwُjgِrْhkَaʾ āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِmْwَq َbāَwَjg َnāَk āَmَw

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ āَhِḥāَlْṣِiʾ َdْʿعَb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُdِsْfُt āَlَw ْmُhَءāَyْhsَaʾ َsāَّnlā āwُsَhkْbَt āَlَw َnāَzyِmْlāَw َlْyَkْlā āwُfْwَaʾَf ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَnِّyَb mُkْtَءāَjg ْdَq ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۗ āًbْyَʿعُhs ْmُhāَhkَaʾ َnَyْdَm ٰyَlِiʾَw

َnyِdِsْfُmْlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnāَw ۖ ْmُkَrَّhtَkَf āًlyِlَq ْmُtnُk ْhdِiʾ āwُrُkْhdāَw ۚ āًjgَwِʿع āَhَnwُغْbَtَw ِhِb َnَmāʾ ْnَm ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّdُṣَtَw َnwُdِʿعwُt ٍṭāَrِṣ ِّlُkِb āwُdُʿعْqَt āَlَw
َnyِmِkāَḥْlā ُrْyَhk َwُhَw ۚ āَnَnْyَb ُhَّllā َmُkْḥَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُrِbْṣāَf āwُnِmْwʾُy ْmَّl ٌhَfِyʾāَṭَw ِhِb ُtْlِsْrُaʾ yِhdَّlāِb āwُnَmāʾ ْmُknِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ َnāَk nِiʾَw

َnyِhِrāَk āَّnُk ْwَlَwَaʾ َlāَq ۚ āَnِtَّlِm yِf َّnُdwُʿعَtَl ْwَaʾ āَnِtَyْrَq nِm َkَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ُbْyَʿعُhs āَy َkَّnَjgِrْhkُnَl ِhِmْwَq nِm āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlā ُaʾَlَmْlā َlāَq

َnyِḥِtāَfْlā ُrْyَhk َtnَaʾَw ِّqَḥْlāِb āَnِmْwَq َnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb ْḥَtْfā āَnَّbَr ۚ āَnْlَّkَwَt ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ۚ āًmْlِʿع ٍءْyَhs َّlُk āَnُّbَr َʿعِsَw ۚ āَnُّbَr ُhَّllā َءāَhsَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhyِf َdwُʿعَّn nَaʾ āَnَl ُnwُkَy āَmَw ۚ āَhْnِm ُhَّllā āَnāَّjgَn ْhdِiʾ َdْʿعَb mُkِtَّlِm yِf āَnْdُʿع ْnِiʾ āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āَnْyَrَtْfā ِdَq
َnyِrِsāَhkْlā ُmُh āwُnāَk āًbْyَʿعُhs āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā ۚ āَhyِf āْwَnْغَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk āًbْyَʿعُhs āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā
َnwُʿعَّrَّḍَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِءāَّrَّḍlāَw ِءāَsْaʾَbْlāِb āَhَlْhَaʾ āَnْhdَhkَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍّyِbَّn nِّm ٍhَyْrَq yِf āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw
َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَl ْmُhَw ًhَtْغَb mُhāَnْhdَhkَaʾَf ُءāَّrَّslāَw ُءāَّrَّḍlā āَnَءāَbāʾ َّsَm ْdَq āwُlāَqَّw āwَfَʿع ٰyَّtَḥ َhَnَsَḥْlā ِhَyʾِّyَّslā َnāَkَm āَnْlَّdَb َّmُht

footnotes.text: Instead of being grateful to Allāh for His blessings, they merely attributed them to the changing fortunes of time.
That they had been tried and tested.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِsْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mُhāَnْhdَhkَaʾَf āwُbَّhdَk nِkٰـَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm ٍtāَkَrَb mِhْyَlَʿع āَnْḥَtَfَl āْwَqَّtāَw āwُnَmāʾ ٰyَrُqْlā َlْhَaʾ َّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Of blame for their sin.
i.e., occupied with such activities that have no benefit.
They do not benefit from what they hear.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā ِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā ُʿعَbْṭَy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ُlْbَq nِm āwُbَّhdَk āَmِb āwُnِmْwʾُyِl āwُnāَk āَmَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjg ْdَqَlَw ۚ āَhِyʾāَbnَaʾ ْnِm َkْyَlَʿع ُّṣُqَn ٰyَrُqْlā َkْlِt

footnotes.text: i.e., they persistently denied every warning given them.
i.e., they were found to be unfaithful and negligent of Allāh's covenant.

ayas.translation: َnyِdِsْfُmْlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk ْrُẓnāَf ۖ āَhِb āwُmَlَẓَf ِhِyʾَlَmَw َnْwَʿعْrِf ٰyَlِiʾ āَnِtāَyāʾِb ٰyَswُّm mِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْhtَʿعَb َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., they rejected and opposed the signs.

ayas.translation: َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َyِʿعَm ْlِsْrَaʾَf ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَbِb mُkُtْyʾِjg ْdَq ۚ َّqَḥْlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َlwُqَaʾ āَّl nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ٌqyِqَḥ

footnotes.text: i.e., free them from oppression and allow them to emigrate.
i.e., genuine and not imagined, as a miracle from Allāh.
After mutual consultation and agreement.

ayas.translation: َnyِqْlُmْlā ُnْḥَn َnwُkَّn nَaʾ āَّmِiʾَw َyِqْlُt nَaʾ āَّmِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Their staffs and ropes appeared as writhing snakes.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt َfْwَsَf ۖ āَhَlْhَaʾ āَhْnِm āwُjgِrْhkُtِl ِhَnyِdَmْlā yِf ُhwُmُtْrَkَّm ٌrْkَmَl āَhdٰـَh َّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkَl َnَhdāʾ ْnَaʾ َlْbَq ِhِb mُtnَmāʾ ُnْwَʿعْrِf َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., in Moses, avoiding the mention of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlْsُm āَnَّfَwَtَw āًrْbَṣ āَnْyَlَʿع ْغِrْfَaʾ āَnَّbَr ۚ āَnْtَءāَjg āَّmَl āَnِّbَr ِtāَyāʾِb āَّnَmāʾ ْnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَّnِm ُmِqnَt āَmَw

footnotes.text: To endure the torture to which we will be subjected.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt َfْyَk َrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُkَfِlْhkَtْsَyَw ْmُkَّwُdَʿع َkِlْhُy nَaʾ ْmُkُّbَr ٰyَsَʿع َlāَq ۚ āَnَtْyʾِjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِmَw āَnَyِtْaʾَt nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm āَnyِhdwُaʾ āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Imposed on them by way of trial and warning.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ْmُhُrِyʾāَṭ āَmَّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ُhَʿعَّm nَmَw ٰyَswُmِb āwُrَّyَّṭَy ٌhَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۖ ِhِhdٰـَh āَnَl āwُlāَq ُhَnَsَḥْlā ُmُhْtَءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf
َnyِnِmْwʾُmِb َkَl ُnْḥَn āَmَf āَhِb āَnَrَḥْsَtِّl ٍhَyāʾ ْnِm ِhِb āَnِtْaʾَt āَmْhَm āwُlāَqَw

َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َkَʿعَm َّnَlِsْrُnَlَw َkَl َّnَnِmْwʾُnَl َzْjgِّrlā āَّnَʿع َtْfَhsَk nِyʾَl ۖ َkَdnِʿع َdِhَʿع āَmِb َkَّbَr āَnَl ُʿعْdā yَswُm āَy āwُlāَq ُzْjgِّrlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َʿعَqَw āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., a specified term which would end with their reversion to disobedience and disbelief.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِfāَغ āَhْnَʿع āwُnāَkَw āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb ِّmَyْlā yِf ْmُhāَnْqَrْغَaʾَf ْmُhْnِm āَnْmَqَtnāَf

َnwُhsِrْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmَw ُhُmْwَqَw ُnْwَʿعْrِf ُʿعَnْṣَy َnāَk āَm āَnْrَّmَdَw ۖ āwُrَbَṣ āَmِb َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb ٰyَlَʿع ٰyَnْsُḥْlā َkِّbَr ُtَmِlَk ْtَّmَtَw ۖ āَhyِf āَnْkَrāَb yِtَّlā āَhَbِrāَغَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā َqِrāَhsَm َnwُfَʿعْḍَtْsُy āwُnāَk َnyِhdَّlā َmْwَqْlā āَnْhtَrْwَaʾَw

َnwُlَhْjgَt ٌmْwَq ْmُkَّnِiʾ َlāَq ۚ ٌhَhِlāʾ ْmُhَl āَmَk āًhٰـَlِiʾ āَnَّl lَʿعْjgā yَswُm āَy āwُlāَq ۚ ْmُhَّl ٍmāَnْṣَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع َnwُfُkْʿعَy ٍmْwَq ٰyَlَʿع āْwَtَaʾَf َrْḥَbْlā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِb āَnْzَwāَjgَw

footnotes.text: An object of worship.

ayas.translation: َnyِdِsْfُmْlā َlyِbَs ْʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ْḥِlْṣَaʾَw yِmْwَq yِf yِnْfُlْhkā َnwُrāَh ِhyِhkَaʾِl ٰyَswُm َlāَqَw ۚ ًhَlْyَl َnyِʿعَbْrَaʾ ِhِّbَr ُtāَqyِm َّmَtَf ٍrْhsَʿعِb āَhāَnْmَmْtَaʾَw ًhَlْyَl َnyِhtāَlَht ٰyَswُm āَnْdَʿعāَwَw

footnotes.text: i.e., keep their affairs in order.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ُlَّwَaʾ āَnَaʾَw َkْyَlِiʾ ُtْbُt َkَnāَḥْbُs َlāَq َqāَfَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۚ āًqِʿعَṣ ٰyَswُm َّrَhkَw āًّkَd ُhَlَʿعَjg ِlَbَjgْlِl ُhُّbَr ٰyَّlَjgَt āَّmَlَf ۚ yِnāَrَt َfْwَsَf ُhَnāَkَm َّrَqَtْsā ِnِiʾَf ِlَbَjgْlā yَlِiʾ ْrُẓnā ِnِkٰـَlَw yِnāَrَt nَl َlāَq ۚ َkْyَlِiʾ ْrُẓnَaʾ yِnِrَaʾ ِّbَr َlāَq ُhُّbَr ُhَmَّlَkَw āَnِtāَqyِmِl ٰyَswُm َءāَjg āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: That no one can see Allāh during the life of this world.
It crumbled to dust.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِkāَّhslā َnِّm nُkَw َkُtْyَtāʾ āَm ْhdُhkَf yِmāَlَkِbَw yِtāَlāَsِrِb ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿع َkُtْyَfَṭْṣā yِّnِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy َlāَq

َnyِqِsāَfْlā َrāَd ْmُkyِrُaʾَs ۚ āَhِnَsْḥَaʾِb āwُhdُhkْaʾَy َkَmْwَq ْrُmْaʾَw ٍhَّwُqِb āَhْhdُhkَf ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِّl āًlyِṣْfَtَw ًhَẓِʿعْwَّm ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk nِm ِḥāَwْlَaʾْlā yِf ُhَl āَnْbَtَkَw

footnotes.text: This is a severe warning from Allāh against rebellion.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِfāَغ āَhْnَʿع āwُnāَkَw āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ āًlyِbَs ُhwُhdِhkَّtَy ِّyَغْlā َlyِbَs āْwَrَy nِiʾَw āًlyِbَs ُhwُhdِhkَّtَy āَl ِdْhsُّrlā َlyِbَs āْwَrَy nِiʾَw āَhِb āwُnِmْwʾُy āَّl ٍhَyāʾ َّlُk āْwَrَy nِiʾَw ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnwُrَّbَkَtَy َnyِhdَّlā َyِtāَyāʾ ْnَʿع ُfِrْṣَaʾَs

footnotes.text: i.e., reason and integrity.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَẓ āwُnāَkَw ُhwُhdَhkَّtā ۘ āًlyِbَs ْmِhyِdْhَy āَlَw ْmُhُmِّlَkُy āَl ُhَّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَaʾ ۚ ٌrāَwُhk ُhَّl āًdَsَjg āًlْjgِʿع ْmِhِّyِlُḥ ْnِm ِhِdْʿعَb nِm ٰyَswُm ُmْwَq َhdَhkَّtāَw
َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَnَl āَnَl ْrِfْغَyَw āَnُّbَr āَnْmَḥْrَy ْmَّl nِyʾَl āwُlāَq āwُّlَḍ ْdَq ْmُhَّnَaʾ āْwَaʾَrَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ yِf َṭِqُs āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: Literally, "When their hands had been descended upon," i.e., bitten by them out of severe regret.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā ِmْwَqْlā َʿعَm yِnْlَʿعْjgَt āَlَw َءāَdْʿعَaʾْlā َyِb ْtِmْhsُt āَlَf yِnَnwُlُtْqَy āwُdāَkَw yِnwُfَʿعْḍَtْsā َmْwَqْlā َّnِiʾ َّmُaʾ َnْbā َlāَq ۚ ِhْyَlِiʾ ُhُّrُjgَy ِhyِhkَaʾ ِsْaʾَrِb َhdَhkَaʾَw َḥāَwْlَaʾْlā yَqْlَaʾَw ۖ ْmُkِّbَr َrْmَaʾ ْmُtْlِjgَʿعَaʾ ۖ yِdْʿعَb nِm yِnwُmُtْfَlَhk āَmَsْyʾِb َlāَq āًfِsَaʾ َnāَbْḍَغ ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ ٰyَswُm َʿعَjgَr āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., over your humiliation of me.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغَl āَhِdْʿعَb nِm َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ āwُnَmāʾَw āَhِdْʿعَb nِm āwُbāَt َّmُht ِtāَyʾِّyَّslā āwُlِmَʿع َnyِhdَّlāَw
َnwُbَhْrَy ْmِhِّbَrِl ْmُh َnyِhdَّlِّl ٌhَmْḥَrَw yًdُh āَhِtَhkْsُn yِfَw ۖ َḥāَwْlَaʾْlā َhdَhkَaʾ ُbَḍَغْlā yَswُّm nَʿع َtَkَs āَّmَlَw

َnyِrِfāَغْlā ُrْyَhk َtnَaʾَw ۖ āَnْmَḥْrāَw āَnَl ْrِfْغāَf āَnُّyِlَw َtnَaʾ ۖ ُءāَhsَt nَm yِdْhَtَw ُءāَhsَt nَm āَhِb ُّlِḍُt َkُtَnْtِf āَّlِiʾ َyِh ْnِiʾ ۖ āَّnِm ُءāَhَfُّslā َlَʿعَf āَmِb āَnُkِlْhُtَaʾ ۖ َyāَّyِiʾَw ُlْbَq nِّm mُhَtْkَlْhَaʾ َtْyʾِhs ْwَl ِّbَr َlāَq ُhَfْjgَّrlā ُmُhْtَhdَhkَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ āَnِtāَqyِmِّl āًlُjgَr َnyِʿعْbَs ُhَmْwَq ٰyَswُm َrāَtْhkāَw

footnotes.text: Whereupon they were to apologize to Allāh for having worshipped the calf.
Upon reaching the appointed place, they said to Moses, "We will not believe until we see Allāh outright." So the mountain convulsed, killing them.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَnِtāَyāʾِb mُh َnyِhdَّlāَw َhāَkَّzlā َnwُtْwʾُyَw َnwُqَّtَy َnyِhdَّlِl āَhُbُtْkَaʾَsَf ۚ ٍءْyَhs َّlُk ْtَʿعِsَw yِtَmْḥَrَw ۖ ُءāَhsَaʾ ْnَm ِhِb ُbyِṣُaʾ yِbāَhdَʿع َlāَq ۚ َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْdُh āَّnِiʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِfَw ًhَnَsَḥ āَyْnُّdlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِf āَnَl ْbُtْkāَw

َnwُḥِlْfُmْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۙ ُhَʿعَm َlِznُaʾ yِhdَّlā َrwُّnlā āwُʿعَbَّtāَw ُhwُrَṣَnَw ُhwُrَّzَʿعَw ِhِb āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَf ۚ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَnāَk yِtَّlā َlāَlْغَaʾْlāَw ْmُhَrْṣِiʾ ْmُhْnَʿع ُʿعَḍَyَw َhtِyʾāَbَhkْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ُmِّrَḥُyَw ِtāَbِّyَّṭlā ُmُhَl ُّlِḥُyَw ِrَknُmْlā ِnَʿع ْmُhāَhْnَyَw ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb mُhُrُmْaʾَy ِlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw ِhāَrْwَّtlā yِf ْmُhَdnِʿع āًbwُtْkَm ُhَnwُdِjgَy yِhdَّlā َّyِّmُaʾْlā َّyِbَّnlā َlwُsَّrlā َnwُʿعِbَّtَy َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: Difficulties in religious practice.
i.e., extreme measures previously required for repentance, and retribution without recourse to compensation.

ayas.translation: َnwُdَtْhَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ُhwُʿعِbَّtāَw ِhِtāَmِlَkَw ِhَّllāِb ُnِmْwʾُy yِhdَّlā ِّyِّmُaʾْlā ِّyِbَّnlā ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnِmāʾَf ۖ ُtyِmُyَw yِyْḥُy َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُkْlُm ُhَl yِhdَّlā āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُkْyَlِiʾ ِhَّllā ُlwُsَr yِّnِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: Those of them who accepted and followed the final prophet, Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw āَnwُmَlَẓ āَmَw ۚ ْmُkāَnْqَzَr āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ nِm āwُlُk ۖ ٰyَwْlَّslāَw َّnَmْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾَw َmāَmَغْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَّlَẓَw ۚ ْmُhَbَrْhsَّm ٍsāَnُaʾ ُّlُk َmِlَʿع ْdَq ۖ āًnْyَʿع َhَrْhsَʿع āَtَnْhtā ُhْnِm ْtَsَjgَbnāَf ۖ َrَjgَḥْlā َkāَṣَʿعِّb bِrْḍā ِnَaʾ ُhُmْwَq ُhāَqْsَtْsā ِhdِiʾ ٰyَswُm ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَw ۚ āًmَmُaʾ āًṭāَbْsَaʾ َhَrْhsَʿع ْyَtَnْhtā ُmُhāَnْʿعَّṭَqَw

footnotes.text: From the twelve sons of Jacob.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ُdyِzَnَs ۚ ْmُkِtāَyʾyِṭَhk ْmُkَl ْrِfْغَّn āًdَّjgُs َbāَbْlā āwُlُhkْdāَw ٌhَّṭِḥ āwُlwُqَw ْmُtْyʾِhs ُhtْyَḥ āَhْnِm āwُlُkَw َhَyْrَqْlā ِhِhdٰـَh āwُnُkْsā ُmُhَl َlyِq ْhdِiʾَw
َnwُmِlْẓَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm āًzْjgِr ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَsْrَaʾَf ْmُhَl َlyِq yِhdَّlā َrْyَغ āًlْwَq ْmُhْnِm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā َlَّdَbَf

َnwُqُsْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mُhwُlْbَn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ْmِhyِtْaʾَt āَl ۙ َnwُtِbْsَy āَl َmْwَyَw āًʿعَّrُhs ْmِhِtْbَs َmْwَy ْmُhُnāَtyِḥ ْmِhyِtْaʾَt ْhdِiʾ ِtْbَّslā yِf َnwُdْʿعَy ْhdِiʾ ِrْḥَbْlā َhَrِḍāَḥ ْtَnāَk yِtَّlā ِhَyْrَqْlā ِnَʿع ْmُhْlَaʾْsāَw
َnwُqُsْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ٍsyِyʾَb ٍbāَhdَʿعِb āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā āَnْhdَhkَaʾَw ِءwُّslā ِnَʿع َnْwَhْnَy َnyِhdَّlā āَnْyَjgnَaʾ ِhِb āwُrِّkُhd āَm āwُsَn āَّmَlَf
َnyِyʾِsāَhk ًhَdَrِq āwُnwُk ْmُhَl āَnْlُq ُhْnَʿع āwُhُn āَّm nَʿع āْwَtَʿع āَّmَlَf

َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۗ َnwُqَّtَy َnyِhdَّlِّl ٌrْyَhk ُhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrāَّdlāَw ۗ ِhyِf āَm āwُsَrَdَw َّqَḥْlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlwُqَy āَّl nَaʾ ِbāَtِkْlā ُqāَhtyِّm mِhْyَlَʿع ْhdَhkْwʾُy ْmَlَaʾ ۚ ُhwُhdُhkْaʾَy ُhُlْhtِّm ٌḍَrَʿع ْmِhِtْaʾَy nِiʾَw āَnَl ُrَfْغُyَs َnwُlwُqَyَw ٰyَnْdَaʾْlā āَhdٰـَh َḍَrَʿع َnwُhdُhkْaʾَy َbāَtِkْlā āwُhtِrَw ٌfْlَhk ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِm َfَlَhkَf

footnotes.text: i.e., unlawful gains and pleasures.
i.e., a similar temptation.

ayas.translation: َnwُqَّtَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِhyِf āَm āwُrُkْhdāَw ٍhَّwُqِb mُkāَnْyَtāʾ āَm āwُhdُhk ْmِhِb ٌʿعِqāَw ُhَّnَaʾ āwُّnَẓَw ٌhَّlُẓ ُhَّnَaʾَk ْmُhَqْwَf َlَbَjgْlā āَnْqَtَn ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: For their rebellion and disobedience.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِfāَغ āَhdٰـَh ْnَʿع āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy āwُlwُqَt nَaʾ ۛ āَnْdِhَhs ۛ ٰyَlَb āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُkِّbَrِb ُtْsَlَaʾ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَdَhْhsَaʾَw ْmُhَtَّyِّrُhd ْmِhِrwُhُẓ nِm َmَdāʾ yِnَb nِm َkُّbَr َhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw
َnwُlِṭْbُmْlā َlَʿعَf āَmِb āَnُkِlْhُtَfَaʾ ۖ ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِّm ًhَّyِّrُhd āَّnُkَw ُlْbَq nِm āَnُwʾāَbāʾ َkَrْhsَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ āwُlwُqَt ْwَaʾ

footnotes.text: To the way of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), from their diversions and deviations.
A man from the Children of Israel at the time of Moses.
Those who deliberately persist in error to the point of destruction.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl َṣَṣَqْlā ِṣُṣْqāَf ۚ āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā ِmْwَqْlā ُlَhtَm َkِlَّٰhd ۚ htَhْlَy ُhْkُrْtَt ْwَaʾ ْhtَhْlَy ِhْyَlَʿع ْlِmْḥَt nِiʾ ِbْlَkْlā ِlَhtَmَk ُhُlَhtَmَf ۚ ُhāَwَh َʿعَbَّtāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yَlِiʾ َdَlْhkَaʾ ُhَّnِkٰـَlَw āَhِb ُhāَnْʿعَfَrَl āَnْyʾِhs ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., through the revelations, signs or evidences of which he had been given knowledge.
i.e., its worldly pleasures.
Whether or not they have been exposed to Allāh's signs or warnings, it is all the same: they will not believe.
As a result of persistence in evil and rejection of truth.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِfāَغْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ُّlَḍَaʾ ْmُh ْlَb ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlāَk َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āَhِb َnwُʿعَmْsَy āَّl ٌnāَhdāʾ ْmُhَlَw āَhِb َnwُrِṣْbُy āَّl ٌnُyْʿعَaʾ ْmُhَlَw āَhِb َnwُhَqْfَy āَّl ٌbwُlُq ْmُhَl ۖ ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk َmَّnَhَjgِl āَnْaʾَrَhd ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: The reference is to their inability (i.e., refusal) to think and reason, while blindly following (as they are accustomed).
i.e., use them improperly or deny them.
The followers of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).
Allāh will test them with one favor after another in spite of their disobedience, which only increases them in arrogance and sin.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَhُmْlِʿع āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۖ āَhْnَʿع ٌّyِfَḥ َkَّnَaʾَk َkَnwُlَaʾْsَy ۗ ًhَtْغَb āَّlِiʾ ْmُkyِtْaʾَt āَl ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ْtَlُqَht ۚ َwُh āَّlِiʾ āَhِtْqَwِl āَhyِّlَjgُy āَl ۖ yِّbَr َdnِʿع āَhُmْlِʿع āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۖ āَhāَsْrُm َnāَّyَaʾ ِhَʿعāَّslā ِnَʿع َkَnwُlَaʾْsَy

footnotes.text: Literally, "resting" or "establishment."
i.e., it is a source of concern, worry or fear.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ٌryِhsَbَw ٌryِhdَn āَّlِiʾ āَnَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۚ ُءwُّslā َyِnَّsَm āَmَw ِrْyَhkْlā َnِm ُtْrَhtْkَtْsāَl َbْyَغْlā ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُtnُk ْwَlَw ۚ ُhَّllā َءāَhs āَm āَّlِiʾ āًّrَḍ āَlَw āًʿعْfَn yِsْfَnِl ُkِlْmَaʾ āَّl lُq

َnyِrِkāَّhslā َnِm َّnَnwُkَnَّl āًḥِlāَṣ āَnَtْyَtāʾ ْnِyʾَl āَmُhَّbَr َhَّllā āَwَʿعَّd tَlَqْhtَaʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ ِhِb ْtَّrَmَf āًfyِfَhk āًlْmَḥ ْtَlَmَḥ āَhāَّhsَغَt āَّmَlَf ۖ āَhْyَlِiʾ َnُkْsَyِl āَhَjgْwَz āَhْnِm َlَʿعَjgَw ٍhَdِḥāَw ٍsْfَّn nِّm mُkَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: i.e., man or every descendent of Adam.
An allusion to sexual intercourse.
Physically sound or righteous.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy āَّmَʿع ُhَّllā yَlāَʿعَtَf ۚ āَmُhāَtāʾ āَmyِf َءāَkَrُhs ُhَl āَlَʿعَjg āًḥِlāَṣ āَmُhāَtāʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: The ungrateful man and woman or the polytheistic man and woman.

ayas.translation: ِnwُrِẓnُt āَlَf ِnwُdyِk َّmُht ْmُkَءāَkَrُhs āwُʿعْdā ِlُq ۗ āَhِb َnwُʿعَmْsَy ٌnāَhdāʾ ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ ۖ āَhِb َnwُrِṣْbُy ٌnُyْʿعَaʾ ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ ۖ āَhِb َnwُhsِṭْbَy ٍdْyَaʾ ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ ۖ āَhِb َnwُhsْmَy ٌlُjgْrَaʾ ْmُhَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: From the dispositions of men or from their wealth. In other words, be easy in dealing with them and avoid causing them difficulty.
Those among mankind who listen to the devils and obey their orders.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ٌhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ُrِyʾāَṣَb āَhdٰـَh ۚ yِّbَّr nِm َّyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥwُy āَm ُʿعِbَّtَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۚ āَhَtْyَbَtْjgā āَlْwَl āwُlāَq ٍhَyāʾِb mِhِtْaʾَt ْmَl āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Referring to a dispute which occurred among the Muslims over distribution of war booty.
i.e., either the caravan of Quraysh or their army.

ayas.translation: ٍnāَnَb َّlُk ْmُhْnِm āwُbِrْḍāَw ِqāَnْʿعَaʾْlā َqْwَf āwُbِrْḍāَf َbْʿعُّrlā āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِbwُlُq yِf yِqْlُaʾَs ۚ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āwُtِّbَhtَf ْmُkَʿعَm yِّnَaʾ ِhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā yَlِiʾ َkُّbَr yِḥwُy ْhdِiʾ

footnotes.text: By which they grasp and manipulate their weapons. Also interpreted as "all extremities," i.e., their hands and feet.

ayas.translation: َrāَbْdَaʾْlā ُmُhwُّlَwُt āَlَf āًfْḥَz āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmُtyِqَl āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., Your strength was insufficient to overcome them, but Allāh supported you and gave you victory.
When the Prophet (ﷺ) threw a handful of dust into the faces of the disbelievers, Allāh caused it to fill the eyes and nose of every soldier, preventing their advance.
So that they would appreciate Allāh's favor to them.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َʿعَm َhَّllā َّnَaʾَw ْtَrُhtَk ْwَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ْmُkُtَyʾِf ْmُknَʿع َyِnْغُt nَlَw ْdُʿعَn āwُdwُʿعَt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُhَf āwُhَtnَt nِiʾَw ۖ ُḥْtَfْlā ُmُkَءāَjg ْdَqَf āwُḥِtْfَtْsَt nِiʾ
َnwُʿعَmْsَt ْmُtnَaʾَw ُhْnَʿع āْwَّlَwَt āَlَw ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُrَhsْḥُt ِhْyَlِiʾ ُhَّnَaʾَw ِhِbْlَqَw ِءْrَmْlā َnْyَb ُlwُḥَy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۖ ْmُkyِyْḥُy āَmِl ْmُkāَʿعَd āَhdِiʾ ِlwُsَّrlِlَw ِhَّlِl āwُbyِjgَtْsā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., an affliction or punishment during life upon this earth. When corruption spreads among a people, its consequences will affect everyone.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnَaʾَw ْmُkِtāَnāَmَaʾ āwُnwُhkَtَw َlwُsَّrlāَw َhَّllā āwُnwُhkَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
ِmyِẓَʿعْlā ِlْḍَfْlā wُhd ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَl ْrِfْغَyَw ْmُkِtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُknَʿع ْrِّfَkُyَw āًnāَqْrُf ْmُkَّl lَʿعْjgَy َhَّllā āwُqَّtَt nِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: By which to judge between truth and falsehood. Also interpreted as a "way out" of difficulties.

ayas.translation: َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُryِṭāَsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ۙ āَhdٰـَh َlْhtِm āَnْlُqَl ُءāَhsَn ْwَl āَnْʿعِmَs ْdَq āwُlāَq āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw َnwُqَّtُmْlā āَّlِiʾ ُhُwʾāَyِlْwَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۚ ُhَءāَyِlْwَaʾ āwُnāَk āَmَw ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā ِnَʿع َnwُّdُṣَy ْmُhَw ُhَّllā ُmُhَbِّhdَʿعُy āَّlَaʾ ْmُhَl āَmَw
َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُtَّnُs ْtَḍَm ْdَqَf āwُdwُʿعَy nِiʾَw َfَlَs ْdَq āَّm mُhَl ْrَfْغُy āwُhَtnَy nِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlِّl lُq

footnotes.text: This is a warning that punishment is always the result of rebellion against Allāh and His messengers.
Persecution. See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="191">2:191</reference>.
i.e., until polytheism is no longer dominant.

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِnāَʿعْmَjgْlā yَqَtْlā َmْwَy ِnāَqْrُfْlā َmْwَy āَnِdْbَʿع ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllāِb mُtnَmāʾ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِlyِbَّslā ِnْbāَw ِnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَmāَtَyْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِhdِlَw ِlwُsَّrlِlَw ُhَsُmُhk ِhَّlِl َّnَaʾَf ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُtْmِnَغ āَmَّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw

footnotes.text: To be spent in Allāh's cause.
The tribes of Banū Hāshim and Banū Muṭṭalib, who were not eligible for zakāh.
The remaining four fifths are divided among the soldiers.
Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعyِmَsَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾَw ۗ ٍhَnِّyَb nَʿع َّyَḥ ْnَm ٰyَyْḥَyَw ٍhَnِّyَb nَʿع َkَlَh ْnَm َkِlْhَyِّl āًlwُʿعْfَm َnāَk āًrْmَaʾ ُhَّllā َyِḍْqَyِّl nِkٰـَlَw ۙ ِdāَʿعyِmْlā yِf ْmُtْfَlَtْhkāَl ْmُّtdَʿعāَwَt ْwَlَw ۚ ْmُknِm َlَfْsَaʾ ُbْkَّrlāَw ٰyَwْṣُqْlā ِhَwْdُʿعْlāِb mُhَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhَwْdُʿعْlāِb mُtnَaʾ ْhdِiʾ
ُrwُmُaʾْlā ُʿعَjgْrُt ِhَّllā yَlِiʾَw ۗ āًlwُʿعْfَm َnāَk āًrْmَaʾ ُhَّllā َyِḍْqَyِl ْmِhِnُyْʿعَaʾ yِf ْmُkُlِّlَqُyَw āًlyِlَq ْmُkِnُyْʿعَaʾ yِf ْmُtْyَqَtْlā ِhdِiʾ ْmُhwُmُkyِrُy ْhdِiʾَw
َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَّl āًryِhtَk َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdāَw āwُtُbْhtāَf ًhَyʾِf ْmُtyِqَl āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
ٌṭyِḥُm َnwُlَmْʿعَy āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّdُṣَyَw ِsāَّnlā َءāَyʾِrَw āًrَṭَb mِhِrāَyِd nِm āwُjgَrَhk َnyِhdَّlāَk āwُnwُkَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: In knowledge. See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ِbāَqِʿعْlā ُdyِdَhs ُhَّllāَw ۚ َhَّllā ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾ َnْwَrَt āَl āَm ٰyَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ْmُknِّm ٌءyِrَb yِّnِiʾ َlāَqَw ِhْyَbِqَʿع ٰyَlَʿع َṣَkَn ِnāَtَyʾِfْlā ِtَءāَrَt āَّmَlَf ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌrāَjg yِّnِiʾَw ِsāَّnlā َnِm َmْwَyْlā ُmُkَl َbِlāَغ āَl َlāَqَw ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُhَl َnَّyَz ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: This sentence is left incomplete for additional effect. Its conclusion is left to the imagination of the reader or listener and estimated as "...you would see a dreadful sight."
i.e., kill them and make an example of them to discourage those who follow them.
When you see signs of treachery from those with whom you have made a treaty, announce to them its dissolution so they will know exactly where they stand.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْẓُt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ْmُkْyَlِiʾ َّfَwُy ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ٍءْyَhs nِm āwُqِfnُt āَmَw ۚ ْmُhُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllā ُmُhَnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmِhِnwُd nِm َnyِrَhkāʾَw ْmُkَّwُdَʿعَw ِhَّllā َّwُdَʿع ِhِb َnwُbِhْrُt ِlْyَhkْlā ِṭāَbِّr nِmَw ٍhَّwُq nِّm mُtْʿعَṭَtْsā āَّm mُhَl āwُّdِʿعَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Or equipment which serves the same purpose.

ayas.translation: َnwُhَqْfَy āَّl ٌmْwَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َnِّm āًfْlَaʾ āwُbِlْغَy ٌhَyʾāِّm mُknِّm nُkَy nِiʾَw ۚ ِnْyَtَyʾāِm āwُbِlْغَy َnwُrِbāَṣ َnwُrْhsِʿع ْmُknِّm nُkَy nِiʾ ۚ ِlāَtِqْlā yَlَʿع َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِḍِّrَḥ ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِrِbāَّṣlā َʿعَm ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb ِnْyَfْlَaʾ āwُbِlْغَy ٌfْlَaʾ ْmُknِّm nُkَy nِiʾَw ۚ ِnْyَtَyʾāِm āwُbِlْغَy ٌhَrِbāَṣ ٌhَyʾāِّm mُknِّm nُkَy nِiʾَf ۚ āًfْʿعَḍ ْmُkyِf َّnَaʾ َmِlَʿعَw ْmُknَʿع ُhَّllā َfَّfَhk َnāʾْlā

footnotes.text: i.e., material benefit, such as the ransom paid for prisoners.

Three interpretations of the "decree" are given: that by which the companions of Badr were forgiven, that by which indeliberate errors in judgement by believers are not punished, and that which made lawful the spoils of war.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَl ْrِfْغَyَw ْmُknِm َhdِhkُaʾ āَّmِّm āًrْyَhk ْmُkِtْwʾُy āًrْyَhk ْmُkِbwُlُq yِf ُhَّllā ِmَlْʿعَy nِiʾ ٰyَrْsَaʾْlā َnِّm mُkyِdْyَaʾ yِf nَmِّl lُq ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ٌqāَhtyِّm mُhَnْyَbَw ْmُkَnْyَb ٍmْwَq ٰyَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ ُrْṣَّnlā ُmُkْyَlَʿعَf ِnyِّdlā yِf ْmُkwُrَṣnَtْsā ِnِiʾَw ۚ āwُrِjgāَhُy ٰyَّtَḥ ٍءْyَhs nِّm mِhِtَyāَlَw nِّm mُkَl āَm āwُrِjgāَhُy ْmَlَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb ُءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ āwُrَṣَnَّw āwَwāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmِhِsُfnَaʾَw ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾِb āwُdَhāَjgَw āwُrَjgāَhَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
ٌmyِrَk ٌqْzِrَw ٌhَrِfْغَّm mُhَّl ۚ āًّqَḥ َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ āwُrَṣَnَّw āwَwāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُdَhāَjgَw āwُrَjgāَhَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw

ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhَّllā ِbāَtِk yِf ٍḍْʿعَbِb ٰyَlْwَaʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb ِmāَḥْrَaʾْlā wُlwُaʾَw ۚ ْmُknِm َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ْmُkَʿعَm āwُdَhāَjgَw āwُrَjgāَhَw ُdْʿعَb nِm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: This applies to Muslim relatives only. Others may be given by bequest. See <reference chapter="4" verses="11">4:11</reference>.
But who had violated it.

ayas.translation: ٍmyِlَaʾ ٍbāَhdَʿعِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِrِّhsَbَw ۗ ِhَّllā yِzِjgْʿعُm ُrْyَغ ْmُkَّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَf ْmُtْyَّlَwَt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُhَf ْmُtْbُt nِiʾَf ۚ ُhُlwُsَrَw ۙ َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِّm ٌءyِrَb َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ِrَbْkَaʾْlā ِّjgَḥْlā َmْwَy ِsāَّnlā yَlِiʾ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٌnāَhdَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Ḥajj. ʿUmrah is the lesser pilgrimage.
i.e., you cannot escape His punishment.

ayas.translation: َnyِqَّtُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmِhِtَّdُm ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhَdْhَʿع ْmِhْyَlِiʾ āwُّmِtَaʾَf āًdَḥَaʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع āwُrِhāَẓُy ْmَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ْmُkwُṣُqnَy ْmَl َّmُht َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِّm mُّtdَhāَʿع َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ

ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhَlyِbَs āwُّlَhkَf َhāَkَّzlā āُwَtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmāَqَaʾَw āwُbāَt nِiʾَf ۚ ٍdَṣْrَm َّlُk ْmُhَl āwُdُʿعْqāَw ْmُhwُrُṣْḥāَw ْmُhwُhdُhkَw ْmُhwُmُّtdَjgَw ُhtْyَḥ َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā āwُlُtْqāَf ُmُrُḥْlā ُrُhْhsَaʾْlā َhkَlَsnā āَhdِiʾَf

footnotes.text: The four months mentioned in <reference chapter="9" verses="2">verse 2</reference>, in which the disbelievers were allowed free movement within the land. Other scholars have interpreted them as "the sacred months," i.e., Muḥarram, Rajab, Dhul-Qaʿdah and Dhul-Ḥijjah.
i.e., maintain the terms of the treaty.

ayas.translation: َnwُqِsāَf ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾَw ْmُhُbwُlُq ٰyَbْaʾَtَw ْmِhِhāَwْfَaʾِb mُkَnwُḍْrُy ۚ ًhَّmِhd āَlَw āًّlِiʾ ْmُkyِf āwُbُqْrَy āَl ْmُkْyَlَʿع āwُrَhْẓَy nِiʾَw َfْyَk
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm َءāَs ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِhِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّdَṣَf āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb āْwَrَtْhsā
َnwُhَtnَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ْmُhَl َnāَmْyَaʾ āَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۙ ِrْfُkْlā َhَّmِyʾَaʾ āwُlِtāَqَf ْmُkِnyِd yِf āwُnَʿعَṭَw ْmِhِdْhَʿع ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُhَnāَmْyَaʾ āwُhtَkَّn nِiʾَw

َnyِnِmْwʾُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ ُhْwَhsْhkَt nَaʾ ُّqَḥَaʾ ُhَّllāَf ۚ ْmُhَnْwَhsْhkَtَaʾ ۚ ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ْmُkwُءَdَb mُhَw ِlwُsَّrlā ِjgāَrْhkِiʾِb āwُّmَhَw ْmُhَnāَmْyَaʾ āwُhtَkَّn āًmْwَq َnwُlِtāَqُt āَlَaʾ

َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ٌryِbَhk ُhَّllāَw ۚ ًhَjgyِlَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā āَlَw ِhِlwُsَr āَlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm āwُhdِhkَّtَy ْmَlَw ْmُknِm āwُdَhāَjg َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā ِmَlْʿعَy āَّmَlَw āwُkَrْtُt nَaʾ ْmُtْbِsَḥ ْmَaʾ

َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ْmُknِّm mُhَّlَwَtَy nَmَw ۚ ِnāَmyِiʾْlā yَlَʿع َrْfُkْlā āwُّbَḥَtْsā ِnِiʾ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْmُkَnāَwْhkِiʾَw ْmُkَءāَbāʾ āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِqِsāَfْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhِrْmَaʾِb ُhَّllā َyِtْaʾَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُṣَّbَrَtَf ِhِlyِbَs yِf ٍdāَhِjgَw ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā َnِّm mُkْyَlِiʾ َّbَḥَaʾ āَhَnْwَḍْrَt ُnِkāَsَmَw āَhَdāَsَk َnْwَhsْhkَt ٌhَrāَjgِtَw āَhwُmُtْfَrَtْqā ٌlāَwْmَaʾَw ْmُkُtَryِhsَʿعَw ْmُkُjgāَwْzَaʾَw ْmُkُnāَwْhkِiʾَw ْmُkُwʾāَnْbَaʾَw ْmُkُwʾāَbāʾ َnāَk nِiʾ ْlُq

ٌmyِkَḥ ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َءāَhs nِiʾ ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā ُmُkyِnْغُy َfْwَsَf ًhَlْyَʿع ْmُtْfِhk ْnِiʾَw ۚ āَhdٰـَh ْmِhِmāَʿع َdْʿعَb َmāَrَḥْlā َdِjgْsَmْlā āwُbَrْqَy āَlَf ٌsَjgَn َnwُkِrْhsُmْlā āَmَّnِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُrِغāَṣ ْmُhَw ٍdَy nَʿع َhَyْzِjgْlā āwُṭْʿعُy ٰyَّtَḥ َbāَtِkْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِm ِّqَḥْlā َnyِd َnwُnyِdَy āَlَw ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ āَm َnwُmِّrَḥُy āَlَw ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāِb āَlَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlā āwُlِtāَq

footnotes.text: A tax required of non-Muslims exempting them from military service and entitling them to the protection of the Islāmic state. Concurrently, zakāh is not taken from them, being an obligation only upon Muslims.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy āَّmَʿع ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۚ َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَّl ۖ āًdِḥāَw āًhٰـَlِiʾ āwُdُbْʿعَyِl āَّlِiʾ āwُrِmُaʾ āَmَw َmَyْrَm َnْbā َḥyِsَmْlāَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm āًbāَbْrَaʾ ْmُhَnāَbْhُrَw ْmُhَrāَbْḥَaʾ āwُhdَhkَّtā

footnotes.text: By their obedience to them rather than to what Allāh ordained.
By their worship of him in conjunction with Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍmyِlَaʾ ٍbāَhdَʿعِb mُhْrِّhsَbَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āَhَnwُqِfnُy āَlَw َhَّḍِfْlāَw َbَhَّhdlā َnwُzِnْkَy َnyِhdَّlāَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّdُṣَyَw ِlِṭāَbْlāِb ِsāَّnlā َlāَwْmَaʾ َnwُlُkْaʾَyَl ِnāَbْhُّrlāَw ِrāَbْḥَaʾْlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., through false pretense.

ayas.translation: َnwُzِnْkَt ْmُtnُk āَm āwُqwُhdَf ْmُkِsُfnَaʾِl ْmُtْzَnَk āَm āَhdٰـَh ۖ ْmُhُrwُhُẓَw ْmُhُbwُnُjgَw ْmُhُhāَbِjg āَhِb ٰyَwْkُtَf َmَّnَhَjg ِrāَn yِf āَhْyَlَʿع ٰyَmْḥُy َmْwَy

footnotes.text: The gold and silver which was hoarded, i.e., whose zakāh was not paid.

ayas.translation: َnyِqَّtُmْlā َʿعَm َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۚ ًhَّfāَk ْmُkَnwُlِtāَqُy āَmَk ًhَّfāَk َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā āwُlِtāَqَw ۚ ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ َّnِhyِf āwُmِlْẓَt āَlَf ۚ ُmِّyَqْlā ُnyِّdlā َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٌmُrُḥ ٌhَʿعَbْrَaʾ āَhْnِm َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk َmْwَy ِhَّllā ِbāَtِk yِf āًrْhَhs َrَhsَʿع āَnْhtā ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ِrwُhُّhslā َhَّdِʿع َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="9" verses="5">9:5</reference>.
i.e., do not violate the sacred months or commit aggression therein.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmِhِlāَmْʿعَaʾ ُءwُs ْmُhَl َnِّyُz ۚ ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ āَm āwُّlِḥُyَf ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ āَm َhَّdِʿع āwُyʾِṭāَwُyِّl āًmāَʿع ُhَnwُmِّrَḥُyَw āًmāَʿع ُhَnwُّlِḥُy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِhِb ُّlَḍُy ۖ ِrْfُkْlā yِf ٌhَdāَyِz ُءyِsَّnlā āَmَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Fighting during a sacred month.
If they found it advantageous to violate a sacred month, they would do so, designating another month in its place in which to observe the restrictions concerning fighting.

ayas.translation: ٌlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā ُʿعāَtَm āَmَf ۚ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā َnِm āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlāِb mُtyِḍَrَaʾ ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُtْlَqāَّhtā ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُrِfnā ُmُkَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾ ْmُkَl āَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., inclining toward the comforts of worldly life.

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ āًyʾْyَhs ُhwُّrُḍَt āَlَw ْmُkَrْyَغ āًmْwَq ْlِdْbَtْsَyَw āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْbِّhdَʿعُy āwُrِfnَt āَّlِiʾ

ٌmyِkَḥ ٌzyِzَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ āَyْlُʿعْlā َyِh ِhَّllā ُhَmِlَkَw ۗ ٰyَlْfُّslā āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َhَmِlَk َlَʿعَjgَw āَhْwَrَt ْmَّl ٍdwُnُjgِb ُhَdَّyَaʾَw ِhْyَlَʿع ُhَtَnyِkَs ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾَf ۖ āَnَʿعَm َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ْnَzْḥَt āَl ِhِbِḥāَṣِl ُlwُqَy ْhdِiʾ ِrāَغْlā yِf āَmُh ْhdِiʾ ِnْyَnْhtā َyِnāَht āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُhَjgَrْhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾ ُhَّllā ُhَrَṣَn ْdَqَf ُhwُrُṣnَt āَّlِiʾ

footnotes.text: The second was his companion, Abū Bakr.
i.e., their claims and slogans.
i.e., degraded and dishonored.
"Lā ilāha ill-Allāh" ("There is no deity except Allāh").

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmُkِsُfnَaʾَw ْmُkِlāَwْmَaʾِb āwُdِhāَjgَw āًlāَqِhtَw āًfāَfِhk āwُrِfnā

footnotes.text: i.e., young or old, riding or walking, in ease or in hardship - in all circumstances and conditions.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِhdāَkَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ َnwُkِlْhُy ْmُkَʿعَm āَnْjgَrَhkَl āَnْʿعَṭَtْsā ِwَl ِhَّllāِb َnwُfِlْḥَyَsَw ۚ ُhَّqُّhslā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَdُʿعَb nِkٰـَlَw َkwُʿعَbَّtāَّl āًdِṣāَq āًrَfَsَw āًbyِrَq āًḍَrَʿع َnāَk ْwَl

footnotes.text: When you return from the Tabūk expedition.
i.e., the women and children.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlāِb ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُhَl َnwُʿعāَّmَs ْmُkyِfَw َhَnْtِfْlā ُmُkَnwُغْbَy ْmُkَlāَlِhk āwُʿعَḍْwَaʾَlَw āًlāَbَhk āَّlِiʾ ْmُkwُdāَz āَّm mُkyِf āwُjgَrَhk ْwَl

footnotes.text: Or "turned matters related to you over [in their minds, considering how to cause you failure]."

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlāِb ٌhَṭyِḥُmَl َmَّnَhَjg َّnِiʾَw ۗ āwُṭَqَs ِhَnْtِfْlā yِf āَlَaʾ ۚ yِّnِtْfَt āَlَw yِّl nَhdْyʾā ُlwُqَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw

footnotes.text: By avoiding their obligation, they fell into destruction.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِrَf ْmُhَّw āwَّlَwَtَyَw ُlْbَq nِm āَnَrْmَaʾ āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْdَq āwُlwُqَy ٌhَbyِṣُm َkْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُhْwʾُsَt ٌhَnَsَḥ َkْbِṣُt nِiʾ

footnotes.text: The hypocrites claim to have protected themselves by remaining behind.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۚ āَnāَlْwَm َwُh āَnَl ُhَّllā َbَtَk āَm āَّlِiʾ āَnَbyِṣُy nَّl lُq

َnwُṣِّbَrَtُّm mُkَʿعَm āَّnِiʾ āwُṣَّbَrَtَf ۖ āَnyِdْyَaʾِb ْwَaʾ ِhِdnِʿع ْnِّm ٍbāَhdَʿعِb ُhَّllā ُmُkَbyِṣُy nَaʾ ْmُkِb ُṣَّbَrَtَn ُnْḥَnَw ۖ ِnْyَyَnْsُḥْlā yَdْḥِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āَnِb َnwُṣَّbَrَt ْlَh ْlُq

َnwُhِrāَk ْmُhَw āَّlِiʾ َnwُqِfnُy āَlَw ٰyَlāَsُk ْmُhَw āَّlِiʾ َhāَlَّṣlā َnwُtْaʾَy āَlَw ِhِlwُsَrِbَw ِhَّllāِb āwُrَfَk ْmُhَّnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُtāَqَfَn ْmُhْnِm َlَbْqُt nَaʾ ْmُhَʿعَnَm āَmَw
َnwُrِfāَk ْmُhَw ْmُhُsُfnَaʾ َqَhْzَtَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf āَhِb mُhَbِّhdَʿعُyِl ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhُdāَlْwَaʾ āَlَw ْmُhُlāَwْmَaʾ َkْbِjgْʿعُt āَlَf
َnwُṭَhkْsَy ْmُh āَhdِiʾ āَhْnِm āْwَṭْʿعُy ْmَّl nِiʾَw āwُḍَr āَhْnِm āwُṭْʿعُaʾ ْnِiʾَf ِtāَqَdَّṣlā yِf َkُzِmْlَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw
َnwُbِغāَr ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āَّnِiʾ ُhُlwُsَrَw ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā āَnyِtْwʾُyَs ُhَّllā āَnُbْsَḥ āwُlāَqَw ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā ُmُhāَtāʾ āَm āwُḍَr ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Meaning "We desire Allāh and His grace and acceptance," or "We desire whatever Allāh wills to give us of His bounty."
By the state to collect, guard and distribute the zakāh.
i.e., one who believes everything he hears.
Literally, "to satisfy Him," meaning that Allāh would be satisfied by obedience to the Messenger (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُrَhdْḥَt āَّm ٌjgِrْhkُm َhَّllā َّnِiʾ āwُyʾِzْhَtْsā ِlُq ۚ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf āَmِb mُhُyʾِّbَnُt ٌhَrwُs ْmِhْyَlَʿع َlَّzَnُt nَaʾ َnwُqِfāَnُmْlā ُrَhdْḥَy

footnotes.text: i.e., exposing the truth about.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِrْjgُm āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb ًhَfِyʾāَṭ ْbِّhdَʿعُn ْmُknِّm ٍhَfِyʾāَṭ nَʿع ُfْʿعَّn nِiʾ ۚ ْmُkِnāَmyِiʾ َdْʿعَb mُtْrَfَk ْdَq āwُrِhdَtْʿعَt āَl

footnotes.text: i.e., refuse to spend in the way of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِsāَhkْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf ْmُhُlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْtَṭِbَḥ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āwُḍāَhk yِhdَّlāَk ْmُtْḍُhkَw ْmِhِqāَlَhkِb mُkِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َʿعَtْmَtْsā āَmَk ْmُkِqāَlَhkِb mُtْʿعَtْmَtْsāَf ْmِhِqāَlَhkِb āwُʿعَtْmَtْsāَf āًdāَlْwَaʾَw āًlāَwْmَaʾ َrَhtْkَaʾَw ًhَّwُq ْmُknِm َّdَhsَaʾ āwُnāَk ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlāَk

footnotes.text: i.e., those to which Lot was sent and which earned for themselves Allāh's punishment. See <reference chapter="11" verses="82-83">11:82-83</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhَl āَmَw ۚ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ُhَّllā ُmُhْbِّhdَʿعُy āْwَّlَwَtَy nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُhَّl āًrْyَhk ُkَy āwُbwُtَy nِiʾَf ۚ ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā ُmُhāَnْغَaʾ ْnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āwُmَqَn āَmَw ۚ āwُlāَnَy ْmَl āَmِb āwُّmَhَw ْmِhِmāَlْsِiʾ َdْʿعَb āwُrَfَkَw ِrْfُkْlā َhَmِlَk āwُlāَq ْdَqَlَw āwُlāَq āَm ِhَّllāِb َnwُfِlْḥَy

footnotes.text: i.e., the murder of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).
i.e., for no reason. On the contrary, they should have been grateful.

ayas.translation: َnwُḍِrْʿعُّm mُhَّw āwَّlَwَtَw ِhِb āwُlِhkَb ِhِlْḍَf nِّm mُhāَtāʾ āَّmَlَf
َnwُbِhdْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِbَw ُhwُdَʿعَw āَm َhَّllā āwُfَlْhkَaʾ āَmِb ُhَnْwَqْlَy ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf āًqāَfِn ْmُhَbَqْʿعَaʾَf

َnyِqِsāَfْlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُrَfَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ْmُhَl ُhَّllā َrِfْغَy nَlَf ًhَّrَm َnyِʿعْbَs ْmُhَl ْrِfْغَtْsَt nِiʾ ْmُhَl ْrِfْغَtْsَt āَl ْwَaʾ ْmُhَl ْrِfْغَtْsā

َnwُhَqْfَy āwُnāَk ْwَّl ۚ āًّrَḥ ُّdَhsَaʾ َmَّnَhَjg ُrāَn ْlُq ۗ ِّrَḥْlā yِf āwُrِfnَt āَl āwُlāَqَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ْmِhِsُfnَaʾَw ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾِb āwُdِhāَjgُy nَaʾ āwُhِrَkَw ِhَّllā ِlwُsَr َfāَlِhk ْmِhِdَʿعْqَmِb َnwُfَّlَhkُmْlā َḥِrَf

footnotes.text: Literally, "were left behind [as Allāh willed]" due to their false excuses having been accepted by the Prophet (ﷺ). While pleased with their assumed deception, in reality, Allāh had prevented their participation knowing of their hypocrisy and evil intent.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِsْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ًءāَzَjg āًryِhtَk āwُkْbَyْlَw āًlyِlَq āwُkَḥْḍَyْlَf

َnyِfِlāَhkْlā َʿعَm āwُdُʿعْqāَf ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ِdwُʿعُqْlāِb mُtyِḍَr ْmُkَّnِiʾ ۖ āًّwُdَʿع َyِʿعَm āwُlِtāَqُt nَlَw āًdَbَaʾ َyِʿعَm āwُjgُrْhkَt nَّl lُqَf ِjgwُrُhkْlِl َkwُnَhdْaʾَtْsāَf ْmُhْnِّm ٍhَfِyʾāَṭ ٰyَlِiʾ ُhَّllā َkَʿعَjgَّr nِiʾَf
َnwُqِsāَf ْmُhَw āwُtāَmَw ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُrَfَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhِrْbَq ٰyَlَʿع ْmُqَt āَlَw āًdَbَaʾ َtāَّm mُhْnِّm ٍdَḥَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ِّlَṣُt āَlَw
َnwُrِfāَk ْmُhَw ْmُhُsُfnَaʾ َqَhْzَtَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf āَhِb mُhَbِّhdَʿعُy nَaʾ ُhَّllā ُdyِrُy āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhُdāَlْwَaʾَw ْmُhُlāَwْmَaʾ َkْbِjgْʿعُt āَlَw
َnyِdِʿعāَqْlā َʿعَّm nُkَn āَnْrَhd āwُlāَqَw ْmُhْnِm ِlْwَّṭlā wُlwُaʾ َkَnَhdْaʾَtْsā ِhِlwُsَr َʿعَm āwُdِhāَjgَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnِmāʾ ْnَaʾ ٌhَrwُs ْtَlِznُaʾ āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., claimed faith.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۚ ٍlyِbَs nِm َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā yَlَʿع āَm ۚ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّlِl āwُḥَṣَn āَhdِiʾ ٌjgَrَḥ َnwُqِfnُy āَm َnwُdِjgَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ٰyَḍْrَmْlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ِءāَfَʿعُّḍlā yَlَʿع َsْyَّl

َnwُqِfnُy āَm āwُdِjgَy āَّlَaʾ āًnَzَḥ ِʿعْmَّdlā َnِm ُḍyِfَt ْmُhُnُyْʿعَaʾَّw āwَّlَwَt ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkُlِmْḥَaʾ āَm ُdِjgَaʾ āَl َtْlُq ْmُhَlِmْḥَtِl َkْwَtَaʾ āَm āَhdِiʾ َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āَlَw

footnotes.text: No mounts or even shoes were available.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَf ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َʿعَbَṭَw ِfِlāَwَhkْlā َʿعَm āwُnwُkَy nَaʾِb āwُḍَr ۚ ُءāَyِnْغَaʾ ْmُhَw َkَnwُnِhdْaʾَtْsَy َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿع ُlyِbَّslā āَmَّnِiʾ

َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُyَf ِhَdāَhَّhslāَw ِbْyَغْlā ِmِlāَʿع ٰyَlِiʾ َnwُّdَrُt َّmُht ُhُlwُsَrَw ْmُkَlَmَʿع ُhَّllā yَrَyَsَw ۚ ْmُkِrāَbْhkَaʾ ْnِm ُhَّllā āَnَaʾَّbَn ْdَq ْmُkَl َnِmْwʾُّn nَl āwُrِhdَtْʿعَt āَّl lُq ۚ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُtْʿعَjgَr āَhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlِiʾ َnwُrِhdَtْʿعَy

footnotes.text: See footnotes to <reference chapter="6" verses="73">6:73</reference>.
i.e., a fine or penalty.

ayas.translation: ُmyِẓَʿعْlā ُzْwَfْlā َkِlَٰhd ۚ āًdَbَaʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhَtْḥَt yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ْmُhَl َّdَʿعَaʾَw ُhْnَʿع āwُḍَrَw ْmُhْnَʿع ُhَّllā َyِḍَّr ٍnāَsْḥِiʾِb mُhwُʿعَbَّtā َnyِhdَّlāَw ِrāَṣnَaʾْlāَw َnyِrِjgāَhُmْlā َnِm َnwُlَّwَaʾْlā َnwُqِbāَّslāَw

footnotes.text: Those who emigrated from Makkah and settled in Madīnah for the cause of Islām.
The inhabitants of Madīnah who had accepted Islām and assisted the Prophet (ﷺ) and other emigrants upon their arrival there.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َbwُtَy nَaʾ ُhَّllā yَsَʿع āًyʾِّyَs َrَhkāʾَw āًḥِlāَṣ āًlَmَʿع āwُṭَlَhk ْmِhِbwُnُhdِb āwُfَrَtْʿعā َnwُrَhkāʾَw

footnotes.text: This refers to their having previously taken part in jihād but having abstained on the occasion of Tabūk.
Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="2" verses="37">2:37</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِhdāَkَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ ُdَhْhsَy ُhَّllāَw ۖ ٰyَnْsُḥْlā āَّlِiʾ āَnْdَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ َّnُfِlْḥَyَlَw ۚ ُlْbَq nِm ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā َbَrāَḥ ْnَmِّl āًdāَṣْrِiʾَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnْyَb āًqyِrْfَtَw āًrْfُkَw āًrāَrِḍ āًdِjgْsَm āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlāَw

َnyِrِّhَّṭُmْlā ُّbِḥُy ُhَّllāَw ۚ āwُrَّhَṭَtَy nَaʾ َnwُّbِḥُy ٌlāَjgِr ِhyِf ۚ ِhyِf َmwُqَt nَaʾ ُّqَḥَaʾ ٍmْwَy ِlَّwَaʾ ْnِm ٰyَwْqَّtlā yَlَʿع َsِّsُaʾ ٌdِjgْsَmَّl ۚ āًdَbَaʾ ِhyِf ْmُqَt āَl

footnotes.text: This description is of the Qubā’ mosque.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِkَḥ ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُhُbwُlُq َʿعَّṭَqَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf ًhَbyِr āْwَnَb yِhdَّlā ُmُhُnāَyْnُb ُlāَzَy āَl

ُmyِẓَʿعْlā ُzْwَfْlā َwُh َkِlَٰhdَw ۚ ِhِb mُtْʿعَyāَb yِhdَّlā ُmُkِʿعْyَbِb āwُrِhsْbَtْsāَf ۚ ِhَّllā َnِm ِhِdْhَʿعِb ٰyَfْwَaʾ ْnَmَw ۚ ِnāʾْrُqْlāَw ِlyِjgnِiʾْlāَw ِhāَrْwَّtlā yِf āًّqَḥ ِhْyَlَʿع āًdْʿعَw ۖ َnwُlَtْqُyَw َnwُlُtْqَyَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnwُlِtāَqُy ۚ َhَّnَjgْlā ُmُhَl َّnَaʾِb mُhَlāَwْmَaʾَw ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm ٰyَrَtْhsā َhَّllā َّnِiʾ
ِmyِḥَjgْlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ ْmُhَّnَaʾ ْmُhَl َnَّyَbَt āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm ٰyَbْrُq yِlwُaʾ āwُnāَk ْwَlَw َnyِkِrْhsُmْlِl āwُrِfْغَtْsَy nَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ِّyِbَّnlِl َnāَk āَm
ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ۚ ُtyِmُyَw yِyْḥُy ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُkْlُm ُhَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

ُmyِḥَّrlā ُbāَّwَّtlā َwُh َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُbwُtَyِl ْmِhْyَlَʿع َbāَt َّmُht ِhْyَlِiʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā َnِm َaʾَjgْlَm āَّl nَaʾ āwُّnَẓَw ْmُhُsُfnَaʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَqāَḍَw ْtَbُḥَr āَmِb ُḍْrَaʾْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ْtَqāَḍ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ āwُfِّlُhk َnyِhdَّlā ِhَhtāَlَّhtlā yَlَʿعَw

footnotes.text: Thus it seemed to them in their extreme distress.
Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="2" verses="37">2:37</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َrْjgَaʾ ُʿعyِḍُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ٌḥِlāَṣ ٌlَmَʿع ِhِb mُhَl َbِtُk āَّlِiʾ āًlْyَّn ٍّwُdَʿع ْnِm َnwُlāَnَy āَlَw َrāَّfُkْlā ُẓyِغَy āًyʾِṭْwَm َnwُyʾَṭَy āَlَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf ٌhَṣَmْhkَm āَlَw ٌbَṣَn āَlَw ٌaʾَmَẓ ْmُhُbyِṣُy āَl ْmُhَّnَaʾِb َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِb āwُbَغْrَy āَlَw ِhَّllā ِlwُsَّr nَʿع āwُfَّlَhkَtَy nَaʾ ِbāَrْʿعَaʾْlā َnِّm mُhَlْwَḥ ْnَmَw ِhَnyِdَmْlā ِlْhَaʾِl َnāَk āَm

footnotes.text: In times of hardship. Rather, they should have been willing to endure with the Prophet (ﷺ) whatever was necessary for Islām.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm َnَsْḥَaʾ ُhَّllā ُmُhَyِzْjgَyِl ْmُhَl َbِtُk āَّlِiʾ āًyِdāَw َnwُʿعَṭْqَy āَlَw ًhَryِbَk āَlَw ًhَryِغَṣ ًhَqَfَn َnwُqِfnُy āَlَw

َnwُrَhdْḥَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ْmِhْyَlِiʾ āwُʿعَjgَr āَhdِiʾ ْmُhَmْwَq āwُrِhdnُyِlَw ِnyِّdlā yِf āwُhَّqَfَtَyِّl ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ ْmُhْnِّm ٍhَqْrِf ِّlُk nِm َrَfَn āَlْwَlَf ۚ ًhَّfāَk āwُrِfnَyِl َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā َnāَk āَmَw
َnyِqَّtُmْlā َʿعَm َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَw ۚ ًhَẓْlِغ ْmُkyِf āwُdِjgَyْlَw ِrāَّfُkْlā َnِّm mُkَnwُlَy َnyِhdَّlā āwُlِtāَq āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُrِhsْbَtْsَy ْmُhَw āًnāَmyِiʾ ْmُhْtَdāَzَf āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَf ۚ āًnāَmyِiʾ ِhِhdٰـَh ُhْtَdāَz ْmُkُّyَaʾ ُlwُqَy nَّm mُhْnِmَf ٌhَrwُs ْtَlِznُaʾ āَm āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Literally, "filth," i.e., disbelief and hypocrisy.

ayas.translation: َnwُhَqْfَy āَّl ٌmْwَq ْmُhَّnَaʾِb mُhَbwُlُq ُhَّllā َfَrَṣ ۚ āwُfَrَṣnā َّmُht ٍdَḥَaʾ ْnِّm mُkāَrَy ْlَh ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb َrَẓَّn ٌhَrwُs ْtَlِznُaʾ āَm āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
The adjective "wise" expresses the qualities of will, purpose, discrimination and precision.
i.e., a sure position due to their righteous deeds.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ُhwُdُbْʿعāَf ْmُkُّbَr ُhَّllā ُmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhِnْhdِiʾ ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ ٍʿعyِfَhs nِm āَm ۖ َrْmَaʾْlā ُrِّbَdُy ۖ ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā ُmُkَّbَr َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: See footnotes to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference> and <reference chapter="7" verses="54">7:54</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُfْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿعَw ٍmyِmَḥ ْnِّm ٌbāَrَhs ْmُhَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ِṭْsِqْlāِb ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َyِzْjgَyِl ُhُdyِʿعُy َّmُht َqْlَhkْlā ُaʾَdْbَy ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āًّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw ۖ āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm ِhْyَlِiʾ
َnwُlِfāَغ āَnِtāَyāʾ ْnَʿع ْmُh َnyِhdَّlāَw āَhِb āwُّnَaʾَmْṭāَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlāِb āwُḍَrَw āَnَءāَqِl َnwُjgْrَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
ِmyِʿعَّnlā ِtāَّnَjg yِf ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā ُmِhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ۖ ْmِhِnāَmyِiʾِb mُhُّbَr ْmِhyِdْhَy ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: In anger or in heedlessness.
i.e., Allāh would have destroyed them on account of that.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm َnyِfِrْsُmْlِl َnِّyُz َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ُhَّsَّm ٍّrُḍ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnُʿعْdَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk َّrَm ُhَّrُḍ ُhْnَʿع āَnْfَhsَk āَّmَlَf āًmِyʾāَq ْwَaʾ āًdِʿعāَq ْwَaʾ ِhِbnَjgِl āَnāَʿعَd ُّrُّḍlā َnāَsnِiʾْlā َّsَm āَhdِiʾَw
َnyِmِrْjgُmْlā َmْwَqْlā yِzْjgَn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ āwُnِmْwʾُyِl āwُnāَk āَmَw ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjgَw ۙ āwُmَlَẓ āَّmَl ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َnwُrُqْlā āَnْkَlْhَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

ٍmyِẓَʿع ٍmْwَy َbāَhdَʿع yِّbَr ُtْyَṣَʿع ْnِiʾ ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ۖ َّyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥwُy āَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعِbَّtَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ yِsْfَn ِءāَqْlِt nِm ُhَlِّdَbُaʾ ْnَaʾ yِl ُnwُkَy āَm ْlُq ۚ ُhْlِّdَb ْwَaʾ āَhdٰـَh ِrْyَغ ٍnāʾْrُqِb ِtْyʾā āَnَءāَqِl َnwُjgْrَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ۙ ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ِhِlْbَq nِّm āًrُmُʿع ْmُkyِf ُtْhtِbَl ْdَqَf ۖ ِhِb mُkāَrْdَaʾ āَlَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhُtْwَlَt āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَّl lُq

footnotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) lived among his people forty years before receiving any revelation.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy āَّmَʿع ٰyَlāَʿعَtَw ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَlَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ُmَlْʿعَy āَl āَmِb َhَّllā َnwُyʾِّbَnُtَaʾ ْlُq ۚ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَnُwʾāَʿعَfُhs ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh َnwُlwُqَyَw ْmُhُʿعَfnَy āَlَw ْmُhُّrُḍَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَyَw
َnwُfِlَtْhkَy ِhyِf āَmyِf ْmُhَnْyَb َyِḍُqَl َkِّbَّr nِm ْtَqَbَs ٌhَmِlَk āَlْwَlَw ۚ āwُfَlَtْhkāَf ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَّmُaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُsāَّnlā َnāَk āَmَw

footnotes.text: Allāh's decree to allow time on earth for His creation or not to punish anyone before evidence has come to him.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِẓَtnُmْlā َnِّm mُkَʿعَm yِّnِiʾ āwُrِẓَtnāَf ِhَّlِl ُbْyَغْlā āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُqَf ۖ ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَyāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَlْwَl َnwُlwُqَyَw
َnwُrُkْmَt āَm َnwُbُtْkَy āَnَlُsُr َّnِiʾ ۚ āًrْkَm ُʿعَrْsَaʾ ُhَّllā ِlُq ۚ āَnِtāَyāʾ yِf ٌrْkَّm mُhَl āَhdِiʾ ْmُhْtَّsَm َءāَّrَḍ ِdْʿعَb nِّm ًhَmْḥَr َsāَّnlā āَnْqَhdَaʾ āَhdِiʾَw

َnyِrِkāَّhslā َnِm َّnَnwُkَnَl ِhِhdٰـَh ْnِm āَnَtْyَjgnَaʾ ْnِyʾَl َnyِّdlā ُhَl َnyِṣِlْhkُm َhَّllā āُwَʿعَd ۙ ْmِhِb َṭyِḥُaʾ ْmُhَّnَaʾ āwُّnَẓَw ٍnāَkَm ِّlُk nِm ُjgْwَmْlā ُmُhَءāَjgَw ٌfِṣāَʿع ٌḥyِr āَhْtَءāَjg āَhِb āwُḥِrَfَw ٍhَbِّyَṭ ٍḥyِrِb mِhِb َnْyَrَjgَw ِkْlُfْlā yِf ْmُtnُk āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِrْḥَbْlāَw ِّrَbْlā yِf ْmُkُrِّyَsُy yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: The change in pronoun from the second to third person shows that the following description applies specifically to the disbelievers.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُnَf ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm āَnْyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā َʿعāَtَّm ۖ mُkِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkُyْغَb āَmَّnِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ۗ ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnwُغْbَy ْmُh āَhdِiʾ ْmُhāَjgnَaʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: By oppression and disobedience or by invoking others besides Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُlِّṣَfُn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ِsْmَaʾْlāِb َnْغَt ْmَّl nَaʾَk āًdyِṣَḥ āَhāَnْlَʿعَjgَf āًrāَhَn ْwَaʾ āًlْyَl āَnُrْmَaʾ āَhāَtَaʾ āَhْyَlَʿع َnwُrِdāَq ْmُhَّnَaʾ āَhُlْhَaʾ َّnَẓَw ْtَnَّyَّzāَw āَhَfُrْhkُz ُḍْrَaʾْlā ِtَhdَhkَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ُmāَʿعْnَaʾْlāَw ُsāَّnlā ُlُkْaʾَy āَّmِm ِḍْrَaʾْlā ُtāَbَn ِhِb َṭَlَtْhkāَf ِءāَmَّslā َnِm ُhāَnْlَznَaʾ ٍءāَmَk āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā ُlَhtَm āَmَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Its vegetation having been cut down or uprooted, i.e., utterly destroyed.
In addition to the pleasures of Paradise, they will be able to see Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), as reported in an authentic ḥadīth narrated by Muslim.

ayas.translation: َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āًmِlْẓُm ِlْyَّllā َnِّm āًʿعَṭِq ْmُhُhwُjgُw ْtَyِhsْغُaʾ āَmَّnَaʾَk ۖ ٍmِṣāَʿع ْnِm ِhَّllā َnِّm mُhَl āَّm ۖ ٌhَّlِhd ْmُhُqَhْrَtَw āَhِlْhtِmِb ٍhَyʾِّyَs ُءāَzَjg ِtāَyʾِّyَّslā āwُbَsَk َnyِhdَّlāَw

َnwُdُbْʿعَt āَnāَّyِiʾ ْmُtnُk āَّm mُhُwʾāَkَrُhs َlāَqَw ۖ ْmُhَnْyَb āَnْlَّyَzَf ۚ ْmُkُwʾāَkَrُhsَw ْmُtnَaʾ ْmُkَnāَkَm āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlِl ُlwُqَn َّmُht āًʿعyِmَjg ْmُhُrُhsْḥَn َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: Those they had associated with Allāh.
From the believers.
The inanimate objects, such as idols, will not have been aware of their worship of them. But those beings who consented to be worshipped will lie and deny it on the Day of Judgement.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع َّlَḍَw ۖ ِّqَḥْlā ُmُhāَlْwَm ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āwُّdُrَw ۚ ْtَfَlْsَaʾ āَّm ٍsْfَn ُّlُk wُlْbَt َkِlāَnُh

َnwُqَّtَt āَlَfَaʾ ْlُqَf ۚ ُhَّllā َnwُlwُqَyَsَf ۚ َrْmَaʾْlā ُrِّbَdُy nَmَw ِّyَḥْlā َnِm َtِّyَmْlā ُjgِrْhkُyَw ِtِّyَmْlā َnِm َّyَḥْlā ُjgِrْhkُy nَmَw َrāَṣْbَaʾْlāَw َʿعْmَّslā ُkِlْmَy nَّmَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mُkُqُzْrَy nَm ْlُq

َnwُmُkْḥَt َfْyَk ْmُkَl āَmَf ۖ ٰyَdْhُy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ yِّdِhَy āَّl nَّmَaʾ َʿعَbَّtُy nَaʾ ُّqَḥَaʾ ِّqَḥْlā yَlِiʾ yِdْhَy nَmَfَaʾ ۗ ِّqَḥْlِl yِdْhَy ُhَّllā ِlُq ۚ ِّqَḥْlā yَlِiʾ yِdْhَy nَّm mُkِyʾāَkَrُhs nِm ْlَh ْlُq
َnwُlَʿعْfَy āَmِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ِّqَḥْlā َnِm yِnْغُy āَl َّnَّẓlā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًّnَẓ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ُʿعِbَّtَy āَmَw
َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ِّbَّr nِm ِhyِf َbْyَr āَl ِbāَtِkْlā َlyِṣْfَtَw ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb yِhdَّlā َqyِdْṣَt nِkٰـَlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ٰyَrَtْfُy nَaʾ ُnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh َnāَk āَmَw

footnotes.text: This phrase refers back to the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmِّm ٌءyِrَb āَnَaʾَw ُlَmْʿعَaʾ āَّmِm َnwُyʾyِrَb mُtnَaʾ ۖ ْmُkُlَmَʿع ْmُkَlَw yِlَmَʿع yِّl lُqَf َkwُbَّhdَk nِiʾَw
َnyِdَtْhُm āwُnāَk āَmَw ِhَّllā ِءāَqِlِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā َrِsَhk ْdَq ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb َnwُfَrāَʿعَtَy ِrāَhَّnlā َnِّm ًhَʿعāَs āَّlِiʾ āwُhtَbْlَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk ْmُhُrُhsْḥَy َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: To witness on the Day of Judgement. Another meaning is "Once a messenger has come [to them in this world]..."

ayas.translation: َnwُmِdْqَtْsَy āَlَw ۖ ًhَʿعāَs َnwُrِhkْaʾَtْsَy āَlَf ْmُhُlَjgَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ۚ ٌlَjgَaʾ ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُkِl ۗ ُhَّllā َءāَhs āَm āَّlِiʾ āًʿعْfَn āَlَw āًّrَḍ yِsْfَnِl ُkِlْmَaʾ āَّl lُq

footnotes.text: "Impatience" refers to the disbelievers' ridicule of the Prophet (ﷺ) by telling him to produce Allāh's punishment as proof of his truthfulness.
i.e., when it is too late to benefit from belief.
Challenging those who warned of it to bring it on immediately.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْẓُy āَl ْmُhَw ۚ ِṭْsِqْlāِb mُhَnْyَb َyِḍُqَw ۖ َbāَhdَʿعْlā āُwَaʾَr āَّmَl َhَmāَdَّnlā āwُّrَsَaʾَw ۗ ِhِb ْtَdَtْfāَl ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَm ْtَmَlَẓ ٍsْfَn ِّlُkِl َّnَaʾ ْwَlَw
َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlِّl ٌhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ِrwُdُّṣlā yِf āَmِّl ٌءāَfِhsَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَẓِʿعْwَّm mُkْtَءāَjg ْdَq ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnwُrَtْfَt ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ْmَaʾ ۖ ْmُkَl َnِhdَaʾ ُhَّllāʾ ْlُq āًlāَlَḥَw āًmāَrَḥ ُhْnِّm mُtْlَʿعَjgَf ٍqْzِّr nِّm mُkَl ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَّm mُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., what do they think He will do with them.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍbāَtِk yِf āَّlِiʾ َrَbْkَaʾ āَlَw َkِlَٰhd nِm َrَغْṣَaʾ āَlَw ِءāَmَّslā yِf āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍhَّrَhd ِlāَqْhtِّm nِm َkِّbَّr nَʿع ُbُzْʿعَy āَmَw ۚ ِhyِf َnwُḍyِfُt ْhdِiʾ āًdwُhُhs ْmُkْyَlَʿع āَّnُk āَّlِiʾ ٍlَmَʿع ْnِm َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَlَw ٍnāʾْrُq nِm ُhْnِm wُlْtَt āَmَw ٍnْaʾَhs yِf ُnwُkَt āَmَw

footnotes.text: Or "the weight of a small ant."

ayas.translation: َnwُṣُrْhkَy āَّlِiʾ ْmُh ْnِiʾَw َّnَّẓlā āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَy nِiʾ ۚ َءāَkَrُhs ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَy َnyِhdَّlā ُʿعِbَّtَy āَmَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm ِhَّlِl َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., making things visible.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُlwُqَtَaʾ ۚ āَhdٰـَhِb ٍnāَṭْlُs nِّm mُkَdnِʿع ْnِiʾ ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَl ۖ ُّyِnَغْlā َwُh ۖ ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۗ āًdَlَw ُhَّllā َhdَhkَّtā āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: The Christians and others.
Or "evidence."

ayas.translation: ِnwُrِẓnُt āَlَw َّyَlِiʾ āwُḍْqā َّmُht ًhَّmُغ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْmُkُrْmَaʾ ْnُkَy āَl َّmُht ْmُkَءāَkَrُhsَw ْmُkَrْmَaʾ āwُʿعِmْjgَaʾَf ُtْlَّkَwَt ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَf ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb yِryِkْhdَtَw yِmāَqَّm mُkْyَlَʿع َrُbَk َnāَk nِiʾ ِmْwَq āَy ِhِmْwَqِl َlāَq ْhdِiʾ ٍḥwُn َaʾَbَn ْmِhْyَlَʿع ُlْtāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., Do not let it be a source of doubt or anxiety to you but let it be clear, open and defined.

ayas.translation: َnyِdَtْʿعُmْlā ِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع ُʿعَbْṭَn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ُlْbَq nِm ِhِb āwُbَّhdَk āَmِb āwُnِmْwʾُyِl āwُnāَk āَmَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhwُءāَjgَf ْmِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āًlُsُr ِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْhtَʿعَb َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., the succeeding generations were persistent in disbelief.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِrْjgُّm āًmْwَq āwُnāَkَw āwُrَbْkَtْsāَf āَnِtāَyāʾِb ِhِyʾَlَmَw َnْwَʿعْrِf ٰyَlِiʾ َnwُrāَhَw ٰyَswُّm mِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْhtَʿعَb َّmُht
َnyِnِmْwʾُmِb āَmُkَl ُnْḥَn āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُءāَyِrْbِkْlā āَmُkَl َnwُkَtَw āَnَءāَbāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْdَjgَw āَّmَʿع āَnَtِfْlَtِl āَnَtْyʾِjgَaʾ āwُlāَq

َnyِfِrْsُmْlā َnِmَl ُhَّnِiʾَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍlāَʿعَl َnْwَʿعْrِf َّnِiʾَw ۚ ْmُhَnِtْfَy nَaʾ ْmِhِyʾَlَmَw َnْwَʿعْrِf nِّm ٍfْwَhk ٰyَlَʿع ِhِmْwَq nِّm ٌhَّyِّrُhd āَّlِiʾ ٰyَswُmِl َnَmāʾ āَmَf
َnyِmِlْsُّm mُtnُk nِiʾ āwُlَّkَwَt ِhْyَlَʿعَf ِhَّllāِb mُtnَmāʾ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِmْwَq āَy ٰyَswُm َlāَqَw
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā ِmْwَqْlِّl ًhَnْtِf āَnْlَʿعْjgَt āَl āَnَّbَr āَnْlَّkَwَt ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlāَqَf
َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِrِّhsَbَw ۗ َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَw ًhَlْbِq ْmُkَtwُyُb āwُlَʿعْjgāَw āًtwُyُb َrْṣِmِb āَmُkِmْwَqِl āʾَّwَbَt nَaʾ ِhyِhkَaʾَw ٰyَswُm ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَw

footnotes.text: In order that they might pray therein unseen by their enemy.

ayas.translation: َmyِlَaʾْlā َbāَhdَʿعْlā āُwَrَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُnِmْwʾُy āَlَf ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع ْdُdْhsāَw ْmِhِlāَwْmَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ْsِmْṭā āَnَّbَr ۖ َkِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّlِḍُyِl āَnَّbَr āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf āًlāَwْmَaʾَw ًhَnyِz ُhَaʾَlَmَw َnْwَʿعْrِf َtْyَtāʾ َkَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَr ٰyَswُm َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Literally, "the supplication of both of you," i.e., that of Moses and of Aaron, who joined by saying, "Āmeen" ("O Allāh, respond").

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlْsُmْlā َnِm āَnَaʾَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ wُnَb ِhِb ْtَnَmāʾ yِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ُhَّnَaʾ ُtnَmāʾ َlāَq ُqَrَغْlā ُhَkَrْdَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ āًwْdَʿعَw āًyْغَb ُhُdwُnُjgَw ُnْwَʿعْrِf ْmُhَʿعَbْtَaʾَf َrْḥَbْlā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِb āَnْzَwāَjgَw

footnotes.text: i.e., his dead body will be preserved and not destroyed.

ayas.translation: َnwُfِlَtْhkَy ِhyِf āwُnāَk āَmyِf ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُhَnْyَb yِḍْqَy َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ ُmْlِʿعْlā ُmُhَءāَjg ٰyَّtَḥ āwُfَlَtْhkā āَmَf ِtāَbِّyَّṭlā َnِّm mُhāَnْqَzَrَw ٍqْdِṣ َaʾَّwَbُm َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَnْaʾَّwَb ْdَqَlَw
َnyِrَtْmُmْlā َnِm َّnَnwُkَt āَlَf َkِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā َkَءāَjg ْdَqَl ۚ َkِlْbَq nِm َbāَtِkْlā َnwُءَrْqَy َnyِhdَّlā ِlَaʾْsāَf َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَznَaʾ āَّmِّm ٍّkَhs yِf َtnُk nِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Among the interpretations of the last two verses is that they were meant to stir the Prophet (ﷺ) to declare and confirm his certainty, which he did. Another is that although the words are addressed to the Prophet (ﷺ), they are directed to all people.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِḥ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhāَnْʿعَّtَmَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ِyْzِhkْlā َbāَhdَʿع ْmُhْnَʿع āَnْfَhsَk āwُnَmāʾ āَّmَl َsُnwُy َmْwَq āَّlِiʾ āَhُnāَmyِiʾ āَhَʿعَfَnَf ْtَnَmāʾ ٌhَyْrَq ْtَnāَk āَlْwَlَf

footnotes.text: Among its meanings are filth, wrath, punishment, disbelief, confusion and error.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَّl ٍmْwَq nَʿع ُrُhdُّnlāَw ُtāَyāʾْlā yِnْغُt āَmَw ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَhdāَm āwُrُẓnā ِlُq
َnyِrِẓَtnُmْlā َnِّm mُkَʿعَm yِّnِiʾ āwُrِẓَtnāَf ْlُq ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm āْwَlَhk َnyِhdَّlā ِmāَّyَaʾ َlْhtِm āَّlِiʾ َnwُrِẓَtnَy ْlَhَf

footnotes.text: From Allāh's punishment.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm َnwُkَaʾ ْnَaʾ ُtْrِmُaʾَw ۖ ْmُkāَّfَwَtَy yِhdَّlā َhَّllā ُdُbْʿعَaʾ ْnِkٰـَlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَt َnyِhdَّlā ُdُbْʿعَaʾ āَlَf yِnyِd nِّm ٍّkَhs yِf ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ْlُq
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِّm āًhdِiʾ َkَّnِiʾَf َtْlَʿعَf nِiʾَf ۖ َkُّrُḍَy āَlَw َkُʿعَfnَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ُʿعْdَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., worship.
See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="95">10:95</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُmyِḥَّrlā ُrwُfَغْlā َwُhَw ۚ ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِb ُbyِṣُy ۚ ِhِlْḍَfِl َّdāَr āَlَf ٍrْyَhkِb َkْdِrُy nِiʾَw ۖ َwُh āَّlِiʾ ُhَl َfِhsāَk āَlَf ٍّrُḍِb ُhَّllā َkْsَsْmَy nِiʾَw

ٍlyِkَwِb mُkْyَlَʿع āَnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ āَhْyَlَʿع ُّlِḍَy āَmَّnِiʾَf َّlَḍ nَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَnِl yِdَtْhَy āَmَّnِiʾَf ٰyَdَtْhā ِnَmَf ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ُmُkَءāَjg ْdَq ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
Refer to footnotes of <reference chapter="6" verses="18">6:18</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍryِbَk ٍmْwَy َbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَw ۖ ُhَlْḍَf ٍlْḍَf yِhd َّlُk ِtْwʾُyَw yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āًnَsَḥ āًʿعāَtَّm mُkْʿعِّtَmُy ِhْyَlِiʾ āwُbwُt َّmُht ْmُkَّbَr āwُrِfْغَtْsā ِnَaʾَw
ٍnyِbُّm ٍbāَtِk yِf ٌّlُk ۚ āَhَʿعَdْwَtْsُmَw āَhَّrَqَtْsُm ُmَlْʿعَyَw āَhُqْzِr ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍhَّbāَd nِm āَmَw

footnotes.text: Before birth and after death.

ayas.translation: ٌnyِbُّm ٌrْḥِs āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnَlwُqَyَl ِtْwَmْlā ِdْʿعَb nِm َnwُhtwُʿعْbَّm mُkَّnِiʾ َtْlُq nِyʾَlَw ۗ āًlَmَʿع ُnَsْḥَaʾ ْmُkُّyَaʾ ْmُkَwُlْbَyِl ِءāَmْlā yَlَʿع ُhُhsْrَʿع َnāَkَw ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِb َqāَḥَw ْmُhْnَʿع āًfwُrْṣَm َsْyَl ْmِhyِtْaʾَy َmْwَy āَlَaʾ ۗ ُhُsِbْḥَy āَm َّnُlwُqَyَّl ٍhَdwُdْʿعَّm ٍhَّmُaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmُhْnَʿع āَnْrَّhkَaʾ ْnِyʾَlَw

footnotes.text: In ridicule and disbelief.
Knowing of the Prophet's difficulties, Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) urges him to patience, certain that he would not fail to convey the message in its entirety.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُّm mُtnَaʾ ْlَhَf ۖ َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَّl nَaʾَw ِhَّllā ِmْlِʿعِb َlِznُaʾ āَmَّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعāَf ْmُkَl āwُbyِjgَtْsَy ْmَّlِiʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., that knowledge which no one possesses except Him (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).
After having been convinced by such evidence.

ayas.translation: َnwُsَhkْbُy āَl āَhyِf ْmُhَw āَhyِf ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ِّfَwُn āَhَtَnyِzَw āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā ُdyِrُy َnāَk nَm

footnotes.text: i.e., during worldly life.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَّm ٌlِṭāَbَw āَhyِf āwُʿعَnَṣ āَm َṭِbَḥَw ۖ ُrāَّnlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ْmُhَl َsْyَl َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., during worldly life.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw َkِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ُhْnِّm ٍhَyْrِm yِf ُkَt āَlَf ۚ ُhُdِʿعْwَm ُrāَّnlāَf ِbāَzْḥَaʾْlā َnِm ِhِb ْrُfْkَy nَmَw ۚ ِhِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ًhَmْḥَrَw āًmāَmِiʾ ٰyَswُm ُbāَtِk ِhِlْbَq nِmَw ُhْnِّm ٌdِhāَhs ُhwُlْtَyَw ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع َnāَk nَmَfَaʾ

footnotes.text: Referring to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) or to the angel Gabriel.
Testifying to its truth. Additionally, it can mean "recites it," i.e., the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِṣْbُy āwُnāَk āَmَw َʿعْmَّslā َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āwُnāَk āَm ۚ ُbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmُhَl ُfَʿعāَḍُy ۘ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْnِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُhَl َnāَk āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnyِzِjgْʿعُm āwُnwُkَy ْmَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

footnotes.text: They refused to listen to the truth or to perceive it.

ayas.translation: َnyِbِhdāَk ْmُkُّnُẓَn ْlَb ٍlْḍَf nِm āَnْyَlَʿع ْmُkَl ٰyَrَn āَmَw ِyْaʾَّrlā َyِdāَb āَnُlِhdāَrَaʾ ْmُh َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ َkَʿعَbَّtā َkāَrَn āَmَw āَnَlْhtِّm āًrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ َkāَrَn āَm ِhِmْwَq nِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُaʾَlَmْlā َlāَqَf

footnotes.text: i.e., without any thought or hesitation.

ayas.translation: َnwُhِrāَk āَhَl ْmُtnَaʾَw āَhwُmُkُmِzْlُnَaʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ْtَyِّmُʿعَf ِhِdnِʿع ْnِّm ًhَmْḥَr yِnāَtāʾَw yِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع ُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq

َnwُlَhْjgَt āًmْwَq ْmُkāَrَaʾ yِّnِkٰـَlَw ْmِhِّbَr wُqāَlُّm mُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِdِrāَṭِb āَnَaʾ āَmَw ۚ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ َyِrْjgَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ āًlāَm ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkُlَaʾْsَaʾ āَl ِmْwَq āَyَw

َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِmَّl āًhdِiʾ yِّnِiʾ ۖ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllā ۖ āًrْyَhk ُhَّllā ُmُhَyِtْwʾُy nَl ْmُkُnُyْʿعَaʾ yِrَdْzَt َnyِhdَّlِl ُlwُqَaʾ āَlَw ٌkَlَm yِّnِiʾ ُlwُqَaʾ āَlَw َbْyَغْlā ُmَlْʿعَaʾ āَlَw ِhَّllā ُnِyʾāَzَhk yِdnِʿع ْmُkَl ُlwُqَaʾ āَlَw
َnyِqِdāَّṣlā َnِm َtnُk nِiʾ āَnُdِʿعَt āَmِb āَnِtْaʾَf āَnَlāَdِjg َtْrَhtْkَaʾَf āَnَtْlَdāَjg ْdَq ُḥwُn āَy āwُlāَq
َnwُlَʿعْfَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ْsِyʾَtْbَt āَlَf َnَmāʾ ْdَq nَm āَّlِiʾ َkِmْwَq nِm َnِmْwʾُy nَl ُhَّnَaʾ ٍḥwُn ٰyَlِiʾ َyِḥwُaʾَw
َnwُqَrْغُّm mُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā yِf yِnْbِṭāَhkُt āَlَw āَnِyْḥَwَw āَnِnُyْʿعَaʾِb َkْlُfْlā ِʿعَnْṣāَw
َnwُrَhkْsَt āَmَk ْmُknِm ُrَhkْsَn āَّnِiʾَf āَّnِm āwُrَhkْsَt nِiʾ َlāَq ۚ ُhْnِm āwُrِhkَs ِhِmْwَq nِّm ٌaʾَlَm ِhْyَlَʿع َّrَm āَmَّlُkَw َkْlُfْlā ُʿعَnْṣَyَw

ٌlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ُhَʿعَm َnَmāʾ āَmَw ۚ َnَmāʾ ْnَmَw ُlْwَqْlā ِhْyَlَʿع َqَbَs nَm āَّlِiʾ َkَlْhَaʾَw ِnْyَnْhtā ِnْyَjgْwَz ٍّlُk nِm āَhyِf ْlِmْḥā āَnْlُq ُrwُّnَّtlā َrāَfَw āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

footnotes.text: As a sign to Noah of the imminence of the flood. The tannūr is a large, rounded oven. The word can also mean the earth's lowlands.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā َʿعَّm nُkَt āَlَw āَnَʿعَّm bَkْrā َّyَnُb āَy ٍlِzْʿعَm yِf َnāَkَw ُhَnْbā ٌḥwُn ٰyَdāَnَw ِlāَbِjgْlāَk ٍjgْwَm yِf ْmِhِb yِrْjgَt َyِhَw
َnyِqَrْغُmْlā َnِm َnāَkَf ُjgْwَmْlā āَmُhَnْyَb َlāَḥَw ۚ َmِḥَّr nَm āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā ِrْmَaʾ ْnِm َmْwَyْlā َmِṣāَʿع āَl َlāَq ۚ ِءāَmْlā َnِm yِnُmِṣْʿعَy ٍlَbَjg ٰyَlِiʾ yِwāʾَs َlāَq
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā ِmْwَqْlِّl āًdْʿعُb َlyِqَw ۖ ِّyِdwُjgْlā yَlَʿع ْtَwَtْsāَw ُrْmَaʾْlā َyِḍُqَw ُءāَmْlā َḍyِغَw yِʿعِlْqَaʾ ُءāَmَs āَyَw ِkَءāَm yِʿعَlْbā ُḍْrَaʾ āَy َlyِqَw
َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َnِّm nُkَaʾ yِnْmَḥْrَtَw yِl ْrِfْغَt āَّlِiʾَw ۖ ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb yِl َsْyَl āَm َkَlَaʾْsَaʾ ْnَaʾ َkِb ُhdwُʿعَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ِّbَr َlāَq
َnyِqَّtُmْlِl َhَbِqāَʿعْlā َّnِiʾ ۖ ْrِbْṣāَf ۖ āَhdٰـَh ِlْbَq nِm َkُmْwَq āَlَw َtnَaʾ āَhُmَlْʿعَt َtnُk āَm ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ āَhyِḥwُn ِbْyَغْlā ِءāَbnَaʾ ْnِm َkْlِt
َnwُrَtْfُm āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۚ āًdwُh ْmُhāَhkَaʾ ٍdāَʿع ٰyَlِiʾَw
َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ yِnَrَṭَf yِhdَّlā yَlَʿع āَّlِiʾ َyِrْjgَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ āًrْjgَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkُlَaʾْsَaʾ āَl ِmْwَq āَy
َnyِmِrْjgُm āْwَّlَwَtَt āَlَw ْmُkِtَّwُq ٰyَlِiʾ ًhَّwُq ْmُkْdِzَyَw āًrāَrْdِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َءāَmَّslā ِlِsْrُy ِhْyَlِiʾ āwُbwُt َّmُht ْmُkَّbَr āwُrِfْغَtْsā ِmْwَq āَyَw
َnyِnِmْwʾُmِb َkَl ُnْḥَn āَmَw َkِlْwَq nَʿع āَnِtَhِlāʾ yِkِrāَtِb ُnْḥَn āَmَw ٍhَnِّyَbِb āَnَtْyʾِjg āَm ُdwُh āَy āwُlāَq
َnwُkِrْhsُt āَّmِّm ٌءyِrَb yِّnَaʾ āwُdَhْhsāَw َhَّllā ُdِhْhsُaʾ yِّnِiʾ َlāَq ۗ ٍءwُsِb āَnِtَhِlāʾ ُḍْʿعَb َkāَrَtْʿعā āَّlِiʾ ُlwُqَّn nِiʾ
ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlَʿع yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ āَhِtَyِṣāَnِb ٌhdِhkāʾ َwُh āَّlِiʾ ٍhَّbāَd nِm āَّm ۚ mُkِّbَrَw yِّbَr ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ُtْlَّkَwَt yِّnِiʾ
ٌẓyِfَḥ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ُhَnwُّrُḍَt āَlَw ْmُkَrْyَغ āًmْwَq yِّbَr ُfِlْhkَtْsَyَw ۚ ْmُkْyَlِiʾ ِhِb ُtْlِsْrُaʾ āَّm mُkُtْغَlْbَaʾ ْdَqَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Protecting and preserving the existence and attributes of His creations.

ayas.translation: ٍẓyِlَغ ٍbāَhdَʿع ْnِّm mُhāَnْyَّjgَnَw āَّnِّm ٍhَmْḥَrِb ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw āًdwُh āَnْyَّjgَn āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَّmَlَw
ٍdwُh ِmْwَq ٍdāَʿعِّl āًdْʿعُb āَlَaʾ ۗ ْmُhَّbَr āwُrَfَk āًdāَʿع َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَyَw ًhَnْʿعَl āَyْnُّdlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِf āwُʿعِbْtُaʾَw

ٌbyِjgُّm ٌbyِrَq yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhْyَlِiʾ āwُbwُt َّmُht ُhwُrِfْغَtْsāَf āَhyِf ْmُkَrَmْʿعَtْsāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِّm mُkَaʾَhsnَaʾ َwُh ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۚ āًḥِlāَṣ ْmُhāَhkَaʾ َdwُmَht ٰyَlِiʾَw
ٍbyِrُm ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnwُʿعْdَt āَّmِّm ٍّkَhs yِfَl āَnَّnِiʾَw āَnُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy āَm َdُbْʿعَّn nَaʾ āَnāَhْnَtَaʾ ۖ āَhdٰـَh َlْbَq āًّwُjgْrَm āَnyِf َtnُk ْdَq ُḥِlāَṣ āَy āwُlāَq
ٍryِsْhkَt َrْyَغ yِnَnwُdyِzَt āَmَf ۖ ُhُtْyَṣَʿع ْnِiʾ ِhَّllā َnِm yِnُrُṣnَy nَmَf ًhَmْḥَr ُhْnِm yِnāَtāʾَw yِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع ُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq
