ُzyِzَʿعْlā ُّyِwَqْlā َwُh َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۗ ٍhdِyʾِmْwَy ِyْzِhk ْnِmَw āَّnِّm ٍhَmْḥَrِb ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw āًḥِlāَṣ āَnْyَّjgَn āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: The day of Thamūd's destruction.
A piercing cry or blast from the sky.

ayas.translation: َdwُmَhtِّl āًdْʿعُb āَlَaʾ ۗ ْmُhَّbَr āwُrَfَk َdwُmَht َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ āَhyِf āْwَnْغَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk
ٍṭwُl ِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْlِsْrُaʾ āَّnِiʾ ْfَhkَt āَl āwُlāَq ۚ ًhَfyِhk ْmُhْnِm َsَjgْwَaʾَw ْmُhَrِkَn ِhْyَlِiʾ ُlِṣَt āَl ْmُhَyِdْyَaʾ ٰyَaʾَr āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: Traditionally, if a guest refused to eat, it meant that he harbored ill will toward the host or intended him harm.
In pleasure at the news of the forthcoming punishment of the evil people who denied Prophet Lot (upon him be peace).

ayas.translation: ٌbyِjgَʿع ٌءْyَhsَl āَhdٰـَh َّnِiʾ ۖ āًhkْyَhs yِlْʿعَb āَhdٰـَhَw ٌzwُjgَʿع āَnَaʾَw ُdِlَaʾَaʾ ٰyَtَlْyَw āَy ْtَlāَq

footnotes.text: An expression of surprise and amazement.
i.e., with Our angels.
i.e., sighing or moaning during supplication out of grief for people and fear of Allāh.
Prophet Lot feared for the safety and honor of his guests.

ayas.translation: ٌdyِhsَّr ٌlُjgَr ْmُknِm َsْyَlَaʾ ۖ yِfْyَḍ yِf ِnwُzْhkُt āَlَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَf ۖ ْmُkَl ُrَhْṭَaʾ َّnُh yِtāَnَb ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۚ ِtāَyʾِّyَّslā َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk ُlْbَq nِmَw ِhْyَlِiʾ َnwُʿعَrْhُy ُhُmْwَq ُhَءāَjgَw

footnotes.text: Referring to their practice of sodomy and homosexual rape of males.
i.e., the women of his community who were available for marriage.

ayas.translation: ٍbyِrَqِb ُḥْbُّṣlā َsْyَlَaʾ ۚ ُḥْbُّṣlā ُmُhَdِʿعْwَm َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhَbāَṣَaʾ āَm āَhُbyِṣُm ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ َkَtَaʾَrْmā āَّlِiʾ ٌdَḥَaʾ ْmُknِm ْtِfَtْlَy āَlَw ِlْyَّllā َnِّm ٍʿعْṭِqِb َkِlْhَaʾِb ِrْsَaʾَf ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ āwُlِṣَy nَl َkِّbَr ُlُsُr āَّnِiʾ ُṭwُl āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., sometime before dawn.

ayas.translation: ٍdwُḍnَّm ٍlyِّjgِs nِّm ًhَrāَjgِḥ āَhْyَlَʿع āَnْrَṭْmَaʾَw āَhَlِfāَs āَhَyِlāَʿع āَnْlَʿعَjg āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَّmَlَf

ٍṭyِḥُّm ٍmْwَy َbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾَw ٍrْyَhkِb mُkāَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ۚ َnāَzyِmْlāَw َlāَyْkِmْlā āwُṣُqnَt āَlَw ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۚ āًbْyَʿعُhs ْmُhāَhkَaʾ َnَyْdَm ٰyَlِiʾَw
َnyِdِsْfُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āْwَhtْʿعَt āَlَw ْmُhَءāَyْhsَaʾ َsāَّnlā āwُsَhkْbَt āَlَw ۖ ِṭْsِqْlāِb َnāَzyِmْlāَw َlāَyْkِmْlā āwُfْwَaʾ ِmْwَq āَyَw
ُdyِhsَّrlā ُmyِlَḥْlā َtnَaʾَl َkَّnِiʾ ۖ ُءāَhsَn āَm āَnِlāَwْmَaʾ yِf َlَʿعْfَّn nَaʾ ْwَaʾ āَnُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy āَm َkُrْtَّn nَaʾ َkُrُmْaʾَt َkُtāَlَṣَaʾ ُbْyَʿعُhs āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: This is a sarcastic description implying the opposite.

ayas.translation: ُbyِnُaʾ ِhْyَlِiʾَw ُtْlَّkَwَt ِhْyَlَʿع ۚ ِhَّllāِb āَّlِiʾ yِqyِfْwَt āَmَw ۚ ُtْʿعَṭَtْsā āَm َḥāَlْṣِiʾْlā āَّlِiʾ ُdyِrُaʾ ْnِiʾ ۚ ُhْnَʿع ْmُkāَhْnَaʾ āَm ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُkَfِlāَhkُaʾ ْnَaʾ ُdyِrُaʾ āَmَw ۚ āًnَsَḥ āًqْzِr ُhْnِm yِnَqَzَrَw yِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع ُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq

footnotes.text: The conclusion of the sentence is estimated as "...would it not be my duty to warn you against corruption and disobedience?"
i.e., I turn to Allāh frequently in supplication and repentance.

ayas.translation: ٍdyِʿعَbِb mُknِّm ٍṭwُl ُmْwَq āَmَw ۚ ٍḥِlāَṣ َmْwَq ْwَaʾ ٍdwُh َmْwَq ْwَaʾ ٍḥwُn َmْwَq َbāَṣَaʾ āَm ُlْhtِّm mُkَbyِṣُy nَaʾ yِqāَqِhs ْmُkَّnَmِrْjgَy āَl ِmْwَq āَyَw
ٍzyِzَʿعِb āَnْyَlَʿع َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ َkāَnْmَjgَrَl َkُṭْhَr āَlْwَlَw ۖ āًfyِʿعَḍ āَnyِf َkāَrَnَl āَّnِiʾَw ُlwُqَt āَّmِّm āًryِhtَk ُhَqْfَn āَm ُbْyَʿعُhs āَy āwُlāَq
ٌṭyِḥُm َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۖ āًّyِrْhِẓ ْmُkَءāَrَw ُhwُmُtْhdَhkَّtāَw ِhَّllā َnِّm mُkْyَlَʿع ُّzَʿعَaʾ yِṭْhَrَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq
ٌbyِqَr ْmُkَʿعَm yِّnِiʾ āwُbِqَtْrāَw ۖ ٌbِhdāَk َwُh ْnَmَw ِhyِzْhkُy ٌbāَhdَʿع ِhyِtْaʾَy nَm َnwُmَlْʿعَt َfْwَs ۖ ٌlِmāَʿع yِّnِiʾ ْmُkِtَnāَkَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُlَmْʿعā ِmْwَq āَyَw
َnyِmِhtāَjg ْmِhِrāَyِd yِf āwُḥَbْṣَaʾَf ُhَḥْyَّṣlā āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā ِtَhdَhkَaʾَw āَّnِّm ٍhَmْḥَrِb ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw āًbْyَʿعُhs āَnْyَّjgَn āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَّmَlَw
ُdwُmَht ْtَdِʿعَb āَmَk َnَyْdَmِّl āًdْʿعُb āَlَaʾ ۗ āَhyِf āْwَnْغَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk

footnotes.text: i.e., evidences from Allāh.
i.e., the curse which follows them in both worlds.
Their structures have been completely destroyed.

ayas.translation: ٍbyِbْtَt َrْyَغ ْmُhwُdāَz āَmَw ۖ َkِّbَr ُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَّmَّl ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَy yِtَّlā ُmُhُtَhِlāʾ ْmُhْnَʿع ْtَnْغَaʾ āَmَf ۖ ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُmَlَẓ nِkٰـَlَw ْmُhāَnْmَlَẓ āَmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., their sighs and sobs, resembling the bray of a donkey.

ayas.translation: ٍhdwُhdْjgَm َrْyَغ ًءāَṭَʿع ۖ َkُّbَr َءāَhs āَm āَّlِiʾ ُḍْrَaʾْlāَw ُtāَwāَmَّslā ِtَmāَd āَm āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ِhَّnَjgْlā yِfَf āwُdِʿعُs َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَw
ٍṣwُqnَm َrْyَغ ْmُhَbyِṣَn ْmُhwُّfَwُmَl āَّnِiʾَw ۚ ُlْbَq nِّm mُhُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy āَmَk āَّlِiʾ َnwُdُbْʿعَy āَm ۚ ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ُdُbْʿعَy āَّmِّm ٍhَyْrِm yِf ُkَt āَlَf

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="19">10:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَṣnُt āَl َّmُht َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْnِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ُrāَّnlā ُmُkَّsَmَtَf āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā yَlِiʾ āwُnَkْrَt āَlَw

َnyِmِrْjgُm āwُnāَkَw ِhyِf āwُfِrْtُaʾ āَm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā َʿعَbَّtāَw ۗ ْmُhْnِm āَnْyَjgnَaʾ ْnَّmِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ِdāَsَfْlā ِnَʿع َnْwَhْnَy ٍhَّyِqَb wُlwُaʾ ْmُkِlْbَq nِm ِnwُrُqْlā َnِm َnāَk āَlْwَlَf

footnotes.text: Meaning "If only there had been..."
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
i.e., revealed in the Arabic language.
The prophet Jacob (upon whom be peace).
Benjamin, who was born of the same mother as Joseph.
i.e., You can repent thereafter.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِṣāَnَl ُhَl āَّnِiʾَw َfُswُy ٰyَlَʿع āَّnَmْaʾَt āَl َkَl āَm āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq
َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَl ْmُhَw āَhdٰـَh ْmِhِrْmَaʾِb mُhَّnَyʾِّbَnُtَl ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَw ۚ ِّbُjgْlā ِtَbāَyَغ yِf ُhwُlَʿعْjgَy nَaʾ āwُʿعَmْjgَaʾَw ِhِb āwُbَhَhd āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: The conclusion of this sentence is estimated to be "...they tormented him."

ayas.translation: َnyِqِdāَṣ āَّnُk ْwَlَw āَnَّl ٍnِmْwʾُmِb َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ ُbْyʾِّhdlā ُhَlَkَaʾَf āَnِʿعāَtَm َdnِʿع َfُswُy āَnْkَrَtَw ُqِbَtْsَn āَnْbَhَhd āَّnِiʾ āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: They had stained Joseph's shirt with the blood of a lamb but had forgotten to tear it, thereby arousing their father's suspicion.
To be sold as a slave.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِhِrْmَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ٌbِlāَغ ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِhtyِdāَḥَaʾْlā ِlyِwْaʾَt nِm ُhَmِّlَʿعُnِlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َfُswُyِl āَّnَّkَm َkِlَٰhdَkَw ۚ āًdَlَw ُhَhdِhkَّtَn ْwَaʾ āَnَʿعَfnَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ُhāَwْhtَm yِmِrْkَaʾ ِhِtَaʾَrْmāِl َrْṣِّm nِm ُhāَrَtْhsā yِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: The minister in charge of supplies, whose title was al-ʿAzeez.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُḥِlْfُy āَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ َyāَwْhtَm َnَsْḥَaʾ yِّbَr ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllā َhdāَʿعَm َlāَq ۚ َkَl َtْyَh ْtَlāَqَw َbāَwْbَaʾْlā ِtَqَّlَغَw ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع āَhِtْyَb yِf َwُh yِtَّlā ُhْtَdَwāَrَw

footnotes.text: Her husband, al-ʿAzeez.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْwَaʾ َnَjgْsُy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āًءwُs َkِlْhَaʾِb َdāَrَaʾ ْnَm ُءāَzَjg āَm ْtَlāَq ۚ ِbāَbْlā yَdَl āَhَdِّyَs āَyَfْlَaʾَw ٍrُbُd nِm ُhَṣyِmَq ْtَّdَqَw َbāَbْlā āَqَbَtْsāَw
َnyِbِhdāَkْlā َnِm َwُhَw ْtَqَdَṣَf ٍlُbُq nِm َّdُq ُhُṣyِmَq َnāَk nِiʾ āَhِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm ٌdِhāَhs َdِhَhsَw ۚ yِsْfَّn nَʿع yِnْtَdَwāَr َyِh َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., conceal it and act as if it had not taken place.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍlāَlَḍ yِf āَhāَrَnَl āَّnِiʾ ۖ āًّbُḥ āَhَfَغَhs ْdَq ۖ ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع āَhāَtَf ُdِwāَrُt ِzyِzَʿعْlā ُtَaʾَrْmā ِhَnyِdَmْlā yِf ٌhَwْsِn َlāَqَw

ٌmyِrَk ٌkَlَm āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āًrَhsَb āَhdٰـَh āَm ِhَّlِl َhsāَḥ َnْlُqَw َّnُhَyِdْyَaʾ َnْʿعَّṭَqَw ُhَnْrَbْkَaʾ ُhَnْyَaʾَr āَّmَlَf ۖ َّnِhْyَlَʿع ْjgُrْhkā ِtَlāَqَw āًnyِّkِs َّnُhْnِّm ٍhَdِḥāَw َّlُk ْtَtāʾَw ًaʾَkَّtُm َّnُhَl ْtَdَtْʿعَaʾَw َّnِhْyَlِiʾ ْtَlَsْrَaʾ َّnِhِrْkَmِb ْtَʿعِmَs āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: So distracted were they at the sight of him.
In His ability to create such beauty.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِغāَّṣlā َnِّm āًnwُkَyَlَw َّnَnَjgْsُyَl ُhُrُmāʾ āَm ْlَʿعْfَy ْmَّl nِyʾَlَw ۖ َmَṣْʿعَtْsāَf ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع ُhُّtdَwāَr ْdَqَlَw ۖ ِhyِf yِnَّnُtْmُl yِhdَّlā َّnُkِlَٰhdَf ْtَlāَq

footnotes.text: Proofs of his innocence.
Until the scandal be forgotten.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َnِm َkāَrَn āَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhِlyِwْaʾَtِb āَnْyʾِّbَn ۖ ُhْnِm ُrْyَّṭlā ُlُkْaʾَt āًzْbُhk yِsْaʾَr َqْwَf ُlِmْḥَaʾ yِnāَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ُrَhkāʾْlā َlāَqَw ۖ āًrْmَhk ُrِṣْʿعَaʾ yِnāَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ āَmُhُdَḥَaʾ َlāَq ۖ ِnāَyَtَf َnْjgِّslā ُhَʿعَm َlَhkَdَw

َnwُrِfāَk ْmُh ِhَrِhkāʾْlāِb mُhَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَّl ٍmْwَq َhَّlِm ُtْkَrَt yِّnِiʾ ۚ yِّbَr yِnَmَّlَʿع āَّmِm āَmُkِlَٰhd ۚ āَmُkَyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ َlْbَq ِhِlyِwْaʾَtِb āَmُkُtْaʾَّbَn āَّlِiʾ ِhِnāَqَzْrُt ٌmāَʿعَṭ āَmُkyِtْaʾَy āَl َlāَq

َnwُrُkْhsَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿعَw āَnْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ِlْḍَf nِm َkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllāِb َkِrْhsُّn nَaʾ āَnَl َnāَk āَm ۚ َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ yِyʾāَbāʾ َhَّlِm ُtْʿعَbَّtāَw

footnotes.text: Single, individual and unique in His attributes and His deeds.
He who subdues doubts and false arguments with clear evidences and who subdues and imposes His will upon all creation.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ُmِّyَqْlā ُnyِّdlā َkِlَٰhd ۚ ُhāَّyِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āwُdُbْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ َrَmَaʾ ۚ ِhَّlِl āَّlِiʾ ُmْkُḥْlā ِnِiʾ ۚ ٍnāَṭْlُs nِm āَhِb ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَّm mُkُwʾāَbāʾَw ْmُtnَaʾ āَhwُmُtْyَّmَs ًءāَmْsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَt āَm

footnotes.text: The false objects of worship which you have called "gods."

ayas.translation: ِnāَyِtْfَtْsَt ِhyِf yِhdَّlā ُrْmَaʾْlā َyِḍُq ۚ ِhِsْaʾَّr nِm ُrْyَّṭlā ُlُkْaʾَtَf ُbَlْṣُyَf ُrَhkāʾْlā āَّmَaʾَw ۖ āًrْmَhk ُhَّbَr yِqْsَyَf āَmُkُdَḥَaʾ āَّmَaʾ ِnْjgِّslā ِyَbِḥāَṣ āَy

َnwُrُbْʿعَt āَyْwʾُّrlِl ْmُtnُk nِiʾ َyāَyْwʾُr yِf yِnwُtْfَaʾ ُaʾَlَmْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ۖ ٍtāَsِbāَy َrَhkُaʾَw ٍrْḍُhk ٍtāَlُbnُs َʿعْbَsَw ٌfāَjgِʿع ٌʿعْbَs َّnُhُlُkْaʾَy ٍnāَmِs ٍtāَrَqَb َʿعْbَs ٰyَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ُkِlَmْlā َlāَqَw
َnwُlُkْaʾَt āَّmِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ِhِlُbnُs yِf ُhwُrَhdَf ْmُّtdَṣَḥ āَmَf āًbَaʾَd َnyِnِs َʿعْbَs َnwُʿعَrْzَt َlāَq
َnwُnِṣْḥُt āَّmِّm āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َّnُhَl ْmُtْmَّdَq āَm َnْlُkْaʾَy ٌdāَdِhs ٌʿعْbَs َkِlَٰhd ِdْʿعَb nِm yِtْaʾَy َّmُht

َnyِqِdāَّṣlā َnِmَl ُhَّnِiʾَw ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع ُhُّtdَwāَr āَnَaʾ ُّqَḥْlā َṣَḥْṣَḥ َnāʾْlā ِzyِzَʿعْlā ُtَaʾَrْmā ِtَlāَq ۚ ٍءwُs nِm ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْmِlَʿع āَm ِhَّlِl َhsāَḥ َnْlُq ۚ ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع َfُswُy َّnُّtdَwāَr ْhdِiʾ َّnُkُbْṭَhk āَm َlāَq

footnotes.text: In His ability to create such purity of character.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ yِّbَr َmِḥَr āَm āَّlِiʾ ِءwُّslāِb ٌhَrāَّmَaʾَl َsْfَّnlā َّnِiʾ ۚ yِsْfَn ُyʾِّrَbُaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: Although Ibn Katheer attributes the words of verses 52-53 to the wife of al-ʿAzeez, others have concluded that they were spoken by Joseph, thereby justifying his request for an inquiry and acknowledging Allāh's mercy to him.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َrْjgَaʾ ُʿعyِḍُn āَlَw ۖ ُءāَhsَّn nَm āَnِtَmْḥَrِb ُbyِṣُn ۚ ُءāَhsَy ُhtْyَḥ āَhْnِm ُaʾَّwَbَtَy ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َfُswُyِl āَّnَّkَm َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: Due to the change in his appearance over the years.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِznُmْlā ُrْyَhk āَnَaʾَw َlْyَkْlā yِfwُaʾ yِّnَaʾ َnْwَrَt āَlَaʾ ۚ ْmُkyِbَaʾ ْnِّm mُkَّl ٍhkَaʾِb yِnwُtْyʾā َlāَq ْmِhِzāَhَjgِb mُhَzَّhَjg āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., Benjamin, who had been kept at home by his father Jacob.
The goods which they had brought to trade for food supplies.

ayas.translation: َnwُẓِfāَḥَl ُhَl āَّnِiʾَw ْlَtْkَn āَnāَhkَaʾ āَnَʿعَm ْlِsْrَaʾَf ُlْyَkْlā āَّnِm َʿعِnُm āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq ْmِhyِbَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āwُʿعَjgَr āَّmَlَf

ٌryِsَy ٌlْyَk َkِlَٰhd ۖ ٍryِʿعَb َlْyَk ُdāَdْzَnَw āَnāَhkَaʾ ُẓَfْḥَnَw āَnَlْhَaʾ ُryِmَnَw ۖ āَnْyَlِiʾ ْtَّdُr āَnُtَʿعāَḍِb ِhِhdٰـَh ۖ yِغْbَn āَm āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq ۖ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ْtَّdُr ْmُhَtَʿعāَḍِb āwُdَjgَw ْmُhَʿعāَtَm āwُḥَtَf āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: For them. Or one obtained by us with ease.

ayas.translation: ٌlyِkَw ُlwُqَn āَm ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َlāَq ْmُhَqِhtْwَm ُhْwَtāʾ āَّmَlَf ۖ ْmُkِb َṭāَḥُy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِb yِnَّnُtْaʾَtَl ِhَّllā َnِّm āًqِhtْwَm ِnwُtْwʾُt ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُkَʿعَm ُhَlِsْrُaʾ ْnَl َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., sufficient to witness and deal with the matter.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِّkَwَtُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhْyَlَʿعَw ۖ ُtْlَّkَwَt ِhْyَlَʿع ۖ ِhَّlِl āَّlِiʾ ُmْkُḥْlā ِnِiʾ ۖ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllā َnِّm mُknَʿع yِnْغُaʾ āَmَw ۖ ٍhَqِّrَfَtُّm ٍbāَwْbَaʾ ْnِm āwُlُhkْdāَw ٍdِḥāَw ٍbāَb nِm āwُlُhkْdَt āَl َّyِnَb āَy َlāَqَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ُhāَnْmَّlَʿع āَmِّl ٍmْlِʿع wُhdَl ُhَّnِiʾَw ۚ āَhāَḍَq َbwُqْʿعَy ِsْfَn yِf ًhَjgāَḥ āَّlِiʾ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllā َnِّm mُhْnَʿع yِnْغُy َnāَk āَّm mُhwُbَaʾ ْmُhَrَmَaʾ ُhtْyَḥ ْnِm āwُlَhkَd āَّmَlَw
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ْsِyʾَtْbَt āَlَf َkwُhkَaʾ āَnَaʾ yِّnِiʾ َlāَq ۖ ُhāَhkَaʾ ِhْyَlِiʾ ٰyَwāʾ َfُswُy ٰyَlَʿع āwُlَhkَd āَّmَlَw
َnyِqِrāَs āَّnُk āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َdِsْfُnِl āَnْyʾِjg āَّm mُtْmِlَʿع ْdَqَl ِhَّllāَt āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: The punishment for theft.
According to their law, a convicted thief was made a slave of the one from whom he had stolen.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍmْlِʿع yِhd ِّlُk َqْwَfَw ۗ ُءāَhsَّn nَّm ٍtāَjgَrَd ُʿعَfْrَn ۚ ُhَّllā َءāَhsَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِkِlَmْlā ِnyِd yِf ُhāَhkَaʾ َhdُhkْaʾَyِl َnāَk āَm ۖ َfُswُyِl āَnْdِk َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ِhyِhkَaʾ ِءāَʿعِw nِm āَhَjgَrْhkَtْsā َّmُht ِhyِhkَaʾ ِءāَʿعِw َlْbَq ْmِhِtَyِʿعْwَaʾِb َaʾَdَbَf

footnotes.text: Ending with the ultimate knowledge of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

ayas.translation: َnwُfِṣَt āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۖ āًnāَkَّm ٌّrَhs ْmُtnَaʾ َlāَq ۚ ْmُhَl āَhِdْbُy ْmَlَw ِhِsْfَn yِf ُfُswُy āَhَّrَsَaʾَf ۚ ُlْbَq nِm ُhَّl ٌhkَaʾ َqَrَs ْdَqَf ْqِrْsَy nِiʾ āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: He did not answer that he himself had been stolen by them from his father.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َnِm َkāَrَn āَّnِiʾ ۖ ُhَnāَkَm āَnَdَḥَaʾ ْhdُhkَf āًryِbَk āًhkْyَhs āًbَaʾ ُhَl َّnِiʾ ُzyِzَʿعْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Addressing Joseph, who now held the title of "al-ʿAzeez."

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlāَẓَّl āًhdِiʾ āَّnِiʾ ُhَdnِʿع āَnَʿعāَtَm āَnْdَjgَw nَm āَّlِiʾ َhdُhkْaʾَّn nَaʾ ِhَّllā َhdāَʿعَm َlāَq

َnyِmِkāَḥْlā ُrْyَhk َwُhَw ۖ yِl ُhَّllā َmُkْḥَy ْwَaʾ yِbَaʾ yِl َnَhdْaʾَy ٰyَّtَḥ َḍْrَaʾْlā َḥَrْbَaʾ ْnَlَf ۖ َfُswُy yِf ْmُtṭَّrَf āَm ُlْbَq nِmَw ِhَّllā َnِّm āًqِhtْwَّm mُkْyَlَʿع َhdَhkَaʾ ْdَq ْmُkāَbَaʾ َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعَt ْmَlَaʾ ْmُhُryِbَk َlāَq ۖ āًّyِjgَn āwُṣَlَhk ُhْnِm āwُsَaʾْyَtْsā āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., in my favor by bringing about the release of Benjamin.

ayas.translation: َnyِẓِfāَḥ ِbْyَغْlِl āَّnُk āَmَw āَnْmِlَʿع āَmِb āَّlِiʾ āَnْdِhَhs āَmَw َqَrَs َkَnْbā َّnِiʾ āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlwُqَf ْmُkyِbَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āwُʿعِjgْrā

footnotes.text: i.e., We could not have known when we gave you the oath that he would steal and be apprehended.

ayas.translation: َnwُqِdāَṣَl āَّnِiʾَw ۖ āَhyِf āَnْlَbْqَaʾ yِtَّlā َryِʿعْlāَw āَhyِf āَّnُk yِtَّlā َhَyْrَqْlā ِlَaʾْsāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., he lost his sight.
He did not express the extent of his grief or his anger at what he suspected his sons had done but was patient, depending only upon Allāh for help.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā َnِm ُmَlْʿعَaʾَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ yِnْzُḥَw yِّhtَb wُkْhsَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ َlāَq
َnwُrِfāَkْlā ُmْwَqْlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā ِḥْwَّr nِm ُsَaʾْyَy āَl ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllā ِḥْwَّr nِm āwُsَaʾْyَt āَlَw ِhyِhkَaʾَw َfُswُy nِm āwُsَّsَḥَtَf āwُbَhْhdā َّyِnَb āَy

َnyِqِّdَṣَtُmْlā yِzْjgَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ āَnْyَlَʿع ْqَّdَṣَtَw َlْyَkْlā āَnَl ِfْwَaʾَf ٍhāَjgْzُّm ٍhَʿعāَḍِbِb āَnْyʾِjgَw ُّrُّḍlā āَnَlْhَaʾَw āَnَّsَm ُzyِzَʿعْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq ِhْyَlَʿع āwُlَhkَd āَّmَlَf
َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā َrْjgَaʾ ُʿعyِḍُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ْrِbْṣَyَw ِqَّtَy nَm ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ āَnْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َّnَm ْdَq ۖ yِhkَaʾ āَhdٰـَhَw ُfُswُy āَnَaʾ َlāَq ۖ ُfُswُy َtnَaʾَl َkَّnِiʾَaʾ āwُlāَq
َnyِʿعَmْjgَaʾ ْmُkِlْhَaʾِb yِnwُtْaʾَw āًryِṣَb ِtْaʾَy yِbَaʾ ِhْjgَw ٰyَlَʿع ُhwُqْlَaʾَf āَhdٰـَh yِṣyِmَqِb āwُbَhْhdā

footnotes.text: To those present with him, either some of his sons or other relatives.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl āَm ِhَّllā َnِm ُmَlْʿعَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ْmُkَّl lُqَaʾ ْmَlَaʾ َlāَq ۖ āًryِṣَb َّdَtْrāَf ِhِhْjgَw ٰyَlَʿع ُhāَqْlَaʾ ُryِhsَbْlā َءāَjg nَaʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: He who carried Joseph's shirt from among the brothers.

ayas.translation: َnyِyʾِṭāَhk āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ āَnَbwُnُhd āَnَl ْrِfْغَtْsā āَnāَbَaʾ āَy āwُlāَq

ُmyِkَḥْlā ُmyِlَʿعْlā َwُh ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ُءāَhsَy āَmِّl ٌfyِṭَl yِّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ yِtَwْhkِiʾ َnْyَbَw yِnْyَb ُnāَṭْyَّhslā َغَzَّn nَaʾ ِdْʿعَb nِm ِwْdَbْlā َnِّm mُkِb َءāَjgَw ِnْjgِّslā َnِm yِnَjgَrْhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾ yِb َnَsْḥَaʾ ْdَqَw ۖ āًّqَḥ yِّbَr āَhَlَʿعَjg ْdَq ُlْbَq nِm َyāَyْwʾُr ُlyِwْaʾَt āَhdٰـَh ِtَbَaʾ āَy َlāَqَw ۖ āًdَّjgُs ُhَl āwُّrَhkَw ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ِhْyَwَbَaʾ َʿعَfَrَw

footnotes.text: That of greeting and respect, which was lawful until the time of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ). Prostration to any person or object other than Allāh was then prohibited conclusively.
Perceptive of unapparent matters within which is benefit to His servants.

ayas.translation: َnyِḥِlāَّṣlāِb yِnْqِḥْlَaʾَw āًmِlْsُm yِnَّfَwَt ۖ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf yِّyِlَw َtnَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َrِṭāَf ۚ ِhtyِdāَḥَaʾْlā ِlyِwْaʾَt nِm yِnَtْmَّlَʿعَw ِkْlُmْlā َnِm yِnَtْyَtāʾ ْdَq ِّbَr
َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā َnِm āَnَaʾ āَmَw ِhَّllā َnāَḥْbُsَw ۖ yِnَʿعَbَّtā ِnَmَw āَnَaʾ ٍhَryِṣَb ٰyَlَʿع ۚ ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ wُʿعْdَaʾ yِlyِbَs ِhِhdٰـَh ْlُq

َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۗ āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlِّl ٌrْyَhk ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrāَdَlَw ۗ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَfَaʾ ۗ ٰyَrُqْlā ِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm mِhْyَlِiʾ yِḥwُّn āًlāَjgِr āَّlِiʾ َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: Those who deny Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnyِmِrْjgُmْlā ِmْwَqْlā ِnَʿع āَnُsْaʾَb ُّdَrُy āَlَw ۖ ُءāَhsَّn nَm َyِّjgُnَf āَnُrْṣَn ْmُhَءāَjg āwُbِhdُk ْdَq ْmُhَّnَaʾ āwُّnَẓَw ُlُsُّrlā َsَaʾْyَtْsā āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ًhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk َlyِṣْfَtَw ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb yِhdَّlā َqyِdْṣَt nِkٰـَlَw ٰyَrَtْfُy āًhtyِdَḥ َnāَk āَm ۗ ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾِّl ٌhَrْbِʿع ْmِhِṣَṣَq yِf َnāَk ْdَqَl

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِqwُt ْmُkِّbَr ِءāَqِlِb mُkَّlَʿعَl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُlِّṣَfُy َrْmَaʾْlā ُrِّbَdُy ۚ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾِl yِrْjgَy ٌّlُk ۖ َrَmَqْlāَw َsْmَّhslā َrَّhkَsَw ۖ ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht ۖ āَhَnْwَrَt ٍdَmَʿع ِrْyَغِb ِtāَwāَmَّslā َʿعَfَr yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: See footnotes to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference> and <reference chapter="7" verses="54">7:54</reference>.
For the benefit of mankind.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ َrāَhَّnlā َlْyَّllā yِhsْغُy ۖ ِnْyَnْhtā ِnْyَjgْwَz āَhyِf َlَʿعَjg ِtāَrَmَّhtlā ِّlُk nِmَw ۖ āًrāَhْnَaʾَw َyِsāَwَr āَhyِf َlَʿعَjgَw َḍْrَaʾْlā َّdَm yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

footnotes.text: i.e., only one from a root.

ayas.translation: َnwُdِlāَhk āَhyِf ْmُh ۖ ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ ْmِhِqāَnْʿعَaʾ yِf ُlāَlْغَaʾْlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۖ ْmِhِّbَrِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۗ ٍdyِdَjg ٍqْlَhk yِfَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًbāَrُt āَّnُk āَhdِiʾَaʾ ْmُhُlْwَq ٌbَjgَʿعَf ْbَjgْʿعَt nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: At those who deny resurrection.
Iron collars to which their hands are chained.
They said, challenging the Prophet (ﷺ) in ridicule, "Bring on the punishment, if you are truthful," rather than asking for mercy and forgiveness from Allāh.
With absolute knowledge inclusive of every aspect of the fetus' existence.
Beyond their normal period of pregnancy and/or the number of fetuses therein.

ayas.translation: ٍlāَw nِm ِhِnwُd nِّm mُhَl āَmَw ۚ ُhَl َّdَrَm āَlَf āًءwُs ٍmْwَqِb ُhَّllā َdāَrَaʾ āَhdِiʾَw ۗ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِb āَm āwُrِّyَغُy ٰyَّtَḥ ٍmْwَqِb āَm ُrِّyَغُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhَّllā ِrْmَaʾ ْnِm ُhَnwُẓَfْḥَy ِhِfْlَhk ْnِmَw ِhْyَdَy ِnْyَb nِّm ٌtāَbِّqَʿعُm ُhَl

footnotes.text: Replacing each other by turn.
The phrase may also be rendered "...who guard him from [everything except] the decree of Allāh."
i.e., punishment or destruction because of their sins.

ayas.translation: ٍlāَlَḍ yِf āَّlِiʾ َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُءāَʿعُd āَmَw ۚ ِhِغِlāَbِb َwُh āَmَw ُhāَf َغُlْbَyِl ِءāَmْlā yَlِiʾ ِhْyَّfَk ِṭِsāَbَk āَّlِiʾ ٍءْyَhsِb mُhَl َnwُbyِjgَtْsَy āَl ِhِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَy َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ِّqَḥْlā ُhَwْʿعَd ُhَl

footnotes.text: The analogy indicates that false deities will never respond to them at all.

ayas.translation: ُrāَّhَqْlā ُdِḥāَwْlā َwُhَw ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ُqِlāَhk ُhَّllā ِlُq ۚ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ُqْlَhkْlā َhَbāَhsَtَf ِhِqْlَhkَk āwُqَlَhk َءāَkَrُhs ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعَjg ْmَaʾ ۗ ُrwُّnlāَw ُtāَmُlُّẓlā yِwَtْsَt ْlَh ْmَaʾ ُryِṣَbْlāَw ٰyَmْʿعَaʾْlā yِwَtْsَy ْlَh ْlُq ۚ āًّrَḍ āَlَw āًʿعْfَn ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِl َnwُkِlْmَy āَl َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ِhِnwُd nِّm mُtْhdَhkَّtāَfَaʾ ْlُq ۚ ُhَّllā ِlُq ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُّbَّr nَm ْlُq

footnotes.text: The obvious conclusion is that the claimed partners, having no ability to create, cannot be compared to Allāh in any way.
Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="12" verses="39">12:39</reference>.

ayas.translation: َlāَhtْmَaʾْlā ُhَّllā ُbِrْḍَy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُhtُkْmَyَf َsāَّnlā ُʿعَfnَy āَm āَّmَaʾَw ۖ ًءāَfُjg ُbَhْhdَyَf ُdَbَّzlā āَّmَaʾَf ۚ َlِṭāَbْlāَw َّqَḥْlā ُhَّllā ُbِrْḍَy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ُhُlْhtِّm ٌdَbَz ٍʿعāَtَm ْwَaʾ ٍhَyْlِḥ َءāَغِtْbā ِrāَّnlā yِf ِhْyَlَʿع َnwُdِqwُy āَّmِmَw ۚ āًyِbāَّr āًdَbَz ُlْyَّslā َlَmَtْḥāَf āَhِrَdَqِb ٌhَyِdْwَaʾ ْtَlāَsَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَznَaʾ

ُdāَhِmْlā َsْyʾِbَw ۖ ُmَّnَhَjg ْmُhāَwْaʾَmَw ِbāَsِḥْlā ُءwُs ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ِhِb āْwَdَtْfāَl ُhَʿعَm ُhَlْhtِmَw āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَّm mُhَl َّnَaʾ ْwَl ُhَl āwُbyِjgَtْsَy ْmَl َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ٰyَnْsُḥْlā ُmِhِّbَrِl āwُbāَjgَtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl

footnotes.text: i.e., they uphold the ties of relationship.

ayas.translation: ِrāَّdlā yَbْqُʿع ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ َhَyʾِّyَّslā ِhَnَsَḥْlāِb َnwُءَrْdَyَw ًhَyِnāَlَʿعَw āًّrِs ْmُhāَnْqَzَr āَّmِm āwُqَfnَaʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmāَqَaʾَw ْmِhِّbَr ِhْjgَw َءāَغِtْbā āwُrَbَṣ َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the world and its trials, its good consequence being Paradise.
i.e., Hell. Another meaning is (in contrast to <reference chapter="13" verses="22">verse 22</reference>), "...and they will have the bad consequence of [this] home," also referring to Hell.

ayas.translation: ٌʿعāَtَm āَّlِiʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā āَmَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlāِb āwُḥِrَfَw ۚ ُrِdْqَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَmِl َqْzِّrlā ُṭُsْbَy ُhَّllā

ِbāَtَm ِhْyَlِiʾَw ُtْlَّkَwَt ِhْyَlَʿع َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl yِّbَr َwُh ْlُq ۚ ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlāِb َnwُrُfْkَy ْmُhَw َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ yِhdَّlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َwُlْtَtِّl ٌmَmُaʾ āَhِlْbَq nِm ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٍhَّmُaʾ yِf َkāَnْlَsْrَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَk

َdāَʿعyِmْlā ُfِlْhkُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā ُdْʿعَw َyِtْaʾَy ٰyَّtَḥ ْmِhِrāَd nِّm āًbyِrَq ُّlُḥَt ْwَaʾ ٌhَʿعِrāَq āwُʿعَnَṣ āَmِb mُhُbyِṣُt āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُlāَzَy āَlَw ۗ āًʿعyِmَjg َsāَّnlā yَdَhَl ُhَّllā ُءāَhsَy ْwَّl nَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِsَaʾْyَy ْmَlَfَaʾ ۗ āًʿعyِmَjg ُrْmَaʾْlā ِhَّlِّl lَb ۗ ٰyَtْwَmْlā ِhِb َmِّlُk ْwَaʾ ُḍْrَaʾْlā ِhِb ْtَʿعِّṭُq ْwَaʾ ُlāَbِjgْlā ِhِb ْtَrِّyُs āًnāʾْrُq َّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: As suggested by the disbelievers.

ayas.translation: ٍdāَh ْnِm ُhَl āَmَf ُhَّllā ِlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۗ ِlyِbَّslā ِnَʿع āwُّdُṣَw ْmُhُrْkَm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlِl َnِّyُz ْlَb ۗ ِlْwَqْlā َnِّm ٍrِhāَẓِb mَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُmَlْʿعَy āَl āَmِb ُhَnwُyʾِّbَnُt ْmَaʾ ۚ ْmُhwُّmَs ْlُq َءāَkَrُhs ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعَjgَw ۗ ْtَbَsَk āَmِb ٍsْfَn ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ٌmِyʾāَq َwُh ْnَmَfَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., other "deities."
i.e., your attributing of divinity to other than Allāh.

ayas.translation: ُrāَّnlā َnyِrِfāَkْlā yَbْqُʿعَّw ۖ āwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlā yَbْqُʿع َkْlِt ۚ āَhُّlِẓَw ٌmِyʾāَd āَhُlُkُaʾ ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ۖ َnwُqَّtُmْlā َdِʿعُw yِtَّlā ِhَّnَjgْlā ُlَhtَّm
ٍqāَw āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhَّllā َnِm َkَl āَm ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِm َkَءāَjg āَm َdْʿعَb mُhَءāَwْhَaʾ َtْʿعَbَّtā ِnِyʾَlَw ۚ āًّyِbَrَʿع āًmْkُḥ ُhāَnْlَznَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: i.e., revealed in the Arabic language.

ayas.translation: ٌbāَtِk ٍlَjgَaʾ ِّlُkِl ۗ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ٍhَyāʾِb َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ٍlwُsَrِl َnāَk āَmَw ۚ ًhَّyِّrُhdَw āًjgāَwْzَaʾ ْmُhَl āَnْlَʿعَjgَw َkِlْbَq nِّm āًlُsُr āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), in which is inscribed the original of every scripture revealed by Allāh.

ayas.translation: ِbāَsِḥْlā ُʿعyِrَs َwُhَw ۚ ِhِmْkُḥِl َbِّqَʿعُm āَl ُmُkْḥَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ āَhِfāَrْṭَaʾ ْnِm āَhُṣُqnَn َḍْrَaʾْlā yِtْaʾَn āَّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: Referring to the spread of Islām through Allāh's Prophet (ﷺ) and the diminishing of those areas controlled by the polytheists.
i.e., those who recognize the truth through their knowledge of previous scriptures.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍdyِʿعَb ٍlāَlَḍ yِf َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āًjgَwِʿع āَhَnwُغْbَyَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّdُṣَyَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yَlَʿع āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā َnwُّbِḥَtْsَy َnyِhdَّlā
ُmyِkَḥْlā ُzyِzَʿعْlā َwُhَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِdْhَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَm ُhَّllā ُّlِḍُyَf ۖ ْmُhَl َnِّyَbُyِl ِhِmْwَq ِnāَsِlِb āَّlِiʾ ٍlwُsَّr nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., those who refuse His guidance.
Days of blessings bestowed upon the Children of Israel. Also interpreted as days of punishment and destruction of the former nations.

ayas.translation: ٍbyِrُm ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnَnwُʿعْdَt āَّmِّm ٍّkَhs yِfَl āَّnِiʾَw ِhِb mُtْlِsْrُaʾ āَmِb āَnْrَfَk āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَqَw ْmِhِhāَwْfَaʾ yِf ْmُhَyِdْyَaʾ āwُّdَrَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjg ۚ ُhَّllā āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُmَlْʿعَy āَl ۛ ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِm َnyِhdَّlāَw ۛ َdwُmَhtَw ٍdāَʿعَw ٍḥwُn ِmْwَq ْmُkِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā ُaʾَbَn ْmُkِtْaʾَy ْmَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: Several explanations have been given as to the meaning. Based upon the conclusion of the verse, Ibn Katheer preferred that this was a gesture of denial and rejection.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍnāَṭْlُsِb āَnwُtْaʾَf āَnُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy َnāَk āَّmَʿع āَnwُّdُṣَt nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُt āَnُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ āwُlāَq ۚ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُkَrِّhkَwʾُyَw ْmُkِbwُnُhd nِّm mُkَl َrِfْغَyِl ْmُkwُʿعْdَy ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ِrِṭāَf ٌّkَhs ِhَّllā yِfَaʾ ْmُhُlُsُr ْtَlāَq

َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۚ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ٍnāَṭْlُsِb mُkَyِtْaʾَّn nَaʾ āَnَl َnāَk āَmَw ۖ ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَm ٰyَlَʿع ُّnُmَy َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw ْmُkُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ ُnْḥَّn nِiʾ ْmُhُlُsُr ْmُhَl ْtَlāَq
َnwُlِّkَwَtُmْlā ِlَّkَwَtَyْlَf ِhَّllā yَlَʿعَw ۚ āَnwُmُtْyَhdāʾ āَm ٰyَlَʿع َّnَrِbْṣَnَlَw ۚ āَnَlُbُs āَnāَdَh ْdَqَw ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َlَّkَwَtَn āَّlَaʾ āَnَl āَmَw

footnotes.text: An alternative meaning is "the standing [for account] before Me."
Literally, "after him [in time]," meaning ahead of him.
That which oozes from the skins of Hell's inhabitants.

ayas.translation: ٍṣyِḥَّm nِm āَnَl āَm āَnْrَbَṣ ْmَaʾ āَnْʿعِzَjgَaʾ āَnْyَlَʿع ٌءāَwَs ۖ ْmُkāَnْyَdَhَl ُhَّllā āَnāَdَh ْwَl āwُlāَq ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllā ِbāَhdَʿع ْnِm āَّnَʿع َnwُnْغُّm mُtnَaʾ ْlَhَf āًʿعَbَt ْmُkَl āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl ُءāَfَʿعُّḍlā َlāَqَf āًʿعyِmَjg ِhَّlِl āwُzَrَbَw

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َّnِiʾ ۗ ُlْbَq nِm ِnwُmُtْkَrْhsَaʾ āَmِb ُtْrَfَk yِّnِiʾ ۖ َّyِhkِrْṣُmِb mُtnَaʾ āَmَw ْmُkِhkِrْṣُmِb āَnَaʾ āَّm ۖ mُkَsُfnَaʾ āwُmwُlَw yِnwُmwُlَt āَlَf ۖ yِl ْmُtْbَjgَtْsāَf ْmُkُtْwَʿعَd nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍnāَṭْlُs nِّm mُkْyَlَʿع َyِl َnāَk āَmَw ۖ ْmُkُtْfَlْhkَaʾَf ْmُkُّtdَʿعَwَw ِّqَḥْlā َdْʿعَw ْmُkَdَʿعَw َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ُrْmَaʾْlā َyِḍُq āَّmَl ُnāَṭْyَّhslā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: By your obedience to me instead of Him during life on earth.

ayas.translation: ٌmāَlَs āَhyِf ْmُhُtَّyِḥَt ۖ ْmِhِّbَr ِnْhdِiʾِb āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َlِhkْdُaʾَw

footnotes.text: The testimony that there is no deity except Allāh and that Muḥammad (ﷺ) is the messenger of Allāh.
When questioned in their graves by the angels after death.
They met Allāh's blessing with denial instead of gratitude.

ayas.translation: ِrāَّnlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkَryِṣَm َّnِiʾَf āwُʿعَّtَmَt ْlُq ۗ ِhِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّlِḍُyِّl āًdāَdnَaʾ ِhَّlِl āwُlَʿعَjgَw
ٌlāَlِhk āَlَw ِhyِf ٌʿعْyَb āَّl ٌmْwَy َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِّm ًhَyِnāَlَʿعَw āًّrِs ْmُhāَnْqَzَr āَّmِm āwُqِfnُyَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqُy āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َyِdāَbِʿعِّl lُq

footnotes.text: i.e., made serviceable to you.

ayas.translation: ٌrāَّfَk ٌmwُlَẓَl َnāَsnِiʾْlā َّnِiʾ ۗ āَhwُṣْḥُt āَl ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُّdُʿعَt nِiʾَw ۚ ُhwُmُtْlَaʾَs āَm ِّlُk nِّm mُkāَtāʾَw

footnotes.text: Something of what you asked and all of what you continually require, according to His wisdom.
i.e., disbelieving and denying of Allāh's favor.
i.e., of my religion.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْhsَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl ِtāَrَmَّhtlā َnِّm mُhْqُzْrāَw ْmِhْyَlِiʾ yِwْhَt ِsāَّnlā َnِّm ًhَdِyʾْfَaʾ ْlَʿعْjgāَf َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqُyِl āَnَّbَr ِmَّrَḥُmْlā َkِtْyَb َdnِʿع ٍʿعْrَz yِhd ِrْyَغ ٍdāَwِb yِtَّyِّrُhd nِm ُtnَkْsَaʾ yِّnِiʾ āَnَّbَّr
ِءāَmَّslā yِf āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ٰyَfْhkَy āَmَw ۗ ُnِlْʿعُn āَmَw yِfْhkُn āَm ُmَlْʿعَt َkَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَr

footnotes.text: This is their state at the time of resurrection from the graves. Their heads are upraised in fixed stares of terror, unable even to glance back.

ayas.translation: ٍlāَwَz nِّm mُkَl āَm ُlْbَq nِّm mُtْmَsْqَaʾ āwُnwُkَt ْmَlَwَaʾ ۗ َlُsُّrlā ِʿعِbَّtَnَw َkَtَwْʿعَd ْbِjgُّn ٍbyِrَq ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْrِّhkَaʾ āَnَّbَr āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَyَf ُbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmِhyِtْaʾَy َmْwَy َsāَّnlā ِrِhdnَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Of the blessings which Allāh had bestowed upon you during life on earth.
An alternative meaning is "...and their plan was not [sufficient] to do away with the mountains," i.e., it had no effect against Allāh's will.
Refer to footnote for <reference chapter="3" verses="5">3:5</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
On the Day of Judgement or at the time of death.
Literally, "possessed by jinn."
i.e., with a message or, as the conclusion of the verse suggests, to carry out a promised punishment.

ayas.translation: ٍnwُzْwَّm ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf āَnْtَbnَaʾَw َyِsāَwَr āَhyِf āَnْyَqْlَaʾَw āَhāَnْdَdَm َḍْrَaʾْlāَw

footnotes.text: Allāh has put at your service other men and animals for which He provides. An additional meaning is that Allāh provides means for your living and for all other creatures as well.

ayas.translation: ٍmwُlْʿعَّm ٍrَdَqِb āَّlِiʾ ُhُlِّzَnُn āَmَw ُhُnِyʾāَzَhk āَnَdnِʿع āَّlِiʾ ٍءْyَhs nِّm nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Causing precipitation in rainclouds or carrying pollen. Another meaning is "pregnant winds," i.e., those carrying rainclouds.
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) remains after all creation has passed away.
The element of life and soul which Allāh created for that body, not His own spirit or part of Himself (as some mistakenly believe).
Who was of the jinn. See <reference chapter="18" verses="50">18:50</reference>.
Your position in the heavens.
See footnote to <reference chapter="7" verses="43">7:43</reference>.
For having collaborated with the evildoers.
At the news of Lot's visitors.
i.e., the women of his community who were lawful for marriage.
See footnote to <reference chapter="11" verses="67">11:67</reference>.
The valley of stone.
Referring to Sūrah al-Fātiḥah.
Those who separated from the teachings of their prophets. Another meaning is "As We sent down [punishment] on the sworn opponents [to Allāh's message]."
Accepting part and rejecting part according to their own inclinations.
The implication is "Thereby you will distinguish or separate the disbelievers from the believers."
Any who persist in association of others with Allāh.
Literally, "has come," indicating the certainty and nearness of the Last Hour.
As soon as he becomes strong and independent.
i.e., in clothing, tents, furnishings, etc.
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has taken it upon Himself to guide man to the right path. The meaning has also been interpreted as "To Allāh..."

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَlَw ِhِlْḍَf nِm āwُغَtْbَtِlَw ِhyِf َrِhkāَwَm َkْlُfْlā yَrَtَw āَhَnwُsَbْlَt ًhَyْlِḥ ُhْnِm āwُjgِrْhkَtْsَtَw āًّyِrَṭ āًmْḥَl ُhْnِm āwُlُkْaʾَtِl َrْḥَbْlā َrَّhkَs yِhdَّlā َwُhَw

footnotes.text: Through the desert or the sea at night.
i.e., inanimate or without understanding.
i.e., Allāh caused their plan to fail and exposed their plot.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ٰyَlَb ۚ ٍءwُs nِm ُlَmْʿعَn āَّnُk āَm َmَlَّslā āُwَqْlَaʾَf ۖ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِmِlāَẓ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmُhāَّfَwَtَt َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: i.e., having made punishment due to them for their numerous sins and crimes.

ayas.translation: َnyِqَّtُmْlā ُrāَd َmْʿعِnَlَw ۚ ٌrْyَhk ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrāَdَlَw ۚ ٌhَnَsَḥ āَyْnُّdlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِf āwُnَsْḥَaʾ َnyِhdَّlِّl ۗ āًrْyَhk āwُlāَq ۚ ْmُkُّbَr َlَznَaʾ āَhdāَm āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlِl َlyِqَw
َnyِqَّtُmْlā ُhَّllā yِzْjgَy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ َnwُءāَhsَy āَm āَhyِf ْmُhَl ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt āَhَnwُlُhkْdَy ٍnْdَʿع ُtāَّnَjg

َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw ُhَّllā ُmُhَmَlَẓ āَmَw ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َlَʿعَf َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ َkِّbَr ُrْmَaʾ َyِtْaʾَy ْwَaʾ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmُhَyِtْaʾَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ْlَh

ُnyِbُmْlā ُغāَlَbْlā āَّlِiʾ ِlُsُّrlā yَlَʿع ْlَhَf ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َlَʿعَf َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhِnwُd nِm āَnْmَّrَḥ āَlَw āَnُwʾāَbāʾ āَlَw ُnْḥَّn ٍءْyَhs nِm ِhِnwُd nِm āَnْdَbَʿع āَm ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَl āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

َnyِbِّhdَkُmْlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnāَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَf ۚ ُhَlāَlَّḍlā ِhْyَlَʿع ْtَّqَḥ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَw ُhَّllā yَdَh ْnَّm mُhْnِmَf ۖ َtwُغāَّṭlā āwُbِnَtْjgāَw َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِnَaʾ āًlwُsَّr ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُk yِf āَnْhtَʿعَb ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: False objects of worship.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِṣāَّn nِّm mُhَl āَmَw ۖ ُّlِḍُy nَm yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ْmُhāَdُh ٰyَlَʿع ْṣِrْḥَt nِiʾ

footnotes.text: As a result of their choice to reject guidance.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw āًّqَḥ ِhْyَlَʿع āًdْʿعَw ٰyَlَb ۚ ُtwُmَy nَm ُhَّllā ُhtَʿعْbَy āَl ۙ ْmِhِnāَmْyَaʾ َdْhَjg ِhَّllāِb āwُmَsْqَaʾَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَy āwُnāَk ْwَl ۚ ُrَbْkَaʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrْjgَaʾَlَw ۖ ًhَnَsَḥ āَyْnُّdlā yِf ْmُhَّnَyʾِّwَbُnَl āwُmِlُẓ āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm ِhَّllā yِf āwُrَjgāَh َnyِhdَّlāَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِrْkِّhdlā َlْhَaʾ āwُlَaʾْsāَf ۚ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ yِḥwُّn āًlāَjgِr āَّlِiʾ َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., being aware of what is about to strike them after having seen those near them succumb.
Postponing deserved punishment and giving opportunities for repentance.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِbْkَtْsَy āَl ْmُhَw ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlāَw ٍhَّbāَd nِm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُdُjgْsَy ِhَّlِlَw

footnotes.text: Meaning more than one.
i.e., that of which they have no knowledge; rather, they have mere assumption based upon tradition or the claims of misguided men.
By claiming that the angels are His daughters.
Such as that described in the previous two verses.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِdْqَtْsَy āَlَw ۖ ًhَʿعāَs َnwُrِhkْaʾَtْsَy āَl ْmُhُlَjgَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۖ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُrِّhkَwʾُy nِkٰـَlَw ٍhَّbāَd nِm āَhْyَlَʿع َkَrَt āَّm mِhِmْlُẓِb َsāَّnlā ُhَّllā ُhdِhkāَwʾُy ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Another meaning is "...and they will be made to precede [all others thereto]."

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ًhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ۙ ِhyِf āwُfَlَtْhkā yِhdَّlā ُmُhَl َnِّyَbُtِl āَّlِiʾ َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَmَw
َnyِbِrāَّhslِّl āًغِyʾāَs āًṣِlāَhk āًnَbَّl ٍmَdَw ٍhtْrَf ِnْyَb nِm ِhِnwُṭُb yِf āَّmِّm mُkyِqْsُّn ۖ ًhَrْbِʿعَl ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā yِf ْmُkَl َّnِiʾَw

footnotes.text: This verse was revealed before the prohibition of intoxicants. It alludes to the fact that there are both evil and good possibilities in certain things.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِّl ًhَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۗ ِsāَّnlِّl ٌءāَfِhs ِhyِf ُhُnāَwْlَaʾ ٌfِlَtْhkُّm ٌbāَrَhs āَhِnwُṭُb nِm ُjgُrْhkَy ۚ āًlُlُhd ِkِّbَr َlُbُs yِkُlْsāَf ِtāَrَmَّhtlā ِّlُk nِm yِlُk َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., delicious substances found by the bee.
The argument presented in this verse is that if they cannot consider their own possessions equal to themselves, then how can they consider Allāh's creations as being equal to Him?

ayas.translation: َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َnِّm āًqْzِr ْmُhَl ُkِlْmَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَyَw

footnotes.text: As there is nothing comparable to Him.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā ۚ َnwُwَtْsَy ْlَh ۖ āًrْhَjgَw āًّrِs ُhْnِm ُqِfnُy َwُhَf āًnَsَḥ āًqْzِr āَّnِm ُhāَnْqَzَّr nَmَw ٍءْyَhs ٰyَlَʿع ُrِdْqَy āَّl āًkwُlْmَّm āًdْbَʿع āًlَhtَm ُhَّllā َbَrَḍ

ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlَʿع َwُhَw ۙ ِlْdَʿعْlāِb ُrُmْaʾَy nَmَw َwُh yِwَtْsَy ْlَh ۖ ٍrْyَhkِb ِtْaʾَy āَl ُّhhِّjgَwُy āَmَnْyَaʾ ُhāَlْwَm ٰyَlَʿع ٌّlَk َwُhَw ٍءْyَhs ٰyَlَʿع ُrِdْqَy āَl ُmَkْbَaʾ āَmُhُdَḥَaʾ ِnْyَlُjgَّr āًlَhtَm ُhَّllā َbَrَḍَw
َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۗ ُhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َّnُhُkِsْmُy āَm ِءāَmَّslā ِّwَjg yِf ٍtāَrَّhkَsُm ِrْyَّṭlā yَlِiʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَaʾ

ٍnyِḥ ٰyَlِiʾ āًʿعāَtَmَw āًhtāَhtَaʾ āَhِrāَʿعْhsَaʾَw āَhِrāَbْwَaʾَw āَhِfāَwْṣَaʾ ْnِmَw ۙ ْmُkِtَmāَqِiʾ َmْwَyَw ْmُkِnْʿعَẓ َmْwَy āَhَnwُّfِhkَtْsَt āًtwُyُb ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ِdwُlُjg nِّm mُkَl َlَʿعَjgَw āًnَkَs ْmُkِtwُyُb nِّm mُkَl َlَʿعَjg ُhَّllāَw

َnwُmِlْsُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُhَtَmْʿعِn ُّmِtُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ْmُkَsْaʾَb mُkyِqَt َlyِbāَrَsَw َّrَḥْlā ُmُkyِqَt َlyِbāَrَs ْmُkَl َlَʿعَjgَw āًnāَnْkَaʾ ِlāَbِjgْlā َnِّm mُkَl َlَʿعَjgَw āًlāَlِẓ َqَlَhk āَّmِّm mُkَl َlَʿعَjg ُhَّllāَw

َnwُbِhdāَkَl ْmُkَّnِiʾ َlْwَqْlā ُmِhْyَlِiʾ āْwَqْlَaʾَf ۖ َkِnwُd nِm wُʿعْdَn āَّnُk َnyِhdَّlā āَnُwʾāَkَrُhs ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq ْmُhَءāَkَrُhs āwُkَrْhsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā yَaʾَr āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُdِsْfُy āwُnāَk āَmِb ِbāَhdَʿعْlā َqْwَf āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُhāَnْdِz ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّdَṣَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā

َnyِmِlْsُmْlِl ٰyَrْhsُbَw ًhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِّl āًnāَyْbِt َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَّzَnَw ۚ ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ٰyَlَʿع āًdyِhَhs َkِb āَnْyʾِjgَw ۖ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ْnِّm mِhْyَlَʿع āًdyِhَhs ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُk yِf ُhtَʿعْbَn َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: Those who have submitted themselves to Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَʿعْfَt āَm ُmَlْʿعَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًlyِfَk ْmُkْyَlَʿع َhَّllā ُmُtْlَʿعَjg ْdَqَw āَhِdyِkْwَt َdْʿعَb َnāَmْyَaʾْlā āwُḍُqnَt āَlَw ْmُّtdَhāَʿع āَhdِiʾ ِhَّllā ِdْhَʿعِb āwُfْwَaʾَw

َnwُfِlَtْhkَt ِhyِf ْmُtnُk āَm ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُkَl َّnَnِّyَbُyَlَw ۚ ِhِb ُhَّllā ُmُkwُlْbَy āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ ٍhَّmُaʾ ْnِm ٰyَbْrَaʾ َyِh ٌhَّmُaʾ َnwُkَt nَaʾ ْmُkَnْyَb āًlَhkَd ْmُkَnāَmْyَaʾ َnwُhdِhkَّtَt āًhtāَknَaʾ ٍhَّwُq ِdْʿعَb nِm āَhَlْzَغ ْtَḍَqَn yِtَّlāَk āwُnwُkَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., do not swear falsely or break a treaty or contract merely for a worldly advantage.
According to His knowledge of each soul's preference.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُkَlَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع ْmُّtdَdَṣ āَmِb َءwُّslā āwُqwُhdَtَw āَhِtwُbُht َdْʿعَb ٌmَdَq َّlِzَtَf ْmُkَnْyَb āًlَhkَd ْmُkَnāَmْyَaʾ āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Referring to those who would be dissuaded from Islām as a result of a Muslim's deceit and treachery.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُh ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَmَّnِiʾ ۚ āًlyِlَq āًnَmَht ِhَّllā ِdْhَʿعِb āwُrَtْhsَt āَlَw
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm ِnَsْḥَaʾِb mُhَrْjgَaʾ āwُrَbَṣ َnyِhdَّlā َّnَyِzْjgَnَlَw ۗ ٍqāَb ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَmَw ۖ ُdَfnَy ْmُkَdnِʿع āَm
َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ٍrَtْfُm َtnَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ُlِّzَnُy āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllāَw ۙ ٍhَyāʾ َnāَkَّm ًhَyāʾ āَnْlَّdَb āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Having seen the Prophet (ﷺ) speaking with a foreign man on occasion, the Quraysh accused him of repeating the man's words.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ِhَّllā َnِّm ٌbَḍَغ ْmِhْyَlَʿعَf āًrْdَṣ ِrْfُkْlāِb َḥَrَhs nَّm nِkٰـَlَw ِnāَmyِiʾْlāِb ٌّnِyʾَmْṭُm ُhُbْlَqَw َhِrْkُaʾ ْnَm āَّlِiʾ ِhِnāَmyِiʾ ِdْʿعَb nِm ِhَّllāِb َrَfَk nَm

footnotes.text: Based upon the conclusion of this verse, the omitted phrase concerning the apostate is understood to be "...has earned the wrath of Allāh..."

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغَl āَhِdْʿعَb nِm َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ āwُrَbَṣَw āwُdَhāَjg َّmُht āwُnِtُf āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āwُrَjgāَh َnyِhdَّlِl َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ َّmُht

َnwُʿعَnْṣَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ِfْwَhkْlāَw ِʿعwُjgْlā َsāَbِl ُhَّllā āَhَqāَhdَaʾَf ِhَّllā ِmُʿعْnَaʾِb ْtَrَfَkَf ٍnāَkَm ِّlُk nِّm āًdَغَr āَhُqْzِr āَhyِtْaʾَy ًhَّnِyʾَmْṭُّm ًhَnِmāʾ ْtَnāَk ًhَyْrَq āًlَhtَm ُhَّllā َbَrَḍَw
َnwُdُbْʿعَt ُhāَّyِiʾ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhsāَw āًbِّyَṭ āًlāَlَḥ ُhَّllā ُmُkَqَzَr āَّmِm āwُlُkَf

footnotes.text: Those not slaughtered or hunted expressly for food.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِlْfُy āَl َbِhdَkْlā ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َnwُrَtْfَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ َbِhdَkْlā ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُrَtْfَtِّl ٌmāَrَḥ āَhdٰـَhَw ٌlāَlَḥ āَhdٰـَh َbِhdَkْlā ُmُkُtَnِsْlَaʾ ُfِṣَt āَmِl āwُlwُqَt āَlَw
َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw ْmُhāَnْmَlَẓ āَmَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm َkْyَlَʿع āَnْṣَṣَq āَm āَnْmَّrَḥ āwُdāَh َnyِhdَّlā yَlَʿعَw

footnotes.text: See <reference chapter="6" verses="146">6:146</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغَl āَhِdْʿعَb nِm َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ āwُḥَlْṣَaʾَw َkِlَٰhd ِdْʿعَb nِm āwُbāَt َّmُht ٍhَlāَhَjgِb َءwُّslā āwُlِmَʿع َnyِhdَّlِl َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., embodying all the excellent qualities which make one an example to be followed.
Not exceeding it.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْmَy āَّmِّm ٍqْyَḍ yِf ُkَt āَlَw ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْnَzْḥَt āَlَw ۚ ِhَّllāِb āَّlِiʾ َkُrْbَṣ āَmَw ْrِbْṣāَw

ُryِṣَbْlā ُʿعyِmَّslā َwُh ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āَnِtāَyāʾ ْnِm ُhَyِrُnِl ُhَlْwَḥ āَnْkَrāَb yِhdَّlā yَṣْqَaʾْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā yَlِiʾ ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā َnِّm āًlْyَl ِhِdْbَʿعِb ٰyَrْsَaʾ yِhdَّlā َnāَḥْbُs ِmyِḥَّrlā ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِhَّllā ِmْsِb

footnotes.text: Above any imperfection or failure to do as He wills.
In Jerusalem.
Who hears every sound, distinguishes every voice, understands every word, and accepts and responds to supplications.
Who sees and understands all things apparent and unapparent, visible and invisible.

ayas.translation: āًlyِkَw yِnwُd nِm āwُhdِhkَّtَt āَّlَaʾ َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِّl yًdُh ُhāَnْlَʿعَjgَw َbāَtِkْlā yَswُm āَnْyَtāʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., trust in Allāh, knowing that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) is responsible for every occurrence.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَk āًّwُlُʿع َّnُlْʿعَtَlَw ِnْyَtَّrَm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َّnُdِsْfُtَl ِbāَtِkْlā yِf َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḍَqَw

footnotes.text: Foretold out of divine knowledge of what they would do.

ayas.translation: āًlwُʿعْfَّm āًdْʿعَw َnāَkَw ۚ ِrāَyِّdlā َlāَlِhk āwُsāَjgَf ٍdyِdَhs ٍsْaʾَb yِlwُaʾ āَnَّl āًdāَbِʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع āَnْhtَʿعَb āَmُhāَlwُaʾ ُdْʿعَw َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., the promised punishment for the first of their two transgressions.
Violating their sanctity, to kill and plunder.

ayas.translation: āًryِbْtَt āْwَlَʿع āَm āwُrِّbَtُyِlَw ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ُhwُlَhkَd āَmَk َdِjgْsَmْlā āwُlُhkْdَyِlَw ْmُkَhwُjgُw āwُءwُsَyِl ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُdْʿعَw َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۚ āَhَlَf ْmُtْaʾَsَaʾ ْnِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾِl ْmُtnَsْḥَaʾ ْmُtnَsْḥَaʾ ْnِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., impatient, emotional, and acting without forethought.

ayas.translation: āًlyِṣْfَt ُhāَnْlَّṣَf ٍءْyَhs َّlُkَw ۚ َbāَsِḥْlāَw َnyِnِّslā َdَdَʿع āwُmَlْʿعَtِlَw ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm āًlْḍَf āwُغَtْbَtِّl ًhَrِṣْbُm ِrāَhَّnlā َhَyāʾ āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ِlْyَّllā َhَyāʾ āَnْwَḥَmَf ۖ ِnْyَtَyāʾ َrāَhَّnlāَw َlْyَّllā āَnْlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: Or "giving sight."
i.e., after having instructed him, We have made him responsible for his own destiny.

ayas.translation: āًlwُsَr َhtَʿعْbَn ٰyَّtَḥ َnyِbِّhdَʿعُm āَّnُk āَmَw ۗ ٰyَrْhkُaʾ َrْzِw ٌhَrِzāَw ُrِzَt āَlَw ۚ āَhْyَlَʿع ُّlِḍَy āَmَّnِiʾَf َّlَḍ nَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَnِl yِdَtْhَy āَmَّnِiʾَf ٰyَdَtْhā ِnَّm
āًryِmْdَt āَhāَnْrَّmَdَf ُlْwَqْlā āَhْyَlَʿع َّqَḥَf āَhyِf āwُqَsَfَf āَhyِfَrْtُm āَnْrَmَaʾ ًhَyْrَq َkِlْhُّn nَaʾ āَnْdَrَaʾ āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: To obey Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًrwُḥْdَّm āًmwُmْhdَm āَhāَlْṣَy َmَّnَhَjg ُhَl āَnْlَʿعَjg َّmُht ُdyِrُّn nَmِl ُءāَhsَn āَm āَhyِf ُhَl āَnْlَّjgَʿع َhَlِjgāَʿعْlā ُdyِrُy َnāَk nَّm

footnotes.text: i.e., worldly gratifications.

ayas.translation: āًmyِrَk āًlْwَq āَmُhَّl lُqَw āَmُhْrَhْnَt āَlَw ٍّfُaʾ āَmُhَّl lُqَt āَlَf āَmُhāَlِk ْwَaʾ āَmُhُdَḥَaʾ َrَbِkْlā َkَdnِʿع َّnَغُlْbَy āَّmِiʾ ۚ āًnāَsْḥِiʾ ِnْyَdِlāَwْlāِbَw ُhāَّyِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āwُdُbْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ َkُّbَr ٰyَḍَqَw

footnotes.text: An expression of disapproval or irritation.

ayas.translation: āًryِغَṣ yِnāَyَّbَr āَmَk āَmُhْmَḥْrā ِّbَّr lُqَw ِhَmْḥَّrlā َnِm ِّlُّhdlā َḥāَnَjg āَmُhَl ْḍِfْhkāَw

footnotes.text: For those who intend righteousness, hastening to repent from sins and errors committed through human weakness, Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) promises forgiveness.
i.e., on that which is unlawful or in disobedience to Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًrwُsْyَّm āًlْwَq ْmُhَّl lُqَf āَhwُjgْrَt َkِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَmْḥَr َءāَغِtْbā ُmُhْnَʿع َّnَḍِrْʿعُt āَّmِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., if you have not the means to give them at present.
i.e., refusing to spend.
i.e., being extravagant.
i.e., avoid all situations that might possibly lead to it.

ayas.translation: āًrwُṣnَm َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِlْtَqْlā yِّf fِrْsُy āَlَf āًnāَṭْlُs ِhِّyِlَwِl āَnْlَʿعَjg ْdَqَf āًmwُlْẓَm َlِtُq nَmَw ۗ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَّlِiʾ ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ yِtَّlā َsْfَّnlā āwُlُtْqَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., through legal justice or during jihād.
Grounds for legal action.

ayas.translation: āًlwُyʾْsَm َnāَk َdْhَʿعْlā َّnِiʾ ۖ ِdْhَʿعْlāِb āwُfْwَaʾَw ۚ ُhَّdُhsَaʾ َغُlْbَy ٰyَّtَḥ ُnَsْḥَaʾ َyِh yِtَّlāِb āَّlِiʾ ِmyِtَyْlā َlāَm āwُbَrْqَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., to improve or increase it.
i.e., do not assume and do not say.

ayas.translation: āًlwُṭ َlāَbِjgْlā َغُlْbَt nَlَw َḍْrَaʾْlā َqِrْhkَt nَl َkَّnِiʾ ۖ āًḥَrَm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ِhsْmَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Man, for all his arrogance, is yet a weak and small creature.

ayas.translation: āًrwُḥْdَّm āًmwُlَm َmَّnَhَjg yِf ٰyَqْlُtَf َrَhkāʾ āًhٰـَlِiʾ ِhَّllā َʿعَm ْlَʿعْjgَt āَlَw ۗ ِhَmْkِḥْlā َnِm َkُّbَr َkْyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥْwَaʾ āَّmِm َkِlَٰhd
āًrwُfُn āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُdyِzَy āَmَw āwُrَّkَّhdَyِl ِnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh yِf āَnْfَّrَṣ ْdَqَlَw
āًlyِbَs ِhsْrَʿعْlā yِhd ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَغَtْbāَّl āًhdِiʾ َnwُlwُqَy āَmَk ٌhَhِlāʾ ُhَʿعَm َnāَk ْwَّl lُq

footnotes.text: To please Him, recognizing His superiority. Another interpretation is "...they would seek a way" to depose Him (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) and take over His Throne.

ayas.translation: āًrwُfَغ āًmyِlَḥ َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۗ ْmُhَḥyِbْsَt َnwُhَqْfَt āَّl nِkٰـَlَw ِhِdْmَḥِb ُḥِّbَsُy āَّlِiʾ ٍءْyَhs nِّm nِiʾَw ۚ َّnِhyِf nَmَw ُḍْrَaʾْlāَw ُʿعْbَّslā ُtāَwāَmَّslā ُhَl ُḥِّbَsُt

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="2" verses="225">2:225</reference>.
Preventing guidance from reaching them.

ayas.translation: āًrwُfُn ْmِhِrāَbْdَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āْwَّlَw ُhَdْḥَw ِnāʾْrُqْlā yِf َkَّbَr َtْrَkَhd āَhdِiʾَw ۚ āًrْqَw ْmِhِnāَhdāʾ yِfَw ُhwُhَqْfَy nَaʾ ًhَّnِkَaʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: Describing the Prophet (ﷺ) as a poet, a madman or one under the influence of sorcery.

ayas.translation: āًdyِdَjg āًqْlَhk َnwُhtwُʿعْbَmَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًtāَfُrَw āًmāَẓِʿع āَّnُk āَhdِiʾَaʾ āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: i.e., even if you should be stones or iron.

ayas.translation: āًbyِrَq َnwُkَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ْlُq ۖ َwُh ٰyَtَm َnwُlwُqَyَw ْmُhَswُءُr َkْyَlِiʾ َnwُḍِغْnُyَsَf ۚ ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ْmُkَrَṭَf yِhdَّlā ِlُq ۖ āَnُdyِʿعُy nَm َnwُlwُqَyَsَf ۚ ْmُkِrwُdُṣ yِf ُrُbْkَy āَّmِّm āًqْlَhk ْwَaʾ

footnotes.text: Such as the heavens and earth.
In disbelief and ridicule.

ayas.translation: āًnyِbُّm āًّwُdَʿع ِnāَsnِiʾْlِl َnāَk َnāَṭْyَّhslā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb ُغَznَy َnāَṭْyَّhslā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُnَsْḥَaʾ َyِh yِtَّlā āwُlwُqَy yِdāَbِʿعِّl lُqَw
āًlyِwْḥَt āَlَw ْmُknَʿع ِّrُّḍlā َfْhsَk َnwُkِlْmَy āَlَf ِhِnwُd nِّm mُtْmَʿعَz َnyِhdَّlā āwُʿعْdā ِlُq

footnotes.text: Among the righteous of Allāh's creation, such as angels, prophets, deceased scholars, etc.

ayas.translation: āًrwُṭْsَm ِbāَtِkْlā yِf َkِlَٰhd َnāَk ۚ āًdyِdَhs āًbāَhdَʿع āَhwُbِّhdَʿعُm ْwَaʾ ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy َlْbَq āَhwُkِlْhُm ُnْḥَn āَّlِiʾ ٍhَyْrَq nِّm nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Because of the sins of its inhabitants.
The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), which is with Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًfyِwْhkَt āَّlِiʾ ِtāَyāʾْlāِb ُlِsْrُn āَmَw ۚ āَhِb āwُmَlَẓَf ًhَrِṣْbُm َhَqāَّnlā َdwُmَht āَnْyَtāʾَw ۚ َnwُlَّwَaʾْlā āَhِb َbَّhdَk nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِtāَyāʾْlāِb َlِsْrُّn nَaʾ āَnَʿعَnَm āَmَw

āًryِbَk āًnāَyْغُṭ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُdyِzَy āَmَf ْmُhُfِّwَhkُnَw ۚ ِnāʾْrُqْlā yِf َhَnwُʿعْlَmْlā َhَrَjgَّhslāَw ِsāَّnlِّl ًhَnْtِf āَّlِiʾ َkāَnْyَrَaʾ yِtَّlā āَyْwʾُّrlā āَnْlَʿعَjg āَmَw ۚ ِsāَّnlāِb َṭāَḥَaʾ َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ َkَl āَnْlُq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: In His knowledge and power, meaning that Allāh would protect him (ﷺ) from their harm.
During the miʿrāj (ascension) into the heavens.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="34">2:34</reference>.
By tempting them and leading them astray.

ayas.translation: āًrwُrُغ āَّlِiʾ ُnāَṭْyَّhslā ُmُhُdِʿعَy āَmَw ۚ ْmُhْdِʿعَw ِdāَlْwَaʾْlāَw ِlāَwْmَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhْkِrāَhsَw َkِlِjgَrَw َkِlْyَhkِb mِhْyَlَʿع ْbِlْjgَaʾَw َkِtْwَṣِb mُhْnِm َtْʿعَṭَtْsā ِnَm ْzِzْfَtْsāَw

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="3" verses="173">3:173</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَr ْmُkِb َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِhِlْḍَf nِm āwُغَtْbَtِl ِrْḥَbْlā yِf َkْlُfْlā ُmُkَl yِjgْzُy yِhdَّlā ُmُkُّbَّr
āًrwُfَk ُnāَsnِiʾْlā َnāَkَw ۚ ْmُtْḍَrْʿعَaʾ ِّrَbْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkāَّjgَn āَّmَlَf ۖ ُhāَّyِiʾ āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعْdَt nَm َّlَḍ ِrْḥَbْlā yِf ُّrُّḍlā ُmُkَّsَm āَhdِiʾَw
āًʿعyِbَt ِhِb āَnْyَlَʿع ْmُkَl āwُdِjgَt āَl َّmُht ۙ ْmُtْrَfَk āَmِb mُkَqِrْغُyَf ِḥyِّrlā َnِّm āًfِṣāَq ْmُkْyَlَʿع َlِsْrُyَf ٰyَrْhkُaʾ ًhَrāَt ِhyِf ْmُkَdyِʿعُy nَaʾ ْmُtnِmَaʾ ْmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Or "for your disbelief."
Or "someone to demand restitution."

ayas.translation: āًlyِḍْfَt āَnْqَlَhk ْnَّmِّm ٍryِhtَk ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhāَnْlَّḍَfَw ِtāَbِّyَّṭlā َnِّm mُhāَnْqَzَrَw ِrْḥَbْlāَw ِّrَbْlā yِf ْmُhāَnْlَmَḥَw َmَdāʾ yِnَb āَnْmَّrَk ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: Other meanings are "with their leader" or "with that which they had followed."
i.e., refusing to see the truth.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَhk َkwُhdَhkَّtāَّl āًhdِiʾَw ۖ ُhَrْyَغ āَnْyَlَʿع َyِrَtْfَtِl َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ yِhdَّlā ِnَʿع َkَnwُnِtْfَyَl āwُdāَk nِiʾَw
āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َkَfāَlِhk َnwُhtَbْlَy āَّl āًhdِiʾَw ۖ āَhْnِm َkwُjgِrْhkُyِl ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِm َkَnwُّzِfَtْsَyَl āwُdāَk nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Only ten years after the Prophet's emigration, Makkah was completely cleared of his enemies.

ayas.translation: āًlyِwْḥَt āَnِtَّnُsِl ُdِjgَt āَlَw ۖ āَnِlُsُّr nِm َkَlْbَq āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَq nَm َhَّnُs

footnotes.text: i.e., the period which includes the ẓuhr, aṣr, maghrib, and ʿishā’ prayers.
i.e., the fajr prayer, in which the recitation of the Qur’ān is prolonged.
Literally, "arise from sleep for prayer."
This is a promise from Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).
The position of intercession by permission of Allāh and the highest degree in Paradise.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَّn āًnāَṭْlُs َknُdَّl nِm yِّl lَʿعْjgāَw ٍqْdِṣ َjgَrْhkُm yِnْjgِrْhkَaʾَw ٍqْdِṣ َlَhkْdُm yِnْlِhkْdَaʾ ِّbَّr lُqَw

footnotes.text: Into Madīnah at the time of emigration, or into the grave.
From Makkah, or from the grave at the time of resurrection.

ayas.translation: āًlyِkَw āَnْyَlَʿع ِhِb َkَl ُdِjgَt āَl َّmُht َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ yِhdَّlāِb َّnَbَhْhdَnَl āَnْyʾِhs nِyʾَlَw
āًryِhَẓ ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُhُḍْʿعَb َnāَk ْwَlَw ِhِlْhtِmِb َnwُtْaʾَy āَl ِnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh ِlْhtِmِb āwُtْaʾَy nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ُّnِjgْlāَw ُsnِiʾْlā ِtَʿعَmَtْjgā ِnِyʾَّl lُq
āًrwُfُk āَّlِiʾ ِsāَّnlā ُrَhtْkَaʾ ٰyَbَaʾَf ٍlَhtَm ِّlُk nِm ِnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh yِf ِsāَّnlِl āَnْfَّrَṣ ْdَqَlَw

āًlwُsَّr āًrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ ُtnُk ْlَh yِّbَr َnāَḥْbُs ْlُq ۗ ُhُwʾَrْqَّn āًbāَtِk āَnْyَlَʿع َlِّzَnُt ٰyَّtَḥ َkِّyِqُrِl َnِmْwʾُّn nَlَw ِءāَmَّslā yِf ٰyَqْrَt ْwَaʾ ٍfُrْhkُz nِّm ٌtْyَb َkَl َnwُkَy ْwَaʾ
āًlwُsَّr āًrَhsَb ُhَّllā َhtَʿعَbَaʾ āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ٰyَdُhْlā ُmُhَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ āwُnِmْwʾُy nَaʾ َsāَّnlā َʿعَnَm āَmَw
āًlwُsَّr āًkَlَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَّzَnَl َnyِّnِyʾَmْṭُm َnwُhsْmَy ٌhَkِyʾāَlَm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnāَk ْwَّl lُq

footnotes.text: i.e., who were settled and established there, as is man.

ayas.translation: āًryِʿعَs ْmُhāَnْdِz ْtَbَhk āَmَّlُk ۖ ُmَّnَhَjg ْmُhāَwْaʾَّm ۖ āًّmُṣَw āًmْkُbَw āًyْmُʿع ْmِhِhwُjgُw ٰyَlَʿع ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُhُrُhsْḥَnَw ۖ ِhِnwُd nِm َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْmُhَl َdِjgَt nَlَf ْlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۖ ِdَtْhُmْlā َwُhَf ُhَّllā ِdْhَy nَmَw

footnotes.text: As a result of his own preference.

ayas.translation: āًdyِdَjg āًqْlَhk َnwُhtwُʿعْbَmَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًtāَfُrَw āًmāَẓِʿع āَّnُk āَhdِiʾَaʾ āwُlāَqَw āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُrَfَk ْmُhَّnَaʾِb mُhُwʾāَzَjg َkِlَٰhd

āًrwُfُk āَّlِiʾ َnwُmِlāَّẓlā yَbَaʾَf ِhyِf َbْyَr āَّl āًlَjgَaʾ ْmُhَl َlَʿعَjgَw ْmُhَlْhtِm َqُlْhkَy nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ٌrِdāَq َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., I am certain.

ayas.translation: āًfyِfَl ْmُkِb āَnْyʾِjg ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُdْʿعَw َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf َḍْrَaʾْlā āwُnُkْsā َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِl ِhِdْʿعَb nِm āَnْlُqَw
āًdَّjgُs ِnāَqْhdَaʾْlِl َnwُّrِhkَy ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُy āَhdِiʾ ِhِlْbَq nِm َmْlِʿعْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُnِmْwʾُt āَl ْwَaʾ ِhِb āwُnِmāʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., the righteous among the People of the Scriptures who recognize the truth contained in the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: āًlyِbَs َkِlَٰhd َnْyَb ِغَtْbāَw āَhِb ْtِfāَhkُt āَlَw َkِtāَlَṣِb ْrَhْjgَt āَlَw ۚ ٰyَnْsُḥْlā ُءāَmْsَaʾْlā ُhَlَf āwُʿعْdَt āَّm āًّyَaʾ ۖ َnٰـَmْḥَّrlā āwُʿعْdā ِwَaʾ َhَّllā āwُʿعْdā ِlُq
āًryِbْkَt ُhْrِّbَkَw ۖ ِّlُّhdlā َnِّm ٌّyِlَw ُhَّl nُkَy ْmَlَw ِkْlُmْlā yِf ٌkyِrَhs ُhَّl nُkَy ْmَlَw āًdَlَw ْhdِhkَّtَy ْmَl yِhdَّlā ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā ِlُqَw

footnotes.text: From the truth or the straight path.

ayas.translation: āًnَsَḥ āًrْjgَaʾ ْmُhَl َّnَaʾ ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā َnwُlَmْʿعَy َnyِhdَّlā َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َrِّhsَbُyَw ُhْnُdَّl nِّm āًdyِdَhs āًsْaʾَb َrِhdnُyِّl āًmِّyَq
āًbِhdَk āَّlِiʾ َnwُlwُqَy nِiʾ ۚ ْmِhِhāَwْfَaʾ ْnِm ُjgُrْhkَt ًhَmِlَk ْtَrُbَk ۚ ْmِhِyʾāَbāʾِl āَlَw ٍmْlِʿع ْnِm ِhِb mُhَl āَّm

footnotes.text: i.e., they could not have had knowledge of something which is not true.

ayas.translation: āًlَmَʿع ُnَsْḥَaʾ ْmُhُّyَaʾ ْmُhَwُlْbَnِl āَhَّl ًhَnyِz ِḍْrَaʾْlā yَlَʿع āَm āَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Rather, it is only one of the many wonders of Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًdَhsَr āَnِrْmَaʾ ْnِm āَnَl ْyʾِّyَhَw ًhَmْḥَr َknُdَّl nِm āَnِtāʾ āَnَّbَr āwُlāَqَf ِfْhَkْlā yَlِiʾ ُhَyْtِfْlā yَwَaʾ ْhdِiʾ
āًṭَṭَhs āًhdِiʾ āَnْlُq ْdَqَّl ۖ āًhٰـَlِiʾ ِhِnwُd nِm َwُʿعْdَّn nَl ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُّbَr āَnُّbَr āwُlāَqَf āwُmāَq ْhdِiʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْṭَbَrَw
āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع ٰyَrَtْfā ِnَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَf ۖ ٍnِّyَb ٍnāَṭْlُsِb mِhْyَlَʿع َnwُtْaʾَy āَlْwَّl ۖ ًhَhِlāʾ ِhِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā āَnُmْwَq ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh
āًqَfْrِّm mُkِrْmَaʾ ْnِّm mُkَl ْyʾِّyَhُyَw ِhِtَmْḥَّr nِّm mُkُّbَr ْmُkَl ْrُhsnَy ِfْhَkْlā yَlِiʾ āwُwْaʾَf َhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َnwُdُbْʿعَy āَmَw ْmُhwُmُtْlَzَtْʿعā ِhdِiʾَw

āًdِhsْrُّm āًّyِlَw ُhَl َdِjgَt nَlَf ْlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۖ ِdَtْhُmْlā َwُhَf ُhَّllā ِdْhَy nَm ۗ ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ ْnِm َkِlَٰhd ۚ ُhْnِّm ٍhَwْjgَf yِf ْmُhَw ِlāَmِّhslā َtāَhd ْmُhُḍِrْqَّt tَbَrَغ āَhdِiʾَw ِnyِmَyْlā َtāَhd ْmِhِfْhَk nَʿع ُrَwāَzَّt tَʿعَlَṭ āَhdِiʾ َsْmَّhslā yَrَtَw

āًdَḥَaʾ ْmُkِb َّnَrِʿعْhsُy āَlَw ْfَّṭَlَtَyْlَw ُhْnِّm ٍqْzِrِb mُkِtْaʾَyْlَf āًmāَʿعَṭ ٰyَkْzَaʾ āَhُّyَaʾ ْrُẓnَyْlَf ِhَnyِdَmْlā yَlِiʾ ِhِhdٰـَh ْmُkِqِrَwِb mُkَdَḥَaʾ āwُhtَʿعْbāَf ْmُtْhtِbَl āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ْmُkُّbَr āwُlāَq ۚ ٍmْwَy َḍْʿعَb ْwَaʾ āًmْwَy āَnْhtِbَl āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُtْhtِbَl ْmَk ْmُhْnِّm ٌlِyʾāَq َlāَq ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb āwُlَءāَsَtَyِl ْmُhāَnْhtَʿعَb َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: By the will of Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًdَbَaʾ āًhdِiʾ āwُḥِlْfُt nَlَw ْmِhِtَّlِm yِf ْmُkwُdyِʿعُy ْwَaʾ ْmُkwُmُjgْrَy ْmُkْyَlَʿع āwُrَhْẓَy nِiʾ ْmُhَّnِiʾ

āًdِjgْsَّm mِhْyَlَʿع َّnَhdِhkَّtَnَl ْmِhِrْmَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُbَlَغ َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ۚ ْmِhِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ْmُhُّbَّr ۖ āًnāَyْnُb mِhْyَlَʿع āwُnْbā āwُlāَqَf ۖ ْmُhَrْmَaʾ ْmُhَnْyَb َnwُʿعَzāَnَtَy ْhdِiʾ āَhyِf َbْyَr āَl َhَʿعāَّslā َّnَaʾَw ٌّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw َّnَaʾ āwُmَlْʿعَyِl ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْrَhtْʿعَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: The people of the city.
i.e., we will make this site a place of worship.

ayas.translation: āًdَḥَaʾ ْmُhْnِّm mِhyِf ِtْfَtْsَt āَlَw āًrِhāَẓ ًءāَrِm āَّlِiʾ ْmِhyِf ِrāَmُt āَlَf ۗ ٌlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُmَlْʿعَy āَّm mِhِtَّdِʿعِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ yِّbَّr lُq ۚ ْmُhُbْlَk ْmُhُnِmāَhtَw ٌhَʿعْbَs َnwُlwُqَyَw ۖ ِbْyَغْlāِb āًmْjgَr ْmُhُbْlَk ْmُhُsِdāَs ٌhَsْmَhk َnwُlwُqَyَw ْmُhُbْlَk ْmُhُʿعِbāَّr ٌhَhtāَlَht َnwُlwُqَyَs

footnotes.text: i.e., one from the Qur’ān, which is the only sure argument.

ayas.translation: āًdَhsَr āَhdٰـَh ْnِm َbَrْqَaʾِl yِّbَr ِnَyِdْhَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ْlُqَw َtyِsَn āَhdِiʾ َkَّbَّr rُkْhdāَw ۚ ُhَّllā َءāَhsَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., 309 lunar years.

ayas.translation: āًdَḥَaʾ ِhِmْkُḥ yِf ُkِrْhsُy āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhِnwُd nِّm mُhَl āَm ۚ ْʿعِmْsَaʾَw ِhِb ْrِṣْbَaʾ ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُbْyَغ ُhَl ۖ āwُhtِbَl āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllā ِlُq
āًdَḥَtْlُm ِhِnwُd nِm َdِjgَt nَlَw ِhِtāَmِlَkِl َlِّdَbُm āَl ۖ َkِّbَr ِbāَtِk nِm َkْyَlِiʾ َyِḥwُaʾ āَm ُlْtāَw

āًṭُrُf ُhُrْmَaʾ َnāَkَw ُhāَwَh َʿعَbَّtāَw āَnِrْkِhd nَʿع ُhَbْlَq āَnْlَfْغَaʾ ْnَm ْʿعِṭُt āَlَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā َhَnyِz ُdyِrُt ْmُhْnَʿع َkāَnْyَʿع ُdْʿعَt āَlَw ۖ ُhَhْjgَw َnwُdyِrُy ِّyِhsَʿعْlāَw ِhāَdَغْlāِb mُhَّbَr َnwُʿعْdَy َnyِhdَّlā َʿعَm َkَsْfَn ْrِbْṣāَw

footnotes.text: Or "in excess," exceeding the limits of Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًqَfَtْrُm ْtَءāَsَw ُbāَrَّhslā َsْyʾِb ۚ َhwُjgُwْlā yِwْhsَy ِlْhُmْlāَk ٍءāَmِb āwُhtāَغُy āwُhtyِغَtْsَy nِiʾَw ۚ āَhُqِdāَrُs ْmِhِb َṭāَḥَaʾ āًrāَn َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl āَnْdَtْʿعَaʾ āَّnِiʾ ۚ ْrُfْkَyْlَf َءāَhs nَmَw nِmْwʾُyْlَf َءāَhs nَmَf ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ِlُqَw

āًqَfَtْrُm ْtَnُsَḥَw ُbāَwَّhtlā َmْʿعِn ۚ ِkِyʾāَrَaʾْlā yَlَʿع āَhyِf َnyِyʾِkَّtُّm ٍqَrْbَtْsِiʾَw ٍsُdnُs nِّm āًrْḍُhk āًbāَyِht َnwُsَbْlَyَw ٍbَhَhd nِm َrِwāَsَaʾ ْnِm āَhyِf َnْwَّlَḥُy ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā ُmِhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍnْdَʿع ُtāَّnَjg ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ
āًʿعْrَz āَmُhَnْyَb āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ٍlْhkَnِb āَmُhāَnْfَfَḥَw ٍbāَnْʿعَaʾ ْnِm ِnْyَtَّnَjg āَmِhِdَḥَaʾِl āَnْlَʿعَjg ِnْyَlُjgَّr āًlَhtَّm mُhَl ْbِrْḍāَw
āًrَhَn āَmُhَlāَlِhk āَnْrَّjgَfَw ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ُhْnِّm mِlْẓَt ْmَlَw āَhَlُkُaʾ ْtَtāʾ ِnْyَtَّnَjgْlā āَtْlِk

footnotes.text: i.e., proud and ungrateful to Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًbَlَqnُm āَhْnِّm āًrْyَhk َّnَdِjgَaʾَl yِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ ُّtdِdُّr nِyʾَlَw ًhَmِyʾāَq َhَʿعāَّslā ُّnُẓَaʾ āَmَw
āًdَlَwَw āًlāَm َknِm َّlَqَaʾ āَnَaʾ ِnَrَt nِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllāِb āَّlِiʾ َhَّwُq āَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs āَm َtْlُq َkَtَّnَjg َtْlَhkَd ْhdِiʾ āَlْwَlَw
āًqَlَz āًdyِʿعَṣ َḥِbْṣُtَf ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm āًnāَbْsُḥ āَhْyَlَʿع َlِsْrُyَw َkِtَّnَjg nِّm āًrْyَhk ِnَyِtْwʾُy nَaʾ yِّbَr ٰyَsَʿعَf
āًdَḥَaʾ yِّbَrِb ْkِrْhsُaʾ ْmَl yِnَtْyَl āَy ُlwُqَyَw āَhِhswُrُʿع ٰyَlَʿع ٌhَyِwāَhk َyِhَw āَhyِf َqَfnَaʾ āَm ٰyَlَʿع ِhْyَّfَk ُbِّlَqُy َḥَbْṣَaʾَf ِhِrَmَhtِb َṭyِḥُaʾَw

footnotes.text: He attributed his prosperity to himself rather than to Allāh and disbelieved in the account of the Hereafter.
i.e., at such a time or on the Day of Judgement.
Absorbs it, growing lush and thick.
i.e., in His sight or evaluation.
i.e., flattened and bare.

ayas.translation: āًdِʿعْwَّm mُkَl َlَʿعْjgَّn nَّlَaʾ ْmُtْmَʿعَz ْlَb ۚ ٍhَّrَm َlَّwَaʾ ْmُkāَnْqَlَhk āَmَk āَnwُmُtْyʾِjg ْdَqَّl āًّfَṣ َkِّbَr ٰyَlَʿع āwُḍِrُʿعَw

āًdَḥَaʾ َkُّbَr ُmِlْẓَy āَlَw ۗ āًrِḍāَḥ āwُlِmَʿع āَm āwُdَjgَwَw ۚ āَhāَṣْḥَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ًhَryِbَk āَlَw ًhَryِغَṣ ُrِdāَغُy āَl ِbāَtِkْlā āَhdٰـَh ِlāَm āَnَtَlْyَw āَy َnwُlwُqَyَw ِhyِf āَّmِm َnyِqِfْhsُm َnyِmِrْjgُmْlā yَrَtَf ُbāَtِkْlā َʿعِḍُwَw

āًlَdَb َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl َsْyʾِb ۚ ٌّwُdَʿع ْmُkَl ْmُhَw yِnwُd nِm َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ُhَtَّyِّrُhdَw ُhَnwُhdِhkَّtَtَfَaʾ ۗ ِhِّbَr ِrْmَaʾ ْnَʿع َqَsَfَf ِّnِjgْlā َnِm َnāَk َsyِlْbِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āwُdَjgَsَf َmَdāʾِl āwُdُjgْsā ِhَkِyʾāَlَmْlِl āَnْlُq ْhdِiʾَw
āًfِrْṣَm āَhْnَʿع āwُdِjgَy ْmَlَw āَhwُʿعِqāَwُّm mُhَّnَaʾ āwُّnَẓَf َrāَّnlā َnwُmِrْjgُmْlā yَaʾَrَw
āًlُbُq ُbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmُhَyِtْaʾَy ْwَaʾ َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُhَّnُs ْmُhَyِtْaʾَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَّbَr āwُrِfْغَtْsَyَw ٰyَdُhْlā ُmُhَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ āwُnِmْwʾُy nَaʾ َsāَّnlā َʿعَnَm āَmَw

footnotes.text: Who denied the truth brought by Allāh's messengers.

ayas.translation: āًwُzُh āwُrِhdnُaʾ āَmَw yِtāَyāʾ āwُhdَhkَّtāَw ۖ َّqَḥْlā ِhِb āwُḍِḥْdُyِl ِlِṭāَbْlāِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُlِdāَjgُyَw ۚ َnyِrِhdnُmَw َnyِrِّhsَbُm āَّlِiʾ َnyِlَsْrُmْlā ُlِsْrُn āَmَw

āًdَbَaʾ āًhdِiʾ āwُdَtْhَy nَlَf ٰyَdُhْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُhُʿعْdَt nِiʾَw ۖ āًrْqَw ْmِhِnāَhdāʾ yِfَw ُhwُhَqْfَy nَaʾ ًhَّnِkَaʾ ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnِiʾ ۚ ُhāَdَy ْtَmَّdَq āَm َyِsَnَw āَhْnَʿع َḍَrْʿعَaʾَf ِhِّbَr ِtāَyāʾِb َrِّkُhd nَّmِm ُmَlْẓَaʾ ْnَmَw
āًlِyʾْwَm ِhِnwُd nِm āwُdِjgَy nَّl ٌdِʿعْwَّm mُhَّl lَb ۚ َbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmُhَl َlَّjgَʿعَl āwُbَsَk āَmِb mُhُhdِhkāَwʾُy ْwَl ۖ ِhَmْḥَّrlā wُhd ُrwُfَغْlā َkُّbَrَw
āًbَrَs ِrْḥَbْlā yِf ُhَlyِbَs َhdَhkَّtāَf āَmُhَtwُḥ āَyِsَn āَmِhِnْyَb َʿعَmْjgَm āَغَlَb āَّmَlَf
āًbَṣَn āَhdٰـَh āَnِrَfَs nِm āَnyِqَl ْdَqَl āَnَءāَdَغ āَnِtāʾ ُhāَtَfِl َlāَq āَzَwāَjg āَّmَlَf
āًbَjgَʿع ِrْḥَbْlā yِf ُhَlyِbَs َhdَhkَّtāَw ۚ ُhَrُkْhdَaʾ ْnَaʾ ُnāَṭْyَّhslā āَّlِiʾ ُhyِnāَsnَaʾ āَmَw َtwُḥْlā ُtyِsَn yِّnِiʾَf ِhَrْhkَّṣlā yَlِiʾ āَnْyَwَaʾ ْhdِiʾ َtْyَaʾَrَaʾ َlāَq
āًmْlِʿع āَّnُdَّl nِm ُhāَnْmَّlَʿعَw āَnِdnِʿع ْnِّm ًhَmْḥَr ُhāَnْyَtāʾ āَnِdāَbِʿع ْnِّm āًdْbَʿع āَdَjgَwَf
āًrْmَaʾ َkَl yِṣْʿعَaʾ āَlَw āًrِbāَṣ ُhَّllā َءāَhs nِiʾ yِnُdِjgَtَs َlāَq
āًrْmِiʾ āًyʾْyَhs َtْyʾِjg ْdَqَl āَhَlْhَaʾ َqِrْغُtِl āَhَtْqَrَhkَaʾ َlāَq ۖ āَhَqَrَhk ِhَnyِfَّslā yِf āَbِkَr āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ āَqَlَṭnāَf
āًrْsُʿع yِrْmَaʾ ْnِm yِnْqِhْrُt āَlَw ُtyِsَn āَmِb yِnْhdِhkāَwʾُt āَl َlāَq
āًrْkُّn āًyʾْyَhs َtْyʾِjg ْdَqَّl ٍsْfَn ِrْyَغِb ًhَّyِkَz āًsْfَn َtْlَtَqَaʾ َlāَq ُhَlَtَqَf āًmāَlُغ āَyِqَl āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ āَqَlَṭnāَf
āًrْhdُʿع yِّnُdَّl nِm َtْغَlَb ْdَq ۖ yِnْbِḥāَṣُt āَlَf āَhَdْʿعَb ٍءْyَhs nَʿع َkُtْlَaʾَs nِiʾ َlāَq

āًrْjgَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َtْhdَhkَّtāَl َtْyʾِhs ْwَl َlāَq ۖ ُhَmāَqَaʾَf َّḍَqnَy nَaʾ ُdyِrُy āًrāَdِjg āَhyِf āَdَjgَwَf āَmُhwُfِّyَḍُy nَaʾ āْwَbَaʾَf āَhَlْhَaʾ āَmَʿعْṭَtْsā ٍhَyْrَq َlْhَaʾ āَyَtَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ āَqَlَṭnāَf
āًrْfُkَw āًnāَyْغُṭ āَmُhَqِhْrُy nَaʾ āَnyِhsَhkَf ِnْyَnِmْwʾُm ُhāَwَbَaʾ َnāَkَf ُmāَlُغْlā āَّmَaʾَw
āًmْḥُr َbَrْqَaʾَw ًhāَkَz ُhْnِّm āًrْyَhk āَmُhُّbَr āَmُhَlِdْbُy nَaʾ āَnْdَrَaʾَf

āًrْbَṣ ِhْyَlَّʿع ʿعِṭْsَt ْmَl āَm ُlyِwْaʾَt َkِlَٰhd ۚ yِrْmَaʾ ْnَʿع ُhُtْlَʿعَf āَmَw ۚ َkِّbَّr nِّm ًhَmْḥَr āَmُhَznَk āَjgِrْhkَtْsَyَw āَmُhَّdُhsَaʾ āَغُlْbَy nَaʾ َkُّbَr َdāَrَaʾَf āًḥِlāَṣ āَmُhwُbَaʾ َnāَkَw āَmُhَّl ٌznَk ُhَtْḥَt َnāَkَw ِhَnyِdَmْlā yِf ِnْyَmyِtَy ِnْyَmāَlُغِl َnāَkَf ُrāَdِjgْlā āَّmَaʾَw

āًnْsُḥ ْmِhyِf َhdِhkَّtَt nَaʾ āَّmِiʾَw َbِّhdَʿعُt nَaʾ āَّmِiʾ ِnْyَnْrَqْlā āَhd āَy āَnْlُq ۗ āًmْwَq āَhَdnِʿع َdَjgَwَw ٍhَyʾِmَḥ ٍnْyَʿع yِf ُbُrْغَt āَhَdَjgَw ِsْmَّhslā َbِrْغَm َغَlَb āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

footnotes.text: Another meaning is "a body of hot water."
Persists in disbelief and rebellion.

ayas.translation: āًrْtِs āَhِnwُd nِّm mُhَّl lَʿعْjgَn ْmَّl ٍmْwَq ٰyَlَʿع ُʿعُlْṭَt āَhَdَjgَw ِsْmَّhslā َʿعِlْṭَm َغَlَb āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

footnotes.text: Such was the affair of Dhul-Qarnayn.

ayas.translation: āًlْwَq َnwُhَqْfَy َnwُdāَkَy āَّl āًmْwَq āَmِhِnwُd nِm َdَjgَw ِnْyَّdَّslā َnْyَb َغَlَb āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ
āًّdَs ْmُhَnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb َlَʿعْjgَt nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āًjgْrَhk َkَl ُlَʿعْjgَn ْlَhَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnwُdِsْfُm َjgwُjgْaʾَmَw َjgwُjgْaʾَy َّnِiʾ ِnْyَnْrَqْlā āَhd āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Savage tribes who had ravaged large parts of central Asia, committing every kind of atrocity.

ayas.translation: āًrْṭِq ِhْyَlَʿع ْغِrْfُaʾ yِnwُtāʾ َlāَq āًrāَn ُhَlَʿعَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ āwُhkُfnā َlāَq ِnْyَfَdَّṣlā َnْyَb ٰyَwāَs āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِdyِdَḥْlā َrَbُz yِnwُtāʾ
āًbْqَn ُhَl āwُʿعāَṭَtْsā āَmَw ُhwُrَhْẓَy nَaʾ āwُʿعāَṭْsā āَmَf
āًّqَḥ yِّbَr ُdْʿعَw َnāَkَw ۖ َءāَّkَd ُhَlَʿعَjg yِّbَr ُdْʿعَw َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۖ yِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَmْḥَr āَhdٰـَh َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., the Hour of Resurrection.
The day the dam is destroyed.

ayas.translation: āًʿعْmَs َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āَl āwُnāَkَw yِrْkِhd nَʿع ٍءāَṭِغ yِf ْmُhُnُyْʿعَaʾ ْtَnāَk َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: i.e., Allāh's signs or the Qur’ān.
They refused to listen to the Qur’ān or to understand it.

ayas.translation: āًlُzُn َnyِrِfāَkْlِl َmَّnَhَjg āَnْdَtْʿعَaʾ āَّnِiʾ ۚ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ yِnwُd nِm yِdāَbِʿع āwُhdِhkَّtَy nَaʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َbِsَḥَfَaʾ
āًwُzُh yِlُsُrَw yِtāَyāʾ āwُhdَhkَّtāَw āwُrَfَk āَmِb ُmَّnَhَjg ْmُhُwʾāَzَjg َkِlَٰhd

footnotes.text: i.e., the highest part of Paradise, al-Firdaus.

ayas.translation: āًdَdَm ِhِlْhtِmِb āَnْyʾِjg ْwَlَw yِّbَr ُtāَmِlَk َdَfnَt nَaʾ َlْbَq ُrْḥَbْlā َdِfَnَl yِّbَr ِtāَmِlَkِّl āًdāَdِm ُrْḥَbْlā َnāَk ْwَّl lُq

footnotes.text: The words of Allāh's unlimited knowledge or words describing His attributes and His grandeur or praise of Him (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

ayas.translation: āًdَḥَaʾ ِhِّbَr ِhَdāَbِʿعِb ْkِrْhsُy āَlَw āًḥِlāَṣ āًlَmَʿع ْlَmْʿعَyْlَf ِhِّbَr َءāَqِl wُjgْrَy َnāَk nَmَf ۖ ٌdِḥāَw ٌhٰـَlِiʾ ْmُkُhٰـَlِiʾ āَmَّnَaʾ َّyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥwُy ْmُkُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَnَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
Literally, "ignited." The spread of white hair throughout the head is likened to that of fire in the bush.

ayas.translation: āًّyِlَw َknُdَّl nِm yِl ْbَhَf āًrِqāَʿع yِtَaʾَrْmā ِtَnāَkَw yِyʾāَrَw nِm َyِlāَwَmْlā ُtْfِhk yِّnِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Those relatives from the father's side who would inherit religious authority.
Inherit from me religious knowledge and prophethood.

ayas.translation: āًّyِmَs ُlْbَq nِm ُhَّl lَʿعْjgَn ْmَl ٰyَyْḥَy ُhُmْsā ٍmāَlُغِb َkُrِّhsَbُn āَّnِiʾ āَّyِrَkَz āَy

footnotes.text: By Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) through the angels.
i.e., without illness or defect.

ayas.translation: āًّyِwَs āًrَhsَb āَhَl َlَّhtَmَtَf āَnَḥwُr āَhْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَsْrَaʾَf āًbāَjgِḥ ْmِhِnwُd nِm ْtَhdَhkَّtāَf
āًّyِsnَّm āًyْsَn ُtnُkَw āَhdٰـَh َlْbَq ُّtِm yِnَtْyَl āَy ْtَlāَq ِhَlْhkَّnlā ِʿعْhdِjg ٰyَlِiʾ ُḍāَhkَmْlā āَhَءāَjgَaʾَf
āًّyِrَs ِkَtْḥَt ِkُّbَr َlَʿعَjg ْdَq yِnَzْḥَt āَّlَaʾ āَhِtْḥَt nِm āَhāَdāَnَf

footnotes.text: There is a difference of opinion among scholars as to whether "he" refers to the baby or to the angel.

ayas.translation: āًّyِsnِiʾ َmْwَyْlā َmِّlَkُaʾ ْnَlَf āًmْwَṣ ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlِl ُtْrَhdَn yِّnِiʾ yِlwُqَf āًdَḥَaʾ ِrَhsَbْlā َnِm َّnِyَrَt āَّmِiʾَf ۖ āًnْyَʿع yِّrَqَw yِbَrْhsāَw yِlُkَf
āًّyَḥ ُtْmُd āَm ِhāَkَّzlāَw ِhāَlَّṣlāِb yِnāَṣْwَaʾَw ُtnُk āَm َnْyَaʾ āًkَrāَbُm yِnَlَʿعَjgَw
ُnwُkَyَf nُk ُhَl ُlwُqَy āَmَّnِiʾَf āًrْmَaʾ ٰyَḍَq āَhdِiʾ ۚ ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۖ ٍdَlَw nِm َhdِhkَّtَy nَaʾ ِhَّlِl َnāَk āَm

footnotes.text: i.e., far removed is He from any such need.
i.e., "judged" or "accomplished."

ayas.translation: āًyʾْyَhs َknَʿع yِnْغُy āَlَw ُrِṣْbُy āَlَw ُʿعَmْsَy āَl āَm ُdُbْʿعَt َmِl ِtَbَaʾ āَy ِhyِbَaʾِl َlāَq ْhdِiʾ
āًّyِwَs āًṭāَrِṣ َkِdْhَaʾ yِnْʿعِbَّtāَf َkِtْaʾَy ْmَl āَm ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِm yِnَءāَjg ْdَq yِّnِiʾ ِtَbَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Meaning "You are secure" or "I will not harm you."

ayas.translation: āًّyِqَhs yِّbَr ِءāَʿعُdِb َnwُkَaʾ āَّlَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع yِّbَr wُʿعْdَaʾَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt āَmَw ْmُkُlِzَtْʿعَaʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., worship.

ayas.translation: āًّyِbَn āَnْlَʿعَjg āًّlُkَw ۖ َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾ ُhَl āَnْbَhَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَy āَmَw ْmُhَlَzَtْʿعā āَّmَlَf
āًّyِlَʿع ٍqْdِṣ َnāَsِl ْmُhَl āَnْlَʿعَjgَw āَnِtَmْḥَّr nِّm mُhَl āَnْbَhَwَw

footnotes.text: A messenger (rasūl) is one who was charged by Allāh to reform society. A prophet (nabī) is one who received revelation from Allāh, the latter being more numerous than the former.
Mount Sinai.

ayas.translation: ۩ āًّyِkُbَw āًdَّjgُs āwُّrَhk ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾ ۚ āَnْyَbَtْjgāَw āَnْyَdَh ْnَّmِmَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ِhَّyِّrُhd nِmَw ٍḥwُn َʿعَm āَnْlَmَḥ ْnَّmِmَw َmَdāʾ ِhَّyِّrُhd nِm َnyِّyِbَّnlā َnِّm mِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َmَʿعْnَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

footnotes.text: Described as a valley in Hell or may be rendered "the consequence of error."
Literally, "that to which all will come."

ayas.translation: āًّyِhsَʿعَw ًhَrْkُb āَhyِf ْmُhُqْzِr ْmُhَlَw ۖ āًmāَlَs āَّlِiʾ āًwْغَl āَhyِf َnwُʿعَmْsَy āَّl
āًّyِsَn َkُّbَr َnāَk āَmَw ۚ َkِlَٰhd َnْyَb āَmَw āَnَfْlَhk āَmَw āَnyِdْyَaʾ َnْyَb āَm ُhَl ۖ َkِّbَr ِrْmَaʾِb āَّlِiʾ ُlَّzَnَtَn āَmَw

footnotes.text: In answer to the Prophet's wish that Gabriel would visit him more often.
i.e., fallen on their knees from terror or dragged there unwillingly on their knees.
i.e., be exposed to it. However, the people of Paradise will not be harmed thereby.

ayas.translation: āًّyِdَn ُnَsْḥَaʾَw āًmāَqَّm ٌrْyَhk ِnْyَqyِrَfْlā ُّyَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: In regard to worldly interests.

ayas.translation: āًdnُjg ُfَʿعْḍَaʾَw āًnāَkَّm ٌّrَhs َwُh ْnَm َnwُmَlْʿعَyَsَf َhَʿعāَّslā āَّmِiʾَw َbāَhdَʿعْlā āَّmِiʾ َnwُdَʿعwُy āَm āْwَaʾَr āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۚ āًّdَm ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ُhَl ْdُdْmَyْlَf ِhَlāَlَّḍlā yِf َnāَk nَm ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., in the sight or evaluation of Allāh.
Instead of giving him wealth and children in the Hereafter, Allāh will take from him those he had in worldly life at the time of his death.
Of breaths, of days, or of evil deeds.
Not to worship other than Him.

ayas.translation: āًdْbَʿع ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā yِtāʾ āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm ُّlُk nِiʾ

footnotes.text: From Himself and from among each other.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
i.e., having ascendancy over all creation. See footnotes to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference> and <reference chapter="7" verses="54">7:54</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٰyَrَّhtlā َtْḥَt āَmَw āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَl
yًdُh ِrāَّnlā yَlَʿع ُdِjgَaʾ ْwَaʾ ٍsَbَqِb āَhْnِّm mُkyِtāʾ yِّlَʿعَّl āًrāَn ُtْsَnāʾ yِّnِiʾ āwُhtُkْmā ِhِlْhَaʾِl َlāَqَf āًrāَn ٰyَaʾَr ْhdِiʾ
yِrْkِhdِl َhāَlَّṣlā ِmِqَaʾَw yِnْdُbْʿعāَf āَnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ُhَّllā āَnَaʾ yِnَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Meaning that Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) keeps knowledge of the Hour hidden from everyone except Himself.
From preparation for the Hour or for the Hereafter.
Allāh put love of Moses into the hearts of the people.

ayas.translation: ٰyَswُm āَy ٍrَdَq ٰyَlَʿع َtْyʾِjg َّmُht َnَyْdَm ِlْhَaʾ yِf َnyِnِs َtْhtِbَlَf ۚ āًnwُtُf َkāَّnَtَfَw ِّmَغْlā َnِm َkāَnْyَّjgَnَf āًsْfَn َtْlَtَqَw ۚ َnَzْḥَt āَlَw āَhُnْyَʿع َّrَqَt ْyَk َkِّmُaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َkāَnْʿعَjgَrَf ۖ ُhُlُfْkَy nَm ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkُّlُdَaʾ ْlَh ُlwُqَtَf َkُtْhkُaʾ yِhsْmَt ْhdِiʾ

footnotes.text: The Copt who died after being struck by Moses.
Allāh had already selected Moses and made him strong in body and character according to the requirements of his mission.

ayas.translation: ٰyَغْṭَy nَaʾ ْwَaʾ āَnْyَlَʿع َṭُrْfَy nَaʾ ُfāَhkَn āَnَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَr āَlāَq

ٰyَdُhْlā َʿعَbَّtā ِnَm ٰyَlَʿع ُmāَlَّslāَw ۖ َkِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَyāʾِb َkāَnْyʾِjg ْdَq ۖ ْmُhْbِّhdَʿعُt āَlَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb āَnَʿعَm ْlِsْrَaʾَf َkِّbَr āَlwُsَr āَّnِiʾ āَlwُqَf ُhāَyِtْaʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., safety and security from Allāh's punishment.

ayas.translation: yَsnَy āَlَw yِّbَr ُّlِḍَy āَّl ۖ ٍbāَtِk yِf yِّbَr َdnِʿع āَhُmْlِʿع َlāَq
ٰyَّtَhs ٍtāَbَّn nِّm āًjgāَwْzَaʾ ِhِb āَnْjgَrْhkَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَznَaʾَw āًlُbُs āَhyِf ْmُkَl َkَlَsَw āًdْhَm َḍْrَaʾْlā ُmُkَl َlَʿعَjg yِhdَّlā
yًwُs āًnāَkَm َtnَaʾ āَlَw ُnْḥَn ُhُfِlْhkُn āَّl āًdِʿعْwَm َkَnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb ْlَʿعْjgāَf ِhِlْhtِّm ٍrْḥِsِb َkَّnَyِtْaʾَnَlَf

footnotes.text: Literally, "marked," as to be known. Another meaning is "a place midway [between us]" or "a level place."
So that the signs of Allāh would be seen clearly.

ayas.translation: ٰyَrَtْfā ِnَm َbāَhk ْdَqَw ۖ ٍbāَhdَʿعِb mُkَtِḥْsُyَf āًbِhdَk ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُrَtْfَt āَl ْmُkَlْyَw ٰyَswُّm mُhَl َlāَq
ٰyَlْhtُmْlā ُmُkِtَqyِrَṭِb āَbَhْhdَyَw āَmِhِrْḥِsِb mُkِḍْrَaʾ ْnِّm mُkāَjgِrْhkُy nَaʾ ِnāَdyِrُy ِnāَrِḥāَsَl ِnāَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āwُlāَq
ٰyَqْlَaʾ ْnَm َlَّwَaʾ َnwُkَّn nَaʾ āَّmِiʾَw َyِqْlُt nَaʾ āَّmِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy āwُlāَq
ٰyَtَaʾ ُhtْyَḥ ُrِḥāَّslā ُḥِlْfُy āَlَw ۖ ٍrِḥāَs ُdْyَk āwُʿعَnَṣ āَmَّnِiʾ ۖ āwُʿعَnَṣ āَm ْfَqْlَt َkِnyِmَy yِf āَm ِqْlَaʾَw

footnotes.text: After they had seen the miracles which Allāh had given Moses and that they were realities and not merely impressions of magic.

ayas.translation: āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِḍْqَt āَmَّnِiʾ ۖ ٍḍāَq َtnَaʾ āَm ِḍْqāَf ۖ āَnَrَṭَf yِhdَّlāَw ِtāَnِّyَbْlā َnِm āَnَءāَjg āَm ٰyَlَʿع َkَrِhtْwʾُّn nَl āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: This phrase has also been interpreted as an oath, i.e., "...by Him who created us."

ayas.translation: ٰyَqْbَaʾَw ٌrْyَhk ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِrْḥِّslā َnِm ِhْyَlَʿع āَnَtْhَrْkَaʾ āَmَw āَnāَyāَṭَhk āَnَl َrِfْغَyِl āَnِّbَrِb āَّnَmāʾ āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: In reward and in punishment.
From all uncleanliness, the greatest of which is worship and obedience to other than Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٰyَhsْhkَt āَlَw āًkَrَd ُfāَhkَt āَّl āًsَbَy ِrْḥَbْlā yِf āًqyِrَṭ ْmُhَl ْbِrْḍāَf yِdāَbِʿعِb ِrْsَaʾ ْnَaʾ ٰyَswُm ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., not only the water but that which only Allāh knows - terror, pain, regret, etc.
i.e., with your prophet, to receive the scripture for you.

ayas.translation: ٰyَwَh ْdَqَf yِbَḍَغ ِhْyَlَʿع ْlِlْḥَy nَmَw ۖ yِbَḍَغ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َّlِḥَyَf ِhyِf āْwَغْṭَt āَlَw ْmُkāَnْqَzَr āَm ِtāَbِّyَṭ nِm āwُlُk

footnotes.text: Translated as "the Samaritan" (from Samaria), a hypocrite among them who led the Children of Israel into idol-worship.

ayas.translation: yِdِʿعْwَّm mُtْfَlْhkَaʾَf ْmُkِّbَّr nِّm ٌbَḍَغ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َّlِḥَy nَaʾ ْmُّtdَrَaʾ ْmَaʾ ُdْhَʿعْlā ُmُkْyَlَʿع َlāَṭَfَaʾ ۚ āًnَsَḥ āًdْʿعَw ْmُkُّbَr ْmُkْdِʿعَy ْmَlَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ۚ āًfِsَaʾ َnāَbْḍَغ ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ ٰyَswُm َʿعَjgَrَf

footnotes.text: The meaning may also be "angry and enraged."
That He would send down the Torah, containing guidance for you.

ayas.translation: ُّyِrِmāَّslā yَqْlَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَkَf āَhāَnْfَhdَqَf ِmْwَqْlā ِhَnyِz nِّm āًrāَzْwَaʾ āَnْlِّmُḥ āَّnِkٰـَlَw āَnِkْlَmِb َkَdِʿعْwَm āَnْfَlْhkَaʾ āَm āwُlāَq
āًʿعْfَn āَlَw āًّrَḍ ْmُhَl ُkِlْmَy āَlَw āًlْwَq ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ُʿعِjgْrَy āَّlَaʾ َnْwَrَy āَlَfَaʾ
yِrْmَaʾ āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw yِnwُʿعِbَّtāَf ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ُmُkَّbَr َّnِiʾَw ۖ ِhِb mُtnِtُf āَmَّnِiʾ ِmْwَq āَy ُlْbَq nِm ُnwُrāَh ْmُhَl َlāَq ْdَqَlَw
yِlْwَq ْbُqْrَt ْmَlَw َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb َnْyَb َtْqَّrَf َlwُqَt nَaʾ ُtyِhsَhk yِّnِiʾ ۖ yِsْaʾَrِb āَlَw yِtَyْḥِlِb ْhdُhkْaʾَt āَl َّmُaʾ َnْbā āَy َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., a hoof-print in the sand left by the angel Gabriel's horse.
Into the fire upon the melted ornaments in order to form the calf.

ayas.translation: āًfْsَn ِّmَyْlā yِf ُhَّnَfِsnَnَl َّmُht ُhَّnَqِّrَḥُnَّl ۖ āًfِkāَʿع ِhْyَlَʿع َtْlَẓ yِhdَّlā َkِhٰـَlِiʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ْrُẓnāَw ۖ ُhَfَlْhkُt nَّl āًdِʿعْwَm َkَl َّnِiʾَw ۖ َsāَsِm āَl َlwُqَt nَaʾ ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf َkَl َّnِiʾَf ْbَhْhdāَf َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., Do not touch me. As chastisement, he was to be completely shunned by all people.
i.e., in the state of sin.
From terror, or blinded completely.
Once they have been reduced to dust.
To the gathering for judgement.
Allāh’s knowledge encompasses every aspect of His creations in the past, present and future.
See footnotes describing these attributes in <reference chapter="2" verses="255">2:255</reference>.
i.e., sin or wrongdoing towards Allāh or any of His creation.
i.e., revealed in the Arabic language.

ayas.translation: āًmْlِʿع yِnْdِz ِّbَّr lُqَw ۖ ُhُyْḥَw َkْyَlِiʾ ٰyَḍْqُy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm ِnāʾْrُqْlāِb ْlَjgْʿعَt āَlَw ۗ ُّqَḥْlā ُkِlَmْlā ُhَّllā yَlāَʿعَtَf

footnotes.text: And owner of everything in existence.
Or "the True Reality," i.e., the real and permanent existence upon which all other existence depends.
To resist temptation.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="34">2:34</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٰyَwَغَf ُhَّbَr ُmَdāʾ ٰyَṣَʿعَw ۚ ِhَّnَjgْlā ِqَrَw nِm āَmِhْyَlَʿع ِnāَfِṣْhkَy āَqِfَṭَw āَmُhُtāʾْwَs āَmُhَl ْtَdَbَf āَhْnِm āَlَkَaʾَf
ٰyَqْhsَy āَlَw ُّlِḍَy āَlَf َyāَdُh َʿعَbَّtā ِnَmَf yًdُh yِّnِّm mُkَّnَyِtْaʾَy āَّmِiʾَf ۖ ٌّwُdَʿع ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُkُḍْʿعَb ۖ āًʿعyِmَjg āَhْnِm āَṭِbْhā َlāَq

footnotes.text: Than that of this world.
See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="19">10:19</reference>.
Allāh would have punished the disbelievers in this world as He did with previous peoples.

ayas.translation: ٰyَlwُaʾْlā ِfُḥُّṣlā yِf āَm ُhَnِّyَb mِhِtْaʾَt ْmَlَwَaʾ ۚ ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٍhَyāʾِb āَnyِtْaʾَy āَlْwَl āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Is not the Qur’ān an adequate proof of Muḥammad's prophethood and sufficient as a lasting miracle?

ayas.translation: ٰyَzْhkَnَw َّlِhdَّn nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm َkِtāَyāʾ َʿعِbَّtَnَf āًlwُsَr āَnْyَlِiʾ َtْlَsْrَaʾ āَlْwَl āَnَّbَr āwُlāَqَl ِhِlْbَq nِّm ٍbāَhdَʿعِb mُhāَnْkَlْhَaʾ āَّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ). Also interpreted as "before it," i.e., the Qur’ān.
For the outcome of this matter.

ayas.translation: َnwُbَʿعْlَy ْmُhَw ُhwُʿعَmَtْsā āَّlِiʾ ٍhtَdْḥُّm mِhِّbَّr nِّm ٍrْkِhd nِّm mِhyِtْaʾَy āَm

footnotes.text: Even though they had witnessed signs and miracles.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِrْkِّhdlā َlْhَaʾ āwُlَaʾْsāَf ۖ ْmِhْyَlِiʾ yِḥwُّn āًlāَjgِr āَّlِiʾ َkَlْbَq āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: Like the angels. Rather, they were human beings with human attributes.
Once they had conveyed the message.
This implies the honor of having been mentioned or addressed. Another meaning is "your reminder."
i.e., its inhabitants persisting in wrongdoing.

ayas.translation: َnwُḍُkْrَy āَhْnِّm mُh āَhdِiʾ āَnَsْaʾَb āwُّsَḥَaʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: About what happened to you. This is said to them in sarcasm and ridicule.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِʿعāَf āَّnُk nِiʾ āَّnُdَّl nِm ُhāَnْhdَhkَّtāَّl āًwْhَl َhdِhkَّtَّn nَaʾ āَnْdَrَaʾ ْwَl
