footnotes.text: Such as a wife or a child.
Literally, "strikes its brain," disabling or killing it.
Of untruth concerning Allāh, particularly here, the claim that He has a son or other "partner" in divinity.

ayas.translation: َnwُḍِrْʿعُّm mُhَf ۖ َّqَḥْlā َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۗ yِlْbَq nَm ُrْkِhdَw َyِʿعَّm nَm ُrْkِhd āَhdٰـَh ۖ ْmُkَnāَhْrُb āwُtāَh ْlُq ۖ ًhَhِlāʾ ِhِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā ِmَaʾ

footnotes.text: All previous prophets called for the worship of Allāh alone.

ayas.translation: ِnwُdُbْʿعāَf āَnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ُhَّnَaʾ ِhْyَlِiʾ yِḥwُn āَّlِiʾ ٍlwُsَّr nِm َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: Those they claim to be "children" of Allāh, such as the angels, Ezra, Jesus, etc.
See footnote to <reference chapter="20" verses="110">20:110</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَlَfَaʾ ۖ ٍّyَḥ ٍءْyَhs َّlُk ِءāَmْlā َnِm āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ۖ āَmُhāَnْqَtَfَf āًqْtَr āَtَnāَk َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َّnَaʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َrَy ْmَlَwَaʾ
َnwُdَtْhَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَّl āًlُbُs āًjgāَjgِf āَhyِf āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ْmِhِb َdyِmَt nَaʾ َyِsāَwَr ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَnْlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: The signs present in the heavens.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِfāَk ْmُh ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِrْkِhdِb mُhَw ْmُkَtَhِlāʾ ُrُkْhdَy yِhdَّlā āَhdٰـَhَaʾ āًwُzُh āَّlِiʾ َkَnwُhdِhkَّtَy nِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َkāʾَr āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُrَṣnُy ْmُh āَlَw ْmِhِrwُhُẓ nَʿع āَlَw َrāَّnlā ُmِhِhwُjgُw nَʿع َnwُّfُkَy āَl َnyِḥ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmَlْʿعَy ْwَl

footnotes.text: The completion of the sentence is understood to be "...they would not be asking in disbelief and ridicule to be shown the punishment."

ayas.translation: َnwُbَḥْṣُy āَّnِّm mُh āَlَw ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ َrْṣَn َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَy āَl ۚ āَnِnwُd nِّm mُhُʿعَnْmَt ٌhَhِlāʾ ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ
َnwُbِlāَغْlā ُmُhَfَaʾ ۚ āَhِfāَrْṭَaʾ ْnِm āَhُṣُqnَn َḍْrَaʾْlā yِtْaʾَn āَّnَaʾ َnْwَrَy āَlَfَaʾ ۗ ُrُmُʿعْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َlāَṭ ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُhَءāَbāʾَw ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āَnْʿعَّtَm ْlَb

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="13" verses="41">13:41</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِbِsāَḥ āَnِb ٰyَfَkَw ۗ āَhِb āَnْyَtَaʾ ٍlَdْrَhk ْnِّm ٍhَّbَḥ َlāَqْhtِm َnāَk nِiʾَw ۖ āًyʾْyَhs ٌsْfَn ُmَlْẓُt āَlَf ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَyِl َṭْsِqْlā َnyِzāَwَmْlā ُʿعَḍَnَw

footnotes.text: i.e., anything as small or insignificant as a mustard seed.
These are three qualities of the Torah.
Which can mean "Him being unseen" by them or "though they are unseen" by others.
i.e., pretending ignorance, disapproving or refusing to acknowledge it?
i.e., before Moses. Allāh had guided him from early youth.
To what they had heard him say. It may also mean "...that they may witness [what will be done to him as punishment]."
After first admitting their error, they were seized by pride and obstinacy.
An exclamation of anger and displeasure.

ayas.translation: َnyِqِsāَf ٍءْwَs َmْwَq āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۗ َhtِyʾāَbَhkْlā ُlَmْʿعَّt tَnāَk yِtَّlā ِhَyْrَqْlā َnِm ُhāَnْyَّjgَnَw āًmْlِʿعَw āًmْkُḥ ُhāَnْyَtāʾ āًṭwُlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., supplicated against his people who had persisted in denial and animosity. See <reference chapter="71" verses="26-28">71:26-28</reference>.
Eating and destroying the crops.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِʿعāَf āَّnُkَw ۚ َrْyَّṭlāَw َnْḥِّbَsُy َlāَbِjgْlā َdwُwāَd َʿعَm āَnْrَّhkَsَw ۚ āًmْlِʿعَw āًmْkُḥ āَnْyَtāʾ āًّlُkَw ۚ َnāَmْyَlُs āَhāَnْmَّhَfَf

footnotes.text: Meaning that Allāh has always been capable of accomplishing whatever He wills.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb āَّnُkَw ۚ āَhyِf āَnْkَrāَb yِtَّlā ِḍْrَaʾْlā yَlِiʾ ِhِrْmَaʾِb yِrْjgَt ًhَfِṣāَʿع َḥyِّrlā َnāَmْyَlُsِlَw

footnotes.text: Preventing any disobedience or deviation by them from Solomon's instructions and protecting him from being harmed by them.

ayas.translation: َnyِdِbāَʿعْlِl ٰyَrْkِhdَw āَnِdnِʿع ْnِّm ًhَmْḥَr ْmُhَʿعَّm mُhَlْhtِmَw ُhَlْhَaʾ ُhāَnْyَtāʾَw ۖ ٍّrُḍ nِm ِhِb āَm āَnْfَhsَkَf ُhَl āَnْbَjgَtْsāَf
َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َnِm ُtnُk yِّnِiʾ َkَnāَḥْbُs َtnَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَّl nَaʾ ِtāَmُlُّẓlā yِf ٰyَdāَnَf ِhْyَlَʿع َrِdْqَّn nَّl nَaʾ َّnَẓَf āًbِḍāَغُm َbَhَّhd hdِiʾ ِnwُّnlā āَhdَw

footnotes.text: At the disbelief of his people.
Or "would not restrict him" in the belly of the fish.
That of the night, of the sea, and of the fish's interior.

ayas.translation: َnyِʿعِhsāَhk āَnَl āwُnāَkَw ۖ āًbَhَrَw āًbَغَr āَnَnwُʿعْdَyَw ِtāَrْyَhkْlā yِf َnwُʿعِrāَsُy āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ُhَjgْwَz ُhَl āَnْḥَlْṣَaʾَw ٰyَyْḥَy ُhَl āَnْbَhَwَw ُhَl āَnْbَjgَtْsāَf

footnotes.text: i.e., worship.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlِّl ًhَyāʾ āَhَnْbāَw āَhāَnْlَʿعَjgَw āَnِḥwُّr nِm āَhyِf āَnْhkَfَnَf āَhَjgْrَf ْtَnَṣْḥَaʾ yِtَّlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., a collective way of life or course of conduct followed by a community.
Becoming sects and denominations.
Such a person will not be deprived of his due reward.
They cannot return to this world, nor can they repent to Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَẓ āَّnُk ْlَb āَhdٰـَh ْnِّm ٍhَlْfَغ yِf āَّnُk ْdَq āَnَlْyَw āَy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُrāَṣْbَaʾ ٌhَṣِhkāَhs َyِh āَhdِiʾَf ُّqَḥْlā ُdْʿعَwْlā َbَrَtْqāَw

footnotes.text: The events of the Last Hour or of the Resurrection.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِʿعāَf āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ ۚ āَnْyَlَʿع āًdْʿعَw ۚ ُhُdyِʿعُّn ٍqْlَhk َlَّwَaʾ āَnْaʾَdَb āَmَk ۚ ِbُtُkْlِl ِّlِjgِّslā ِّyَṭَk َءāَmَّslā yِwْṭَn َmْwَy

footnotes.text: More literally, "Indeed, We are ever doers" of what We will.
Az-Zabūr can also mean "scriptures" in general.
i.e., the Torah. The "mention" may also refer to the original inscription with Allāh, i.e., the Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).
The Prophet (ﷺ) made this message known to all people, not concealing any of it from anyone or preferring any group over another.
The postponement of punishment.
i.e., their lies and disbelief.

ayas.translation: ٌdyِdَhs ِhَّllā َbāَhdَʿع َّnِkٰـَlَw ٰyَrāَkُsِb mُh āَmَw ٰyَrāَkُs َsāَّnlā yَrَtَw āَhَlْmَḥ ٍlْmَḥ ِtāَhd ُّlُk ُʿعَḍَtَw ْtَʿعَḍْrَaʾ āَّmَʿع ٍhَʿعِḍْrُm ُّlُk ُlَhْhdَt āَhَnْwَrَt َmْwَy

ٍjgyِhَb ٍjgْwَz ِّlُk nِm ْtَtَbnَaʾَw ْtَbَrَw ْtَّzَtْhā َءāَmْlā āَhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ًhَdِmāَh َḍْrَaʾْlā yَrَtَw ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ٍmْlِʿع ِdْʿعَb nِm َmَlْʿعَy āَlْyَkِl ِrُmُʿعْlā ِlَhdْrَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ُّdَrُy nَّm mُknِmَw ٰyَّfَwَtُy nَّm mُknِmَw ۖ ْmُkَّdُhsَaʾ āwُغُlْbَtِl َّmُht āًlْfِṭ ْmُkُjgِrْhkُn َّmُht yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ُءāَhsَn āَm ِmāَḥْrَaʾْlā yِf ُّrِqُnَw ۚ ْmُkَl َnِّyَbُnِّl ٍhَqَّlَhkُm ِrْyَغَw ٍhَqَّlَhkُّm ٍhَغْḍُّm nِm َّmُht ٍhَqَlَʿع ْnِm َّmُht ٍhَfْṭُّn nِm َّmُht ٍbāَrُt nِّm mُkāَnْqَlَhk āَّnِiʾَf ِhtْʿعَbْlā َnِّm ٍbْyَr yِf ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: That which is incomplete. This may include what is aborted at that stage.
Our power and creative ability.
At the edge of his religion, so to speak, i.e., with uncertainty, hypocrisy or heedlessness.

ayas.translation: ُdyِʿعَbْlā ُlāَlَّḍlā َwُh َkِlَٰhd ۚ ُhُʿعَfnَy āَl āَmَw ُhُّrُḍَy āَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm wُʿعْdَy
ُdyِrُy āَm ُlَʿعْfَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُlِhkْdُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ
ُẓyِغَy āَm ُhُdْyَk َّnَbِhْhdُy ْlَh ْrُẓnَyْlَf ْʿعَṭْqَyْl َّmُht ِءāَmَّslā yَlِiʾ ٍbَbَsِb ْdُdْmَyْlَf ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf ُhَّllā ُhَrُṣnَy nَّl nَaʾ ُّnُẓَy َnāَk nَm

footnotes.text: i.e., strangle himself.
See footnote of <reference chapter="4" verses="79">4:79</reference>.

ayas.translation: ۩ ُءāَhsَy āَm ُlَʿعْfَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ٍmِrْkُّm nِm ُhَl āَmَf ُhَّllā ِnِhُy nَmَw ۗ ُbāَhdَʿعْlā ِhْyَlَʿع َّqَḥ ٌryِhtَkَw ۖ ِsāَّnlā َnِّm ٌryِhtَkَw ُّbāَwَّdlāَw ُrَjgَّhslāَw ُlāَbِjgْlāَw ُmwُjgُّnlāَw ُrَmَqْlāَw ُsْmَّhslāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm ُhَl ُdُjgْsَy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: And therefore decreed.
i.e., the believers and the disbelievers.

ayas.translation: ِqyِrَḥْlā َbāَhdَʿع āwُqwُhdَw āَhyِf āwُdyِʿعُaʾ ٍّmَغ ْnِm āَhْnِm āwُjgُrْhkَy nَaʾ āwُdāَrَaʾ āَmَّlُk

ٌryِrَḥ āَhyِf ْmُhُsāَbِlَw ۖ āًwʾُlْwʾُlَw ٍbَhَhd nِm َrِwāَsَaʾ ْnِm āَhyِf َnْwَّlَḥُy ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُlِhkْdُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Whether inside its boundaries or intending from afar to do evil therein. The Ḥaram is unique in that the mere intention of sin therein (whether or not it is actually carried out) is sufficient to bring punishment from Allāh.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="125">2:125</reference>.

ayas.translation: َryِqَfْlā َsِyʾāَbْlā āwُmِʿعْṭَaʾَw āَhْnِm āwُlُkَf ۖ ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ِhَmyِhَb nِّm mُhَqَzَr āَm ٰyَlَʿع ٍtāَmwُlْʿعَّm ٍmāَّyَaʾ yِf ِhَّllā َmْsā āwُrُkْhdَyَw ْmُhَl َʿعِfāَnَm āwُdَhْhsَyِّl

footnotes.text: Al-anʿām: camels, cattle, sheep and goats.
See <reference chapter="5" verses="3">5:3</reference>.
i.e., they may be milked or ridden (in the case of camels) before the time of slaughter.
i.e., within the boundaries of the Ḥaram, which includes Minā.

ayas.translation: َnyِtِbْhkُmْlā ِrِّhsَbَw ۗ āwُmِlْsَaʾ ُhَlَf ٌdِḥāَw ٌhٰـَlِiʾ ْmُkُhٰـَlِiʾَf ۗ ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ِhَmyِhَb nِّm mُhَqَzَr āَm ٰyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َmْsā āwُrُkْhdَyِّl āًkَsnَm āَnْlَʿعَjg ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُkِlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the rite of sacrifice has always been a part of Allāh's revealed religion.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ْmُkَl āَhāَnْrَّhkَs َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ َّrَtْʿعُmْlāَw َʿعِnāَqْlā āwُmِʿعْṭَaʾَw āَhْnِm āwُlُkَf āَhُbwُnُjg ْtَbَjgَw āَhdِiʾَf ۖ َّfāَwَṣ āَhْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َmْsā āwُrُkْhdāَf ۖ ٌrْyَhk āَhyِf ْmُkَl ِhَّllā ِrِyʾāَʿعَhs nِّm mُkَl āَhāَnْlَʿعَjg َnْdُbْlāَw
َnyِnِsْḥُmْlā ِrِّhsَbَw ۗ ْmُkāَdَh āَm ٰyَlَʿع َhَّllā āwُrِّbَkُtِl ْmُkَl āَhَrَّhkَs َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ْmُknِm ٰyَwْqَّtlā ُhُlāَnَy nِkٰـَlَw āَhُwʾāَmِd āَlَw āَhُmwُḥُl َhَّllā َlāَnَy nَl

footnotes.text: Referring here to the Prophet's companions.

ayas.translation: ٌzyِzَʿع ٌّyِwَqَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ُhُrُṣnَy nَm ُhَّllā َّnَrُṣnَyَlَw ۗ āًryِhtَk ِhَّllā ُmْsā āَhyِf ُrَkْhdُy ُdِjgāَsَmَw ٌtāَwَlَṣَw ٌʿعَyِbَw ُʿعِmāَwَṣ ْtَmِّdُhَّl ٍḍْʿعَbِb mُhَḍْʿعَb َsāَّnlā ِhَّllā ُʿعْfَd āَlْwَlَw ۗ ُhَّllā āَnُّbَr āwُlwُqَy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍّqَḥ ِrْyَغِb mِhِrāَyِd nِm āwُjgِrْhkُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā
ِrwُmُaʾْlā ُhَbِqāَʿع ِhَّlِlَw ۗ ِrَknُmْlā ِnَʿع āْwَhَnَw ِfwُrْʿعَmْlāِb āwُrَmَaʾَw َhāَkَّzlā āُwَtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmāَqَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhāَّnَّkَّm nِiʾ َnyِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: Literally, "fallen in upon its roofs," i.e., after the roofs of its buildings had caved in, the walls collapsed over them.
i.e., How many wells have been left inoperative, and how many palaces have been emptied of their occupants in the past.

ayas.translation: ِrwُdُّṣlā yِf yِtَّlā ُbwُlُqْlā yَmْʿعَt nِkٰـَlَw ُrāَṣْbَaʾْlā yَmْʿعَt āَl āَhَّnِiʾَf ۖ āَhِb َnwُʿعَmْsَy ٌnāَhdāʾ ْwَaʾ āَhِb َnwُlِqْʿعَy ٌbwُlُq ْmُhَl َnwُkَtَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَfَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., trying to undermine their credibility and thereby defeat the Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: ٌmyِkَḥ ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِhِtāَyāʾ ُhَّllā ُmِkْḥُy َّmُht ُnāَṭْyَّhslā yِqْlُy āَm ُhَّllā ُhkَsnَyَf ِhِtَّyِnْmُaʾ yِf ُnāَṭْyَّhslā yَqْlَaʾ ٰyَّnَmَt āَhdِiʾ āَّlِiʾ ٍّyِbَn āَlَw ٍlwُsَّr nِm َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: Clarifying those issues which were misunderstood to remove any doubt.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="10">2:10</reference>.
One which will not be followed by night and therefore will not give birth to a new day, referring to the Day of Resurrection.
None will compete with Him for authority at that time.

ayas.translation: َnyِqِzāَّrlā ُrْyَhk َwُhَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾَw ۚ āًnَsَḥ āًqْzِr ُhَّllā ُmُhَّnَqُzْrَyَl āwُtāَm ْwَaʾ āwُlِtُq َّmُht ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُrَjgāَh َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: In spite of His ability to take vengeance. The statement contains a suggestion that the believers pardon as well.
i.e., Allāh's capability to give assistance or victory to the oppressed.
Refer to footnote of <reference chapter="6" verses="103">6:103</reference>.
Of His creation and of the needs of His creatures.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌfwُءَrَl ِsāَّnlāِb َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ ِhِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yَlَʿع َʿعَqَt nَaʾ َءāَmَّslā ُkِsْmُyَw ِhِrْmَaʾِb ِrْḥَbْlā yِf yِrْjgَt َkْlُfْlāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَّm mُkَl َrَّhkَs َhَّllā َّnَaʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), which is with Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍryِṣَّn nِm َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl āَmَw ۗ ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb mُhَl َsْyَl āَmَw āًnāَṭْlُs ِhِb ْlِّzَnُy ْmَl āَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَyَw

ُryِṣَmْlā َsْyʾِbَw ۖ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā āَhَdَʿعَw ُrāَّnlā ۗ ُmُkِlَٰhd nِّm ٍّrَhsِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُaʾَfَaʾ ْlُq ۗ āَnِtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َnwُlْtَy َnyِhdَّlāِb َnwُṭْsَy َnwُdāَkَy ۖ َrَknُmْlā āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِhwُjgُw yِf ُfِrْʿعَt ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., worse than the rage you feel against those who recite Allāh's verses or worse than your threats against them.

ayas.translation: ُbwُlْṭَmْlāَw ُbِlāَّṭlā َfُʿعَḍ ۚ ُhْnِm ُhwُhdِqnَtْsَy āَّl āًyʾْyَhs ُbāَbُّhdlā ُmُhْbُlْsَy nِiʾَw ۖ ُhَl āwُʿعَmَtْjgā ِwَlَw āًbāَbُhd āwُqُlْhkَy nَl ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُhَl āwُʿعِmَtْsāَf ٌlَhtَm َbِrُḍ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: A comparison is made here to the worshipper of a false deity and that which he worships.
They have not assessed Him with the assessment due to Him, meaning that they did not take into account His perfect attributes.
See footnote to <reference chapter="20" verses="110">20:110</reference>.

ayas.translation: ۩ َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl َrْyَhkْlā āwُlَʿعْfāَw ْmُkَّbَr āwُdُbْʿعāَw āwُdُjgْsāَw āwُʿعَkْrā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ُryِṣَّnlā َmْʿعِnَw ٰyَlْwَmْlā َmْʿعِnَf ۖ ْmُkāَlْwَm َwُh ِhَّllāِb āwُmِṣَtْʿعāَw َhāَkَّzlā āwُtāʾَw َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmyِqَaʾَf ۚ ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿع َءāَdَhُhs āwُnwُkَtَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع āًdyِhَhs ُlwُsَّrlā َnwُkَyِl āَhdٰـَh yِfَw ُlْbَq nِm َnyِmِlْsُmْlā ُmُkāَّmَs َwُh ۚ َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ْmُkyِbَaʾ َhَّlِّm ۚ ٍjgَrَḥ ْnِm ِnyِّdlā yِf ْmُkْyَlَʿع َlَʿعَjg āَmَw ْmُkāَbَtْjgā َwُh ۚ ِhِdāَhِjg َّqَḥ ِhَّllā yِf āwُdِhāَjgَw

footnotes.text: Female slaves or captives under their ownership.
The highest part of Paradise.
Or "as a zygote."

ayas.translation: َnyِqِlāَhkْlā ُnَsْḥَaʾ ُhَّllā َkَrāَbَtَf ۚ َrَhkāʾ āًqْlَhk ُhāَnْaʾَhsnَaʾ َّmُht āًmْḥَl َmāَẓِʿعْlā āَnْwَsَkَf āًmāَẓِʿع َhَغْḍُmْlā āَnْqَlَhkَf ًhَغْḍُm َhَqَlَʿعْlā āَnْqَlَhkَf ًhَqَlَʿع َhَfْṭُّnlā āَnْqَlَhk َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., the most skillful and only true Creator.

ayas.translation: َnwُlُkْaʾَt āَhْnِmَw ٌhَryِhtَk ُʿعِfāَnَm āَhyِf ْmُkَlَw āَhِnwُṭُb yِf āَّmِّm mُkyِqْsُّn ۖ ًhَrْbِʿعَl ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā yِf ْmُkَl َّnِiʾَw
َnwُqَّtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَqَf ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āًḥwُn āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā āَnِyʾāَbāʾ yِf āَhdٰـَhِb āَnْʿعِmَs āَّm ًhَkِyʾāَlَm َlَznَaʾَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع َlَّḍَfَtَy nَaʾ ُdyِrُy ْmُkُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm ِhِmْwَq nِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُaʾَlَmْlā َlāَqَf

َnwُqَrْغُّm mُhَّnِiʾ ۖ āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā yِf yِnْbِṭāَhkُt āَlَw ۖ ْmُhْnِm ُlْwَqْlā ِhْyَlَʿع َqَbَs nَm āَّlِiʾ َkَlْhَaʾَw ِnْyَnْhtā ِnْyَjgْwَz ٍّlُk nِm āَhyِf ْkُlْsāَf ۙ ُrwُّnَّtlā َrāَfَw āَnُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf āَnِyْḥَwَw āَnِnُyْʿعَaʾِb َkْlُfْlā ِʿعَnْṣā ِnَaʾ ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَf

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="11" verses="40">11:40</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُqَّtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۖ ُhُrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl āَm َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِnَaʾ ْmُhْnِّm āًlwُsَr ْmِhyِf āَnْlَsْrَaʾَf

footnotes.text: Prophet Hūd, who was sent to the tribe of ʿAad.

ayas.translation: َnwُbَrْhsَt āَّmِm ُbَrْhsَyَw ُhْnِm َnwُlُkْaʾَt āَّmِm ُlُkْaʾَy ْmُkُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ْmُhāَnْfَrْtَaʾَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ِءāَqِlِb āwُbَّhdَkَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِhِmْwَq nِm ُaʾَlَmْlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: i.e., how distant and improbable it is.
See footnote to <reference chapter="11" verses="67">11:67</reference>.
i.e., by right or in justice.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَّl ٍmْwَqِّl āًdْʿعُbَf ۚ َhtyِdāَḥَaʾ ْmُhāَnْlَʿعَjgَw āًḍْʿعَb mُhَḍْʿعَb āَnْʿعَbْtَaʾَf ۚ ُhwُbَّhdَk āَhُlwُsَّr ًhَّmُaʾ َءāَjg āَm َّlُk ۖ ٰyَrْtَt āَnَlُsُr āَnْlَsْrَaʾ َّmُht

footnotes.text: i.e., history or lessons for mankind.
i.e., evidences from Allāh.
The Children of Israel.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb yِّnِiʾ ۖ āًḥِlāَṣ āwُlَmْʿعāَw ِtāَbِّyَّṭlā َnِm āwُlُk ُlُsُّrlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="21" verses="92">21:92</reference>.
Of beliefs, opinions, customs, etc.
That the good things given to them in this world are but a trial for them.
Lest their deeds not be acceptable.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْẓُy āَl ْmُhَw ۚ ِّqَḥْlāِb ُqِṭnَy ٌbāَtِk āَnْyَdَlَw ۖ āَhَʿعْsُw āَّlِiʾ āًsْfَn ُfِّlَkُn āَlَw

footnotes.text: In worldly life, before the punishment of the Hereafter. Although general, the description includes specifically the punishment of the Quraysh by famine.
The revelation. Or "him," i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ).
Or "reminder."

ayas.translation: َnwُhَmْʿعَy ْmِhِnāَyْغُṭ yِf āwُّjgَlَّl ٍّrُḍ nِّm mِhِb āَm āَnْfَhsَkَw ْmُhāَnْmِḥَr ْwَlَw
َnwُsِlْbُm ِhyِf ْmُh āَhdِiʾ ٍdyِdَhs ٍbāَhdَʿع āَhd āًbāَb mِhْyَlَʿع āَnْḥَtَf āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

footnotes.text: Instead of understanding or reasoning.

ayas.translation: َnwُhtwُʿعْbَmَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًmāَẓِʿعَw āًbāَrُt āَّnُkَw āَnْtِm āَhdِiʾَaʾ āwُlāَq
َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُryِṭāَsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ُlْbَq nِm āَhdٰـَh āَnُwʾāَbāʾَw ُnْḥَn āَnْdِʿعُw ْdَqَl
َnwُfِṣَy āَّmَʿع ِhَّllā َnāَḥْbُs ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhُḍْʿعَb āَlَʿعَlَw َqَlَhk āَmِb ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ُّlُk َbَhَhdَّl āًhdِiʾ ۚ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِm ُhَʿعَm َnāَk āَmَw ٍdَlَw nِm ُhَّllā َhdَhkَّtā āَm
َnwُhtَʿعْbُy ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ ٌhkَzْrَb mِhِyʾāَrَw nِmَw ۖ āَhُlِyʾāَq َwُh ٌhَmِlَk āَhَّnِiʾ ۚ āَّlَk ۚ ُtْkَrَt āَmyِf āًḥِlāَṣ ُlَmْʿعَaʾ yِّlَʿعَl

footnotes.text: Or "in that which I neglected."
Their lips having been contracted by scorching until the teeth are exposed.

ayas.translation: َnyِّlāَḍ āًmْwَq āَّnُkَw āَnُtَwْqِhs āَnْyَlَʿع ْtَbَlَغ āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: And owner of everything in existence.
Or "the True Reality."

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَṭ āَmُhَbāَhdَʿع ْdَhْhsَyْlَw ۖ ِrِhkāʾْlā ِmْwَyْlāَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُt ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِhَّllā ِnyِd yِf ٌhَfْaʾَr āَmِhِb mُkْhdُhkْaʾَt āَlَw ۖ ٍhَdْlَjg َhَyʾāِm āَmُhْnِّm ٍdِḥāَw َّlُk āwُdِlْjgāَf yِnāَّzlāَw ُhَyِnāَّzlā

footnotes.text: Either by voluntary confession of the offender or the testimony of four male witnesses to having actually seen the act take place. Otherwise, there can be no conviction.
The ruling in this verse is applicable to unmarried fornicators. Execution by stoning is confirmed in the sunnah for convicted adulterers.
i.e., Do not let sympathy for a guilty person move you to alter anything ordained by Allāh, for in His law is protection of society as a whole.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع َkِlَٰhd َmِّrُḥَw ۚ ٌkِrْhsُm ْwَaʾ ٍnāَz āَّlِiʾ āَhُḥِknَy āَl ُhَyِnāَّzlāَw ًhَkِrْhsُm ْwَaʾ ًhَyِnāَz āَّlِiʾ ُḥِknَy āَl yِnāَّzlā

footnotes.text: Included in this ruling is the adulterer as well. Such persons cannot be married to believers unless they have repented and reformed.
The husbands who have been betrayed.
The phrase omitted is estimated to be "...you would have surely been punished, destroyed or scandalized," or "...you would have suffered many difficult situations."

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ُhَl ْmُhْnِm ُhَrْbِk ٰyَّlَwَt yِhdَّlāَw ۚ ِmْhtِiʾْlā َnِm َbَsَtْkā āَّm mُhْnِّm ٍyʾِrْmā ِّlُkِl ۚ ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk َwُh ْlَb ۖ mُkَّl āًّrَhs ُhwُbَsْḥَt āَl ۚ ْmُknِّm ٌhَbْṣُʿع ِkْfِiʾْlāِb āwُءāَjg َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Referring to the incident when the Prophet's wife ʿĀ’ishah was falsely accused by the hypocrites.
i.e., ʿAbdullāh bin ʿUbayy, leader of the hypocrites.
Rather than your ears, i.e., not thinking about what you had heard but hastening to repeat it carelessly.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌnāَtْhُb āَhdٰـَh َkَnāَḥْbُs āَhdٰـَhِb َmَّlَkَtَّn nَaʾ āَnَl ُnwُkَy āَّm mُtْlُq ُhwُmُtْʿعِmَs ْhdِiʾ āَlْwَlَw
َnwُmَlْʿعَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِhَrِhkāʾْlāَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā yِf ُhَhsِḥāَfْlā َʿعyِhsَt nَaʾ َnwُّbِḥُy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Specifically, unlawful sexual relations.
The hidden aspects of all things: what is beneficial and what is harmful.
See footnote to <reference chapter="24" verses="10">verse 10</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعyِmَs ُhَّllāَw ۗ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِّkَzُy َhَّllā َّnِkٰـَlَw āًdَbَaʾ ٍdَḥَaʾ ْnِّm mُknِm ٰyَkَz āَm ُhُtَmْḥَrَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā ُlْḍَf āَlْwَlَw ۚ ِrَknُmْlāَw ِءāَhsْḥَfْlāِb ُrُmْaʾَy ُhَّnِiʾَf ِnāَṭْyَّhslā ِtāَwُṭُhk ْʿعِbَّtَy nَmَw ۚ ِnāَṭْyَّhslā ِtāَwُṭُhk āwُʿعِbَّtَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ ُhَّllāَw ۗ ْmُkَl ُhَّllā َrِfْغَy nَaʾ َnwُّbِḥُt āَlَaʾ ۗ āwُḥَfْṣَyْlَw āwُfْʿعَyْlَw ۖ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf َnyِrِjgāَhُmْlāَw َnyِkāَsَmْlāَw ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِlwُaʾ āwُtْwʾُy nَaʾ ِhَʿعَّslāَw ْmُknِm ِlْḍَfْlā wُlwُaʾ ِlَtْaʾَy āَlَw

footnotes.text: Another accepted interpretation is "Evil women are for evil men, and evil men are for evil women. And good women are for good men, and good men are for good women."

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ْmُkَّl ٌrْyَhk ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ āَhِlْhَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُmِّlَsُtَw āwُsِnْaʾَtْsَt ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُkِtwُyُb َrْyَغ āًtwُyُb āwُlُhkْdَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: By the words "As-salāmu ʿalaykum" ("Peace be upon you").

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllāَw ۚ ْmُkَl ٰyَkْzَaʾ َwُh ۖ āwُʿعِjgْrāَf āwُʿعِjgْrā ُmُkَl َlyِq nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkَl َnَhdْwʾُy ٰyَّtَḥ āَhwُlُhkْdَt āَlَf āًdَḥَaʾ āَhyِf āwُdِjgَt ْmَّl nِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Or a similar expression showing that the occupants are not prepared to receive visitors (which should be respected).

ayas.translation: َnwُmُtْkَt āَmَw َnwُdْbُt āَm ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ ْmُkَّl ٌʿعāَtَm āَhyِf ٍhَnwُkْsَm َrْyَغ āًtwُyُb āwُlُhkْdَt nَaʾ ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَّl

footnotes.text: Some benefit such as rest, shelter, commodities, one's personal belongings, etc.
Looking only at what is lawful and averting their eyes from what is unlawful.
From being seen and from unlawful acts.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥِlْfُt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā َhُّyَaʾ āًʿعyِmَjg ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āwُbwُtَw ۚ َّnِhِtَnyِz nِm َnyِfْhkُy āَm َmَlْʿعُyِl َّnِhِlُjgْrَaʾِb َnْbِrْḍَy āَlَw ۖ ِءāَsِّnlā ِtāَrْwَʿع ٰyَlَʿع āwُrَhْẓَy ْmَl َnyِhdَّlā ِlْfِّṭlā ِwَaʾ ِlāَjgِّrlā َnِm ِhَbْrِiʾْlā yِlwُaʾ ِrْyَغ َnyِʿعِbāَّtlā ِwَaʾ َّnُhُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَm ْwَaʾ َّnِhِyʾāَsِn ْwَaʾ َّnِhِtāَwَhkَaʾ yِnَb ْwَaʾ َّnِhِnāَwْhkِiʾ yِnَb ْwَaʾ َّnِhِnāَwْhkِiʾ ْwَaʾ َّnِhِtَlwُʿعُb ِءāَnْbَaʾ ْwَaʾ َّnِhِyʾāَnْbَaʾ ْwَaʾ َّnِhِtَlwُʿعُb ِءāَbāʾ ْwَaʾ َّnِhِyʾāَbāʾ ْwَaʾ َّnِhِtَlwُʿعُbِl āَّlِiʾ َّnُhَtَnyِz َnyِdْbُy āَlَw ۖ َّnِhِbwُyُjg ٰyَlَʿع َّnِhِrُmُhkِb َnْbِrْḍَyْlَw ۖ āَhْnِm َrَhَẓ āَm āَّlِiʾ َّnُhَtَnyِz َnyِdْbُy āَlَw َّnُhَjgwُrُf َnْẓَfْḥَyَw َّnِhِrāَṣْbَaʾ ْnِm َnْḍُḍْغَy ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlِّl lُqَw

footnotes.text: Looking only at what is lawful and averting their eyes from what is unlawful.
Both natural beauty, such as hair or body shape, and that with which a woman beautifies herself of clothing, jewelry, etc.
i.e., the outer garments or whatever might appear out of necessity, such as a part of the face or the hands.
Referring to an abnormal condition in which a man is devoid of sexual feeling.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َّnِhِhāَrْkِiʾ ِdْʿعَb nِm َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf َّnُّhhِrْkُy nَmَw ۚ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā َḍَrَʿع āwُغَtْbَtِّl āًnُّṣَḥَt َnْdَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ ِءāَغِbْlā yَlَʿع ْmُkِtāَyَtَf āwُhِrْkُt āَlَw ۚ ْmُkāَtāʾ yِhdَّlā ِhَّllā ِlāَّm nِّm mُhwُtāʾَw ۖ āًrْyَhk ْmِhyِf ْmُtْmِlَʿع ْnِiʾ ْmُhwُbِtāَkَf ْmُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَّmِm َbāَtِkْlā َnwُغَtْbَy َnyِhdَّlāَw ۗ ِhِlْḍَf nِm ُhَّllā ُmُhَyِnْغُy ٰyَّtَḥ āًḥāَkِn َnwُdِjgَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā ِfِfْʿعَtْsَyْlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., those slaves who desire to purchase their freedom from their owners for a price agreed upon by both.
i.e., rulings and ordinances, in particular those in this sūrah.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِsāَّnlِl َlāَhtْmَaʾْlā ُhَّllā ُbِrْḍَyَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِrwُnِl ُhَّllā yِdْhَy ۗ ٍrwُn ٰyَlَʿع ٌrwُّn ۚ ٌrāَn ُhْsَsْmَt ْmَl ْwَlَw ُءyِḍُy āَhُtْyَz ُdāَkَy ٍhَّyِbْrَغ āَlَw ٍhَّyِqْrَhs āَّl ٍhَnwُtْyَz ٍhَkَrāَbُّm ٍhَrَjgَhs nِm ُdَqwُy ٌّyِّrُd ٌbَkْwَk āَhَّnَaʾَk ُhَjgāَjgُّzlā ۖ ٍhَjgāَjgُz yِf ُḥāَbْṣِmْlā ۖ ٌḥāَbْṣِm āَhyِf ٍhāَkْhsِmَk ِhِrwُn ُlَhtَm ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُrwُn ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: i.e., the source and bestower of light and enlightenment.
His guidance in the heart of a believing servant.
Literally, "a burning wick," which is the essence of a lamp.
The term used here can refer to either afternoon or evening.

ayas.translation: ٍrwُّn nِm ُhَl āَmَf āًrwُn ُhَl ُhَّllā ِlَʿعْjgَy ْmَّl nَmَw ۗ āَhāَrَy ْdَkَy ْmَl ُhَdَy َjgَrْhkَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٍḍْʿعَb َqْwَf āَhُḍْʿعَb ٌtāَmُlُẓ ۚ ٌbāَḥَs ِhِqْwَf nِّm ٌjgْwَm ِhِqْwَf nِّm ٌjgْwَm ُhāَhsْغَy ٍّyِّjgُّl ٍrْḥَb yِf ٍtāَmُlُẓَk ْwَaʾ

ِrāَṣْbَaʾْlāِb ُbَhْhdَy ِhِqْrَb āَnَs ُdāَkَy ۖ ُءāَhsَy nَّm nَʿع ُhُfِrْṣَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِb ُbyِṣُyَf ٍdَrَb nِm āَhyِf ٍlāَbِjg nِm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm ُlِّzَnُyَw ِhِlāَlِhk ْnِm ُjgُrْhkَy َqْdَwْlā yَrَtَf āًmāَkُr ُhُlَʿعْjgَy َّmُht ُhَnْyَb ُfِّlَwʾُy َّmُht āًbāَḥَs yِjgْzُy َhَّllā َّnَaʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُءāَhsَy āَm ُhَّllā ُqُlْhkَy ۚ ٍʿعَbْrَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع yِhsْmَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw ِnْyَlْjgِr ٰyَlَʿع yِhsْmَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw ِhِnْṭَb ٰyَlَʿع yِhsْmَy nَّm mُhْnِmَf ۖ ٍءāَّm nِّm ٍhَّbāَd َّlُk َqَlَhk ُhَّllāَw
َnwُḥِlْfُmْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَw ۚ āَnْʿعَṭَaʾَw āَnْʿعِmَs āwُlwُqَy nَaʾ ْmُhَnْyَb َmُkْḥَyِl ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āwُʿعُd āَhdِiʾ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َlْwَq َnāَk āَmَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., the hypocrites' pretense of obedience is known to be a lie.

ayas.translation: ُnyِbُmْlā ُغāَlَbْlā āَّlِiʾ ِlwُsَّrlā yَlَʿع āَmَw ۚ āwُdَtْhَt ُhwُʿعyِṭُt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُtْlِّmُḥ āَّm mُkْyَlَʿعَw َlِّmُḥ āَm ِhْyَlَʿع āَmَّnِiʾَf āْwَّlَwَt nِiʾَf ۖ َlwُsَّrlā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾ ْlُq

َnwُqِsāَfْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf َkِlَٰhd َdْʿعَb َrَfَk nَmَw ۚ āًyʾْyَhs yِb َnwُkِrْhsُy āَl yِnَnwُdُbْʿعَy ۚ āًnْmَaʾ ْmِhِfْwَhk ِdْʿعَb nِّm mُhَّnَlِّdَbُyَlَw ْmُhَl ٰyَḍَtْrā yِhdَّlā ُmُhَnyِd ْmُhَl َّnَnِّkَmُyَlَw ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َfَlْhkَtْsā āَmَk ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْmُhَّnَfِlْhkَtْsَyَl ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw ْmُknِm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā َdَʿعَw

footnotes.text: i.e., denies the favor of Allāh or does not live by His ordinance.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِkَḥ ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّllāَw ۗ ِtāَyāʾْlā ُmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُkُḍْʿعَb mُkْyَlَʿع َnwُfāَّwَṭ ۚ َّnُhَdْʿعَb ٌḥāَnُjg ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَlَw ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَl ۚ ْmُkَّl ٍtāَrْwَʿع ُhtāَlَht ۚ ِءāَhsِʿعْlā ِhāَlَṣ ِdْʿعَb nِmَw ِhَryِhَّẓlā َnِّm mُkَbāَyِht َnwُʿعَḍَt َnyِḥَw ِrْjgَfْlā ِhāَlَṣ ِlْbَq nِّm ۚ ٍtāَّrَm َhtāَlَht ْmُknِm َmُlُḥْlā āwُغُlْbَy ْmَl َnyِhdَّlāَw ْmُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm َnyِhdَّlā ُmُknِhdْaʾَtْsَyِl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Literally, "exposure" or "being uncovered."

ayas.translation: َnwُlِqْʿعَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُmُkَl ُhَّllā ُnِّyَbُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ًhَbِّyَṭ ًhَkَrāَbُm ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِّm ًhَّyِḥَt ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُmِّlَsَf āًtwُyُb mُtْlَhkَd āَhdِiʾَf ۚ āًtāَtْhsَaʾ ْwَaʾ āًʿعyِmَjg āwُlُkْaʾَt nَaʾ ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَl ۚ ْmُkِqyِdَṣ ْwَaʾ ُhَḥِtāَfَّm mُtْkَlَm āَm ْwَaʾ ْmُkِtāَlāَhk ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِlāَwْhkَaʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِtāَّmَʿع ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِmāَmْʿعَaʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِtāَwَhkَaʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِnāَwْhkِiʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِtāَhَّmُaʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِyʾāَbāʾ ِtwُyُb ْwَaʾ ْmُkِtwُyُb nِm āwُlُkْaʾَt nَaʾ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَlَw ٌjgَrَḥ ِḍyِrَmْlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ٌjgَrَḥ ِjgَrْʿعَaʾْlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ٌjgَrَḥ ٰyَmْʿعَaʾْlā yَlَʿع َsْyَّl

footnotes.text: Saying, "As-salāmu ʿalaykum" ("Peace be upon you").

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā ُmُhَl ْrِfْغَtْsāَw ْmُhْnِm َtْyʾِhs nَmِّl nَhdْaʾَf ْmِhِnْaʾَhs ِḍْʿعَbِl َkwُnَhdْaʾَtْsā āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ َkَnwُnِhdْaʾَtْsَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُhwُnِhdْaʾَtْsَy ٰyَّtَḥ āwُbَhْhdَy ْmَّl ٍʿعِmāَjg ٍrْmَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ُhَʿعَm āwُnāَk āَhdِiʾَw ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllāِb āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā āَmَّnِiʾ

ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَbyِṣُy ْwَaʾ ٌhَnْtِf ْmُhَbyِṣُt nَaʾ ِhِrْmَaʾ ْnَʿع َnwُfِlāَhkُy َnyِhdَّlā ِrَhdْḥَyْlَf ۚ āًhdāَwِl ْmُknِm َnwُlَّlَsَtَy َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā ُmَlْʿعَy ْdَq ۚ āًḍْʿعَb mُkِḍْʿعَb ِءāَʿعُdَk ْmُkَnْyَb ِlwُsَّrlā َءāَʿعُd āwُlَʿعْjgَt āَّl

footnotes.text: Meaning also his way or his sunnah.
Trials, affliction, dissension, strife, etc.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb ُhَّllāَw ۗ āwُlِmَʿع āَmِb mُhُyʾِّbَnُyَf ِhْyَlِiʾ َnwُʿعَjgْrُy َmْwَyَw ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُtnَaʾ āَm ُmَlْʿعَy ْdَq ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِl َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., your position - the basis for your actions (whether sincere faith or hypocrisy) and the condition of your souls.
The meaning can also be rendered "...and [let them beware of] the Day..."

ayas.translation: āًrwُhsُn āَlَw ًhāَyَḥ āَlَw āًtْwَm َnwُkِlْmَy āَlَw āًʿعْfَn āَlَw āًّrَḍ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾِl َnwُkِlْmَy āَlَw َnwُqَlْhkُy ْmُhَw āًyʾْyَhs َnwُqُlْhkَy āَّl ًhَhِlāʾ ِhِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtāَw
āًrwُzَw āًmْlُẓ āwُءāَjg ْdَqَf ۖ َnwُrَhkāʾ ٌmْwَq ِhْyَlَʿع ُhَnāَʿعَaʾَw ُhāَrَtْfā ٌkْfِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw
āًryِhdَn ُhَʿعَm َnwُkَyَf ٌkَlَm ِhْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَlْwَl ۙ ِqāَwْsَaʾْlā yِf yِhsْmَyَw َmāَʿعَّṭlā ُlُkْaʾَy ِlwُsَّrlā āَhdٰـَh ِlāَm āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: From their own imaginations in order to deny and discredit you.

ayas.translation: āًrwُṣُq َkَّl lَʿعْjgَyَw ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg َkِlَٰhd nِّm āًrْyَhk َkَl َlَʿعَjg َءāَhs nِiʾ yِhdَّlā َkَrāَbَt
āًryِfَzَw āًẓُّyَغَt āَhَl āwُʿعِmَs ٍdyِʿعَb ٍnāَkَّm nِّm mُhْtَaʾَr āَhdِiʾ
āًrwُbُht َkِlāَnُh āْwَʿعَd َnyِnَّrَqُّm āًqِّyَḍ āًnāَkَm āَhْnِm āwُqْlُaʾ āَhdِiʾَw
āًryِhtَk āًrwُbُht āwُʿعْdāَw āًdِḥāَw āًrwُbُht َmْwَyْlā āwُʿعْdَt āَّl

footnotes.text: Or "...a promise requested [for them by the angels]."

ayas.translation: āًrwُb āًmْwَq āwُnāَkَw َrْkِّhdlā āwُsَn ٰyَّtَḥ ْmُhَءāَbāʾَw ْmُhَtْʿعَّtَّm nِkٰـَlَw َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْnِm َkِnwُd nِm َhdِhkَّtَّn nَaʾ āَnَl yِغَbnَy َnāَk āَm َkَnāَḥْbُs āwُlāَq
āًryِbَk āًbāَhdَʿع ُhْqِhdُn ْmُknِّm mِlْẓَy nَmَw ۚ āًrْṣَn āَlَw āًfْrَṣ َnwُʿعyِṭَtْsَt āَmَf َnwُlwُqَt āَmِb mُkwُbَّhdَk ْdَqَf

footnotes.text: At the time of Judgement the false objects of worship will betray their worshippers and deny them.
Specifically, association of others with Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَb َkُّbَr َnāَkَw ۗ َnwُrِbْṣَtَaʾ ًhَnْtِf ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُkَḍْʿعَb āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ۗ ِqāَwْsَaʾْlā yِf َnwُhsْmَyَw َmāَʿعَّṭlā َnwُlُkْaʾَyَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ āَّlِiʾ َnyِlَsْrُmْlā َnِm َkَlْbَq āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw
āًryِbَk āًّwُtُʿع āْwَtَʿعَw ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf āwُrَbْkَtْsā ِdَqَl ۗ āَnَّbَr ٰyَrَn ْwَaʾ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā āَnْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَlْwَl āَnَءāَqِl َnwُjgْrَy āَl َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Additional meanings are "among themselves" and "over [the matter of] themselves."
i.e., at the time of death.
Referring to any good tidings.
On the Day of Judgement.
Within which are the angels.
i.e., followed the Prophet (ﷺ) on a path of guidance.
The person who misguided him.
i.e., the Qur’ān or the remembrance of Allāh.
Forsaking him once he has led him into evil.
i.e., avoiding it, not listening to or understanding it, not living by it, or preferring something else to it.
Also, "recited it with distinct recitation."

ayas.translation: āًryِmْdَt ْmُhāَnْrَّmَdَf āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُbَّhdَk َnyِhdَّlā ِmْwَqْlā yَlِiʾ āَbَhْhdā āَnْlُqَf

footnotes.text: Their denial of Noah was as if they had denied all those who brought the same message from Allāh.
Said to be a people who denied Prophet Shuʿayb or possibly those mentioned in Sūrah Yā Seen, <reference chapter="36" verses="13-29">36:13-29</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًrwُhsُn َnwُjgْrَy āَl āwُnāَk ْlَb ۚ āَhَnْwَrَy āwُnwُkَy ْmَlَfَaʾ ۚ ِءْwَّslā َrَṭَm ْtَrِṭْmُaʾ yِtَّlā ِhَyْrَqْlā yَlَʿع āْwَtَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: So they do not benefit from lessons of the past.

ayas.translation: āًlwُsَr ُhَّllā َhtَʿعَb yِhdَّlā āَhdٰـَhَaʾ āًwُzُh āَّlِiʾ َkَnwُhdِhkَّtَy nِiʾ َkْwَaʾَr āَhdِiʾَw
āًlyِbَs ُّlَḍَaʾ ْnَm َbāَhdَʿعْlā َnْwَrَy َnyِḥ َnwُmَlْʿعَy َfْwَsَw ۚ āَhْyَlَʿع āَnْrَbَṣ nَaʾ āَlْwَl āَnِtَhِlāʾ ْnَʿع āَnُّlِḍُyَl َdāَk nِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., cattle or sheep, that follow without question wherever they are led.
i.e., showing the existence of a shadow or making it apparent by contrast.
i.e., when the sun is overhead at noon.
Covering you in darkness and providing rest.
For renewal of life and activity.
Of Allāh's ability to bring the dead to life.
However, Allāh willed that Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) be sent as the final messenger for all peoples of the earth until the Day of Resurrection.

ayas.translation: āًrwُjgْḥَّm āًrْjgِḥَw āًhkَzْrَb āَmُhَnْyَb َlَʿعَjgَw ٌjgāَjgُaʾ ٌḥْlِm āَhdٰـَhَw ٌtāَrُf ٌbْhdَʿع āَhdٰـَh ِnْyَrْḥَbْlā َjgَrَm yِhdَّlā َwُhَw
āًryِbَhk ِhِb ْlَaʾْsāَf ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ۚ ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā

footnotes.text: See footnotes to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference> and <reference chapter="7" verses="54">7:54</reference>.

ayas.translation: ۩ āًrwُfُn ْmُhَdāَzَw āَnُrُmْaʾَt āَmِl ُdُjgْsَnَaʾ ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā āَmَw āwُlāَq ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlِl āwُdُjgْsā ُmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
āًryِnُّm āًrَmَqَw āًjgāَrِs āَhyِf َlَʿعَjgَw āًjgwُrُb ِءāَmَّslā yِf َlَʿعَjg yِhdَّlā َkَrāَbَt

footnotes.text: i.e., gently, with dignity but without arrogance.
Or "safety," i.e., words free from fault or evil.

ayas.translation: āًmāَhtَaʾ َqْlَy َkِlَٰhd ْlَʿعْfَy nَmَw ۚ َnwُnْzَy āَlَw ِّqَḥْlāِb āَّlِiʾ ُhَّllā َmَّrَḥ yِtَّlā َsْfَّnlā َnwُlُtْqَy āَlَw َrَhkāʾ āًhٰـَlِiʾ ِhَّllā َʿعَm َnwُʿعْdَy āَl َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: Or "worship."

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ ٍtāَnَsَḥ ْmِhِtāَyʾِّyَs ُhَّllā ُlِّdَbُy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf āًḥِlāَṣ āًlَmَʿع َlِmَʿعَw َnَmāʾَw َbāَt nَm āَّlِiʾ
āًnāَyْmُʿعَw āًّmُṣ āَhْyَlَʿع āwُّrِhkَy ْmَl ْmِhِّbَr ِtāَyāʾِb āwُrِّkُhd āَhdِiʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw
āًmāَmِiʾ َnyِqَّtُmْlِl āَnْlَʿعْjgāَw ٍnُyْʿعَaʾ َhَّrُq āَnِtāَّyِّrُhdَw āَnِjgāَwْzَaʾ ْnِm āَnَl ْbَh āَnَّbَr َnwُlwُqَy َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., a source of happiness due to their righteousness.
The most elevated portion of Paradise.
i.e., faith and worship. An alternative meaning is "What would my Lord do with you..."
It will remain with them, causing punishment to be required and imperative upon them.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
i.e., they would be compelled to believe.
The singular form in Arabic indicates that both were sent with a single message.
i.e., striking the Copt, who died as a result.
Angrily addressing those present.
i.e., clearly genuine.
i.e., the morning of the day of festival. See <reference chapter="20" verses="58-59">20:58-59</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِbِlāَغْlā ُnْḥَn āَّnُk nِiʾ āًrْjgَaʾَl āَnَl َّnِyʾَaʾ َnْwَʿعْrِfِl āwُlāَq ُhَrَḥَّslā َءāَjg āَّmَlَf
َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َlَّwَaʾ āَّnُk nَaʾ āَnāَyāَṭَhk āَnُّbَr āَnَl َrِfْغَy nَaʾ ُʿعَmْṭَn āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Recruiters of an army to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) caused them to abandon their wealth and property in pursuit of the Israelites.
The people worshipped idols in addition to Allāh.
The conclusion of this verse is estimated as "...we would do this or that."
See footnote to <reference chapter="25" verses="37">25:37</reference>.
i.e., a symbol or indication of their wealth and power. They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by all who passed by.
Miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allāh.
i.e., Are there, out of all Allāh's creatures, any besides you who commit this unnatural act?
Lot's wife, who had collaborated with the evildoers.
i.e., previous generations.
i.e., the non-Arabs or those who are not fluent in the Arabic language.
As a miracle from Allāh.
As was asserted by the disbelievers. Rather, it was brought by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.
As mentioned in <reference chapter="72" verses="9">72:9</reference>.
Or "worship."
From your bed at night for prayer while you are alone.
i.e., among those who pray with you in congregation.
This was before they were prevented, as described in <reference chapter="72" verses="8-9">72:8-9</reference>.
Speaking lies indiscriminately and praising and disparaging others according to whim.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِlَqnَy ٍbَlَqnُm َّyَaʾ āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā ُmَlْʿعَyَsَw ۗ āwُmِlُẓ āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āwُrَṣَtnāَw āًryِhtَk َhَّllā āwُrَkَhdَw ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ

footnotes.text: By replying through poetry to the attacks of hostile poets.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ِّbَr ِhَّllā َnāَḥْbُsَw āَhَlْwَḥ ْnَmَw ِrāَّnlā yِf nَm َkِrwُb nَaʾ َyِdwُn āَhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf
َnwُlَsْrُmْlā َّyَdَl ُfāَhkَy āَl yِّnِiʾ ْfَhkَt āَl ٰyَswُm āَy ۚ ْbِّqَʿعُy ْmَlَw āًrِbْdُm ٰyَّlَw ٌّnāَjg āَhَّnَaʾَk ُّzَtْhَt āَhāʾَr āَّmَlَf ۚ َkāَṣَʿع ِqْlَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Or "did not look back."

ayas.translation: ُnyِbُmْlā ُlْḍَfْlā َwُhَl āَhdٰـَh َّnِiʾ ۖ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk nِm āَnyِtwُaʾَw ِrْyَّṭlā َqِṭnَm āَnْmِّlُʿع ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy َlāَqَw ۖ َdwُwāَd ُnāَmْyَlُs َhtِrَwَw
َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَl ْmُhَw ُhُdwُnُjgَw ُnāَmْyَlُs ْmُkَّnَmِṭْḥَy āَl ْmُkَnِkāَsَm āwُlُhkْdā ُlْmَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ٌhَlْmَn ْtَlāَq ِlْmَّnlā ِdāَw ٰyَlَʿع āْwَtَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā َkِdāَbِʿع yِf َkِtَmْḥَrِb yِnْlِhkْdَaʾَw ُhāَḍْrَt āًḥِlāَṣ َlَmْʿعَaʾ ْnَaʾَw َّyَdِlāَw ٰyَlَʿعَw َّyَlَʿع َtْmَʿعْnَaʾ yِtَّlā َkَtَmْʿعِn َrُkْhsَaʾ ْnَaʾ yِnْʿعِzْwَaʾ ِّbَr َlāَqَw āَhِlْwَq nِّm āًkِḥāَḍ َmَّsَbَtَf

footnotes.text: More literally, "gather within me the utmost strength and ability."
Or "with Your righteous servants [into Paradise]."
i.e., a valid excuse.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِlْʿعُt āَmَw َnwُfْhkُt āَm ُmَlْʿعَyَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf َءْbَhkْlā ُjgِrْhkُy yِhdَّlā ِhَّlِl āwُdُjgْsَy āَّlَaʾ
ِnwُdَhْhsَt ٰyَّtَḥ āًrْmَaʾ ًhَʿعِṭāَq ُtnُk āَm yِrْmَaʾ yِf yِnwُtْfَaʾ ُaʾَlَmْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ْtَlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., are present with me or testify in my favor.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِغāَṣ ْmُhَw ًhَّlِhdَaʾ āَhْnِّm mُhَّnَjgِrْhkُnَlَw āَhِb mُhَl َlَbِq āَّl ٍdwُnُjgِb mُhَّnَyِtْaʾَnَlَf ْmِhْyَlِiʾ ْʿعِjgْrā
َnyِmِlْsُm yِnwُtْaʾَy nَaʾ َlْbَq āَhِhsْrَʿعِb yِnyِtْaʾَy ْmُkُّyَaʾ ُaʾَlَmْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy َlāَq

ٌmyِrَk ٌّyِnَغ yِّbَr َّnِiʾَf َrَfَk nَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَnِl ُrُkْhsَy āَmَّnِiʾَf َrَkَhs nَmَw ۖ ُrُfْkَaʾ ْmَaʾ ُrُkْhsَaʾَaʾ yِnَwُlْbَyِl yِّbَr ِlْḍَf nِm āَhdٰـَh َlāَq ُhَdnِʿع āًّrِqَtْsُm ُhāʾَr āَّmَlَf ۚ َkُfْrَṭ َkْyَlِiʾ َّdَtْrَy nَaʾ َlْbَq ِhِb َkyِtāʾ āَnَaʾ ِbāَtِkْlā َnِّm ٌmْlِʿع ُhَdnِʿع yِhdَّlā َlāَq
َnyِmِlْsُm āَّnُkَw āَhِlْbَq nِm َmْlِʿعْlā āَnyِtwُaʾَw ۚ َwُh ُhَّnَaʾَk ْtَlāَq ۖ ِkُhsْrَʿع āَhdَkٰـَhَaʾ َlyِq ْtَءāَjg āَّmَlَf
َnyِrِfāَk ٍmْwَq nِm ْtَnāَk āَhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm ُdُbْʿعَّt tَnāَk āَm āَhَّdَṣَw

َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ِّbَr ِhَّlِl َnāَmْyَlُs َʿعَm ُtْmَlْsَaʾَw yِsْfَn ُtْmَlَẓ yِّnِiʾ ِّbَr ْtَlāَq ۗ َryِrāَwَq nِّm ٌdَّrَmُّm ٌḥْrَṣ ُhَّnِiʾ َlāَq ۚ āَhْyَqāَs nَʿع ْtَfَhsَkَw ًhَّjgُl ُhْtَbِsَḥ ُhْtَaʾَr āَّmَlَf ۖ َḥْrَّṣlā yِlُhkْdā āَhَl َlyِq

footnotes.text: The floor was transparent, and beneath it was flowing water.
By challenging Ṣāliḥ to bring on the promised punishment rather than asking for mercy from Allāh.
Or "being tempted [by Satan]."
i.e., the one responsible for executing his will and avenging his blood.
Homosexual acts.
i.e., openly. Another meaning is "...while you are aware [that it is wrong]."

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّhَṭَtَy ٌsāَnُaʾ ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkِtَyْrَq nِّm ٍṭwُl َlāʾ āwُjgِrْhkَaʾ āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِmْwَq َbāَwَjg َnāَk āَmَf

َnwُlِdْʿعَy ٌmْwَq ْmُh ْlَb ۚ ِhَّllā َʿعَّm ٌhٰـَlِiʾَaʾ ۗ āَhَrَjgَhs āwُtِbnُt nَaʾ ْmُkَl َnāَk āَّm ٍhَjgْhَb َtāَhd َqِyʾāَdَḥ ِhِb āَnْtَbnَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mُkَl َlَznَaʾَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk ْnَّmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Three meanings are implied: "Is there another god who did all of this with Allāh?" or "Is there any deity worthy to be worshipped along with Allāh?" or "Is there a deity to be compared with Allāh?"

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ِhَّllā َʿعَّm ٌhٰـَlِiʾَaʾ ۗ āًzِjgāَḥ ِnْyَrْḥَbْlā َnْyَb َlَʿعَjgَw َyِsāَwَr āَhَl َlَʿعَjgَw āًrāَhْnَaʾ āَhَlāَlِhk َlَʿعَjgَw āًrāَrَq َḍْrَaʾْlā َlَʿعَjg nَّmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Generation after generation.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy āَّmَʿع ُhَّllā yَlāَʿعَt ۚ ِhَّllā َʿعَّm ٌhٰـَlِiʾَaʾ ۗ ِhِtَmْḥَr ْyَdَy َnْyَb āًrْhsُb َḥāَyِّrlā ُlِsْrُy nَmَw ِrْḥَbْlāَw ِّrَbْlā ِtāَmُlُẓ yِf ْmُkyِdْhَy nَّmَaʾ
َnwُhtَʿعْbُy َnāَّyَaʾ َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَmَw ۚ ُhَّllā āَّlِiʾ َbْyَغْlā ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm ُmَlْʿعَy āَّl lُq
َnwُjgَrْhkُmَl āَّnِyʾَaʾ āَnُwʾāَbāʾَw āًbāَrُt āَّnُk āَhdِiʾَaʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw
َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُryِṭāَsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ُlْbَq nِm āَnُwʾāَbāʾَw ُnْḥَn āَhdٰـَh āَnْdِʿعُw ْdَqَl

footnotes.text: Literally, "absent [from the senses]."
The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), which is with Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُّm mُhَf āَnِtāَyāʾِb ُnِmْwʾُy nَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعِmْsُt nِiʾ ۖ ْmِhِtَlāَlَḍ nَʿع ِyْmُʿعْlā yِdāَhِb َtnَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: At the approach of the Hour.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَhdāَّmَaʾ āًmْlِʿع āَhِb āwُṭyِḥُt ْmَlَw yِtāَyāʾِb mُtْbَّhdَkَaʾ َlāَq āwُءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ

footnotes.text: Allāh's decree will come into effect upon them, and His promise will be fulfilled.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ āًrِṣْbُm َrāَhَّnlāَw ِhyِf āwُnُkْsَyِl َlْyَّllā āَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَaʾ
َnyِrِhkāَd ُhْwَtَaʾ ٌّlُkَw ۚ ُhَّllā َءāَhs nَm āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm َʿعِzَfَf ِrwُّṣlā yِf ُhkَfnُy َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: Or "solid and rigid."
Without having repented. It may refer generally to any sin or more specifically to association of another with Allāh.
Or region, meaning Makkah and its surroundings.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
By means of those whom they had oppressed and enslaved.

ayas.translation: َnyِlَsْrُmْlā َnِm ُhwُlِʿعāَjgَw ِkْyَlِiʾ ُhwُّdāَr āَّnِiʾ ۖ yِnَzْḥَt āَlَw yِfāَhkَt āَlَw ِّmَyْlā yِf ِhyِqْlَaʾَf ِhْyَlَʿع ِtْfِhk āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ِhyِʿعِḍْrَaʾ ْnَaʾ ٰyَswُm ِّmُaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾَw
َnwُrُʿعْhsَy āَl ْmُhَw āًdَlَw ُhَhdِhkَّtَn ْwَaʾ āَnَʿعَfnَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ُhwُlُtْqَt āَl ۖ َkَlَw yِّl ٍnْyَʿع ُtَّrُq َnْwَʿعْrِf ُtَaʾَrْmā ِtَlāَqَw

footnotes.text: What would be the result of that.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm َnwُkَtِl āَhِbْlَq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْṭَbَّr nَaʾ āَlْwَl ِhِb yِdْbُtَl ْtَdāَk nِiʾ ۖ āًغِrāَf ٰyَswُm ِّmُaʾ ُdāَwʾُf َḥَbْṣَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Prior to that, Moses had refused to nurse from any other woman.

ayas.translation: ٌnyِbُّm ٌّlِḍُّm ٌّwُdَʿع ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِnāَṭْyَّhslā ِlَmَʿع ْnِm āَhdٰـَh َlāَq ۖ ِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَḍَqَf ٰyَswُm ُhَzَkَwَf ِhِّwُdَʿع ْnِm yِhdَّlā yَlَʿع ِhِtَʿعyِhs nِm yِhdَّlā ُhَhtāَغَtْsāَf ۖ ِhِّwُdَʿع ْnِm āَhdٰـَhَw ِhِtَʿعyِhs nِm āَhdٰـَh ِnāَlِtَtْqَy ِnْyَlُjgَr āَhyِf َdَjgَwَf āَhِlْhَaʾ ْnِّm ٍhَlْfَغ ِnyِḥ ٰyَlَʿع َhَnyِdَmْlā َlَhkَdَw

footnotes.text: i.e., during the noon period of rest.

ayas.translation: َnyِḥِlْṣُmْlā َnِm َnwُkَt nَaʾ ُdyِrُt āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًrāَّbَjg َnwُkَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ُdyِrُt nِiʾ ۖ ِsْmَaʾْlāِb āًsْfَn َtْlَtَq āَmَk yِnَlُtْqَt nَaʾ ُdyِrُtَaʾ ٰyَswُm āَy َlāَq āَmُhَّl ٌّwُdَʿع َwُh yِhdَّlāِb َhsِṭْbَy nَaʾ َdāَrَaʾ ْnَaʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., the Israelite, thinking that Moses meant to strike him. Some commentators have attributed the words to the Copt; however, the Israelite was the only one who knew of the previous occurrence.

ayas.translation: ٌryِbَk ٌhkْyَhs āَnwُbَaʾَw ۖ ُءāَʿعِّrlā َrِdْṣُy ٰyَّtَḥ yِqْsَn āَl āَtَlāَq ۖ āَmُkُbْṭَhk āَm َlāَq ۖ ِnāَdwُhdَt ِnْyَtَaʾَrْmā ُmِhِnwُd nِm َdَjgَwَw َnwُqْsَy ِsāَّnlā َnِّm ًhَّmُaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َdَjgَw َnَyْdَm َءāَm َdَrَw āَّmَlَw

َnyِmِlāَّẓlā ِmْwَqْlā َnِm َtْwَjgَn ۖ ْfَhkَt āَl َlāَq َṣَṣَqْlā ِhْyَlَʿع َّṣَqَw ُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf ۚ āَnَl َtْyَqَs āَm َrْjgَaʾ َkَyِzْjgَyِl َkwُʿعْdَy yِbَaʾ َّnِiʾ ْtَlāَq ٍءāَyْḥِtْsā yَlَʿع yِhsْmَt āَmُhāَdْḥِiʾ ُhْtَءāَjgَf

footnotes.text: Prophet Shuʿayb, the father of the two women.

ayas.translation: َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā َnِm ُhَّllā َءāَhs nِiʾ yِnُdِjgَtَs ۚ َkْyَlَʿع َّqُhsَaʾ ْnَaʾ ُdyِrُaʾ āَmَw ۖ َkِdnِʿع ْnِmَf āًrْhsَʿع َtْmَmْtَaʾ ْnِiʾَf ۖ ٍjgَjgِḥ َyِnāَmَht yِnَrُjgْaʾَt nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع ِnْyَtāَh َّyَtَnْbā yَdْḥِiʾ َkَḥِknُaʾ ْnَaʾ ُdyِrُaʾ yِّnِiʾ َlāَq

َnwُlَṭْṣَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَl ِrāَّnlā َnِّm ٍhَwْhdَjg ْwَaʾ ٍrَbَhkِb āَhْnِّm mُkyِtāʾ yِّlَʿعَّl āًrāَn ُtْsَnāʾ yِّnِiʾ āwُhtُkْmā ِhِlْhَaʾِl َlāَq āًrāَn ِrwُّṭlā ِbِnāَjg nِm َsَnāʾ ِhِlْhَaʾِb َrāَsَw َlَjgَaʾْlā yَswُm ٰyَḍَq āَّmَlَf
َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ُّbَr ُhَّllā āَnَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ٰyَswُm āَy nَaʾ ِhَrَjgَّhslā َnِm ِhَkَrāَbُmْlā ِhَʿعْqُbْlā yِf ِnَmْyَaʾْlā ِdāَwْlā ِyʾِṭāَhs nِm َyِdwُn āَhāَtَaʾ āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: Which was within the fire.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmāʾْlā َnِm َkَّnِiʾ ۖ ْfَhkَt āَlَw ْlِbْqَaʾ ٰyَswُm āَy ۚ ْbِّqَʿعُy ْmَlَw āًrِbْdُm ٰyَّlَw ٌّnāَjg āَhَّnَaʾَk ُّzَtْhَt āَhāʾَr āَّmَlَf ۖ َkāَṣَʿع ِqْlَaʾ ْnَaʾَw

footnotes.text: Or "did not look back."

ayas.translation: ِnwُbِّhdَkُy nَaʾ ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾ ۖ yِnُqِّdَṣُy āًءْdِr َyِʿعَm ُhْlِsْrَaʾَf āًnāَsِl yِّnِm ُḥَṣْfَaʾ َwُh ُnwُrāَh yِhkَaʾَw
َnwُbِlāَغْlā āَmُkَʿعَbَّtā ِnَmَw āَmُtnَaʾ āَnِtāَyāʾِb ۚ āَmُkْyَlِiʾ َnwُlِṣَy āَlَf āًnāَṭْlُs āَmُkَl ُlَʿعْjgَnَw َkyِhkَaʾِb َkَdُḍَʿع ُّdُhsَnَs َlāَq
َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā āَnِyʾāَbāʾ yِf āَhdٰـَhِb āَnْʿعِmَs āَmَw yًrَtْfُّm ٌrْḥِs āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm āwُlāَq ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnِtāَyāʾِb ٰyَswُّm mُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., in this world or in the Hereafter.

ayas.translation: َnyِbِhdāَkْlā َnِm ُhُّnُẓَaʾَl yِّnِiʾَw ٰyَswُm ِhٰـَlِiʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ُʿعِlَّṭَaʾ yِّlَʿعَّl āًḥْrَṣ yِّl lَʿعْjgāَf ِnyِّṭlā yَlَʿع ُnāَmāَh āَy yِl ْdِqْwَaʾَf yِrْyَغ ٍhٰـَlِiʾ ْnِّm mُkَl ُtْmِlَʿع āَm ُaʾَlَmْlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ُnْwَʿعْrِf َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: From which bricks are made.

Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) caused them to leave all their worldly wealth behind and enter the sea in pursuit of the Children of Israel. See <reference chapter="26" verses="52-66">26:52-66</reference>.
i.e., examples or precedents, followed by subsequent tyrants.
Literally, "those made hideous," who will be far removed from all good and mercy.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَtَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَّl ًhَmْḥَrَw yًdُhَw ِsāَّnlِl َrِyʾāَṣَb ٰyَlwُaʾْlā َnwُrُqْlā āَnْkَlْhَaʾ āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm َbāَtِkْlā yَswُm āَnْyَtāʾ ْdَqَlَw
َnyِlِsْrُm āَّnُk āَّnِkٰـَlَw āَnِtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع wُlْtَt َnَyْdَm ِlْhَaʾ yِf āًyِwāَht َtnُk āَmَw ۚ ُrُmُʿعْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َlَwāَṭَtَf āًnwُrُq āَnْaʾَhsnَaʾ āَّnِkٰـَlَw

footnotes.text: So they forgot and neglected the ordinances of Allāh.
The Prophet (ﷺ) had no way of obtaining this information except through Allāh's revelation.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَhdَtَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl َkِlْbَq nِّm ٍryِhdَّn nِّm mُhāَtَaʾ āَّm āًmْwَq َrِhdnُtِl َkِّbَّr nِّm ًhَmْḥَّr nِkٰـَlَw āَnْyَdāَn ْhdِiʾ ِrwُّṭlā ِbِnāَjgِb َtnُk āَmَw
َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm َnwُkَnَw َkِtāَyāʾ َʿعِbَّtَnَf āًlwُsَr āَnْyَlِiʾ َtْlَsْrَaʾ āَlْwَl āَnَّbَr āwُlwُqَyَf ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَmَّdَq āَmِb ٌhَbyِṣُّm mُhَbyِṣُt nَaʾ āَlْwَlَw

footnotes.text: The conclusion of the sentence is understood to be "...We would not have sent messengers," meaning that Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) sent messengers and sent Muḥammad (ﷺ) with the final scripture to mankind so that no one could claim that punishment was imposed unjustly without warning.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِfāَk ٍّlُkِb āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَqَw āَrَhāَẓَt ِnāَrْḥِs āwُlāَq ۖ ُlْbَq nِm ٰyَswُm َyِtwُaʾ āَmِb āwُrُfْkَy ْmَlَwَaʾ ۚ ٰyَswُm َyِtwُaʾ āَm َlْhtِm َyِtwُaʾ āَlْwَl āwُlāَq āَnِdnِʿع ْnِm ُّqَḥْlā ُmُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: The reference is by the disbelievers of Quraysh to the Qur’ān and the Torah.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā َnِّm yًdُh ِrْyَغِb ُhāَwَh َʿعَbَّtā ِnَّmِm ُّlَḍَaʾ ْnَmَw ۚ ْmُhَءāَwْhَaʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَy āَmَّnَaʾ ْmَlْʿعāَf َkَl āwُbyِjgَtْsَy ْmَّl nِiʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., the sincere believers among them.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlْsُm ِhِlْbَq nِm āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ āَnِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā ُhَّnِiʾ ِhِb āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُy āَhdِiʾَw
َnyِlِhāَjgْlā yِغَtْbَn āَl ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٌmāَlَs ْmُkُlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْmُkَlَw āَnُlāَmْʿعَaʾ āَnَl āwُlāَqَw ُhْnَʿع āwُḍَrْʿعَaʾ َwْغَّllā āwُʿعِmَs āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: This is not the Islāmic greeting of "Peace be upon you." Rather, it means "You are secure from being treated in a like manner by us."

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw āَّnُdَّl nِّm āًqْzِّr ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ُtāَrَmَht ِhْyَlِiʾ ٰyَbْjgُy āًnِmāʾ āًmَrَḥ ْmُhَّl nِّkَmُn ْmَlَwَaʾ ۚ āَnِḍْrَaʾ ْnِm ْfَّṭَhkَtُn َkَʿعَm ٰyَdُhْlā ِʿعِbَّtَّn nِiʾ āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: By the other Arab tribes.

ayas.translation: َnyِhtِrāَwْlā ُnْḥَn āَّnُkَw ۖ āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِّm nَkْsُt ْmَl ْmُhُnِkāَsَm َkْlِtَf ۖ āَhَtَhsyِʿعَm ْtَrِṭَb ٍhَyْrَq nِm āَnْkَlْhَaʾ ْmَkَw

footnotes.text: By travelers seeking temporary shelter. The reference is to the ruins which were visible to the Quraysh during their journeys.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlāَẓ āَhُlْhَaʾَw āَّlِiʾ ٰyَrُqْlā yِkِlْhُm āَّnُk āَmَw ۚ āَnِtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع wُlْtَy āًlwُsَr āَhِّmُaʾ yِf َhtَʿعْbَy ٰyَّtَḥ ٰyَrُqْlā َkِlْhُm َkُّbَr َnāَk āَmَw
َnwُlِqْʿعَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ٰyَqْbَaʾَw ٌrْyَhk ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَmَw ۚ āَhُtَnyِzَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā ُʿعāَtَmَf ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُtyِtwُaʾ āَmَw
َnwُdُbْʿعَy āَnāَّyِiʾ āwُnāَk āَm ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْaʾَّrَbَt ۖ āَnْyَwَغ āَmَk ْmُhāَnْyَwْغَaʾ āَnْyَwْغَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh āَnَّbَr ُlْwَqْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َّqَḥ َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq

footnotes.text: The decree for their punishment.
i.e., We did not compel them, and they did not obey us; instead, they obeyed their own desires and inclinations.
By which they might invent lies or excuses.
Meaning "Inform me if you really know."

ayas.translation: َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع َّlَḍَw ِhَّlِl َّqَḥْlā َّnَaʾ āwُmِlَʿعَf ْmُkَnāَhْrُb āwُtāَh āَnْlُqَf āًdyِhَhs ٍhَّmُaʾ ِّlُk nِm āَnْʿعَzَnَw

َnyِdِsْfُmْlā ُّbِḥُy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َdāَsَfْlā ِغْbَt āَlَw ۖ َkْyَlِiʾ ُhَّllā َnَsْḥَaʾ āَmَk nِsْḥَaʾَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā َnِm َkَbyِṣَn َsnَt āَlَw ۖ َhَrِhkāʾْlā َrāَّdlā ُhَّllā َkāَtāʾ āَmyِf ِغَtْbāَw

َnwُmِrْjgُmْlā ُmِhِbwُnُhd nَʿع ُlَaʾْsُy āَlَw ۚ āًʿعْmَjg ُrَhtْkَaʾَw ًhَّwُq ُhْnِm ُّdَhsَaʾ َwُh ْnَm ِnwُrُqْlā َnِm ِhِlْbَq nِm َkَlْhَaʾ ْdَq َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ْmَlْʿعَy ْmَlَwَaʾ ۚ yِdnِʿع ٍmْlِʿع ٰyَlَʿع ُhُtyِtwُaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ َlāَq

footnotes.text: There will be no need to enumerate their sins separately, as their quantity is obvious and more than sufficient to warrant punishment in Hell.

ayas.translation: ٍmyِẓَʿع ٍّẓَḥ wُhdَl ُhَّnِiʾ ُnwُrāَq َyِtwُaʾ āَm َlْhtِm āَnَl َtْyَl āَy āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā َnwُdyِrُy َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ۖ ِhِtَnyِz yِf ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlَʿع َjgَrَhkَf

َnwُrِfāَkْlā ُḥِlْfُy āَl ُhَّnَaʾَkْyَw ۖ āَnِb َfَsَhkَl āَnْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َّnَّm nَaʾ āَlْwَl ۖ ُrِdْqَyَw ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَmِl َqْzِّrlā ُṭُsْbَy َhَّllā َّnَaʾَkْyَw َnwُlwُqَy ِsْmَaʾْlāِb ُhَnāَkَm āْwَّnَmَt َnyِhdَّlā َḥَbْṣَaʾَw
َnyِqَّtُmْlِl ُhَbِqāَʿعْlāَw ۚ āًdāَsَf āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًّwُlُʿع َnwُdyِrُy āَl َnyِhdَّlِl āَhُlَʿعْjgَn ُhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrāَّdlā َkْlِt
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm āَّlِiʾ ِtāَyʾِّyَّslā āwُlِmَʿع َnyِhdَّlā yَzْjgُy āَlَf ِhَyʾِّyَّslāِb َءāَjg nَmَw ۖ āَhْnِّm ٌrْyَhk ُhَlَf ِhَnَsَḥْlāِb َءāَjg nَm

footnotes.text: Meaning to Makkah (in this life) or to Paradise (in the Hereafter).

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlِّl āًryِhَẓ َّnَnwُkَt āَlَf ۖ َkِّbَّr nِّm ًhَmْḥَr āَّlِiʾ ُbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlِiʾ ٰyَqْlُy nَaʾ wُjgْrَt َtnُk āَmَw

footnotes.text: In their religion by making any concessions to their beliefs.
i.e., except Himself.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُnَtْfُy āَl ْmُhَw āَّnَmāʾ āwُlwُqَy nَaʾ āwُkَrْtُy nَaʾ ُsāَّnlā َbِsَḥَaʾ

َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُaʾَf ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm َّyَlِiʾ ۚ āَmُhْʿعِṭُt āَlَf ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb َkَl َsْyَl āَm yِb َkِrْhsُtِl َkāَdَhāَjg nِiʾَw ۖ āًnْsُḥ ِhْyَdِlāَwِb َnāَsnِiʾْlā āَnْyَّṣَwَw

footnotes.text: i.e., no knowledge of its divinity. There can be no knowledge about something which is non-existent or untrue.

ayas.translation: َnyِmَlāَʿعْlā ِrwُdُṣ yِf āَmِb َmَlْʿعَaʾِb ُhَّllā َsْyَlَwَaʾ ۚ ْmُkَʿعَm āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ َّnُlwُqَyَl َkِّbَّr nِّm ٌrْṣَn َءāَjg nِyʾَlَw ِhَّllā ِbāَhdَʿعَk ِsāَّnlā َhَnْtِf َlَʿعَjg ِhَّllā yِf َyِhdwُaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ِhَّllāِb āَّnَmāʾ ُlwُqَy nَm ِsāَّnlā َnِmَw
َnwُbِhdāَkَl ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُhāَyāَṭَhk ْnِm َnyِlِmāَḥِb mُh āَmَw ْmُkāَyāَṭَhk ْlِmْḥَnْlَw āَnَlyِbَs āwُʿعِbَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: The phrase may also read: "and let us carry your sins," i.e., the responsibility for your sins.
Besides their own sins, they will carry those of the people they misled, although it will not lessen the burden of the latter.
i.e., the ship, the event or the story.

ayas.translation: َnwُʿعَjgْrُt ِhْyَlِiʾ ۖ ُhَl āwُrُkْhsāَw ُhwُdُbْʿعāَw َqْzِّrlā ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āwُغَtْbāَf āًqْzِr ْmُkَl َnwُkِlْmَy āَl ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَt َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًkْfِiʾ َnwُqُlْhkَtَw āًnāَhtْwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُdُbْʿعَt āَmَّnِiʾ
ُnyِbُmْlā ُغāَlَbْlā āَّlِiʾ ِlwُsَّrlā yَlَʿع āَmَw ۖ ْmُkِlْbَq nِّm ٌmَmُaʾ َbَّhdَk ْdَqَf āwُbِّhdَkُt nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Commentators have differed over this verse - whether it is a continuation of the words of Prophet Abraham or words of comfort given by Allāh to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ), which according to context seems more likely.

ayas.translation: ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ۖ ِءāَmَّslā yِf āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnyِzِjgْʿعُmِb mُtnَaʾ āَmَw

َnyِrِṣāَّn nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ُrāَّnlā ُmُkāَwْaʾَmَw āًḍْʿعَb mُkُḍْʿعَb ُnَʿعْlَyَw ٍḍْʿعَbِb mُkُḍْʿعَb ُrُfْkَy ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy َّmُht ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ْmُkِnْyَb َhَّdَwَّm āًnāَhtْwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُtْhdَhkَّtā āَmَّnِiʾ َlāَqَw
َnyِḥِlāَّṣlā َnِmَl ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُhَّnِiʾَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā yِf ُhَrْjgَaʾ ُhāَnْyَtāʾَw َbāَtِkْlāَw َhَّwُbُّnlā ِhِtَّyِّrُhd yِf āَnْlَʿعَjgَw َbwُqْʿعَyَw َqāَḥْsِiʾ ُhَl āَnْbَhَwَw

َnyِqِdāَّṣlā َnِm َtnُk nِiʾ ِhَّllā ِbāَhdَʿعِb āَnِtْyʾā āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِhِmْwَq َbāَwَjg َnāَk āَmَf ۖ َrَknُmْlā ُmُkyِdāَn yِf َnwُtْaʾَtَw َlyِbَّslā َnwُʿعَṭْqَtَw َlāَjgِّrlā َnwُtْaʾَtَl ْmُkَّnِyʾَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., commit highway robbery and acts of aggression against travelers.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَẓ āwُnāَk āَhَlْhَaʾ َّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَyْrَqْlā ِhِhdٰـَh ِlْhَaʾ wُkِlْhُm āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ٰyَrْhsُbْlāِb َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ āَnُlُsُr ْtَءāَjg āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: Of the birth of Isaac and his descendant, Jacob.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِbāَغْlā َnِm ْtَnāَk ُhَtَaʾَrْmā āَّlِiʾ ُhَlْhَaʾَw ُhَّnَyِّjgَnُnَl ۖ āَhyِf nَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ ُnْḥَn āwُlāَq ۚ āًṭwُl āَhyِf َّnِiʾ َlāَq
َnyِrِbāَغْlā َnِm ْtَnāَk َkَtَaʾَrْmā āَّlِiʾ َkَlْhَaʾَw َkwُّjgَnُm āَّnِiʾ ۖ ْnَzْḥَt āَlَw ْfَhkَt āَl āwُlāَqَw āًʿعْrَhd ْmِhِb َqāَḍَw ْmِhِb َءyِs āًṭwُl āَnُlُsُr ْtَءāَjg nَaʾ āَّmَlَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="11" verses="77">11:77</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِdِsْfُm ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āْwَhtْʿعَt āَlَw َrِhkāʾْlā َmْwَyْlā āwُjgْrāَw َhَّllā āwُdُbْʿعā ِmْwَq āَy َlāَqَf āًbْyَʿعُhs ْmُhāَhkَaʾ َnَyْdَm ٰyَlِiʾَw

َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw ْmُhَmِlْẓَyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَmَw ۚ āَnْqَrْغَaʾ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَw َḍْrَaʾْlā ِhِb āَnْfَsَhk ْnَّm mُhْnِmَw ُhَḥْyَّṣlā ُhْtَhdَhkَaʾ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَw āًbِṣāَḥ ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْnَّm mُhْnِmَf ۖ ِhِbnَhdِb āَnْhdَhkَaʾ āًّlُkَf

footnotes.text: In worship.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُm ُhَl ُnْḥَnَw ٌdِḥāَw ْmُkُhٰـَlِiʾَw āَnُhٰـَlِiʾَw ْmُkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾَw āَnْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ yِhdَّlāِb āَّnَmāʾ āwُlwُqَw ۖ ْmُhْnِm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ ُnَsْḥَaʾ َyِh yِtَّlāِb āَّlِiʾ ِbāَtِkْlā َlْhَaʾ āwُlِdāَjgُt āَlَw
َnwُlِṭْbُmْlā َbāَtْrāَّl āًhdِiʾ ۖ َkِnyِmَyِb ُhُّṭُhkَt āَlَw ٍbāَtِk nِm ِhِlْbَq nِm wُlْtَt َtnُk āَmَw
ٌnyِbُّm ٌryِhdَn āَnَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُtāَyāʾْlā āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq ۖ ِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌtāَyāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾ āَlْwَl āwُlāَqَw
َnwُrِsāَhkْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ِhَّllāِb āwُrَfَkَw ِlِṭāَbْlāِb āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَy ۖ āًdyِhَhs ْmُkَnْyَbَw yِnْyَb ِhَّllāِb ٰyَfَk ْlُq
َnyِlِmāَʿعْlā ُrْjgَaʾ َmْʿعِn ۚ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt āًfَrُغ ِhَّnَjgْlā َnِّm mُhَّnَyʾِّwَbُnَl ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw
َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā ِlُq ۚ ُhَّllā َّnُlwُqَyَl āَhِtْwَm ِdْʿعَb nِm َḍْrَaʾْlā ِhِb āَyْḥَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَّzَّn nَّm mُhَtْlَaʾَs nِyʾَlَw
َnwُkِrْhsُy ْmُh āَhdِiʾ ِّrَbْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُhāَّjgَn āَّmَlَf َnyِّdlā ُhَl َnyِṣِlْhkُm َhَّllā āُwَʿعَd ِkْlُfْlā yِf āwُbِkَr āَhdِiʾَf

footnotes.text: Grammatically, the verse may also be read as a threat, i.e., "So let them deny what We have granted them and let them enjoy themselves, for they are going to know."
i.e., killed and taken captive.
The various ways and means to attain the acceptance and pleasure of Allāh.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
By the Persians.
Another meaning is "in the lowest land."
i.e., the victory given by Allāh to a people of the Scripture (Christians) over the Magians of Persia.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِfāَkَl ْmِhِّbَr ِءāَqِlِb ِsāَّnlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾَw ۗ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾَw ِّqَḥْlāِb āَّlِiʾ āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُhَّllā َqَlَhk āَّm ۗ mِhِsُfnَaʾ yِf āwُrَّkَfَtَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: An additional meaning is "Do they not contemplate concerning themselves."

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْẓَy ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُnāَk nِkٰـَlَw ْmُhَmِlْẓَyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَmَf ۖ ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjgَw āَhwُrَmَʿع āَّmِm َrَhtْkَaʾ āَhwُrَmَʿعَw َḍْrَaʾْlā āwُrāَhtَaʾَw ًhَّwُq ْmُhْnِm َّdَhsَaʾ āwُnāَk ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: Of the graves or out of the earth at the time of resurrection.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ًhَmْḥَrَw ًhَّdَwَّm mُkَnْyَb َlَʿعَjgَw āَhْyَlِiʾ āwُnُkْsَtِّl āًjgāَwْzَaʾ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ ْnِّm mُkَl َqَlَhk ْnَaʾ ِhِtāَyāʾ ْnِmَw

َnwُlِqْʿعَy ٍmْwَqِl ِtāَyāʾْlā ُlِّṣَfُn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ ْmُkِtَfyِhkَk ْmُhَnwُfāَhkَt ٌءāَwَs ِhyِf ْmُtnَaʾَf ْmُkāَnْqَzَr āَm yِf َءāَkَrُhs nِّm mُkُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَّm nِّm mُkَّl lَh ۖ ْmُkِsُfnَaʾ ْnِّm āًlَhtَّm mُkَl َbَrَḍ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="16" verses="71">16:71</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِṣāَّn nِّm mُhَl āَmَw ۖ ُhَّllā َّlَḍَaʾ ْnَm yِdْhَy nَmَf ۖ ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb mُhَءāَwْhَaʾ āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā َʿعَbَّtā ِlَb

footnotes.text: The natural inborn inclination of man to worship his Creator prior to the corruption of his nature by external influences. Thus, Islāmic monotheism is described as the religion of fiṭrah - that of the inherent nature of mankind.
i.e., let people remain true to their fiṭrah within the religion of Islām.
Of beliefs, opinions, customs, etc.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy ْmِhِّbَrِb mُhْnِّm ٌqyِrَf āَhdِiʾ ًhَmْḥَr ُhْnِّm mُhَqāَhdَaʾ āَhdِiʾ َّmُht ِhْyَlِiʾ َnyِbyِnُّm mُhَّbَr āْwَʿعَd ٌّrُḍ َsāَّnlā َّsَm āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Or "So let them deny what We have granted them."

ayas.translation: َnwُṭَnْqَy ْmُh āَhdِiʾ ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَmَّdَq āَmِb ٌhَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۖ āَhِb āwُḥِrَf ًhَmْḥَr َsāَّnlā āَnْqَhdَaʾ āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُfِʿعْḍُmْlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ِhَّllā َhْjgَw َnwُdyِrُt ٍhāَkَz nِّm mُtْyَtāʾ āَmَw ۖ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع wُbْrَy āَlَf ِsāَّnlā ِlāَwْmَaʾ yِf َwُbْrَyِّl āًbِّr nِّm mُtْyَtāʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: The phrase includes several connotations, among them: a) that which is given as usury or interest, b) that which is given on the condition that it be repaid with interest, and c) a gift given with the intention of obtaining from the recipient greater benefit or a larger gift.
The meaning of ṣadaqah (voluntary charity) is included here.
Of their blessings on earth and their rewards in the Hereafter.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِrْhsُy āَّmَʿع ٰyَlāَʿعَtَw ُhَnāَḥْbُs ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُkِlَٰhd nِm ُlَʿعْfَy nَّm mُkِyʾāَkَrُhs nِm ْlَh ۖ ْmُkyِyْḥُy َّmُht ْmُkُtyِmُy َّmُht ْmُkَqَzَr َّmُht ْmُkَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā
َnwُʿعِjgْrَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl āwُlِmَʿع yِhdَّlā َḍْʿعَb mُhَqyِhdُyِl ِsāَّnlā yِdْyَaʾ ْtَbَsَk āَmِb ِrْḥَbْlāَw ِّrَbْlā yِf ُdāَsَfْlā َrَhَẓ

footnotes.text: Into those destined for Paradise and those destined for Hell.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ُrْṣَn āَnْyَlَʿع āًّqَḥ َnāَkَw ۖ āwُmَrْjgَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َnِm āَnْmَqَtnāَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhwُءāَjgَf ْmِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āًlُsُr َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., aid or the bestowal of victory.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِhsْbَtْsَy ْmُh āَhdِiʾ ِhِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِb َbāَṣَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ِhِlāَlِhk ْnِm ُjgُrْhkَy َqْdَwْlā yَrَtَf āًfَsِk ُhُlَʿعْjgَyَw ُءāَhsَy َfْyَk ِءāَmَّslā yِf ُhُṭُsْbَyَf āًbāَḥَs ُryِhtُtَf َḥāَyِّrlā ُlِsْrُy yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā
َnyِsِlْbُmَl ِhِlْbَq nِّm mِhْyَlَʿع َlَّzَnُy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm āwُnāَk nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Denying and ungrateful for the previous favors of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُmِlْsُّm mُhَf āَnِtāَyāʾِb ُnِmْwʾُy nَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعِmْsُt nِiʾ ۖ ْmِhِtَlāَlَḍ nَʿع ِyْmُʿعْlā ِdāَhِb َtnَaʾ āَmَw
ُryِdَqْlā ُmyِlَʿعْlā َwُhَw ۖ ُءāَhsَy āَm ُqُlْhkَy ۚ ًhَbْyَhsَw āًfْʿعَḍ ٍhَّwُq ِdْʿعَb nِm َlَʿعَjg َّmُht ًhَّwُq ٍfْʿعَḍ ِdْʿعَb nِm َlَʿعَjg َّmُht ٍfْʿعَḍ nِّm mُkَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: i.e., acknowledge the truth.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِṭْbُm āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnَlwُqَyَّl ٍhَyāʾِb mُhَtْyʾِjg nِyʾَlَw ۚ ٍlَhtَm ِّlُk nِm ِnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَh yِf ِsāَّnlِl āَnْbَrَḍ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., those who do not wish to know the truth and refuse it.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="1">10:1</reference>.

i.e., that which has no benefit. Described by different ṣaḥābah as shirk (association with Allāh), misleading stories, frivolous songs, or music but includes all which distracts or diverts one from the Qur’ān and remembrance of Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍmyِlَaʾ ٍbāَhdَʿعِb ُhْrِّhsَbَf ۖ āًrْqَw ِhْyَnُhdُaʾ yِf َّnَaʾَk āَhْʿعَmْsَy ْmَّl nَaʾَk āًrِbْkَtْsُm ٰyَّlَw āَnُtāَyāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw

ٍmyِrَk ٍjgْwَz ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf āَnْtَbnَaʾَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm āَnْlَznَaʾَw ۚ ٍhَّbāَd ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf َّhtَbَw ْmُkِb َdyِmَt nَaʾ َyِsāَwَr ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ٰyَqْlَaʾَw ۖ āَhَnْwَrَt ٍdَmَʿع ِrْyَغِb ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk

َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُaʾَf ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَm َّyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۚ َّyَlِiʾ َbāَnَaʾ ْnَm َlyِbَs ْʿعِbَّtāَw ۖ āًfwُrْʿعَm āَyْnُّdlā yِf āَmُhْbِḥāَṣَw ۖ āَmُhْʿعِṭُt āَlَf ٌmْlِʿع ِhِb َkَl َsْyَl āَm yِb َkِrْhsُt nَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع َkāَdَhāَjg nِiʾَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="29" verses="8">29:8</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٌryِbَhk ٌfyِṭَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُhَّllā āَhِb ِtْaʾَy ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ْwَaʾ ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ْwَaʾ ٍhَrْhkَṣ yِf nُkَtَf ٍlَdْrَhk ْnِّm ٍhَّbَḥ َlāَqْhtِm ُkَt nِiʾ āَhَّnِiʾ َّyَnُb āَy

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote of <reference chapter="6" verses="103">6:103</reference>.
For the reason that they are enjoined by Allāh.
Rather, respect them by directing your face and attention to them.

ayas.translation: ٍryِnُّm ٍbāَtِk āَlَw yًdُh āَlَw ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb ِhَّllā yِf ُlِdāَjgُy nَm ِsāَّnlā َnِmَw ۗ ًhَnِṭāَbَw ًhَrِhāَẓ ُhَmَʿعِn ْmُkْyَlَʿع َغَbْsَaʾَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَّm mُkَl َrَّhkَs َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āْwَrَt ْmَlَaʾ
ِryِʿعَّslā ِbāَhdَʿع ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhwُʿعْdَy ُnāَṭْyَّhslā َnāَk ْwَlَwَaʾ ۚ āَnَءāَbāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْdَjgَw āَm ُʿعِbَّtَn ْlَb āwُlāَq ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَm āwُʿعِbَّtā ُmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
ِrwُdُّṣlā ِtāَhdِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُlِmَʿع āَmِb mُhُyʾِّbَnُnَf ْmُhُʿعِjgْrَm āَnْyَlِiʾ ۚ ُhُrْfُk َknُzْḥَy āَlَf َrَfَk nَmَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="18" verses="109">18:109</reference>.
The re-creation and resurrection of one or of all is accomplished with equal ease by Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).
In worship.

ayas.translation: ٍrwُfَk ٍrāَّtَhk ُّlُk āَّlِiʾ āَnِtāَyāʾِb ُdَḥْjgَy āَmَw ۚ ٌdِṣَtْqُّm mُhْnِmَf ِّrَbْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُhāَّjgَn āَّmَlَf َnyِّdlā ُhَl َnyِṣِlْhkُm َhَّllā āُwَʿعَd ِlَlُّẓlāَk ٌjgْwَّm mُhَyِhsَغ āَhdِiʾَw

ُrwُrَغْlā ِhَّllāِb mُkَّnَّrُغَy āَlَw āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُkَّnَّrُغَt āَlَf ۖ ٌّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw َّnِiʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ِhِdِlāَw nَʿع ٍzāَjg َwُh ٌdwُlْwَm āَlَw ِhِdَlَw nَʿع ٌdِlāَw yِzْjgَy āَّl āًmْwَy āْwَhsْhkāَw ْmُkَّbَr āwُqَّtā ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌryِbَhk ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُtwُmَt ٍḍْrَaʾ ِّyَaʾِb ٌsْfَn yِrْdَt āَmَw ۖ āًdَغ ُbِsْkَt āَhdāَّm ٌsْfَn yِrْdَt āَmَw ۖ ِmāَḥْrَaʾْlā yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَyَw َhtْyَغْlā ُlِّzَnُyَw ِhَʿعāَّslā ُmْlِʿع ُhَdnِʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., every aspect of the fetus' present and future existence.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُdَtْhَy ْmُhَّlَʿعَl َkِlْbَq nِّm ٍryِhdَّn nِّm mُhāَtَaʾ āَّm āًmْwَq َrِhdnُtِl َkِّbَّr nِm ُّqَḥْlā َwُh ْlَb ۚ ُhāَrَtْfā َnwُlwُqَy ْmَaʾ

َnwُrَّkَhdَtَt āَlَfَaʾ ۚ ٍʿعyِfَhs āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhِnwُd nِّm mُkَl āَm ۖ ِhsْrَʿعْlā yَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: See footnotes to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference> and <reference chapter="7" verses="54">7:54</reference>.
i.e., element of life. See footnote to <reference chapter="15" verses="29">15:29</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِfāَk ْmِhِّbَr ِءāَqِlِb mُh ْlَb ۚ ٍdyِdَjg ٍqْlَhk yِfَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَnْlَlَḍ āَhdِiʾَaʾ āwُlāَqَw
َnwُnِqwُm āَّnِiʾ āًḥِlāَṣ ْlَmْʿعَn āَnْʿعِjgْrāَf āَnْʿعِmَsَw āَnْrَṣْbَaʾ āَnَّbَr ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmِhِswُءُr wُsِkāَn َnwُmِrْjgُmْlā ِhdِiʾ ٰyَrَt ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Deserved by the evildoers.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb ِdْlُhkْlā َbāَhdَʿع āwُqwُhdَw ۖ ْmُkāَnyِsَn āَّnِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْmُkِmْwَy َءāَqِl ْmُtyِsَn āَmِb āwُqwُhdَf
۩ َnwُrِbْkَtْsَy āَl ْmُhَw ْmِhِّbَr ِdْmَḥِb āwُḥَّbَsَw āًdَّjgُs āwُّrَhk āَhِb āwُrِّkُhd āَhdِiʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَnِtāَyāʾِb ُnِmْwʾُy āَmَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: In the cause of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmِb ًءāَzَjg ٍnُyْʿعَaʾ ِhَّrُq nِّm mُhَl َyِfْhkُaʾ āَّm ٌsْfَn ُmَlْʿعَt āَlَf
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmِb āًlُzُn ٰyَwْaʾَmْlā ُtāَّnَjg ْmُhَlَf ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾ
َnwُbِّhdَkُt ِhِb mُtnُk yِhdَّlā ِrāَّnlā َbāَhdَʿع āwُqwُhd ْmُhَl َlyِqَw āَhyِf āwُdyِʿعُaʾ āَhْnِm āwُjgُrْhkَy nَaʾ āwُdāَrَaʾ āَmَّlُk ۖ ُrāَّnlā ُmُhāَwْaʾَmَf āwُqَsَf َnyِhdَّlā āَّmَaʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the disasters and calamities of this world.

ayas.translation: َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَbِّl yًdُh ُhāَnْlَʿعَjgَw ۖ ِhِyʾāَqِّl nِّm ٍhَyْrِm yِf nُkَt āَlَf َbāَtِkْlā yَswُm āَnْyَtāʾ ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., Muḥammad's meeting Moses on the night of al-Miʿrāj (ascent).

ayas.translation: َnwُnِqwُy āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُnāَkَw ۖ āwُrَbَṣ āَّmَl āَnِrْmَaʾِb َnwُdْhَy ًhَّmِyʾَaʾ ْmُhْnِm āَnْlَʿعَjgَw
َnwُʿعَmْsَy āَlَfَaʾ ۖ ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmِhِnِkāَsَm yِf َnwُhsْmَy ِnwُrُqْlā َnِّm mِhِlْbَq nِm āَnْkَlْhَaʾ ْmَk ْmُhَl ِdْhَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: Or "decision," i.e., judgement.
Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="3" verses="173">3:173</reference>.

ayas.translation: َlyِbَّslā yِdْhَy َwُhَw َّqَḥْlā ُlwُqَy ُhَّllāَw ۖ ْmُkِhāَwْfَaʾِb mُkُlْwَq ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ْmُkَءāَnْbَaʾ ْmُkَءāَyِʿعْdَaʾ َlَʿعَjg āَmَw ۚ ْmُkِtāَhَّmُaʾ َّnُhْnِm َnwُrِhāَẓُt yِyʾāَّllā ُmُkَjgāَwْzَaʾ َlَʿعَjg āَmَw ۚ ِhِfْwَjg yِf ِnْyَbْlَq nِّm ٍlُjgَrِl ُhَّllā َlَʿعَjg āَّm

footnotes.text: By the expression "You are to me like the back of my mother." Such an oath taken against approaching one's wife was a pre-Islāmic practice declared by Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) to be a sin requiring expiation as described in <reference chapter="58" verses="3-4">58:3-4</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ْmُkُbwُlُq ْtَdَّmَʿعَt āَّm nِkٰـَlَw ِhِb mُtْaʾَṭْhkَaʾ āَmyِf ٌḥāَnُjg ْmُkْyَlَʿع َsْyَlَw ۚ ْmُkyِlāَwَmَw ِnyِّdlā yِf ْmُkُnāَwْhkِiʾَf ْmُhَءāَbāʾ āwُmَlْʿعَt ْmَّl nِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ُṭَsْqَaʾ َwُh ْmِhِyʾāَbāʾِl ْmُhwُʿعْdā

footnotes.text: Those children under your care.

ayas.translation: āًrwُṭْsَm ِbāَtِkْlā yِf َkِlَٰhd َnāَk ۚ āًfwُrْʿعَّm mُkِyʾāَyِlْwَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ āwُlَʿعْfَt nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َnyِrِjgāَhُmْlāَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm ِhَّllā ِbāَtِk yِf ٍḍْʿعَbِb ٰyَlْwَaʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb ِmāَḥْrَaʾْlā wُlwُaʾَw ۗ ْmُhُtāَhَّmُaʾ ُhُjgāَwْzَaʾَw ۖ ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ْnِm َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlāِb ٰyَlْwَaʾ ُّyِbَّnlā

footnotes.text: He (ﷺ) is more worthy of their obedience and loyalty and is more concerned for them than they are for one another.
The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).

ayas.translation: āًẓyِlَغ āًqāَhtyِّm mُhْnِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾَw ۖ َmَyْrَm ِnْbā yَsyِʿعَw ٰyَswُmَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾَw ٍḥwُّn nِmَw َknِmَw ْmُhَqāَhtyِm َnyِّyِbَّnlā َnِm āَnْhdَhkَaʾ ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: i.e., that He may ask the prophets what they conveyed to their people and what response they received. "The truthful" may also refer to those who believed in the message conveyed by the prophets and imparted it to others.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ āَhْwَrَt ْmَّl āًdwُnُjgَw āًḥyِr ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَsْrَaʾَf ٌdwُnُjg ْmُkْtَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َhَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًrwُrُغ āَّlِiʾ ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā āَnَdَʿعَw āَّm ٌḍَrَّm mِhِbwُlُq yِf َnyِhdَّlāَw َnwُqِfāَnُmْlā ُlwُqَy ْhdِiʾَw

āًrāَrِf āَّlِiʾ َnwُdyِrُy nِiʾ ۖ ٍhَrْwَʿعِb َyِh āَmَw ٌhَrْwَʿع āَnَtwُyُb َّnِiʾ َnwُlwُqَy َّyِbَّnlā ُmُhْnِّm ٌqyِrَf ُnِhdْaʾَtْsَyَw ۚ āwُʿعِjgْrāَf ْmُkَl َmāَqُm āَl َbِrْhtَy َlْhَaʾ āَy ْmُhْnِّm ٌhَfِyʾāَّṭ tَlāَq ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: The name by which al-Madīnah was known before the arrival of the Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: āًryِsَy āَّlِiʾ āَhِb āwُhtَّbَlَt āَmَw āَhْwَtāʾَl َhَnْtِfْlā āwُlِyʾُs َّmُht āَhِrāَṭْqَaʾ ْnِّm mِhْyَlَʿع ْtَlِhkُd ْwَlَw
āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعَّtَmُt āَّl āًhdِiʾَw ِlْtَqْlā ِwَaʾ ِtْwَmْlā َnِّm mُtْrَrَf nِiʾ ُrāَrِfْlā ُmُkَʿعَfnَy nَّl lُq
āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُhَl َnwُdِjgَy āَlَw ۚ ًhَmْḥَr ْmُkِb َdāَrَaʾ ْwَaʾ āًءwُs ْmُkِb َdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ ِhَّllā َnِّm mُkُmِṣْʿعَy yِhdَّlā āَhd nَm ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., prevent the will of Allāh from being carried out.
Those who dissuade others from supporting the Prophet (ﷺ) in battle.
Rather than joining the Prophet (ﷺ).
Who went out of ulterior motives.

ayas.translation: āًryِsَy ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َkِlَٰhd َnāَkَw ۚ ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ ُhَّllā َṭَbْḥَaʾَf āwُnِmْwʾُy ْmَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ ِrْyَhkْlā yَlَʿع ًhَّḥِhsَaʾ ٍdāَdِḥ ٍhَnِsْlَaʾِb mُkwُqَlَs ُfْwَhkْlā َbَhَhd āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ِtْwَmْlā َnِm ِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَhsْغُy yِhdَّlāَk ْmُhُnُyْʿعَaʾ ُrwُdَt َkْyَlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ْmُhَtْyَaʾَr ُfْwَhkْlā َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ًhَّḥِhsَaʾ

footnotes.text: Literally, "stingy," i.e., unwilling to offer any help.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ āwُlَtāَq āَّm mُkyِf āwُnāَk ْwَlَw ۖ ْmُkِyʾāَbnَaʾ ْnَʿع َnwُlَaʾْsَy ِbāَrْʿعَaʾْlā yِf َnwُdāَb mُhَّnَaʾ ْwَl āwُّdَwَy ُbāَzْḥَaʾْlā ِtْaʾَy nِiʾَw ۖ āwُbَhْhdَy ْmَl َbāَzْḥَaʾْlā َnwُbَsْḥَy

footnotes.text: In their excessive fear the cowardly hypocrites could not believe the enemy forces had been defeated.
An example to be followed.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlْsَtَw āًnāَmyِiʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَdāَz āَmَw ۚ ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā َqَdَṣَw ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā āَnَdَʿعَw āَm āَhdٰـَh āwُlāَq َbāَzْḥَaʾْlā َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlā yَaʾَr āَّmَlَw
āًlyِdْbَt āwُlَّdَb āَmَw ۖ ُrِẓَtnَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw ُhَbْḥَn ٰyَḍَq nَّm mُhْnِmَf ۖ ِhْyَlَʿع َhَّllā āwُdَhāَʿع āَm āwُqَdَṣ ٌlāَjgِr َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِّm
āًzyِzَʿع āًّyِwَq ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ َlāَtِqْlā َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ُhَّllā yَfَkَw ۚ āًrْyَhk āwُlāَnَy ْmَl ْmِhِẓْyَغِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā َّdَrَw

footnotes.text: The Jews of Banū Quraythah, who had violated their treaty with the Muslims.
i.e., that taken in subsequent conquests.

ayas.translation: āًlyِmَjg āًḥāَrَs َّnُkْḥِّrَsُaʾَw َّnُkْʿعِّtَmُaʾ َnْyَlāَʿعَtَf āَhَtَnyِzَw āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā َnْdِrُt َّnُtnُk nِiʾ َkِjgāَwْzَaʾِّl lُq ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًmyِrَk āًqْzِr āَhَl āَnْdَtْʿعَaʾَw ِnْyَtَّrَm āَhَrْjgَaʾ āَhِtْwʾُّn āًḥِlāَṣ ْlَmْʿعَtَw ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّlِl َّnُknِm ْtُnْqَy nَmَw
āًfwُrْʿعَّm āًlْwَq َnْlُqَw ٌḍَrَm ِhِbْlَq yِf yِhdَّlā َʿعَmْṭَyَf ِlْwَqْlāِb َnْʿعَḍْhkَt āَlَf َّnُtْyَqَّtā ِnِiʾ ۚ ِءāَsِّnlā َnِّm ٍdَḥَaʾَk َّnُtْsَl ِّyِbَّnlā َءāَsِn āَy

footnotes.text: The meaning has also been given as "You are not like any among women if you fear Allāh. So do not be soft in speech..."
The teachings of the Prophet (ﷺ) or his sunnah.
Refer to footnote of <reference chapter="6" verses="103">6:103</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًnyِbُّm āًlāَlَḍ َّlَḍ ْdَqَf ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā ِṣْʿعَy nَmَw ۗ ْmِhِrْmَaʾ ْnِm ُhَrَyِhkْlā ُmُhَl َnwُkَy nَaʾ āًrْmَaʾ ُhُlwُsَrَw ُhَّllā yَḍَq āَhdِiʾ ٍhَnِmْwʾُm āَlَw ٍnِmْwʾُmِl َnāَk āَmَw

āًlwُʿعْfَm ِhَّllā ُrْmَaʾ َnāَkَw ۚ āًrَṭَw َّnُhْnِm āْwَḍَq āَhdِiʾ ْmِhِyʾāَyِʿعْdَaʾ ِjgāَwْzَaʾ yِf ٌjgَrَḥ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿع َnwُkَy āَl ْyَkِl āَhَkāَnْjgَّwَz āًrَṭَw āَhْnِّm ٌdْyَz ٰyَḍَq āَّmَlَf ۖ ُhāَhsْhkَt nَaʾ ُّqَḥَaʾ ُhَّllāَw َsāَّnlā yَhsْhkَtَw ِhyِdْbُm ُhَّllā āَm َkِsْfَn yِf yِfْhkُtَw َhَّllā ِqَّtāَw َkَjgْwَz َkْyَlَʿع ْkِsْmَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع َtْmَʿعْnَaʾَw ِhْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َmَʿعْnَaʾ yِhdَّlِl ُlwُqَt ْhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Referring to the Prophet's freed slave, Zayd bin Ḥārithah.
i.e., Allāh's command to the Prophet (ﷺ) to marry Zaynab after Zayd divorced her. This was to demonstrate that a man may marry a woman formerly married to his adopted son.
i.e., feared their saying that the Prophet (ﷺ) had married the (former) wife of his son (which is prohibited by Allāh in the case of a true, begotten son).
By making known His command.

ayas.translation: āًrwُdْqَّm āًrَdَq ِhَّllā ُrْmَaʾ َnāَkَw ۚ ُlْbَq nِm āْwَlَhk َnyِhdَّlā yِf ِhَّllā َhَّnُs ۖ ُhَl ُhَّllā َḍَrَf āَmyِf ٍjgَrَḥ ْnِm ِّyِbَّnlā yَlَʿع َnāَk āَّm

footnotes.text: Or permitted to him.
i.e., the prophets (peace be upon them all) and after them, the followers of the final prophet, Muḥammad (ﷺ), who honestly convey Allāh's message to the people.

ayas.translation: āًryِhtَk āًrْkِhd َhَّllā āwُrُkْhdā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) cares for you and covers you with His mercy. An additional meaning is that He praises you in the presence of the angels.

ayas.translation: āًryِhdَnَw āًrِّhsَbُmَw āًdِhāَhs َkāَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَّnِiʾ ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

āًlyِmَjg āًḥāَrَs َّnُhwُḥِّrَsَw َّnُhwُʿعِّtَmَf ۖ āَhَnwُّdَtْʿعَt ٍhَّdِʿع ْnِm َّnِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkَl āَmَf َّnُhwُّsَmَt nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِm َّnُhwُmُtْqَّlَṭ َّmُht ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlā ُmُtْḥَkَn āَhdِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ ٌjgَrَḥ َkْyَlَʿع َnwُkَy āَlْyَkِl ْmُhُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَmَw ْmِhِjgāَwْzَaʾ yِf ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْḍَrَf āَm āَnْmِlَʿع ْdَq ۗ َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِnwُd nِm َkَّl ًhَṣِlāَhk āَhَḥِknَtْsَy nَaʾ ُّyِbَّnlā َdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ ِّyِbَّnlِl āَhَsْfَn ْtَbَhَw nِiʾ ًhَnِmْwʾُّm ًhَaʾَrْmāَw َkَʿعَm َnْrَjgāَh yِtāَّllā َkِtāَlāَhk ِtāَnَbَw َkِlāَhk ِtāَnَbَw َkِtāَّmَʿع ِtāَnَbَw َkِّmَʿع ِtāَnَbَw َkْyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َءāَfَaʾ āَّmِm َkُnyِmَy ْtَkَlَm āَmَw َّnُhَrwُjgُaʾ َtْyَtāʾ yِtāَّllā َkَjgāَwْzَaʾ َkَl āَnْlَlْḥَaʾ āَّnِiʾ ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., bridal gifts (mahr).

ayas.translation: āًmyِlَḥ āًmyِlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ْmُkِbwُlُq yِf āَm ُmَlْʿعَy ُhَّllāَw ۚ َّnُhُّlُk َّnُhَtْyَtāʾ āَmِb َnْyَḍْrَyَw َّnَzْḥَy āَlَw َّnُhُnُyْʿعَaʾ َّrَqَt nَaʾ ٰyَnْdَaʾ َkِlَٰhd ۚ َkْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَlَf َtْlَzَʿع ْnَّmِm َtْyَغَtْbā ِnَmَw ۖ ُءāَhsَt nَm َkْyَlِiʾ yِwْwʾُtَw َّnُhْnِm ُءāَhsَt nَm yِjgْrُt

footnotes.text: Those mentioned in the previous verse as being lawful to the Prophet (ﷺ) or his wives to which he was married.

ayas.translation: āًbyِqَّr ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ َkُnyِmَy ْtَkَlَm āَm āَّlِiʾ َّnُhُnْsُḥ َkَbَjgْʿعَaʾ ْwَlَw ٍjgāَwْzَaʾ ْnِm َّnِhِb َlَّdَbَt nَaʾ āَlَw ُdْʿعَb nِm ُءāَsِّnlā َkَl ُّlِḥَy āَّl

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="4" verses="1">verse 4:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع ِhَّllā َdnِʿع َnāَk ْmُkِlَٰhd َّnِiʾ ۚ āًdَbَaʾ ِhِdْʿعَb nِm ُhَjgāَwْzَaʾ āwُḥِknَt nَaʾ āَlَw ِhَّllā َlwُsَr āwُhdْwʾُt nَaʾ ْmُkَl َnāَk āَmَw ۚ َّnِhِbwُlُqَw ْmُkِbwُlُqِl ُrَhْṭَaʾ ْmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍbāَjgِḥ ِءāَrَw nِm َّnُhwُlَaʾْsāَf āًʿعāَtَm َّnُhwُmُtْlَaʾَs āَhdِiʾَw ۚ ِّqَḥْlā َnِm yِyْḥَtْsَy āَl ُhَّllāَw ۖ ْmُknِm yِyْḥَtْsَyَf َّyِbَّnlā yِhdْwʾُy َnāَk ْmُkِlَٰhd َّnِiʾ ۚ ٍhtyِdَḥِl َnyِsِnْaʾَtْsُm āَlَw āwُrِhsَtnāَf ْmُtْmِʿعَṭ āَhdِiʾَf āwُlُhkْdāَf ْmُtyِʿعُd āَhdِiʾ ْnِkٰـَlَw ُhāَnِiʾ َnyِrِẓāَn َrْyَغ ٍmāَʿعَṭ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُkَl َnَhdْwʾُy nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ِّyِbَّnlā َtwُyُb āwُlُhkْdَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

āًdyِhَhs ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā َnyِqَّtāَw ۗ َّnُhُnāَmْyَaʾ ْtَkَlَm āَm āَlَw َّnِhِyʾāَsِn āَlَw َّnِhِtāَwَhkَaʾ ِءāَnْbَaʾ āَlَw َّnِhِnāَwْhkِiʾ ِءāَnْbَaʾ āَlَw َّnِhِnāَwْhkِiʾ āَlَw َّnِhِyʾāَnْbَaʾ āَlَw َّnِhِyʾāَbāʾ yِf َّnِhْyَlَʿع َḥāَnُjg āَّl

footnotes.text: It is permissible for a woman to appear before these people without complete covering and to be alone with them. The brothers of both parents (uncles) are included as "fathers" or "parents," according to ḥadīth.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlْsَt āwُmِّlَsَw ِhْyَlَʿع āwُّlَṣ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ۚ ِّyِbَّnlā yَlَʿع َnwُّlَṣُy ُhَtَkِyʾāَlَmَw َhَّllā َّnِiʾ
āًnyِbُّm āًmْhtِiʾَw āًnāَtْhُb āwُlَmَtْḥā ِdَqَf āwُbَsَtْkā āَm ِrْyَغِb ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlāَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnwُhdْwʾُy َnyِhdَّlāَw

āًmyِḥَّr āًrwُfَغ ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۗ َnْyَhdْwʾُy āَlَf َnْfَrْʿعُy nَaʾ ٰyَnْdَaʾ َkِlَٰhd ۚ َّnِhِbyِbāَlَjg nِm َّnِhْyَlَʿع َnyِnْdُy َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِءāَsِnَw َkِtāَnَbَw َkِjgāَwْzَaʾِّl lُq ُّyِbَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: The jilbāb, which is defined as a cloak covering the head and reaching to the ground, thereby covering the woman's entire body.
As chaste believing women.
