Or "and Allāh was Forgiving and Merciful" of what occurred before this injunction or before knowledge of it.

ayas.translation: āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ āَhyِf َkَnwُrِwāَjgُy āَl َّmُht ْmِhِb َkَّnَyِrْغُnَl ِhَnyِdَmْlā yِf َnwُfِjgْrُmْlāَw ٌḍَrَّm mِhِbwُlُq yِf َnyِhdَّlāَw َnwُqِfāَnُmْlā ِhَtnَy ْmَّl nِyʾَّl

footnotes.text: Referring here to those who commit adultery or fornication.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw َnwُdِjgَy āَّl ۖ āًdَbَaʾ āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk
āَlwُsَّrlā āَnْʿعَṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āَnْʿعَṭَaʾ āَnَtْyَl āَy َnwُlwُqَy ِrāَّnlā yِf ْmُhُhwُjgُw ُbَّlَqُt َmْwَy
āَlyِbَّslā āَnwُّlَḍَaʾَf āَnَءāَrَbُkَw āَnَtَdāَs āَnْʿعَṭَaʾ āَّnِiʾ āَnَّbَr āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Also interpreted to mean "our noble ones and our elders [i.e., distinguished scholars]."

ayas.translation: āًhyِjgَw ِhَّllā َdnِʿع َnāَkَw ۚ āwُlāَq āَّmِm ُhَّllā ُhَaʾَّrَbَf ٰyَswُm āْwَhdāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَk āwُnwُkَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًdyِdَs āًlْwَq āwُlwُqَw َhَّllā āwُqَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
āًlwُhَjg āًmwُlَẓ َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ُnāَsnِiʾْlā āَhَlَmَḥَw āَhْnِm َnْqَfْhsَaʾَw āَhَnْlِmْḥَy nَaʾ َnْyَbَaʾَf ِlāَbِjgْlāَw ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yَlَʿع َhَnāَmَaʾْlā āَnْḍَrَʿع āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: The acceptance of obligations and obedience to Allāh.
Coveting its reward while forgetting the penalty for failure to keep his commitment.
The reason for which mankind was permitted to carry the Trust.

ayas.translation: ُryِbَhkْlā ُmyِkَḥْlā َwُhَw ۚ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُdْmَḥْlā ُhَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَl yِhdَّlā ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā ِmyِḥَّrlā ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِhَّllā ِmْsِb
ُrwُfَغْlā ُmyِḥَّrlā َwُhَw ۚ āَhyِf ُjgُrْʿعَy āَmَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِm ُlِznَy āَmَw āَhْnِm ُjgُrْhkَy āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ُjgِlَy āَm ُmَlْʿعَy

ٍnyِbُّm ٍbāَtِk yِf āَّlِiʾ ُrَbْkَaʾ āَlَw َkِlَٰhd nِm ُrَغْṣَaʾ āَlَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَlَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٍhَّrَhd ُlāَqْhtِm ُhْnَʿع ُbُzْʿعَy āَl ۖ ِbْyَغْlā ِmِlāَʿع ْmُkَّnَyِtْaʾَtَl yِّbَrَw ٰyَlَb ْlُq ۖ ُhَʿعāَّslā āَnyِtْaʾَt āَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Or "the weight of a small ant."
i.e., to undermine their credibility in order to defeat the Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: ٍbyِnُّm ٍdْbَʿع ِّlُkِّl ًhَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm āًfَsِk ْmِhْyَlَʿع ْṭِqْsُn ْwَaʾ َḍْrَaʾْlā ُmِhِb ْfِsْhkَn ْaʾَhsَّn nِiʾ ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mُhَfْlَhk āَmَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ َnْyَb āَm ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَfَaʾ
َdyِdَḥْlā ُhَl āَّnَlَaʾَw ۖ َrْyَّṭlāَw ُhَʿعَm yِbِّwَaʾ ُlāَbِjg āَy ۖ āًlْḍَf āَّnِm َdwُwāَd āَnْyَtāʾ ْdَqَlَw

ِryِʿعَّslā ِbāَhdَʿع ْnِm ُhْqِhdُn āَnِrْmَaʾ ْnَʿع ْmُhْnِm ْغِzَy nَmَw ۖ ِhِّbَr ِnْhdِiʾِb ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb ُlَmْʿعَy nَm ِّnِjgْlā َnِmَw ۖ ِrْṭِqْlā َnْyَʿع ُhَl āَnْlَsَaʾَw ۖ ٌrْhَhs āَhُḥāَwَrَw ٌrْhَhs āَhُّwُdُغ َḥyِّrlā َnāَmْyَlُsِlَw

footnotes.text: Described by commentators as palaces, dwellings, or places of prayer.
Which were not prohibited until the time of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: ِnyِhُmْlā ِbāَhdَʿعْlā yِf āwُhtِbَl āَm َbْyَغْlā َnwُmَlْʿعَy āwُnāَk ْwَّl nَaʾ ُّnِjgْlā ِtَnَّyَbَt َّrَhk āَّmَlَf ۖ ُhَtَaʾَsnِm ُlُkْaʾَt ِḍْrَaʾْlā ُhَّbāَd āَّlِiʾ ِhِtْwَm ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَّlَd āَm َtْwَmْlā ِhْyَlَʿع āَnْyَḍَq āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: Upon which he was leaning at the time of his death. A termite continued to gnaw into the stick until it collapsed under his weight.
i.e., hard labor. This verse is evidence that the jinn do not possess knowledge of the unseen, which belongs exclusively to Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).
i.e., caused by a break in their dam. Another meaning is "the overwhelming flood."

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmāʾ āًmāَّyَaʾَw َyِlāَyَl āَhyِf āwُryِs ۖ َrْyَّslā āَhyِf āَnْrَّdَqَw ًhَrِhāَẓ yًrُq āَhyِf āَnْkَrāَb yِtَّlā yَrُqْlā َnْyَbَw ْmُhَnْyَb āَnْlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: In the lands of what is now southern Syria and Palestine.
i.e., We placed the intermediate settlements at calculated distances for the convenience of travelers.
Stories related to others as lessons or examples.
i.e., the people of Saba’ or mankind in general.
That mankind could readily be misled by him.

ayas.translation: ٌẓyِfَḥ ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع َkُّbَrَw ۗ ٍّkَhs yِf āَhْnِm َwُh ْnَّmِm ِhَrِhkāʾْlāِb ُnِmْwʾُy nَm َmَlْʿعَnِl āَّlِiʾ ٍnāَṭْlُs nِّm mِhْyَlَʿع ُhَl َnāَk āَmَw

footnotes.text: Protecting and preserving the existence and attributes of His creations.

ayas.translation: ٍryِhَẓ nِّm mُhْnِm ُhَl āَmَw ٍkْrِhs nِm āَmِhyِf ْmُhَl āَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَlَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٍhَّrَhd َlāَqْhtِm َnwُkِlْmَy āَl ۖ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُtْmَʿعَz َnyِhdَّlā āwُʿعْdā ِlُq
ُryِbَkْlā ُّyِlَʿعْlā َwُhَw ۖ َّqَḥْlā āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُkُّbَr َlāَq āَhdāَm āwُlāَq ْmِhِbwُlُq nَʿع َʿعِّzُf āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۚ ُhَl َnِhdَaʾ ْnَmِl āَّlِiʾ ُhَdnِʿع ُhَʿعāَfَّhslā ُʿعَfnَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the hearts of the angels who will be permitted to intercede.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmَʿع ُlَaʾْsُn āَlَw āَnْmَrْjgَaʾ āَّmَʿع َnwُlَaʾْsُt āَّl lُq

footnotes.text: Literally, "Opener," i.e., He who decides and lays open all matters in truth and justice and who opens the way to victory, success, relief, knowledge and understanding.
Literally, "inclusively, without exception."

ayas.translation: َnyِnِmْwʾُm āَّnُkَl ْmُtnَaʾ āَlْwَl āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl āwُfِʿعْḍُtْsā َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَy َlْwَqْlā ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُḍْʿعَb ُʿعِjgْrَy ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع َnwُfwُqْwَm َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ِhdِiʾ ٰyَrَt ْwَlَw ۗ ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb yِhdَّlāِb āَlَw ِnāʾْrُqْlā āَhdٰـَhِb َnِmْwʾُّn nَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: Having been left to the imagination, the conclusion of this sentence is estimated to be "...you would see a dreadful sight."

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَm āَّlِiʾ َnْwَzْjgُy ْlَh ۚ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ِqāَnْʿعَaʾ yِf َlāَlْغَaʾْlā āَnْlَʿعَjgَw َbāَhdَʿعْlā āُwَaʾَr āَّmَl َhَmāَdَّnlā āwُّrَsَaʾَw ۚ āًdāَdnَaʾ ُhَl َlَʿعْjgَnَw ِhَّllāِb َrُfْkَّn nَaʾ āَnَnwُrُmْaʾَt ْhdِiʾ ِrāَhَّnlāَw ِlْyَّllā ُrْkَm ْlَb āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl āwُfِʿعْḍُtْsā َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw
َnwُrِfāَk ِhِb mُtْlِsْrُaʾ āَmِb āَّnِiʾ āَhwُfَrْtُm َlāَq āَّlِiʾ ٍryِhdَّn nِّm ٍhَyْrَq yِf āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: The affluent ones in general or the people of Makkah specifically.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmāʾ ِtāَfُrُغْlā yِf ْmُhَw āwُlِmَʿع āَmِb ِfْʿعِّḍlā ُءāَzَjg ْmُhَl َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf āًḥِlāَṣ َlِmَʿعَw َnَmāʾ ْnَm āَّlِiʾ ٰyَfْlُz āَnَdnِʿع ْmُkُbِّrَqُt yِtَّlāِb mُkُdāَlْwَaʾ āَlَw ْmُkُlāَwْmَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="34" verses="5">34:5</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُnِmْwʾُّm mِhِb mُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ۖ َّnِjgْlā َnwُdُbْʿعَy āwُnāَk ْlَb ۖ mِhِnwُd nِm āَnُّyِlَw َtnَaʾ َkَnāَḥْbُs āwُlāَq
َnwُbِّhdَkُt āَhِb mُtnُk yِtَّlā ِrāَّnlā َbāَhdَʿع āwُqwُhd āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlِl ُlwُqَnَw āًّrَḍ āَlَw āًʿعْfَّn ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُkُḍْʿعَb ُkِlْmَy āَl َmْwَyْlāَf

ٌnyِbُّm ٌrْḥِs āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ْmُhَءāَjg āَّmَl ِّqَḥْlِl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw ۚ yًrَtْfُّm ٌkْfِiʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm āwُlāَqَw ْmُkُwʾāَbāʾ ُdُbْʿعَy َnāَk āَّmَʿع ْmُkَّdُṣَy nَaʾ ُdyِrُy ٌlُjgَr āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm āwُlāَq ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw
ٍryِhdَّn nِm َkَlْbَq ْmِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَw ۖ āَhَnwُsُrْdَy ٍbُtُk nِّm mُhāَnْyَtāʾ āَmَw
ِryِkَn َnāَk َfْyَkَf ۖ yِlُsُr āwُbَّhdَkَf ْmُhāَnْyَtāʾ āَm َrāَhsْʿعِm āwُغَlَb āَmَw ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā َbَّhdَkَw

ٍdyِdَhs ٍbāَhdَʿع ْyَdَy َnْyَb mُkَّl ٌryِhdَn āَّlِiʾ َwُh ْnِiʾ ۚ ٍhَّnِjg nِّm mُkِbِḥāَṣِb āَm ۚ āwُrَّkَfَtَt َّmُht ٰyَdāَrُfَw ٰyَnْhtَm ِhَّlِl āwُmwُqَt nَaʾ ۖ ٍhَdِḥāَwِb mُkُẓِʿعَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: This expression alludes to complete inability, meaning that falsehood was abolished.

ayas.translation: ٌbyِrَq ٌʿعyِmَs ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ yِّbَr َّyَlِiʾ yِḥwُy āَmِbَf ُtْyَdَtْhā ِnِiʾَw ۖ yِsْfَn ٰyَlَʿع ُّlِḍَaʾ āَmَّnِiʾَf ُtْlَlَḍ nِiʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., have a glimpse of the Hereafter.
Literally, "taking of something within easy reach," in other words, "How can they expect to obtain faith at this point?"
i.e., their former life on earth, wherein they had every opportunity but which is now gone, never to return.
Verbally, by conjecture and denial.
i.e., a position far from truth.

ayas.translation: ٍbyِrُّm ٍّkَhs yِf āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ُlْbَq nِّm mِhِʿعāَyْhsَaʾِb َlِʿعُf āَmَk َnwُhَtْhsَy āَm َnْyَbَw ْmُhَnْyَb َlyِḥَw

footnotes.text: Meaning the attainment of faith and its benefits or entrance into Paradise.

ayas.translation: ُmyِkَḥْlā ُzyِzَʿعْlā َwُhَw ۚ ِhِdْʿعَb nِm ُhَl َlِsْrُm āَlَf ْkِsْmُy āَmَw ۖ āَhَl َkِsْmُm āَlَf ٍhَmْḥَّr nِm ِsāَّnlِl ُhَّllā ِḥَtْfَy āَّm
َnwُkَfْwʾُt ٰyَّnَaʾَf ۖ َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mُkُqُzْrَy ِhَّllā ُrْyَغ ٍqِlāَhk ْnِm ْlَh ۚ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ِhَّllā َtَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdā ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
ُrwُrَغْlā ِhَّllāِb mُkَّnَّrُغَy āَlَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُkَّnَّrُغَt āَlَf ۖ ٌّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw َّnِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnwُʿعَnْṣَy āَmِb ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ٍtāَrَsَḥ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َkُsْfَn ْbَhْhdَt āَlَf ۖ ُءāَhsَy nَm yِdْhَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَm ُّlِḍُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ۖ āًnَsَḥ ُhāʾَrَf ِhِlَmَʿع ُءwُs ُhَl َnِّyُz nَmَfَaʾ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="4" verses="139">4:139</reference>.
For acceptance by Allāh, meaning that righteous deeds are confirmation and proof of what is uttered by the tongue.

ayas.translation: ٌryِsَy ِhَّllā yَlَʿع َkِlَٰhd َّnِiʾ ۚ ٍbāَtِk yِf āَّlِiʾ ِhِrُmُʿع ْnِm ُṣَqnُy āَlَw ٍrَّmَʿعُّm nِm ُrَّmَʿعُy āَmَw ۚ ِhِmْlِʿعِb āَّlِiʾ ُʿعَḍَt āَlَw ٰyَhtnُaʾ ْnِm ُlِmْḥَt āَmَw ۚ āًjgāَwْzَaʾ ْmُkَlَʿعَjg َّmُht ٍhَfْṭُّn nِm َّmُht ٍbāَrُt nِّm mُkَqَlَhk ُhَّllāَw

َnwُrُkْhsَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَlَw ِhِlْḍَf nِm āwُغَtْbَtِl َrِhkāَwَm ِhyِf َkْlُfْlā yَrَtَw ۖ āَhَnwُsَbْlَt ًhَyْlِḥ َnwُjgِrْhkَtْsَtَw āًّyِrَṭ āًmْḥَl َnwُlُkْaʾَt ٍّlُk nِmَw ۖ ٌjgāَjgُaʾ ٌḥْlِm āَhdٰـَhَw ُhُbāَrَhs ٌغِyʾāَs ٌtāَrُf ٌbْhdَʿع āَhdٰـَh ِnāَrْḥَbْlā yِwَtْsَy āَmَw

ٍryِmْṭِq nِm َnwُkِlْmَy āَm ِhِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ُkْlُmْlā ُhَl ْmُkُّbَr ُhَّllā ُmُkِlَٰhd ۚ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾِl yِrْjgَy ٌّlُk َrَmَqْlāَw َsْmَّhslā َrَّhkَsَw ِlْyَّllā yِf َrāَhَّnlā ُjgِlwُyَw ِrāَhَّnlā yِf َlْyَّllā ُjgِlwُy
ٍryِbَhk ُlْhtِm َkُyʾِّbَnُy āَlَw ۚ ْmُkِkْrِhsِb َnwُrُfْkَy ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَyَw ۖ ْmُkَl āwُbāَjgَtْsā āَm āwُʿعِmَs ْwَlَw ْmُkَءāَʿعُd āwُʿعَmْsَy āَl ْmُhwُʿعْdَt nِiʾ

footnotes.text: Of them with Allāh or your worship of them.

ayas.translation: ُryِṣَmْlā ِhَّllā yَlِiʾَw ۚ ِhِsْfَnِl ٰyَّkَzَtَy āَmَّnِiʾَf ٰyَّkَzَt nَmَw ۚ َhāَlَّṣlā āwُmāَqَaʾَw ِbْyَغْlāِb mُhَّbَr َnْwَhsْhkَy َnyِhdَّlā ُrِhdnُt āَmَّnِiʾ ۗ ٰyَbْrُq āَhd َnāَk ْwَlَw ٌءْyَhs ُhْnِm ْlَmْḥُy āَl āَhِlْmِḥ ٰyَlِiʾ ٌhَlَqْhtُm ُʿعْdَt nِiʾَw ۚ ٰyَrْhkُaʾ َrْzِw ٌhَrِzāَw ُrِzَt āَlَw

footnotes.text: Of the sun or of a scorching wind.

ayas.translation: ِrwُbُqْlā yِf nَّm ٍʿعِmْsُmِb َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ ُءāَhsَy nَm ُʿعِmْsُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ُtāَwْmَaʾْlā āَlَw ُءāَyْḥَaʾْlā yِwَtْsَy āَmَw

footnotes.text: The four comparisons given by Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) in verses 19-22 are those of the believer and unbeliever, various kinds of misbelief and (true) belief, Paradise and Hellfire, and those receptive to guidance and those unreceptive.

ayas.translation: ٌryِhdَn āَhyِf āَlَhk āَّlِiʾ ٍhَّmُaʾ ْnِّm nِiʾَw ۚ āًryِhdَnَw āًryِhsَb ِّqَḥْlāِb َkāَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., He gives much in return for little and multiplies rewards.
The followers of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: ٌbwُغُl āَhyِf āَnُّsَmَy āَlَw ٌbَṣَn āَhyِf āَnُّsَmَy āَl ِhِlْḍَf nِm ِhَmāَqُmْlā َrāَd āَnَّlَḥَaʾ yِhdَّlā
ٍrwُfَk َّlُk yِzْjgَn َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ āَhِbāَhdَʿع ْnِّm mُhْnَʿع ُfَّfَhkُy āَlَw āwُtwُmَyَf ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَḍْqُy āَl َmَّnَhَjg ُrāَn ْmُhَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: Or "They are not killed."

ayas.translation: ٍryِṣَّn nِm َnyِmِlāَّẓlِl āَmَf āwُqwُhdَf ۖ ُryِhdَّnlā ُmُkَءāَjgَw َrَّkَhdَt nَm ِhyِf ُrَّkَhdَtَy āَّm mُkْrِّmَʿعُn ْmَlَwَaʾ ۚ ُlَmْʿعَn āَّnُk yِhdَّlā َrْyَغ āًḥِlāَṣ ْlَmْʿعَn āَnْjgِrْhkَaʾ āَnَّbَr āَhyِf َnwُhkِrَṭْṣَy ْmُhَw

footnotes.text: The implication is "Return us to the previous world."

ayas.translation: āًrāَsَhk āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُrْfُk َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُdyِzَy āَlَw ۖ āًtْqَm āَّlِiʾ ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع ْmُhُrْfُk َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُdyِzَy āَlَw ۖ ُhُrْfُk ِhْyَlَʿعَf َrَfَk nَmَf ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َfِyʾāَlَhk ْmُkَlَʿعَjg yِhdَّlā َwُh

āًrwُrُغ āَّlِiʾ āًḍْʿعَb mُhُḍْʿعَb َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُdِʿعَy nِiʾ ْlَb ۚ ُhْnِّm ٍtَnِّyَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhَf āًbāَtِk ْmُhāَnْyَtāʾ ْmَaʾ ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٌkْrِhs ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِm āwُqَlَhk āَhdāَm yِnwُrَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkَءāَkَrُhs ْmُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: Understood to mean "Tell me about..."
By telling their followers that the so-called deities will intercede for them with Allāh.

ayas.translation: āًrwُfَغ āًmyِlَḥ َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِhِdْʿعَb nِّm ٍdَḥَaʾ ْnِm āَmُhَkَsْmَaʾ ْnِiʾ āَtَlāَz nِyʾَlَw ۚ āَlwُzَt nَaʾ َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُkِsْmُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote in <reference chapter="2" verses="225">2:225</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًrwُfُn āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَdāَz āَّm ٌryِhdَn ْmُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf ۖ ِmَmُaʾْlā yَdْḥِiʾ ْnِm ٰyَdْhَaʾ َّnُnwُkَyَّl ٌryِhdَn ْmُhَءāَjg nِyʾَl ْmِhِnāَmْyَaʾ َdْhَjg ِhَّllāِb āwُmَsْqَaʾَw

āًlyِwْḥَt ِhَّllā ِtَّnُsِl َdِjgَt nَlَw ۖ āًlyِdْbَt ِhَّllā ِtَّnُsِl َdِjgَt nَlَf ۚ َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā َtَّnُs āَّlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ْlَhَf ۚ ِhِlْhَaʾِb āَّlِiʾ ُyʾِّyَّslā ُrْkَmْlā ُqyِḥَy āَlَw ۚ ِyʾِّyَّslā َrْkَmَw ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًrāَbْkِtْsā

footnotes.text: i.e., in His punishment of those who deny the prophets.
Or "transfer" of punishment to others in place of them.

ayas.translation: āًryِdَq āًmyِlَʿع َnāَk ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَlَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٍءْyَhs nِm ُhَzِjgْʿعُyِl ُhَّllā َnāَk āَmَw ۚ ًhَّwُq ْmُhْnِm َّdَhsَaʾ āwُnāَkَw ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

āًryِṣَb ِhِdāَbِʿعِb َnāَk َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf ْmُhُlَjgَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۖ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُrِّhkَwʾُy nِkٰـَlَw ٍhَّbāَd nِm āَhِrْhَẓ ٰyَlَʿع َkَrَt āَm āwُbَsَk āَmِb َsāَّnlā ُhَّllā ُhdِhkāَwʾُy ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="1">10:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥَmْqُّm mُhَf ِnāَqْhdَaʾْlā yَlِiʾ َyِhَf āًlāَlْغَaʾ ْmِhِqāَnْʿعَaʾ yِf āَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnِiʾ
َnwُlَsْrُّm mُkْyَlِiʾ āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَqَf ٍhtِlāَhtِb āَnْzَّzَʿعَf āَmُhwُbَّhdَkَf ِnْyَnْhtā ُmِhْyَlِiʾ āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْhdِiʾ
َnwُbِhdْkَt āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ ٍءْyَhs nِm ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā َlَznَaʾ āَmَw āَnُlْhtِّm ٌrَhsَb āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ āَm āwُlāَq
ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع āَّnِّm mُkَّnَّsَmَyَlَw ْmُkَّnَmُjgْrَnَl āwُhَtnَt ْmَّl nِyʾَl ۖ ْmُkِb āَnْrَّyَṭَt āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: Your threat against us.

ayas.translation: ِnwُhdِqnُy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs ْmُhُtَʿعāَfَhs yِّnَʿع ِnْغُt āَّl ٍّrُḍِb ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِnْdِrُy nِiʾ ًhَhِlāʾ ِhِnwُd nِm ُhdِhkَّtَaʾَaʾ

footnotes.text: An abrupt transfer to the Hereafter conveys the meaning that the man met a violent death at the hands of the disbelievers and so was martyred for the cause of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِznُm āَّnُk āَmَw ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm ٍdnُjg nِm ِhِdْʿعَb nِm ِhِmْwَq ٰyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: From Gabriel or a blast from the sky.

ayas.translation: َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّlِiʾ ٍlwُsَّr nِّm mِhyِtْaʾَy āَm ۚ ِdāَbِʿعْlā yَlَʿع ًhَrْsَḥ āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., to those living presently in the world.
i.e., that which Allāh has produced for them.
An alternative meaning is "And [eat from] what their hands have produced [i.e., planted and harvested]." Both are grammatically correct.
Or "all species."
Literally, "strip" or "peel." Sunlight projected onto the earth is removed from it as the earth turns and night approaches.

ayas.translation: َnwُḥَbْsَy ٍkَlَf yِf ٌّlُkَw ۚ ِrāَhَّnlā ُqِbāَs ُlْyَّllā āَlَw َrَmَqْlā َkِrْdُt nَaʾ āَhَl yِغَbnَy ُsْmَّhslā āَl

footnotes.text: Usually meaning "descendants" or "offspring," the word "dhurriyyah" is used here to denote forefathers (their being the offspring of Noah), who were saved from the flood.
Of sins or of life in this world and the Hereafter.
The conclusion of this sentence is understood to be "...they ignored the warning."

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍlāَlَḍ yِf āَّlِiʾ ْmُtnَaʾ ْnِiʾ ُhَmَʿعْṭَaʾ ُhَّllā ُءāَhsَy ْwَّl nَm ُmِʿعْṭُnَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَq ُhَّllā ُmُkَqَzَr āَّmِm āwُqِfnَaʾ ْmُhَl َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Literally, "cry" or "shriek," meaning the first blast of the Horn which will strike dead every living thing on the earth without warning.
For the second time, signaling the Resurrection.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَsْrُmْlā َqَdَṣَw ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā َdَʿعَw āَm āَhdٰـَh ۗ ۜ āَnِdَqْrَّm nِm āَnَhtَʿعَb nَm āَnَlْyَw āَy āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., remove yourself from the ranks of the believers to be distinguished from them.
Or "because you used to disbelieve."
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) could have left man without means of guidance in the life of this world, although in His mercy He did not.
He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) could have prevented man from taking any action to benefit himself in this world or the Hereafter, yet He did not.
In his physical and mental capacity.
In heart and mind, i.e., the believers.

ayas.translation: َnwُkِlāَm āَhَl ْmُhَf āًmāَʿعْnَaʾ āَnyِdْyَaʾ ْtَlِmَʿع āَّmِّm mُhَl āَnْqَlَhk āَّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.
Maintaining and protecting their "gods." Another interpretation is that they (i.e., the gods) will be soldiers set against them in Hellfire.
i.e., as soon as he becomes self-sufficient.
Attempting to establish the finality of death.
To the prophets or among themselves. Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) swears by these three kinds of angels to the fact mentioned in the following verse.
i.e., each point or place of sunrise.
By flaming meteors.

ayas.translation: ٍbِzāَّl ٍnyِṭ nِّm mُhāَnْqَlَhk āَّnِiʾ ۚ āَnْqَlَhk ْnَّm mَaʾ āًqْlَhk ُّdَhsَaʾ ْmُhَaʾ ْmِhِtْfَtْsāَf
َnwُhtwُʿعْbَmَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًmāَẓِʿعَw āًbāَrُt āَّnُkَw āَnْtِm āَhdِiʾَaʾ

footnotes.text: Those similar to them in evil deeds. Another possible meaning is "their wives."
i.e., from our position of strength, oppressing us. Or from where we would have grasped the truth, preventing us.
Meaning everything delicious.
i.e., chaste and modest, looking only at their mates.

ayas.translation: َnwُnyِdَmَl āَّnِiʾَaʾ āًmāَẓِʿعَw āًbāَrُt āَّnُkَw āَnْtِm āَhdِiʾَaʾ

footnotes.text: To his companions in Paradise.
The companion who had tried to dissuade him from belief on earth.
Consume the offerings placed before them.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِbāَّṣlā َnِm ُhَّllā َءāَhs nِiʾ yِnُdِjgَtَs ۖ ُrَmْwʾُt āَm ْlَʿعْfā ِtَbَaʾ āَy َlāَq ۚ ٰyَrَt āَhdāَm ْrُẓnāَf َkُḥَbْhdَaʾ yِّnَaʾ ِmāَnَmْlā yِf ٰyَrَaʾ yِّnِiʾ َّyَnُb āَy َlāَq َyْʿعَّslā ُhَʿعَm َغَlَb āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., the ability to work and be of assistance.
To the command of Allāh.
Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) sent a huge ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.
This verifies that the firstborn son who was to be sacrificed was Ishmael and not Isaac, as claimed by the Jews and Christians.
The name of a great idol worshipped by the people and said to mean "lord."
Ilyāseen is said by some commentators to be a plural form, meaning "Elias and those who followed him."
To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the other passengers. Having been overloaded, the ship was on the verge of sinking.
For having given up hope on his people prematurely and having left them without permission from Allāh.
Meaning that the belly of the fish would have become his grave.
Which is known to give cooling shade and to be a repellent of flies.
i.e., returned him thereafter.
The people of Makkah claimed that the angels were daughters of Allāh, yet they preferred sons for themselves.
i.e., evidence.
Due to his disbelief and evil deeds.
Refuting what the disbelievers had said about them.
For worship. Or "an assigned task" to perform.
Before the revelation of the Qur’ān.
i.e., in their own message, the Qur’ān.
If not in this world, then definitely in the Hereafter.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
The completion of the oath is understood to be that the Qur’ān is inimitable and thus a miracle from Allāh.
Planned by Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) in order to gain influence and prestige for himself.

ayas.translation: ٌqāَlِtْhkā āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh ْnِiʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ِhَّlِmْlā yِf āَhdٰـَhِb āَnْʿعِmَs āَm

footnotes.text: Referring to Christianity or possibly the pagan religion of the Quraysh.

ayas.translation: ِbāَhdَʿع āwُqwُhdَy āَّmَّl lَb ۖ yِrْkِhd nِّm ٍّkَhs yِf ْmُh ْlَb ۚ āَnِnْyَb nِm ُrْkِّhdlā ِhْyَlَʿع َlِznُaʾَaʾ

footnotes.text: Refer to footnote of verse <reference chapter="3" verses="8">3:8</reference>.
To oversee the affairs of their dominion.
By which he tortured people.
That were defeated, among whom will be the disbelievers of Quraysh and others.
Or "respite." More literally, "a period between two milkings of a she-camel," which also alludes to the meanings of "return" or "repetition."

ayas.translation: ِṭāَrِّṣlā ِءāَwَs ٰyَlِiʾ āَnِdْhāَw ْṭِṭْhsُt āَlَw ِّqَḥْlāِb āَnَnْyَb mُkْḥāَf ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع āَnُḍْʿعَb ٰyَغَb ِnāَmْṣَhk ۖ ْfَhkَt āَl āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُhْnِm َʿعِzَfَf َdwُwāَd ٰyَlَʿع āwُlَhkَd ْhdِiʾ

۩ َbāَnَaʾَw āًʿعِkāَr َّrَhkَw ُhَّbَr َrَfْغَtْsāَf ُhāَّnَtَf āَmَّnَaʾ ُdwُwāَd َّnَẓَw ۗ ْmُh āَّm ٌlyِlَqَw ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ ٍḍْʿعَb ٰyَlَʿع ْmُhُḍْʿعَb yِغْbَyَl ِءāَṭَlُhkْlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk َّnِiʾَw ۖ ِhِjgāَʿعِn ٰyَlِiʾ َkِtَjgْʿعَn ِlāَwʾُsِb َkَmَlَẓ ْdَqَl َlāَq

footnotes.text: For his errors, such as fear and suspicion of the two men at the outset, any mistake in judgement he might have made, concealed feelings of partiality, etc.

ayas.translation: ِbāَsِḥْlā َmْwَy āwُsَn āَmِb ٌdyِdَhs ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَl ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َnwُّlِḍَy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع َkَّlِḍُyَf ٰyَwَhْlā ِʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ِّqَḥْlāِb ِsāَّnlā َnْyَb mُkْḥāَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf ًhَfyِlَhk َkāَnْlَʿعَjg āَّnِiʾ ُdwُwāَd āَy
ِrāَّnlā َnِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlِّl ٌlْyَwَf ۚ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُّnَẓ َkِlَٰhd ۚ āًlِṭāَb āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw َءāَmَّslā āَnْqَlَhk āَmَw

footnotes.text: With his sword as expiation. Some commentaries have also suggested the meaning of "stroking" with the hand.
Said to be a devil or a lifeless body (one without capability), but Allāh alone knows.
To sovereignty and to Allāh in repentance.

ayas.translation: ُbāَّhَwْlā َtnَaʾ َkَّnِiʾ ۖ yِdْʿعَb nِّm ٍdَḥَaʾِl yِغَbnَy āَّl āًkْlُm yِl ْbَhَw yِl ْrِfْغā ِّbَr َlāَq

footnotes.text: At a point during his illness, Job became angry with his wife and swore that if he recovered, he would punish her with one hundred lashes. According to Allāh's instruction, the oath was fulfilled by striking her once with one hundred blades of grass.
To their mates alone.

ayas.translation: ِrāَّnlā yِf āًfْʿعِḍ āًbāَhdَʿع ُhْdِzَf āَhdٰـَh āَnَl َmَّdَq nَm āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq
ِrāَrْhsَaʾْlā َnِّm mُhُّdُʿعَn āَّnُk āًlāَjgِr ٰyَrَn āَl āَnَl āَm āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: They are referring to the believers.
Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="12" verses="39">12:39</reference>.
Honored for absolute power associated with wisdom and justice.
Who continually conceals sins and faults.
See footnote to <reference chapter="15" verses="29">15:29</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="34">2:34</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٌrāَّfَk ٌbِhdāَk َwُh ْnَm yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۗ َnwُfِlَtْhkَy ِhyِf ْmُh āَm yِf ْmُhَnْyَb ُmُkْḥَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ٰyَfْlُz ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āَnwُbِّrَqُyِl āَّlِiʾ ْmُhُdُbْʿعَn āَm َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ِhِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ُṣِlāَhkْlā ُnyِّdlā ِhَّlِl āَlَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., acceptable to Allāh is that none be associated with Him in worship and obedience.
Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="12" verses="39">12:39</reference>.
Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="38" verses="66">38:66</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُfَrْṣُt ٰyَّnَaʾَf ۖ َwُh āَّlِiʾ َhٰـَlِiʾ āَl ۖ ُkْlُmْlā ُhَl ْmُkُّbَr ُhَّllā ُmُkِlَٰhd ۚ ٍhtāَlَht ٍtāَmُlُẓ yِf ٍqْlَhk ِdْʿعَb nِّm āًqْlَhk ْmُkِtāَhَّmُaʾ ِnwُṭُb yِf ْmُkُqُlْhkَy ۚ ٍjgāَwْzَaʾ َhَyِnāَmَht ِmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā َnِّm mُkَl َlَznَaʾَw āَhَjgْwَz āَhْnِm َlَʿعَjg َّmُht ٍhَdِḥāَw ٍsْfَّn nِّm mُkَqَlَhk

footnotes.text: See <reference chapter="6" verses="143-144">6:143-144</reference>.
i.e., the belly, the womb, and the amniotic membrane.

ayas.translation: ِrwُdُّṣlā ِtāَhdِb ٌmyِlَʿع ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb mُkُyʾِّbَnُyَf ْmُkُʿعِjgْrَّm mُkِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ َّmُht ۗ ٰyَrْhkُaʾ َrْzِw ٌhَrِzāَw ُrِzَt āَlَw ۗ ْmُkَl ُhَḍْrَy āwُrُkْhsَt nِiʾَw ۖ َrْfُkْlā ِhِdāَbِʿعِl ٰyَḍْrَy āَlَw ۖ ْmُknَʿع ٌّyِnَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾَf āwُrُfْkَt nِiʾ

ِrāَّnlā ِbāَḥْṣَaʾ ْnِm َkَّnِiʾ ۖ āًlyِlَq َkِrْfُkِb ْʿعَّtَmَt ْlُq ۚ ِhِlyِbَs nَʿع َّlِḍُyِّl āًdāَdnَaʾ ِhَّlِl َlَʿعَjgَw ُlْbَq nِm ِhْyَlِiʾ wُʿعْdَy َnāَk āَm َyِsَn ُhْnِّm ًhَmْʿعِn ُhَlَّwَhk āَhdِiʾ َّmُht ِhْyَlِiʾ āًbyِnُm ُhَّbَr āَʿعَd ٌّrُḍ َnāَsnِiʾْlā َّsَm āَhdِiʾَw

footnotes.text: Or "that for which he called upon Him before."

ayas.translation: ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā wُlwُaʾ ُrَّkَhdَtَy āَmَّnِiʾ ۗ َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl َnyِhdَّlāَw َnwُmَlْʿعَy َnyِhdَّlā yِwَtْsَy ْlَh ْlُq ۗ ِhِّbَr َhَmْḥَr wُjgْrَyَw َhَrِhkāʾْlā ُrَhdْḥَy āًmِyʾāَqَw āًdِjgāَs ِlْyَّllā َءāَnāʾ ٌtِnāَq َwُh ْnَّmَaʾ

ٍbāَsِḥ ِrْyَغِb mُhَrْjgَaʾ َnwُrِbāَّṣlā yَّfَwُy āَmَّnِiʾ ۗ ٌhَʿعِsāَw ِhَّllā ُḍْrَaʾَw ۗ ٌhَnَsَḥ āَyْnُّdlā ِhِhdٰـَh yِf āwُnَsْḥَaʾ َnyِhdَّlِl ۚ ْmُkَّbَr āwُqَّtā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ِdāَbِʿع āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) is instructed to say on behalf of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) to His believing servants.

ayas.translation: ُnyِbُmْlā ُnāَrْsُhkْlā َwُh َkِlَٰhd āَlَaʾ ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmِhyِlْhَaʾَw ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُrِsَhk َnyِhdَّlā َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َّnِiʾ ْlُq ۗ ِhِnwُd nِّm mُtْyʾِhs āَm āwُdُbْʿعāَf

footnotes.text: i.e., Satan or any false object of worship.

ayas.translation: َdāَʿعyِmْlā ُhَّllā ُfِlْhkُy āَl ۖ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٌhَّyِnْbَّm ٌfَrُغ āَhِqْwَf nِّm ٌfَrُغ ْmُhَl ْmُhَّbَr āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlā ِnِkٰـَl

footnotes.text: i.e., elevated rooms, dwellings or palaces.

ayas.translation: ِbāَbْlَaʾْlā yِlwُaʾِl ٰyَrْkِhdَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ āًmāَṭُḥ ُhُlَʿعْjgَy َّmُht āًّrَfْṣُm ُhāَrَtَf ُjgyِhَy َّmُht ُhُnāَwْlَaʾ āًfِlَtْhkُّm āًʿعْrَz ِhِb ُjgِrْhkُy َّmُht ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َʿعyِbāَnَy ُhَkَlَsَf ًءāَm ِءāَmَّslā َnِm َlَznَaʾ َhَّllā َّnَaʾ َrَt ْmَlَaʾ

ٍdāَh ْnِm ُhَl āَmَf ُhَّllā ِlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِb yِdْhَy ِhَّllā yَdُh َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِhَّllā ِrْkِhd ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُhُbwُlُqَw ْmُhُdwُlُjg ُnyِlَt َّmُht ْmُhَّbَr َnْwَhsْhkَy َnyِhdَّlā ُdwُlُjg ُhْnِm ُّrِʿعَhsْqَt َyِnāَhtَّm āًhِbāَhsَtُّm āًbāَtِk ِhtyِdَḥْlā َnَsْḥَaʾ َlَّzَn ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: Rather than his hands, which will be chained to his neck.
From the truth.
Through consciousness of Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhُrَhtْkَaʾ ْlَb ۚ ِhَّlِl ُdْmَḥْlā ۚ āًlَhtَm ِnāَyِwَtْsَy ْlَh ٍlُjgَrِّl āًmَlَs āًlُjgَrَw َnwُsِkāَhsَtُm ُءāَkَrُhs ِhyِf āًlُjgَّr āًlَhtَm ُhَّllā َbَrَḍ

َnwُlِّkَwَtُmْlā ُlَّkَwَtَy ِhْyَlَʿع ۖ ُhَّllā َyِbْsَḥ ْlُq ۚ ِhِtَmْḥَr ُtāَkِsْmُm َّnُh ْlَh ٍhَmْḥَrِb yِnَdāَrَaʾ ْwَaʾ ِhِّrُḍ ُtāَfِhsāَk َّnُh ْlَh ٍّrُḍِb ُhَّllā َyِnَdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt āَّm mُtْyَaʾَrَfَaʾ ْlُq ۚ ُhَّllā َّnُlwُqَyَl َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā َqَlَhk ْnَّm mُhَtْlَaʾَs nِyʾَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., "Tell me about..."

ayas.translation: ٍlyِkَwِb mِhْyَlَʿع َtnَaʾ āَmَw ۖ āَhْyَlَʿع ُّlِḍَy āَmَّnِiʾَf َّlَḍ nَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَnِlَf ٰyَdَtْhā ِnَmَf ۖ ِّqَḥْlāِb ِsāَّnlِl َbāَtِkْlā َkْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَّnِiʾ

َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ ٰyَrْhkُaʾْlā ُlِsْrُyَw َtْwَmْlā āَhْyَlَʿع ٰyَḍَq yِtَّlā ُkِsْmُyَf ۖ āَhِmāَnَm yِf ْtُmَt ْmَl yِtَّlāَw āَhِtْwَm َnyِḥ َsُfnَaʾْlā yَّfَwَtَy ُhَّllā
َnwُlِqْʿعَy āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs َnwُkِlْmَy āَl āwُnāَk ْwَlَwَaʾ ْlُq ۚ َءāَʿعَfُhs ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā ِmَaʾ

َnwُbِsَtْḥَy āwُnwُkَy ْmَl āَm ِhَّllā َnِّm mُhَl āَdَbَw ۚ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ِbāَhdَʿعْlā ِءwُs nِm ِhِb āْwَdَtْfāَl ُhَʿعَm ُhَlْhtِmَw āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlِl َّnَaʾ ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Of His anger and punishment.

ayas.translation: َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِb َqāَḥَw āwُbَsَk āَm ُtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhَl āَdَbَw

َnwُmَlْʿعَy āَl ْmُhَrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ٌhَnْtِf َyِh ْlَb ۚ ٍmْlِʿع ٰyَlَʿع ُhُtyِtwُaʾ āَmَّnِiʾ َlāَq āَّnِّm ًhَmْʿعِn ُhāَnْlَّwَhk āَhdِiʾ َّmُht āَnāَʿعَd ٌّrُḍ َnāَsnِiʾْlā َّsَm āَhdِiʾَf
َnwُbِsْkَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع ٰyَnْغَaʾ āَmَf ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā āَhَlāَq ْdَq
َnyِzِjgْʿعُmِb mُh āَmَw āwُbَsَk āَm ُtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhُbyِṣُyَs ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ْnِm āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ āwُbَsَk āَm ُtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhَbāَṣَaʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., prevent Allāh from what He wills or escape from the punishment.

ayas.translation: ُmyِḥَّrlā ُrwُfَغْlā َwُh ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ āًʿعyِmَjg َbwُnُّhdlā ُrِfْغَy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ِhَّllā ِhَmْḥَّr nِm āwُṭَnْqَt āَl ْmِhِsُfnَaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āwُfَrْsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َyِdāَbِʿع āَy ْlُq

footnotes.text: For those who repent and correct themselves.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُʿعْhsَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ًhَtْغَb ُbāَhdَʿعْlā ُmُkَyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِّm mُkِّbَّr nِّm mُkْyَlِiʾ َlِznُaʾ āَm َnَsْḥَaʾ āwُʿعِbَّtāَw

footnotes.text: On the Day of Resurrection.
At worldly life.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِّbَkَtُmْlِّl yًwْhtَm َmَّnَhَjg yِf َsْyَlَaʾ ۚ ٌhَّdَwْsُّm mُhُhwُjgُw ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُbَhdَk َnyِhdَّlā yَrَt ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: i.e., their success in the trials of worldly life and attainment of Paradise.
i.e., appreciation of His attributes.
Literally, "no more than a handful of His."
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrُẓnَy ٌmāَyِq ْmُh āَhdِiʾَf ٰyَrْhkُaʾ ِhyِf َhkِfُn َّmُht ۖ ُhَّllā َءāَhs nَm āَّlِiʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf nَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf nَm َqِʿعَṣَf ِrwُّṣlā yِf َhkِfُnَw

footnotes.text: With no need for any record or witnesses, which are but means to establish proof to the soul itself in addition to its own knowledge of what it has done.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِfāَkْlā yَlَʿع ِbāَhdَʿعْlā ُhَmِlَk ْtَّqَḥ ْnِkٰـَlَw ٰyَlَb āwُlāَq ۚ āَhdٰـَh ْmُkِmْwَy َءāَqِl ْmُkَnwُrِhdnُyَw ْmُkِّbَr ِtāَyāʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع َnwُlْtَy ْmُknِّm ٌlُsُr ْmُkِtْaʾَy ْmَlَaʾ āَhُtَnَzَhk ْmُhَl َlāَqَw āَhُbāَwْbَaʾ ْtَḥِtُf āَhwُءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ āًrَmُz َmَّnَhَjg ٰyَlِiʾ āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َqyِsَw

َnyِdِlāَhk āَhwُlُhkْdāَf ْmُtْbِṭ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٌmāَlَs āَhُtَnَzَhk ْmُhَl َlāَqَw āَhُbāَwْbَaʾ ْtَḥِtُfَw āَhwُءāَjg āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ āًrَmُz ِhَّnَjgْlā yَlِiʾ ْmُhَّbَr āْwَqَّtā َnyِhdَّlā َqyِsَw

footnotes.text: In such honor and joy that is beyond description - thus, the omission of this conclusion in the Arabic text.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: ِdāَlِbْlā yِf ْmُhُbُّlَqَt َkْrُrْغَy āَlَf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ yِf ُlِdāَjgُy āَm
ٍlyِbَs nِّm ٍjgwُrُhk ٰyَlِiʾ ْlَhَf āَnِbwُnُhdِb āَnْfَrَtْʿعāَf ِnْyَtَnْhtā āَnَtْyَyْḥَaʾَw ِnْyَtَnْhtā āَnَّtَmَaʾ āَnَّbَr āwُlāَq
ُbyِnُy nَm āَّlِiʾ ُrَّkَhdَtَy āَmَw ۚ āًqْzِr ِءāَmَّslā َnِّm mُkَl ُlِّzَnُyَw ِhِtāَyāʾ ْmُkyِrُy yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="12" verses="39">12:39</reference>.
In worship.

ayas.translation: ٍqāَw nِm ِhَّllā َnِّm mُhَl َnāَk āَmَw ْmِhِbwُnُhdِb ُhَّllā ُmُhَhdَhkَaʾَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًrāَhtāʾَw ًhَّwُq ْmُhْnِm َّdَhsَaʾ ْmُh āwُnāَk ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm āwُnāَk َnyِhdَّlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَwَaʾ

footnotes.text: i.e., evidences from Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍlāَlَḍ yِf āَّlِiʾ َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُdْyَk āَmَw ۚ ْmُhَءāَsِn āwُyْḥَtْsāَw ُhَʿعَm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َءāَnْbَaʾ āwُlُtْqā āwُlāَq āَnِdnِʿع ْnِm ِّqَḥْlāِb mُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: i.e., dissension or civil strife.

ayas.translation: ٌbāَّhdَk ٌfِrْsُm َwُh ْnَm yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkُdِʿعَy yِhdَّlā ُḍْʿعَb mُkْbِṣُy āًqِdāَṣ ُkَy nِiʾَw ۖ ُhُbِhdَk ِhْyَlَʿعَf āًbِhdāَk ُkَy nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkِّbَّr nِm ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُkَءāَjg ْdَqَw ُhَّllā َyِّbَr َlwُqَy nَaʾ āًlُjgَr َnwُlُtْqَtَaʾ ُhَnāَmyِiʾ ُmُtْkَy َnْwَʿعْrِf ِlāʾ ْnِّm ٌnِmْwʾُّm ٌlُjgَr َlāَqَw

ِdāَhsَّrlā َlyِbَs āَّlِiʾ ْmُkyِdْhَaʾ āَmَw ٰyَrَaʾ āَm āَّlِiʾ ْmُkyِrُaʾ āَm ُnْwَʿعْrِf َlāَq ۚ āَnَءāَjg nِiʾ ِhَّllā ِsْaʾَb nِm āَnُrُṣnَy nَmَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnyِrِhāَẓ َmْwَyْlā ُkْlُmْlā ُmُkَl ِmْwَq āَy

footnotes.text: i.e., the days on which Allāh sent His punishment upon those who rejected their prophets in former times.

i.e., the Day of Judgement, when the criminals will cry out in terror, the people will call to each other (see <reference chapter="7" verses="44-51">7:44-51</reference>), and the angels will call out the results of each person's judgement.

ayas.translation: ٌbāَtْrُّm ٌfِrْsُm َwُh ْnَm ُhَّllā ُّlِḍُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ āًlwُsَr ِhِdْʿعَb nِm ُhَّllā َhtَʿعْbَy nَl ْmُtْlُq َkَlَh āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۖ ِhِb mُkَءāَjg āَّmِّm ٍّkَhs yِf ْmُtْlِz āَmَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb ُlْbَq nِm ُfُswُy ْmُkَءāَjg ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., evidence.
Means of ascent, pathways.

ayas.translation: ٍbāَsِḥ ِrْyَغِb āَhyِf َnwُqَzْrُy َhَّnَjgْlā َnwُlُhkْdَy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ٌnِmْwʾُm َwُhَw ٰyَhtnُaʾ ْwَaʾ ٍrَkَhd nِّm āًḥِlāَṣ َlِmَʿع ْnَmَw ۖ āَhَlْhtِm āَّlِiʾ ٰyَzْjgُy āَlَf ًhَyʾِّyَs َlِmَʿع ْnَm
ِrāَّnlā yَlِiʾ yِnَnwُʿعْdَtَw ِhāَjgَّnlā yَlِiʾ ْmُkwُʿعْdَaʾ yِl āَm ِmْwَq āَyَw

footnotes.text: Refer to footnotes in <reference chapter="38" verses="66">38:66</reference>.

ayas.translation: ِrāَّnlā ُbāَḥْṣَaʾ ْmُh َnyِfِrْsُmْlā َّnَaʾَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āَnَّdَrَm َّnَaʾَw ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf āَlَw āَyْnُّdlā yِf ٌhَwْʿعَd ُhَl َsْyَl ِhْyَlِiʾ yِnَnwُʿعْdَt āَmَّnَaʾ َmَrَjg āَl

footnotes.text: From the time of their death until the Day of Resurrection, when they will be driven into it.

ayas.translation: ِrāَّnlā َnِّm āًbyِṣَn āَّnَʿع َnwُnْغُّm mُtnَaʾ ْlَhَf āًʿعَbَt ْmُkَl āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ āwُrَbْkَtْsā َnyِhdَّlِl ُءāَfَʿعُّḍlā ُlwُqَyَf ِrāَّnlā yِf َnwُّjgāَḥَtَy ْhdِiʾَw
ٍlāَlَḍ yِf āَّlِiʾ َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُءāَʿعُd āَmَw ۗ āwُʿعْdāَf āwُlāَq ۚ ٰyَlَb āwُlāَq ۖ ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُkُlُsُr ْmُkyِtْaʾَt ُkَt ْmَlَwَaʾ āwُlāَq

footnotes.text: What is intended is "fault" or "error" in judgement, since all prophets were protected by Allāh from falling into sin. The implication is that all believers should seek forgiveness for their sins.

ayas.translation: ُryِṣَbْlā ُʿعyِmَّslā َwُh ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllāِb ْhdِʿعَtْsāَf ۚ ِhyِغِlāَbِb mُh āَّm ٌrْbِk āَّlِiʾ ْmِhِrwُdُṣ yِf nِiʾ ۙ ْmُhāَtَaʾ ٍnāَṭْlُs ِrْyَغِb ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ yِf َnwُlِdāَjgُy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
َnwُrَّkَhdَtَt āَّm āًlyِlَq ۚ ُءyِsُmْlā āَlَw ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ُryِṣَbْlāَw ٰyَmْʿعَaʾْlā yِwَtْsَy āَmَw
َnwُrُkْhsَy āَl ِsāَّnlā َrَhtْkَaʾ َّnِkٰـَlَw ِsāَّnlā yَlَʿع ٍlْḍَf wُhdَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًrِṣْbُm َrāَhَّnlāَw ِhyِf āwُnُkْsَtِl َlْyَّllā ُmُkَl َlَʿعَjg yِhdَّlā ُhَّllā

footnotes.text: i.e., making things visible.
Whose life is without beginning or end, and upon whom all created life depends.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِqْʿعَt ْmُkَّlَʿعَlَw yًّmَsُّm āًlَjgَaʾ āwُغُlْbَtِlَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm ٰyَّfَwَtُy nَّm mُknِmَw ۚ āًhkwُyُhs āwُnwُkَtِl َّmُht ْmُkَّdُhsَaʾ āwُغُlْbَtِl َّmُht āًlْfِṭ ْmُkُjgِrْhkُy َّmُht ٍhَqَlَʿع ْnِm َّmُht ٍhَfْṭُّn nِm َّmُht ٍbāَrُt nِّm mُkَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َwُh

footnotes.text: The time decreed for your death.

ayas.translation: ُnwُkَyَf nُk ُhَl ُlwُqَy āَmَّnِiʾَf āًrْmَaʾ ٰyَḍَq āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ُtyِmُyَw yِyْḥُy yِhdَّlā َwُh
َnyِrِfāَkْlā ُhَّllā ُّlِḍُy َkِlَٰhdَk ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ُlْbَq nِm wُʿعْdَّn nُkَn ْmَّl lَb āَّnَʿع āwُّlَḍ āwُlāَq ۖ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm

َnwُlِṭْbُmْlā َkِlāَnُh َrِsَhkَw ِّqَḥْlāِb َyِḍُq ِhَّllā ُrْmَaʾ َءāَjg āَhdِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّllā ِnْhdِiʾِb āَّlِiʾ ٍhَyāʾِb َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ٍlwُsَrِl َnāَk āَmَw ۗ َkْyَlَʿع ْṣُṣْqَn ْmَّl nَّm mُhْnِmَw َkْyَlَʿع āَnْṣَṣَq nَّm mُhْnِm َkِlْbَq nِّm āًlُsُr āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْdَqَlَw
َnwُlَmْḥُt ِkْlُfْlā yَlَʿعَw āَhْyَlَʿعَw ْmُkِrwُdُṣ yِf ًhَjgāَḥ āَhْyَlَʿع āwُغُlْbَtِlَw ُʿعِfāَnَm āَhyِf ْmُkَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., that you may use the animals to carry your loads to distant places, according to need.

ayas.translation: َnwُbِsْkَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع ٰyَnْغَaʾ āَmَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āًrāَhtāʾَw ًhَّwُq َّdَhsَaʾَw ْmُhْnِm َrَhtْkَaʾ āwُnāَk ۚ ْmِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā ُhَbِqāَʿع َnāَk َfْyَk āwُrُẓnَyَf ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُryِsَy ْmَlَfَaʾ
َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِb َqāَḥَw ِmْlِʿعْlā َnِّm mُhَdnِʿع āَmِb āwُḥِrَf ِtāَnِّyَbْlāِb mُhُlُsُr ْmُhْtَءāَjg āَّmَlَf
َnyِkِrْhsُm ِhِb āَّnُk āَmِb āَnْrَfَkَw ُhَdْḥَw ِhَّllāِb āَّnَmāʾ āwُlāَq āَnَsْaʾَb āْwَaʾَr āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
i.e., revealed in the Arabic language.

ayas.translation: َnwُlِmāَʿع āَnَّnِiʾ ْlَmْʿعāَf ٌbāَjgِḥ َkِnْyَbَw āَnِnْyَb nِmَw ٌrْqَw āَnِnāَhdāʾ yِfَw ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnwُʿعْdَt āَّmِّm ٍhَّnِkَaʾ yِf āَnُbwُlُq āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: For your own religion or work against us.

ayas.translation: َnyِlِyʾāَّslِّl ًءāَwَs ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَʿعَbْrَaʾ yِf āَhَtāَwْqَaʾ āَhyِf َrَّdَqَw āَhyِf َkَrāَbَw āَhِqْwَf nِm َyِsāَwَr āَhyِf َlَʿعَjgَw

footnotes.text: Also "four equal days" or "four days of completion."

ayas.translation: َnyِʿعِyʾāَṭ āَnْyَtَaʾ āَtَlāَq āًhْrَk ْwَaʾ āًʿعْwَṭ āَyِtْyʾā ِḍْrَaʾْlِlَw āَhَl َlāَqَf ٌnāَhkُd َyِhَw ِءāَmَّslā yَlِiʾ ٰyَwَtْsā َّmُht

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.
Literally, "become" or "do [as commanded]."

ayas.translation: ِmyِlَʿعْlā ِzyِzَʿعْlā ُryِdْqَt َkِlَٰhd ۚ āًẓْfِḥَw َḥyِbāَṣَmِb āَyْnُّdlā َءāَmَّslā āَّnَّyَzَw ۚ āَhَrْmَaʾ ٍءāَmَs ِّlُk yِf ٰyَḥْwَaʾَw ِnْyَmْwَy yِf ٍtāَwāَmَs َʿعْbَs َّnُhāَḍَqَf

footnotes.text: From the devils who attempt to steal information from the angels.

ayas.translation: َnwُrِfāَk ِhِb mُtْlِsْrُaʾ āَmِb āَّnِiʾَf ًhَkِyʾāَlَm َlَznَaʾَl āَnُّbَr َءāَhs ْwَl āwُlāَq ۖ َhَّllā āَّlِiʾ āwُdُbْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ ْmِhِfْlَhk ْnِmَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ِnْyَb nِm ُlُsُّrlā ُmُhْtَءāَjg ْhdِiʾ

footnotes.text: To send messengers.

ayas.translation: َnwُdَḥْjgَy āَnِtāَyāʾِb āwُnāَkَw ۖ ًhَّwُq ْmُhْnِm ُّdَhsَaʾ َwُh ْmُhَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā َhَّllā َّnَaʾ āْwَrَy ْmَlَwَaʾ ۖ ًhَّwُq āَّnِm ُّdَhsَaʾ ْnَm āwُlāَqَw ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āwُrَbْkَtْsāَf ٌdāَʿع āَّmَaʾَf
َnwُrَṣnُy āَl ْmُhَw ۖ ٰyَzْhkَaʾ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā ُbāَhdَʿعَlَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ِyْzِhkْlā َbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَqyِhdُnِّl ٍtāَsِḥَّn ٍmāَّyَaʾ yِf āًrَṣْrَṣ āًḥyِr ْmِhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَsْrَaʾَf
َnwُlَmْʿعَy āwُnāَk āَmِb mُhُdwُlُjgَw ْmُhُrāَṣْbَaʾَw ْmُhُʿعْmَs ْmِhْyَlَʿع َdِhَhs āَhwُءāَjg āَm āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ
َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَّmِّm āًryِhtَk ُmَlْʿعَy āَl َhَّllā َّnَaʾ ْmُtnَnَẓ nِkٰـَlَw ْmُkُdwُlُjg āَlَw ْmُkُrāَṣْbَaʾ āَlَw ْmُkُʿعْmَs ْmُkْyَlَʿع َdَhْhsَy nَaʾ َnwُrِtَtْsَt ْmُtnُk āَmَw

footnotes.text: With righteousness or by fearing Allāh.

ayas.translation: َnyِbَtْʿعُmْlā َnِّm mُh āَmَf āwُbِtْʿعَtْsَy nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُhَّl yًwْhtَm ُrāَّnlāَf āwُrِbْṣَy nِiʾَf

َnyِrِsāَhk āwُnāَk ْmُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َnِّm mِhِlْbَq nِm ْtَlَhk ْdَq ٍmَmُaʾ yِf ُlْwَqْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع َّqَḥَw ْmُhَfْlَhk āَmَw ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ َnْyَb āَّm mُhَl āwُnَّyَzَf َءāَnَrُq ْmُhَl āَnْḍَّyَqَw

footnotes.text: In this world among the evil jinn and men.
Other meanings include "speak improperly" and/or "make a clamor." The purpose of this was to prevent the hearing or understanding of the Qur’ān.

ayas.translation: َnyِlَfْsَaʾْlā َnِm āَnwُkَyِl āَnِmāَdْqَaʾ َtْḥَt āَmُhْlَʿعْjgَn ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َnِm āَnāَّlَḍَaʾ ِnْyَhdَّllā āَnِrَaʾ āَnَّbَr āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw

footnotes.text: In the lowest depths of Hell. Or "that we may step on them" in revenge.

ayas.translation: َnwُdَʿعwُt ْmُtnُk yِtَّlā ِhَّnَjgْlāِb āwُrِhsْbَaʾَw āwُnَzْḥَt āَlَw āwُfāَhkَt āَّlَaʾ ُhَkِyʾāَlَmْlā ُmِhْyَlَʿع ُlَّzَnَtَt āwُmāَqَtْsā َّmُht ُhَّllā āَnُّbَr āwُlāَq َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
َnwُʿعَّdَt āَm āَhyِf ْmُkَlَw ْmُkُsُfnَaʾ yِhَtْhsَt āَm āَhyِf ْmُkَlَw ۖ ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِfَw āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ْmُkُwʾāَyِlْwَaʾ ُnْḥَn
َnyِmِlْsُmْlā َnِm yِnَّnِiʾ َlāَqَw āًḥِlāَṣ َlِmَʿعَw ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āَʿعَd nَّmِّm āًlْwَq ُnَsْḥَaʾ ْnَmَw
ٌmyِmَḥ ٌّyِlَw ُhَّnَaʾَk ٌhَwāَdَʿع ُhَnْyَbَw َkَnْyَb yِhdَّlā āَhdِiʾَf ُnَsْḥَaʾ َyِh yِtَّlāِb ْʿعَfْdā ۚ ُhَyʾِّyَّslā āَlَw ُhَnَsَḥْlā yِwَtْsَt āَlَw
ٍmyِẓَʿع ٍّẓَḥ wُhd āَّlِiʾ āَhāَّqَlُy āَmَw āwُrَbَṣ َnyِhdَّlā āَّlِiʾ āَhāَّqَlُy āَmَw
َnwُdُbْʿعَt ُhāَّyِiʾ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ َّnُhَqَlَhk yِhdَّlā ِhَّlِl āwُdُjgْsāَw ِrَmَqْlِl āَlَw ِsْmَّhslِl āwُdُjgْsَt āَl ۚ ُrَmَqْlāَw ُsْmَّhslāَw ُrāَhَّnlāَw ُlْyَّllā ِhِtāَyāʾ ْnِmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., Do not worship Allāh through His creations but worship Him directly and exclusively.

ayas.translation: ٌryِdَq ٍءْyَhs ِّlُk ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ٰyَtْwَmْlā yِyْḥُmَl āَhāَyْḥَaʾ yِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْtَbَrَw ْtَّzَtْhā َءāَmْlā āَhْyَlَʿع āَnْlَznَaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ًhَʿعِhsāَhk َḍْrَaʾْlā yَrَt َkَّnَaʾ ِhِtāَyāʾ ْnِmَw

ٌryِṣَb َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُtْyʾِhs āَm āwُlَmْʿعā ۚ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy āًnِmāʾ yِtْaʾَy nَّm mَaʾ ٌrْyَhk ِrāَّnlā yِf ٰyَqْlُy nَmَfَaʾ ۗ āَnْyَlَʿع َnْwَfْhkَy āَl āَnِtāَyāʾ yِf َnwُdِḥْlُy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: Through deviant recitations or interpretations.
i.e., reject it or prefer deviant interpretation.
The conclusion is understood to be "...will have earned an indescribable punishment."
Inimitable, resistant to attack, protected by Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍmyِlَaʾ ٍbāَqِʿع wُhdَw ٍhَrِfْغَm wُhdَl َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ َkِlْbَq nِm ِlُsُّrlِl َlyِq ْdَq āَm āَّlِiʾ َkَl ُlāَqُy āَّm

ٍdyِʿعَb ٍnāَkَّm nِm َnْwَdāَnُy َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ yًmَʿع ْmِhْyَlَʿع َwُhَw ٌrْqَw ْmِhِnāَhdāʾ yِf َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ٌءāَfِhsَw yًdُh āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl َwُh ْlُq ۗ ٌّyِbَrَʿعَw ٌّyِmَjgْʿعَaʾَaʾ ۖ ُhُtāَyāʾ ْtَlِّṣُf āَlْwَl āwُlāَqَّl āًّyِmَjgْʿعَaʾ āًnāʾْrُq ُhāَnْlَʿعَjg ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: For all practical purposes, since they neither hear nor understand.
An alternative meaning is "he was opposed over it."
See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="19">10:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍdyِhَhs nِm āَّnِm āَm َkāَّnَhdāʾ āwُlāَq yِyʾāَkَrُhs َnْyَaʾ ْmِhyِdāَnُy َmْwَyَw ۚ ِhِmْlِʿعِb āَّlِiʾ ُʿعَḍَt āَlَw ٰyَhtnُaʾ ْnِm ُlِmْḥَt āَmَw āَhِmāَmْkَaʾ ْnِّm ٍtāَrَmَht nِm ُjgُrْhkَt āَmَw ۚ ِhَʿعāَّslā ُmْlِʿع ُّdَrُy ِhْyَlِiʾ
ٍṣyِḥَّm nِّm mُhَl āَm āwُّnَẓَw ۖ ُlْbَq nِm َnwُʿعْdَy āwُnāَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع َّlَḍَw

ٍẓyِlَغ ٍbāَhdَʿع ْnِّm mُhَّnَqyِhdُnَlَw āwُlِmَʿع āَmِb āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnَyʾِّbَnُnَlَf ۚ ٰyَnْsُḥْlَl ُhَdnِʿع yِl َّnِiʾ yِّbَr ٰyَlِiʾ ُtْʿعِjgُّr nِyʾَlَw ًhَmِyʾāَq َhَʿعāَّslā ُّnُẓَaʾ āَmَw yِl āَhdٰـَh َّnَlwُqَyَl ُhْtَّsَm َءāَّrَḍ ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّnِّm ًhَmْḥَr ُhāَnْqَhdَaʾ ْnِyʾَlَw

footnotes.text: Because of my effort, knowledge, excellence, etc.
Or "that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) is the Truth."
See footnote of <reference chapter="4" verses="79">4:79</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="255">2:255</reference>.
i.e., from the grandeur of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) above them.

ayas.translation: ِryِʿعَّslā yِf ٌqyِrَfَw ِhَّnَjgْlā yِf ٌqyِrَf ۚ ِhyِf َbْyَr āَl ِʿعْmَjgْlā َmْwَy َrِhdnُtَw āَhَlْwَḥ ْnَmَw ٰyَrُqْlā َّmُaʾ َrِhdnُtِّl āًّyِbَrَʿع āًnāʾْrُq َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَkَw

footnotes.text: i.e., all other peoples.

ayas.translation: ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِّm mُhَl āَm َnwُmِlāَّẓlāَw ۚ ِhِtَmْḥَr yِf ُءāَhsَy nَm ُlِhkْdُy nِkٰـَlَw ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَّmُaʾ ْmُhَlَʿعَjgَl ُhَّllā َءāَhs ْwَlَw

footnotes.text: i.e., those who desire His guidance and His acceptance of them.
In remembrance and repentance.
There is no similarity whatsoever between the Creator and His creation in essence, in attributes or in deed.
See footnotes to <reference chapter="17" verses="1">17:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُbyِnُy nَm ِhْyَlِiʾ yِdْhَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhْyَlِiʾ yِbَtْjgَy ُhَّllā ۚ ِhْyَlِiʾ ْmُhwُʿعْdَt āَm َnyِkِrْhsُmْlā yَlَʿع َrُbَk ۚ ِhyِf āwُqَّrَfَtَt āَlَw َnyِّdlā āwُmyِqَaʾ ْnَaʾ ۖ ٰyَsyِʿعَw ٰyَswُmَw َmyِhāَrْbِiʾ ِhِb āَnْyَّṣَw āَmَw َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ yِhdَّlāَw āًḥwُn ِhِb ٰyَّṣَw āَm ِnyِّdlā َnِّm mُkَl َʿعَrَhs

ٍbyِrُm ُhْnِّm ٍّkَhs yِfَl ْmِhِdْʿعَb nِm َbāَtِkْlā āwُhtِrwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾَw ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb َyِḍُqَّl yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َkِّbَّr nِm ْtَqَbَs ٌhَmِlَk āَlْwَlَw ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb āًyْغَb ُmْlِʿعْlā ُmُhَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ āwُqَّrَfَt āَmَw

footnotes.text: Decree. See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="19">10:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُryِṣَmْlā ِhْyَlِiʾَw ۖ āَnَnْyَb ُʿعَmْjgَy ُhَّllā ۖ ُmُkَnْyَbَw āَnَnْyَb َhَّjgُḥ āَl ۖ ْmُkُlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْmُkَlَw āَnُlāَmْʿعَaʾ āَnَl ۖ ْmُkُّbَrَw āَnُّbَr ُhَّllā ۖ ُmُkَnْyَb َlِdْʿعَaʾِl ُtْrِmُaʾَw ۖ ٍbāَtِk nِm ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَmِb ُtnَmāʾ ْlُqَw ۖ ْmُhَءāَwْhَaʾ ْʿعِbَّtَt āَlَw ۖ َtْrِmُaʾ āَmَk ْmِqَtْsāَw ۖ ُʿعْdāَf َkِlَٰhdِlَf

footnotes.text: Another meaning understood from the Arabic is "So because of that [division and separation into sects], invite [them back to Allāh]..."
i.e., the consequences thereof.
Since the truth has been made clear and since those who refuse it do so only out of stubbornness or worldly interests.
i.e., after people have accepted the truth from Allāh, in an attempt to turn the believers away from His religion of Islām.

ayas.translation: ٍdyِʿعَb ٍlāَlَḍ yِfَl ِhَʿعāَّslā yِf َnwُrāَmُy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ُّqَḥْlā āَhَّnَaʾ َnwُmَlْʿعَyَw āَhْnِm َnwُqِfْhsُm āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ āَhِb َnwُnِmْwʾُy āَl َnyِhdَّlā āَhِb ُlِjgْʿعَtْsَy

footnotes.text: They had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) to bring it on immediately.
See footnote in <reference chapter="12" verses="100">12:100</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍbyِṣَّn nِm ِhَrِhkāʾْlā yِf ُhَl āَmَw āَhْnِm ِhِtْwʾُn āَyْnُّdlā َhtْrَḥ ُdyِrُy َnāَk nَmَw ۖ ِhِhtْrَḥ yِf ُhَl ْdِzَn ِhَrِhkāʾْlā َhtْrَḥ ُdyِrُy َnāَk nَm

footnotes.text: Decree. See footnote to <reference chapter="10" verses="19">10:19</reference>.

ayas.translation: ُryِbَkْlā ُlْḍَfْlā َwُh َkِlَٰhd ۚ ْmِhِّbَr َdnِʿع َnwُءāَhsَy āَّm mُhَl ۖ ِtāَّnَjgْlā ِtāَḍْwَr yِf ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw ۗ ْmِhِb ٌʿعِqāَw َwُhَw āwُbَsَk āَّmِm َnyِqِfْhsُm َnyِmِlāَّẓlā yَrَt

ٌrwُkَhs ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًnْsُḥ āَhyِf ُhَl ْdِzَّn ًhَnَsَḥ ْfِrَtْqَy nَmَw ۗ ٰyَbْrُqْlā yِf َhَّdَwَmْlā āَّlِiʾ āًrْjgَaʾ ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُkُlَaʾْsَaʾ āَّl lُq ۗ ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُhَdāَbِʿع ُhَّllā ُrِّhsَbُy yِhdَّlā َkِlَٰhd

footnotes.text: See footnote in <reference chapter="35" verses="30">35:30</reference>.
i.e., He could make you forget the Qur’ān and deprive you of it.

ayas.translation: ٍryِhtَk nَʿع wُfْʿعَyَw ْmُkyِdْyَaʾ ْtَbَsَk āَmِbَf ٍhَbyِṣُّm nِّm mُkَbāَṣَaʾ āَmَw
ٍryِṣَn āَlَw ٍّyِlَw nِm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ۖ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnyِzِjgْʿعُmِb mُtnَaʾ āَmَw

footnotes.text: i.e., escape from Him.
Meaning that Allāh could sink the ships by means of violent winds.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَّkَwَtَy ْmِhِّbَr ٰyَlَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl ٰyَqْbَaʾَw ٌrْyَhk ِhَّllā َdnِʿع āَmَw ۖ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā ُʿعāَtَmَf ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُtyِtwُaʾ āَmَf

footnotes.text: Restoring their rights and not allowing aggressors to take advantage of them out of weakness.
On the part of those seeking the reward of Allāh.

ayas.translation: ٍlyِbَs nِّm ٍّdَrَm ٰyَlِiʾ ْlَh َnwُlwُqَy َbāَhdَʿعْlā āُwَaʾَr āَّmَl َnyِmِlāَّẓlā yَrَtَw ۗ ِhِdْʿعَb nِّm ٍّyِlَw nِm ُhَl āَmَf ُhَّllā ِlِlْḍُy nَmَw

ٍmyِqُّm ٍbāَhdَʿع yِf َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َّnِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmِhyِlْhَaʾَw ْmُhَsُfnَaʾ āwُrِsَhk َnyِhdَّlā َnyِrِsāَhkْlā َّnِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw ۗ ٍّyِfَhk ٍfْrَṭ nِm َnwُrُẓnَy ِّlُّhdlā َnِm َnyِʿعِhsāَhk āَhْyَlَʿع َnwُḍَrْʿعُy ْmُhāَrَtَw
ٍlyِbَs nِm ُhَl āَmَf ُhَّllā ِlِlْḍُy nَmَw ۗ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِّm mُhَnwُrُṣnَy َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ْnِّm mُhَl َnāَk āَmَw
ٍryِkَّn nِّm mُkَl āَmَw ٍhdِyʾَmْwَy ٍiʾَjgْlَّm nِّm mُkَl āَm ۚ ِhَّllā َnِm ُhَl َّdَrَm āَّl ٌmْwَy َyِtْaʾَy nَaʾ ِlْbَq nِّm mُkِّbَrِl āwُbyِjgَtْsā

footnotes.text: Of your sins or "disapproval" of your punishment.

ayas.translation: ٌrwُfَk َnāَsnِiʾْlā َّnِiʾَf ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ ْtَmَّdَq āَmِb ٌhَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْbِṣُt nِiʾَw ۖ āَhِb َḥِrَf ًhَmْḥَr āَّnِm َnāَsnِiʾْlā āَnْqَhdَaʾ āَhdِiʾ āَّnِiʾَw ۗ ُغāَlَbْlā āَّlِiʾ َkْyَlَʿع ْnِiʾ ۖ āًẓyِfَḥ ْmِhْyَlَʿع َkāَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَmَf āwُḍَrْʿعَaʾ ْnِiʾَf
ٌmyِkَḥ ٌّyِlَʿع ُhَّnِiʾ ۚ ُءāَhsَy āَm ِhِnْhdِiʾِb َyِḥwُyَf āًlwُsَr َlِsْrُy ْwَaʾ ٍbāَjgِḥ ِءāَrَw nِm ْwَaʾ āًyْḥَw āَّlِiʾ ُhَّllā ُhَmِّlَkُy nَaʾ ٍrَhsَbِl َnāَk āَmَw

ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍṭāَrِṣ ٰyَlِiʾ yِdْhَtَl َkَّnِiʾَw ۚ āَnِdāَbِʿع ْnِm ُءāَhsَّn nَm ِhِb yِdْhَّn āًrwُn ُhāَnْlَʿعَjg nِkٰـَlَw ُnāَmyِiʾْlā āَlَw ُbāَtِkْlā āَm yِrْdَt َtnُk āَm ۚ āَnِrْmَaʾ ْnِّm āًḥwُr َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْyَḥْwَaʾ َkِlَٰhdَkَw
ُrwُmُaʾْlā ُryِṣَt ِhَّllā yَlِiʾ āَlَaʾ ۗ ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ُhَl yِhdَّlā ِhَّllā ِṭāَrِṣ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
i.e., the Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).
Also, "precise" or "specific."
The disbelievers of the Quraysh, who denied Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnyِnِrْqُm ُhَl āَّnُk āَmَw āَhdٰـَh āَnَl َrَّhkَs yِhdَّlā َnāَḥْbُs āwُlwُqَtَw ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُtْyَwَtْsā āَhdِiʾ ْmُkِّbَr َhَmْʿعِn āwُrُkْhdَt َّmُht ِhِrwُhُẓ ٰyَlَʿع āwُwَtْsَtِl

footnotes.text: Literally, "made it a companion" or "made it compatible."
By claiming that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has a son or daughters, as it is said that a child is part of his parent. This concept is totally incompatible with Allāh's unity and exclusiveness.
Not "obvious" or "distinct" in an argument. Or not "seen," i.e., absent from battles. The reference is to a daughter.

ayas.translation: َnwُṣُrْhkَy āَّlِiʾ ْmُh ْnِiʾ ۖ ٍmْlِʿع ْnِm َkِlَٰhdِb mُhَl āَّm ۗ mُhāَnْdَbَʿع āَm ُnٰـَmْḥَّrlā َءāَhs ْwَl āwُlāَqَw
َnwُdَtْhُّm mِhِrāَhtāʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَّnِiʾَw ٍhَّmُaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَnَءāَbāʾ āَnْdَjgَw āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ْlَb
َnwُdَtْqُّm mِhِrāَhtāʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَّnِiʾَw ٍhَّmُaʾ ٰyَlَʿع āَnَءāَbāʾ āَnْdَjgَw āَّnِiʾ āَhwُfَrْtُm َlāَq āَّlِiʾ ٍryِhdَّn nِّm ٍhَyْrَq yِf َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ āَm َkِlَٰhdَkَw
َnwُrِfāَk ِhِb mُtْlِsْrُaʾ āَmِb āَّnِiʾ āwُlāَq ۖ ْmُkَءāَbāʾ ِhْyَlَʿع ْmُّtdَjgَw āَّmِm ٰyَdْhَaʾِb mُkُtْyʾِjg ْwَlَwَaʾ َlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., his testimony that none is worthy of worship except Allāh.
The descendants of Abraham.
i.e., one who is obvious with a clear message, meaning Muḥammad (ﷺ).
Referring to Makkah and aṭ-Ṭā’if.

ayas.translation: َnwُʿعَmْjgَy āَّmِّm ٌrْyَhk َkِّbَr ُtَmْḥَrَw ۗ āًّyِrْhkُs āًḍْʿعَb mُhُḍْʿعَb َhdِhkَّtَyِّl ٍtāَjgَrَd ٍḍْʿعَb َqْwَf ْmُhَḍْʿعَb āَnْʿعَfَrَw ۚ āَyْnُّdlā ِhāَyَḥْlā yِf ْmُhَtَhsyِʿعَّm mُhَnْyَb āَnْmَsَq ُnْḥَn ۚ َkِّbَr َtَmْḥَr َnwُmِsْqَy ْmُhَaʾ
َnwُrَhْẓَy āَhْyَlَʿع َjgِrāَʿعَmَw ٍhَّḍِf nِّm āًfُqُs ْmِhِtwُyُbِl ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlāِb ُrُfْkَy nَmِl āَnْlَʿعَjgَّl ًhَdِḥāَw ًhَّmُaʾ ُsāَّnlā َnwُkَy nَaʾ āَlْwَlَw

footnotes.text: Who assumed that Allāh's generosity to them was a sign of His approval or who would hasten to disbelief in order to obtain wealth.
i.e., an honor. Or "a reminder."

ayas.translation: َnwُdَbْʿعُy ًhَhِlāʾ ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِnwُd nِm āَnْlَʿعَjgَaʾ āَnِlُsُّr nِm َkِlْbَq nِm āَnْlَsْrَaʾ ْnَm ْlَaʾْsāَw
َnwُkَḥْḍَy āَhْnِّm mُh āَhdِiʾ āَnِtāَyāʾِb mُhَءāَjg āَّmَlَf
َnwُrِṣْbُt āَlَfَaʾ ۖ yِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā ِhِhdٰـَhَw َrْṣِm ُkْlُm yِl َsْyَlَaʾ ِmْwَq āَy َlāَq ِhِmْwَq yِf ُnْwَʿعْrِf ٰyَdāَnَw

footnotes.text: That was true previous to his appointment as a prophet, at which time Allāh corrected his speech impediment.
Of a creation of Allāh which is being worshipped along with Him.
Implying that they must all be the same.
Or "succeeding [you]."
i.e., follow the guidance and instruction of Allāh.
i.e., those like you. Another meaning may be "your spouses," i.e., the righteous among them.
Meaning everything delicious.
Addressing the keeper of Hell.
Conspiracy against the Prophet (ﷺ). The reference here is to the disbelievers of Makkah.
Only supposing it were so, which it is not.
i.e., worship.
That intercession is granted exclusively by permission of Allāh to those He wills.
Those who associate others with Allāh.
i.e., the complaint of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) about his people.
Meaning safety or security, i.e., "I will not harm you." This was before permission was granted for armed struggle.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
The Night of Decree (Qadr). See Sūrah al-Qadr.
Or "is separated" or "apportioned," from what is inscribed in the Preserved Slate. The angels record and descend with whatever Allāh has decreed for the coming year.
i.e., the Children of Israel.

ayas.translation: ٍnyِbُّm ٍnāَṭْlُsِb mُkyِtāʾ yِّnِiʾ ۖ ِhَّllā yَlَʿع āwُlْʿعَt āَّl nَaʾَw

footnotes.text: To death. Or "lest you assault me [with your tongues or harm me otherwise]."
After it has parted, in order that the soldiers of Pharaoh would follow the Children of Israel and be drowned.
The tribe of Saba’.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَṣnُy ْmُh āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs yًlْwَّm nَʿع yًlْwَm yِnْغُy āَl َmْwَy

footnotes.text: i.e., patron, protector or close associate.
As he had claimed upon the earth. He is taunted with these words in Hell as a reminder and additional torment.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِẓَʿع ٌbāَhdَʿع ْmُhَlَw ۖ َءāَyِlْwَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā āَm āَlَw āًyʾْyَhs āwُbَsَk āَّm mُhْnَʿع yِnْغُy āَlَw ۖ ُmَّnَhَjg ْmِhِyʾāَrَw nِّm

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="14" verses="16">14:16</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُrَّkَfَtَy ٍmْwَqِّl ٍtāَyāʾَl َkِlَٰhd yِf َّnِiʾ ۚ ُhْnِّm āًʿعyِmَjg ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَّm mُkَl َrَّhkَsَw
َnwُbِsْkَy āwُnāَk āَmِb āًmْwَq َyِzْjgَyِl ِhَّllā َmāَّyَaʾ َnwُjgْrَy āَl َnyِhdَّlِl āwُrِfْغَy āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِّl lُq

footnotes.text: In the Hereafter, where those who forgive will be rewarded and those who earned evil will be punished. This was at the outset of daʿwah (invitation to Allāh) before permission for jihād.
Understanding of the law.

ayas.translation: َnwُfِlَtْhkَy ِhyِf āwُnāَk āَmyِf ِhَmāَyِqْlā َmْwَy ْmُhَnْyَb yِḍْqَy َkَّbَr َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُhَnْyَb āًyْغَb ُmْlِʿعْlā ُmُhَءāَjg āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ āwُfَlَtْhkā āَmَf ۖ ِrْmَaʾْlā َnِّm ٍtāَnِّyَb mُhāَnْyَtāʾَw

footnotes.text: Another meaning is "...[the evildoers being] equal in their life and their death," i.e., unresponsive to guidance.
This can refer to Allāh's knowledge of that person and of his preference for his own inclinations or to that person's knowledge of the truth while he refuses it.

ayas.translation: َnwُّnُẓَy āَّlِiʾ ْmُh ْnِiʾ ۖ ٍmْlِʿع ْnِm َkِlَٰhdِb mُhَl āَmَw ۚ ُrْhَّdlā āَّlِiʾ āَnُkِlْhُy āَmَw āَyْḥَnَw ُtwُmَn āَyْnُّdlā āَnُtāَyَḥ āَّlِiʾ َyِh āَm āwُlāَqَw

footnotes.text: i.e., some people die and others live, replacing them.

ayas.translation: َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ āَnِyʾāَbāʾِb āwُtْyʾā āwُlāَq nَaʾ āَّlِiʾ ْmُhَtَّjgُḥ َnāَk āَّm ٍtāَnِّyَb āَnُtāَyāʾ ْmِhْyَlَʿع ٰyَlْtُt āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَm ُhkِsnَtْsَn āَّnُk āَّnِiʾ ۚ ِّqَḥْlāِb mُkْyَlَʿع ُqِṭnَy āَnُbāَtِk āَhdٰـَh

footnotes.text: By recording angels.

ayas.translation: َnyِnِqْyَtْsُmِb ُnْḥَn āَmَw āًّnَẓ āَّlِiʾ ُّnُẓَّn nِiʾ ُhَʿعāَّslā āَm yِrْdَn āَّm mُtْlُq āَhyِf َbْyَr āَl ُhَʿعāَّslāَw ٌّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw َّnِiʾ َlyِq āَhdِiʾَw
َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِb َqāَḥَw āwُlِmَʿع āَm ُtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhَl āَdَbَw
َnwُbَtْʿعَtْsُy ْmُh āَlَw āَhْnِm َnwُjgَrْhkُy āَl َmْwَyْlāَf ۚ āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā ُmُkْtَّrَغَw āًwُzُh ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾ ْmُtْhdَhkَّtā ُmُkَّnَaʾِb mُkِlَٰhd

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: َnwُḍِrْʿعُm āwُrِhdnُaʾ āَّmَʿع āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ yًّmَsُّm ٍlَjgَaʾَw ِّqَḥْlāِb āَّlِiʾ āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā āَnْqَlَhk āَm

َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ٍmْlِʿع ْnِّm ٍhَrāَhtَaʾ ْwَaʾ āَhdٰـَh ِlْbَq nِّm ٍbāَtِkِb yِnwُtْyʾā ۖ ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٌkْrِhs ْmُhَl ْmَaʾ ِḍْrَaʾْlā َnِm āwُqَlَhk āَhdāَm yِnwُrَaʾ ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm َnwُʿعْdَt āَّm mُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ْlُq
َnwُlِfāَغ ْmِhِyʾāَʿعُd nَʿع ْmُhَw ِhَmāَyِqْlā ِmْwَy ٰyَlِiʾ ُhَl ُbyِjgَtْsَy āَّl nَm ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm wُʿعْdَy nَّmِm ُّlَḍَaʾ ْnَmَw

ُmyِḥَّrlā ُrwُfَغْlā َwُhَw ۖ ْmُkَnْyَbَw yِnْyَb āًdyِhَhs ِhِb ٰyَfَk ۖ ِhyِf َnwُḍyِfُt āَmِb ُmَlْʿعَaʾ َwُh ۖ āًyʾْyَhs ِhَّllā َnِm yِl َnwُkِlْmَt āَlَf ُhُtْyَrَtْfā ِnِiʾ ْlُq ۖ ُhāَrَtْfā َnwُlwُqَy ْmَaʾ

footnotes.text: Of false implications and suggestions.

ayas.translation: ٌnyِbُّm ٌryِhdَn āَّlِiʾ āَnَaʾ āَmَw َّyَlِiʾ ٰyَḥwُy āَm āَّlِiʾ ُʿعِbَّtَaʾ ْnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkِb āَlَw yِb ُlَʿعْfُy āَm yِrْdَaʾ āَmَw ِlُsُّrlā َnِّm āًʿعْdِb ُtnُk āَm ْlُq

footnotes.text: i.e., I am neither the first messenger to be sent, nor do I bring something different from the other messengers.

ayas.translation: َnyِmِlāَّẓlā َmْwَqْlā yِdْhَy āَl َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُtْrَbْkَtْsāَw َnَmāʾَf ِhِlْhtِm ٰyَlَʿع َlyِyʾāَrْsِiʾ yِnَb nِّm ٌdِhāَhs َdِhَhsَw ِhِb mُtْrَfَkَw ِhَّllā ِdnِʿع ْnِm َnāَk nِiʾ ْmُtْyَaʾَrَaʾ ْlُq

footnotes.text: Based upon information from the Torah.
The conclusion is estimated to be "...would you not then be the most unjust of people?" or "...in what condition would you then be?"

ayas.translation: ٌmyِdَq ٌkْfِiʾ āَhdٰـَh َnwُlwُqَyَsَf ِhِb āwُdَtْhَy ْmَl ْhdِiʾَw ۚ ِhْyَlِiʾ āَnwُqَbَs āَّm āًrْyَhk َnāَk ْwَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlِl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlāَqَw
َnyِnِsْḥُmْlِl ٰyَrْhsُbَw āwُmَlَẓ َnyِhdَّlā َrِhdnُyِّl āًّyِbَrَʿع āًnāَsِّl ٌqِّdَṣُّm ٌbāَtِk āَhdٰـَhَw ۚ ًhَmْḥَrَw āًmāَmِiʾ ٰyَswُm ُbāَtِk ِhِlْbَq nِmَw

َnyِmِlْsُmْlā َnِm yِّnِiʾَw َkْyَlِiʾ ُtْbُt yِّnِiʾ ۖ yِtَّyِّrُhd yِf yِl ْḥِlْṣَaʾَw ُhāَḍْrَt āًḥِlāَṣ َlَmْʿعَaʾ ْnَaʾَw َّyَdِlāَw ٰyَlَʿعَw َّyَlَʿع َtْmَʿعْnَaʾ yِtَّlā َkَtَmْʿعِn َrُkْhsَaʾ ْnَaʾ yِnْʿعِzْwَaʾ ِّbَr َlāَq ًhَnَs َnyِʿعَbْrَaʾ َغَlَbَw ُhَّdُhsَaʾ َغَlَb āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ۚ āًrْhَhs َnwُhtāَlَht ُhُlāَṣِfَw ُhُlْmَḥَw ۖ āًhْrُk ُhْtَʿعَḍَwَw āًhْrُk ُhُّmُaʾ ُhْtَlَmَḥ ۖ āًnāَsْḥِiʾ ِhْyَdِlāَwِb َnāَsnِiʾْlā āَnْyَّṣَwَw

footnotes.text: Literally, "gather within me the utmost strength and ability."

ayas.translation: َnwُdَʿعwُy āwُnāَk yِhdَّlā ِqْdِّṣlā َdْʿعَw ۖ ِhَّnَjgْlā ِbāَḥْṣَaʾ yِf ْmِhِtāَyʾِّyَs nَʿع ُzَwāَjgَtَnَw āwُlِmَʿع āَm َnَsْḥَaʾ ْmُhْnَʿع ُlَّbَqَtَn َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ

َnyِlَّwَaʾْlā ُryِṭāَsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ āَhdٰـَh āَm ُlwُqَyَf ٌّqَḥ ِhَّllā َdْʿعَw َّnِiʾ ْnِmāʾ َkَlْyَw َhَّllā ِnāَhtyِغَtْsَy āَmُhَw yِlْbَq nِm ُnwُrُqْlā ِtَlَhk ْdَqَw َjgَrْhkُaʾ ْnَaʾ yِnِnāَdِʿعَtَaʾ āَmُkَّl ٍّfُaʾ ِhْyَdِlāَwِl َlāَq yِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: An expression of distaste and irritation.

ayas.translation: َnwُqُsْfَt ْmُtnُk āَmِbَw ِّqَḥْlā ِrْyَغِb ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf َnwُrِbْkَtْsَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb ِnwُhْlā َbāَhdَʿع َnْwَzْjgُt َmْwَyْlāَf āَhِb mُtْʿعَtْmَtْsāَw āَyْnُّdlā ُmُkِtāَyَḥ yِf ْmُkِtāَbِّyَṭ ْmُtْbَhْhdَaʾ ِrāَّnlā yَlَʿع āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُḍَrْʿعُy َmْwَyَw

ٍmyِẓَʿع ٍmْwَy َbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُfāَhkَaʾ yِّnِiʾ َhَّllā āَّlِiʾ āwُdُbْʿعَt āَّlَaʾ ِhِfْlَhk ْnِmَw ِhْyَdَy ِnْyَb nِm ُrُhdُّnlā ِtَlَhk ْdَqَw ِfāَqْḥَaʾْlāِb ُhَmْwَq َrَhdnَaʾ ْhdِiʾ ٍdāَʿع āَhkَaʾ ْrُkْhdāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the prophet Hūd.
Upon the earth. It could also refer to "a tremendous Day," i.e., that of resurrection.

ayas.translation: َnyِqِdāَّṣlā َnِm َtnُk nِiʾ āَnُdِʿعَt āَmِb āَnِtْaʾَf āَnِtَhِlāʾ ْnَʿع āَnَkِfْaʾَtِl āَnَtْyʾِjgَaʾ āwُlāَq
ٌmyِlَaʾ ٌbāَhdَʿع āَhyِf ٌḥyِr ۖ ِhِb mُtْlَjgْʿعَtْsā āَm َwُh ْlَb ۚ āَnُrِṭْmُّm ٌḍِrāَʿع āَhdٰـَh āwُlāَq ْmِhِtَyِdْwَaʾ َlِbْqَtْsُّm āًḍِrāَʿع ُhْwَaʾَr āَّmَlَf

footnotes.text: When you challenged your prophet. See <reference chapter="46" verses="22">verse 22</reference> of this sūrah.

ayas.translation: َnwُyʾِzْhَtْsَy ِhِb āwُnāَk āَّm mِhِb َqāَḥَw ِhَّllā ِtāَyāʾِb َnwُdَḥْjgَy āwُnāَk ْhdِiʾ ٍءْyَhs nِّm mُhُtَdِyʾْfَaʾ āَlَw ْmُhُrāَṣْbَaʾ āَlَw ْmُhُʿعْmَs ْmُhْnَʿع ٰyَnْغَaʾ āَmَf ًhَdِyʾْfَaʾَw āًrāَṣْbَaʾَw āًʿعْmَs ْmُhَl āَnْlَʿعَjgَw ِhyِf ْmُkāَّnَّkَّm nِiʾ āَmyِf ْmُhāَّnَّkَm ْdَqَlَw
َnwُrَtْfَy āwُnāَk āَmَw ْmُhُkْfِiʾ َkِlَٰhdَw ۚ ْmُhْnَʿع āwُّlَḍ ْlَb ۖ ًhَhِlāʾ āًnāَbْrُq ِhَّllā ِnwُd nِm āwُhdَhkَّtā َnyِhdَّlā ُmُhَrَṣَn āَlْwَlَf

footnotes.text: According to their claim.

ayas.translation: َnyِrِhdnُّm mِhِmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ āْwَّlَw َyِḍُq āَّmَlَf ۖ āwُtِṣnَaʾ āwُlāَq ُhwُrَḍَḥ āَّmَlَf َnāʾْrُqْlā َnwُʿعِmَtْsَy ِّnِjgْlā َnِّm āًrَfَn َkْyَlِiʾ āَnْfَrَṣ ْhdِiʾَw
ٍmyِqَtْsُّm ٍqyِrَṭ ٰyَlِiʾَw ِّqَḥْlā yَlِiʾ yِdْhَy ِhْyَdَy َnْyَb āَmِّl āًqِّdَṣُm ٰyَswُm ِdْʿعَb nِm َlِznُaʾ āًbāَtِk āَnْʿعِmَs āَّnِiʾ āَnَmْwَq āَy āwُlāَq
ٍmyِlَaʾ ٍbāَhdَʿع ْnِّm mُkْrِjgُyَw ْmُkِbwُnُhd nِّm mُkَl ْrِfْغَy ِhِb āwُnِmāʾَw ِhَّllā َyِʿعāَd āwُbyِjgَaʾ āَnَmْwَq āَy

footnotes.text: Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُrُfْkَt ْmُtnُk āَmِb َbāَhdَʿعْlā āwُqwُhdَf َlāَq ۚ āَnِّbَrَw ٰyَlَb āwُlāَq ۖ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَhdٰـَh َsْyَlَaʾ ِrāَّnlā yَlَʿع āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُḍَrْʿعُy َmْwَyَw

footnotes.text: Or "because you used to disbelieve."

ayas.translation: َnwُqِsāَfْlā ُmْwَqْlā āَّlِiʾ ُkَlْhُy ْlَhَf ۚ ٌغāَlَb ۚ ٍrāَhَّn nِّm ًhَʿعāَs āَّlِiʾ āwُhtَbْlَy ْmَl َnwُdَʿعwُy āَm َnْwَrَy َmْwَy ْmُhَّnَaʾَk ۚ ْmُhَّl lِjgْʿعَtْsَt āَlَw ِlُsُّrlā َnِm ِmْzَʿعْlā wُlwُaʾ َrَbَṣ āَmَk ْrِbْṣāَf

footnotes.text: i.e., for Allāh's punishment of the disbelievers.
i.e., cause them to be lost or make them worthless, earning no reward.
So that they may know the results of their choice.

ayas.translation: ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ َّlِḍُy nَlَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُlِtُq َnyِhdَّlāَw ۗ ٍḍْʿعَbِb mُkَḍْʿعَb َwُlْbَyِّl nِkٰـَlَw ْmُhْnِm َrَṣَtnāَl ُhَّllā ُءāَhsَy ْwَlَw َkِlَٰhd ۚ āَhَrāَzْwَaʾ ُbْrَḥْlā َʿعَḍَt ٰyَّtَḥ ًءāَdِf āَّmِiʾَw ُdْʿعَb āًّnَm āَّmِiʾَf َqāَhtَwْlā āwُّdُhsَf ْmُhwُmُtnَhkْhtَaʾ āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ ِbāَqِّrlā َbْrَḍَf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmُtyِqَl āَhdِiʾَf

footnotes.text: i.e., take those remaining as captives.
i.e., release them without ransom.
i.e., its armor, machinery, etc., meaning "until the war is over."
i.e., destroyed them and all they owned.

ayas.translation: ْmُhَّl yًwْhtَm ُrāَّnlāَw ُmāَʿعْnَaʾْlā ُlُkْaʾَt āَmَk َnwُlُkْaʾَyَw َnwُʿعَّtَmَtَy āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlāَw ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُlِhkْdُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ

ْmُhَءāَʿعْmَaʾ َʿعَّṭَqَf āًmyِmَḥ ًءāَm āwُqُsَw ِrāَّnlā yِf ٌdِlāَhk َwُh ْnَmَk ۖ ْmِhِّbَّr nِّm ٌhَrِfْغَmَw ِtāَrَmَّhtlā ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf ْmُhَlَw ۖ yًّfَṣُّm ٍlَsَʿع ْnِّm ٌrāَhْnَaʾَw َnyِbِrāَّhslِّl ٍhَّhdَّl ٍrْmَhk ْnِّm ٌrāَhْnَaʾَw ُhُmْʿعَṭ ْrَّyَغَtَy ْmَّl ٍnَbَّl nِّm ٌrāَhْnَaʾَw ٍnِsāʾ ِrْyَغ ٍءāَّm nِّm ٌrāَhْnَaʾ āَhyِf ۖ َnwُqَّtُmْlā َdِʿعُw yِtَّlā ِhَّnَjgْlā ُlَhtَّm

footnotes.text: In taste or smell, neither stagnant nor polluted.

ayas.translation: ْmُhَءāَwْhَaʾ āwُʿعَbَّtāَw ْmِhِbwُlُq ٰyَlَʿع ُhَّllā َʿعَbَṭ َnyِhdَّlā َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾ ۚ āًfِnāʾ َlāَq āَhdāَm َmْlِʿعْlā āwُtwُaʾ َnyِhdَّlِl āwُlāَq َkِdnِʿع ْnِm āwُjgَrَhk āَhdِiʾ ٰyَّtَḥ َkْyَlِiʾ ُʿعِmَtْsَy nَّm mُhْnِmَw

footnotes.text: From among the Prophet's companions.
Taqwā, meaning piety, consciousness and fear of Allāh, and care to avoid His displeasure.
See footnote to <reference chapter="40" verses="55">40:55</reference>.

ayas.translation: ْmُhَl ٰyَlْwَaʾَf ۖ ِtْwَmْlā َnِm ِhْyَlَʿع ِّyِhsْغَmْlā َrَẓَn َkْyَlِiʾ َnwُrُẓnَy ٌḍَrَّm mِhِbwُlُq yِf َnyِhdَّlā َtْyَaʾَr ۙ ُlāَtِqْlā āَhyِf َrِkُhdَw ٌhَmَkْḥُّm ٌhَrwُs ْtَlِznُaʾ āَhdِiʾَf ۖ ٌhَrwُs ْtَlِّzُn āَlْwَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُlwُqَyَw

footnotes.text: i.e., one in which permission is given the believers to fight their enemies.
The words "awlā lahum" can also be interpreted as "woe to them!" In that case, the following verse would begin, "[Better for them would have been] obedience and good words."
From Islām or from jihād (struggling in the cause of Allāh).
i.e., the Jews of Madīnah.

ayas.translation: ْmُhَlāَmْʿعَaʾ ُṭِbْḥُyَsَw āًyʾْyَhs َhَّllā āwُّrُḍَy nَl ٰyَdُhْlā ُmُhَl َnَّyَbَt āَm ِdْʿعَb nِm َlwُsَّrlā āwُّqāَhsَw ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs nَʿع āwُّdَṣَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ
ْmُkَlāَmْʿعَaʾ āwُlِṭْbُt āَlَw َlwُsَّrlā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭَaʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
ْmُkَlāَwْmَaʾ ْmُkْlَaʾْsَy āَlَw ْmُkَrwُjgُaʾ ْmُkِtْwʾُy āwُqَّtَtَw āwُnِmْwʾُt nِiʾَw ۚ ٌwْhَlَw ٌbِʿعَl āَyْnُّdlā ُhāَyَḥْlā āَmَّnِiʾ

mُkَlāَhtْmَaʾ āwُnwُkَy āَl َّmُht ْmُkَrْyَغ āًmْwَq ْlِdْbَtْsَy āْwَّlَwَtَt nِiʾَw ۚ ُءāَrَqُfْlā ُmُtnَaʾَw ُّyِnَغْlā ُhَّllāَw ۚ ِhِsْfَّn nَʿع ُlَhkْbَy āَmَّnِiʾَf ْlَhkْbَy nَmَw ۖ ُlَhkْbَy nَّm mُknِmَf ِhَّllā ِlyِbَs yِf āwُqِfnُtِl َnْwَʿعْdُt ِءāَlُwʾٰـَh ْmُtnَaʾ āَh

footnotes.text: Ibn Masʿūd said, "You [people] consider the conquest to be that of Makkah, but we consider it to be the Treaty of al-Ḥudaybiyyah." Al-Bukhārī reported a similar quotation from al-Barā’ bin ʿĀzib. Although initially regarded by the companions as a setback, the treaty, in effect, served to promote the spread of Islām, which led to the conquest of Makkah two years later.

ayas.translation: āًmyِkَḥ āًmyِlَʿع ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ُdwُnُjg ِhَّlِlَw ۗ ْmِhِnāَmyِiʾ َʿعَّm āًnāَmyِiʾ āwُdāَdْzَyِl َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā ِbwُlُq yِf َhَnyِkَّslā َlَznَaʾ yِhdَّlā َwُh

āًmyِẓَʿع āًzْwَf ِhَّllā َdnِʿع َkِlَٰhd َnāَkَw ۚ ْmِhِtāَyʾِّyَs ْmُhْnَʿع َrِّfَkُyَw āَhyِf َnyِdِlāَhk ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ِtāَnِmْwʾُmْlāَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َlِhkْdُyِّl

āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾ ِhyِtْwʾُyَsَf َhَّllā ُhْyَlَʿع َdَhāَʿع āَmِb ٰyَfْwَaʾ ْnَmَw ۖ ِhِsْfَn ٰyَlَʿع ُhtُknَy āَmَّnِiʾَf َhtَkَّn nَmَf ۚ ْmِhyِdْyَaʾ َqْwَf ِhَّllā ُdَy َhَّllā َnwُʿعِyāَbُy āَmَّnِiʾ َkَnwُʿعِyāَbُy َnyِhdَّlā َّnِiʾ

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.
Meaning that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) accepted their pledge.

ayas.translation: āًryِbَhk َnwُlَmْʿعَt āَmِb ُhَّllā َnāَk ْlَb ۚ āًʿعْfَn ْmُkِb َdāَrَaʾ ْwَaʾ āًّrَḍ ْmُkِb َdāَrَaʾ ْnِiʾ āًyʾْyَhs ِhَّllā َnِّm mُkَl ُkِlْmَy nَmَf ْlُq ۚ ْmِhِbwُlُq yِf َsْyَl āَّm mِhِtَnِsْlَaʾِb َnwُlwُqَy ۚ āَnَl ْrِfْغَtْsāَf āَnwُlْhَaʾَw āَnُlāَwْmَaʾ āَnْtَlَغَhs ِbāَrْʿعَaʾْlā َnِm َnwُfَّlَhkُmْlā َkَl ُlwُqَyَs

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="9" verses="81">9:81</reference>.

ayas.translation: āًrwُb āًmْwَq ْmُtnُkَw ِءْwَّslā َّnَẓ ْmُtnَnَẓَw ْmُkِbwُlُq yِf َkِlَٰhd َnِّyُzَw āًdَbَaʾ ْmِhyِlْhَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َnwُnِmْwʾُmْlāَw ُlwُsَّrlā َbِlَqnَy nَّl nَaʾ ْmُtnَnَẓ ْlَb

āًlyِlَq āَّlِiʾ َnwُhَqْfَy āَl āwُnāَk ْlَb ۚ āَnَnwُdُsْḥَt ْlَb َnwُlwُqَyَsَf ۖ ُlْbَq nِm ُhَّllā َlāَq ْmُkِlَٰhdَk āَnwُʿعِbَّtَt nَّl lُq ۚ ِhَّllā َmāَlَk āwُlِّdَbُy nَaʾ َnwُdyِrُy ۖ ْmُkْʿعِbَّtَn āَnwُrَhd āَhwُhdُhkْaʾَtِl َmِnāَغَm ٰyَlِiʾ ْmُtْqَlَṭnā āَhdِiʾ َnwُfَّlَhkُmْlā ُlwُqَyَs

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="9" verses="81">9:81</reference>.
i.e., they only understood the material aspects of life.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُkْbِّhdَʿعُy ُlْbَq nِّm mُtْyَّlَwَt āَmَk āْwَّlَwَtَt nِiʾَw ۖ āًnَsَḥ āًrْjgَaʾ ُhَّllā ُmُkِtْwʾُy āwُʿعyِṭُt nِiʾَf ۖ َnwُmِlْsُy ْwَaʾ ْmُhَnwُlِtāَqُt ٍdyِdَhs ٍsْaʾَb yِlwُaʾ ٍmْwَq ٰyَlِiʾ َnْwَʿعْdُtَs ِbāَrْʿعَaʾْlā َnِm َnyِfَّlَhkُmْlِّl lُq

footnotes.text: To Allāh in Islām.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ُhْbِّhdَʿعُy َّlَwَtَy nَmَw ۖ ُrāَhْnَaʾْlā āَhِtْḥَt nِm yِrْjgَt ٍtāَّnَjg ُhْlِhkْdُy ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā ِʿعِṭُy nَmَw ۗ ٌjgَrَḥ ِḍyِrَmْlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ٌjgَrَḥ ِjgَrْʿعَaʾْlā yَlَʿع āَlَw ٌjgَrَḥ ٰyَmْʿعَaʾْlā yَlَʿع َsْyَّl

footnotes.text: That of Khaybar, which preceded the conquest of Makkah.
i.e., prepared for you or decreed.

ayas.translation: āًryِṣَn āَlَw āًّyِlَw َnwُdِjgَy āَl َّmُht َrāَbْdَaʾْlā āُwَّlَwَl āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmُkَlَtāَq ْwَlَw

āًmyِlَaʾ āًbāَhdَʿع ْmُhْnِm āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā āَnْbَّhdَʿعَl āwُlَّyَzَt ْwَl ۚ ُءāَhsَy nَm ِhِtَmْḥَr yِf ُhَّllā َlِhkْdُyِّl ۖ ٍmْlِʿع ِrْyَغِb ٌhَّrَʿعَّm mُhْnِّm mُkَbyِṣُtَf ْmُhwُyʾَṭَt nَaʾ ْmُhwُmَlْʿعَt ْmَّl ٌtāَnِmْwʾُّm ٌءāَsِnَw َnwُnِmْwʾُّm ٌlāَjgِr āَlْwَlَw ۚ ُhَّlِḥَm َغُlْbَy nَaʾ āًfwُkْʿعَm َyْdَhْlāَw ِmāَrَḥْlā ِdِjgْsَmْlā ِnَʿع ْmُkwُّdَṣَw āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā ُmُh

footnotes.text: i.e., seventy camels intended for sacrifice and feeding of the poor.

ayas.translation: āًmyِlَʿع ٍءْyَhs ِّlُkِb ُhَّllā َnāَkَw ۚ āَhَlْhَaʾَw āَhِb َّqَḥَaʾ āwُnāَkَw ٰyَwْqَّtlā َhَmِlَk ْmُhَmَzْlَaʾَw َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā yَlَʿعَw ِhِlwُsَr ٰyَlَʿع ُhَtَnyِkَs ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾَf ِhَّyِlِhāَjgْlā َhَّyِmَḥ َhَّyِmَḥْlā ُmِhِbwُlُq yِf āwُrَfَk َnyِhdَّlā َlَʿعَjg ْhdِiʾ

āًbyِrَq āًḥْtَf َkِlَٰhd ِnwُd nِm َlَʿعَjgَf āwُmَlْʿعَt ْmَl āَm َmِlَʿعَf ۖ َnwُfāَhkَt āَl َnyِrِّṣَqُmَw ْmُkَswُءُr َnyِqِّlَḥُm َnyِnِmāʾ ُhَّllā َءāَhs nِiʾ َmāَrَḥْlā َdِjgْsَmْlā َّnُlُhkْdَtَl ۖ ِّqَḥْlāِb āَyْwʾُّrlā ُhَlwُsَr ُhَّllā َqَdَṣ ْdَqَّl

footnotes.text: i.e., having completed the rites of ʿumrah.

ayas.translation: āًmyِẓَʿع āًrْjgَaʾَw ًhَrِfْغَّm mُhْnِm ِtāَḥِlāَّṣlā āwُlِmَʿعَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā ُhَّllā َdَʿعَw ۗ َrāَّfُkْlā ُmِhِb َẓyِغَyِl َʿعāَّrُّzlā ُbِjgْʿعُy ِhِqwُs ٰyَlَʿع ٰyَwَtْsāَf َẓَlْغَtْsāَf ُhَrَzāʾَf ُhَaʾْṭَhs َjgَrْhkَaʾ ٍʿعْrَzَk ِlyِjgnِiʾْlā yِf ْmُhُlَhtَmَw ۚ ِhāَrْwَّtlā yِf ْmُhُlَhtَm َkِlَٰhd ۚ ِdwُjgُّslā ِrَhtَaʾ ْnِّm mِhِhwُjgُw yِf ْmُhāَmyِs ۖ āًnāَwْḍِrَw ِhَّllā َnِّm āًlْḍَf َnwُغَtْbَy āًdَّjgُs āًʿعَّkُr ْmُhāَrَt ۖ ْmُhَnْyَb ُءāَmَḥُr ِrāَّfُkْlā yَlَʿع ُءāَّdِhsَaʾ ُhَʿعَm َnyِhdَّlāَw ۚ ِhَّllā ُlwُsَّr ٌdَّmَḥُّm

footnotes.text: The given examples depict the Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِlَʿع ٌʿعyِmَs َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۖ ِhِlwُsَrَw ِhَّllā ِyَdَy َnْyَb āwُmِّdَqُt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy ِmyِḥَّrlā ِnٰـَmْḥَّrlā ِhَّllā ِmْsِb

footnotes.text: Rather, wait for instruction and follow the way of the Prophet (ﷺ).

ayas.translation: َnwُrُʿعْhsَt āَl ْmُtnَaʾَw ْmُkُlāَmْʿعَaʾ َṭَbْḥَt nَaʾ ٍḍْʿعَbِl ْmُkِḍْʿعَb ِrْhَjgَk ِlْwَqْlāِb ُhَl āwُrَhْjgَt āَlَw ِّyِbَّnlā ِtْwَṣ َqْwَf ْmُkَtāَwْṣَaʾ āwُʿعَfْrَt āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy
َnyِmِdāَn ْmُtْlَʿعَf āَm ٰyَlَʿع āwُḥِbْṣُtَf ٍhَlāَhَjgِb āًmْwَq āwُbyِṣُt nَaʾ āwُnَّyَbَtَf ٍiʾَbَnِb ٌqِsāَf ْmُkَءāَjg nِiʾ āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

َnyِṭِsْqُmْlā ُّbِḥُy َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۖ āwُṭِsْqَaʾَw ِlْdَʿعْlāِb āَmُhَnْyَb āwُḥِlْṣَaʾَf ْtَءāَf nِiʾَf ۚ ِhَّllā ِrْmَaʾ ٰyَlِiʾ َءyِfَt ٰyَّtَḥ yِغْbَt yِtَّlā āwُlِtāَqَf ٰyَrْhkُaʾْlā yَlَʿع āَmُhāَdْḥِiʾ ْtَغَb nِiʾَf ۖ āَmُhَnْyَb āwُḥِlْṣَaʾَf āwُlَtَtْqā َnyِnِmْwʾُmْlā َnِm ِnāَtَfِyʾāَṭ nِiʾَw

َnwُmِlāَّẓlā ُmُh َkِyʾٰـَlwُaʾَf ْbُtَy ْmَّl nَmَw ۚ ِnāَmyِiʾْlā َdْʿعَb ُqwُsُfْlā ُmْsāِlā َsْyʾِb ۖ ِbāَqْlَaʾْlāِb āwُzَbāَnَt āَlَw ْmُkَsُfnَaʾ āwُzِmْlَt āَlَw ۖ َّnُhْnِّm āًrْyَhk َّnُkَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ٍءāَsِّn nِّm ٌءāَsِn āَlَw ْmُhْnِّm āًrْyَhk āwُnwُkَy nَaʾ ٰyَsَʿع ٍmْwَq nِّm ٌmْwَq ْrَhkْsَy āَl āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌmyِḥَّr ٌbāَّwَt َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ َhَّllā āwُqَّtāَw ۚ ُhwُmُtْhِrَkَf āًtْyَm ِhyِhkَaʾ َmْḥَl َlُkْaʾَy nَaʾ ْmُkُdَḥَaʾ ُّbِḥُyَaʾ ۚ āًḍْʿعَb mُkُḍْʿعَّb bَtْغَy āَlَw āwُsَّsَjgَt āَlَw ۖ ٌmْhtِiʾ ِّnَّẓlā َḍْʿعَb َّnِiʾ ِّnَّẓlā َnِّm āًryِhtَk āwُbِnَtْjgā āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

ٌryِbَhk ٌmyِlَʿع َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ ْmُkāَqْtَaʾ ِhَّllā َdnِʿع ْmُkَmَrْkَaʾ َّnِiʾ ۚ āwُfَrāَʿعَtِl َlِyʾāَbَqَw āًbwُʿعُhs ْmُkāَnْlَʿعَjgَw ٰyَhtnُaʾَw ٍrَkَhd nِّm mُkāَnْqَlَhk āَّnِiʾ ُsāَّnlā āَhُّyَaʾ āَy

footnotes.text: Literally, "he who has the most taqwā," i.e., consciousness and fear of Allāh, piety and righteousness.

ayas.translation: ٌmyِḥَّr ٌrwُfَغ َhَّllā َّnِiʾ ۚ āًyʾْyَhs ْmُkِlāَmْʿعَaʾ ْnِّm mُkْtِlَy āَl ُhَlwُsَrَw َhَّllā āwُʿعyِṭُt nِiʾَw ۖ ْmُkِbwُlُq yِf ُnāَmyِiʾْlā ِlُhkْdَy āَّmَlَw āَnْmَlْsَaʾ āwُlwُq nِkٰـَlَw āwُnِmْwʾُt ْmَّl lُq ۖ āَّnَmāʾ ُbāَrْʿعَaʾْlā ِtَlāَq

footnotes.text: i.e., the reward thereof.

ayas.translation: َnyِqِdāَṣ ْmُtnُk nِiʾ ِnāَmyِiʾْlِl ْmُkāَdَh ْnَaʾ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ُّnُmَy ُhَّllā ِlَb ۖ mُkَmāَlْsِiʾ َّyَlَʿع āwُّnُmَt āَّl lُq ۖ āwُmَlْsَaʾ ْnَaʾ َkْyَlَʿع َnwُّnُmَy

footnotes.text: See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="1">2:1</reference>.
See footnote to <reference chapter="38" verses="1">38:1</reference>.

ayas.translation: ٍjgwُrُf nِm āَhَl āَmَw āَhāَّnَّyَzَw āَhāَnْyَnَb َfْyَk ْmُhَqْwَf ِءāَmَّslā yَlِiʾ āwُrُẓnَy ْmَlَfَaʾ
ٍjgyِhَb ٍjgْwَz ِّlُk nِm āَhyِf āَnْtَbnَaʾَw َyِsāَwَr āَhyِf āَnْyَqْlَaʾَw āَhāَnْdَdَm َḍْrَaʾْlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., before the disbelievers of Makkah.
See footnote to <reference chapter="25" verses="38">25:38</reference>.
In absolute knowledge of everything about him. "We" has also been interpreted to mean the angels who are mentioned in the following verse.
And record each word and deed.
i.e., one angel driving the soul to the Judgement and one to testify as to its deeds.
Of heedlessness, or that which had sealed your hearing, your vision and your heart from guidance.

ayas.translation: ٍṣyِḥَّm nِm ْlَh ِdāَlِbْlā yِf āwُbَّqَnَf āًhsْṭَb mُhْnِm ُّdَhsَaʾ ْmُh ٍnْrَq nِّm mُhَlْbَq āَnْkَlْhَaʾ ْmَkَw
ٍbwُغُّl nِm āَnَّsَm āَmَw ٍmāَّyَaʾ ِhَّtِs yِf āَmُhَnْyَb āَmَw َḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā āَnْqَlَhk ْdَqَlَw

footnotes.text: An angel who will call out Allāh's command for the Resurrection.
Forcing people to belief or submission.
Explained as tracks, layers or orbits.
About Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) and the Qur’ān.
Or "May they be destroyed" or "cursed."
i.e., spending a portion of the night in prayer and supplication.
Who were angels given honored positions by Allāh.
See footnote to <reference chapter="11" verses="70">11:70</reference>.
i.e., those who defied Lot (upon him be peace).
i.e., Lot and his family, excepting his wife.
i.e., evidences.
Barren of any benefit, i.e., evil.
Literally, "hands."
i.e., turn to Allāh and take refuge in Him from disbelief and sin, thereby escaping His punishment.

ayas.translation: ٌnwُnْjgَm ْwَaʾ ٌrِḥāَs āwُlāَq āَّlِiʾ ٍlwُsَّr nِّm mِhِlْbَq nِm َnyِhdَّlā yَtَaʾ āَm َkِlَٰhdَk

footnotes.text: i.e., Did the former disbelievers pass on these words to the Makkans so that they repeat the same expressions?
Providing everything required by His creations during their decreed existence. His provision includes guidance.
Interpreted as the Preserved Slate or possibly the Qur’ān.
The house of worship for the angels in the seventh heaven, comparable to the Kaʿbah on earth.
On the Day of Resurrection. Or "the sea which has overflowed."
Becoming dust and moving as clouds.

ayas.translation: َnwُlَmْʿعَt ْmُtnُk āَm َnْwَzْjgُt āَmَّnِiʾ ۖ ْmُkْyَlَʿع ٌءāَwَs āwُrِbْṣَt āَl ْwَaʾ āwُrِbْṣāَf āَhْwَlْṣā
ٌnyِhَr َbَsَk āَmِb ٍyʾِrْmā ُّlُk ۚ ٍءْyَhs nِّm mِhِlَmَʿع ْnِّm mُhāَnْtَlَaʾ āَmَw ْmُhَtَّyِّrُhd ْmِhِb āَnْqَḥْlَaʾ ٍnāَmyِiʾِb mُhُtَّyِّrُhd ْmُhْtَʿعَbَّtāَw āwُnَmāʾ َnyِhdَّlāَw

footnotes.text: i.e., the reward thereof.
i.e., subject or held responsible. Literally, "a hostage."
i.e., worship.
i.e., some accident or inevitable death.
In this expression is also a subtle allusion to the leaders of the Quraysh, who considered themselves to be great minds.
Marking the onset of Allāh's punishment, as they had requested.
If not in this world, in the grave.
i.e., strength of body and of mind.
Gabriel appeared to Muḥammad (ﷺ) at the outset of his prophethood in the angelic form in which Allāh originally created him.
i.e., in the sky, above the eastern horizon.
i.e., to the Servant of Allāh, Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).
i.e., mind or perception (of the Prophet [ﷺ]).
i.e., on another occasion. During his ascent into the heavens (al-Miʿrāj), the Prophet (ﷺ) also saw Gabriel in his true form.
Then and there he (ﷺ) saw Gabriel in angelic form.
The three names given in this and the previous verse are those of well-known "goddesses" which were worshipped by the pagan Arabs before the spread of Islām.
According to their own standards.

ayas.translation: ٰyَdُhْlā ُmِhِّbَّr nِّm mُhَءāَjg ْdَqَlَw ۖ ُsُfnَaʾْlā yَwْhَt āَmَw َّnَّẓlā āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَy nِiʾ ۚ ٍnāَṭْlُs nِm āَhِb ُhَّllā َlَznَaʾ āَّm mُkُwʾāَbāʾَw ْmُtnَaʾ āَhwُmُtْyَّmَs ٌءāَmْsَaʾ āَّlِiʾ َyِh ْnِiʾ
ٰyَḍْrَyَw ُءāَhsَy nَmِl ُhَّllā َnَhdْaʾَy nَaʾ ِdْʿعَb nِm āَّlِiʾ āًyʾْyَhs ْmُhُtَʿعāَfَhs yِnْغُt āَl ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf ٍkَlَّm nِّm mَkَw
āًyʾْyَhs ِّqَḥْlā َnِm yِnْغُy āَl َّnَّẓlā َّnِiʾَw ۖ َّnَّẓlā āَّlِiʾ َnwُʿعِbَّtَy nِiʾ ۖ ٍmْlِʿع ْnِm ِhِb mُhَl āَmَw
āَyْnُّdlā َhāَyَḥْlā āَّlِiʾ ْdِrُy ْmَlَw āَnِrْkِhd nَʿع ٰyَّlَwَt nَّm nَʿع ْḍِrْʿعَaʾَf
yَnْsُḥْlāِb āwُnَsْḥَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َyِzْjgَyَw āwُlِmَʿع āَmِb āwُءāَsَaʾ َnyِhdَّlā َyِzْjgَyِl ِḍْrَaʾْlā yِf āَmَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā yِf āَm ِhَّlِlَw

footnotes.text: Knows that his provision will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has promised otherwise.
A star worshipped by some of the pagan Arabs.
Whose inhabitants defied Prophet Lot.
i.e., a rain of stones.
Additional meanings are "singing [with expanded chest]," "heedless," or "lost in vain amusements."
This was a sign given by Allāh to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) when the Quraysh challenged him to show them a miracle.
Or "Continuing magic."
Said to be an angel announcing the account and judgement.
To those after them, who were expected to derive a lesson from previous occurrences.
From their hiding places.

ayas.translation: ٍrُʿعُsَw ٍlāَlَḍ yِfَّl āًhdِiʾ āَّnِiʾ ُhُʿعِbَّtَّn āًdِḥāَw āَّnِّm āًrَhsَbَaʾ āwُlāَqَf

footnotes.text: i.e., the prophet Ṣāliḥ.
This and the following verse are an address to Ṣāliḥ (upon him be peace).
i.e., between the tribe of Thamūd and the she-camel - a day for each to drink.
i.e., the worst and most despicable among them.
Or "he took," referring to his sword or to the she-camel.
This foretold event took place on the day of Badr.
Or "in blazing fires."
One of the proper names of Hell.
i.e., those similar to you in attitude and behavior when they rejected Allāh's messengers.
Who accomplishes whatever He wills whenever He wills.
They submit obediently to the laws of Allāh. See <reference chapter="22" verses="18">22:18</reference>. An additional meaning of "najm" is vegetation of a kind without a trunk, stalk or stem.
Literally, "you two," addressing the species of mankind and jinn.
i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.
Two bodies of water or two sea waters of distinct characteristics.
See footnote to <reference chapter="2" verses="19">2:19</reference>.
For each of His creatures.
Specifically two: mankind and jinn.

ayas.translation: ٍnāَṭْlُsِb āَّlِiʾ َnwُhdُfnَt āَl ۚ āwُhdُfnāَf ِḍْrَaʾْlāَw ِtāَwāَmَّslā ِrāَṭْqَaʾ ْnِm āwُhdُfnَt nَaʾ ْmُtْʿعَṭَtْsā ِnِiʾ ِsnِiʾْlāَw ِّnِjgْlā َrَhsْʿعَm āَy

footnotes.text: Another possible meaning is liquefied brass or copper.
Or "like a tanned skin."
Once they have been condemned to the Fire.
An alternative meaning is "the standing [for account] before his Lord."
To their own mates, i.e., being chaste and modest.
Literally, they have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.
In purity, color and beauty.
